loans.name: Petronila Vizcaino

texts.en:
Petronila is fifty years old and has seven grown children. Some of them are married and living on their own while the others are in college. Petronila is a seamstress, and for the last 23 years has run a clothing-making business out of her house. She is very experienced and skilled, and a lot of people stop by to purchase her products.
Petronila wants to enlarge her business by hiring one or two employees next year. She has come to us for a loan to buy cloth, thread and other material she needs to meet her clients’ needs.

loans.use: Purchase materials to make new clothing to sell

loans.name: Perpetua

texts.en:
Mambo from Mwanza, Tanzania! This is 43-year-old Perpetua M.. In 2007 Perpetua established a soft drink business, and now requires a loan of $350 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk.

It is said that Coca Cola is one of the most recognized symbols or ‘words’ in the world. And it’s true. Even in the most remote villages in Africa, there is usually some kind of beverage stand selling Coke, Fanta, and Guiness. (Pepsi has made it to most African capitals but not to the sticks, but I’m sure they’re working on it!) The hot weather makes soft drinks all the more appealing--heat is a very cheap marketing tool! All of which explains why selling soft drinks is such a popular venture, whether you’re the CEO of Coca Cola Ltd in the United States or a micro-entrepreneur in Tanzania!

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of soft drinks in bulk.

loans.name: Mernih

texts.en: Mernih A. is 35 years old and her family's sole means of support because her husband is unable to work. She makes a living selling vegetables such as spinach from her stall in the local market, where she earns about $10 a day and takes home a very small profit. She is a member of MBK and is seeking a loan of $125 to buy more vegetables and expand her business. She has agreed to repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To expand a vegetable-selling business

loans.name: Fasineh

texts.en: Fasineh is 36 years old and is married with 5 children.  With a loan he received from SMT, Fasineh purchased planted vegetables for sale.  As a result, he was able to generate Le. 400,000 of net profit.  In turn, he used that profit to purchase 10 bags of pigeon peas for export to Liberia to generate additional income.  As a farmer, he would like to expand his farming operations and activities.  He is therefore requesting a loan of Le. 1, 000,000 to hire labourers and to purchase fertilizer and rice for growing purposes.

loans.use: To further expand his farming operation by purchasing additional inputs and by hiring labourers.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es:
Samuel lives in his own home with his son on Guillermo Killman Street in the zone of Alto Chijini in the city of La Paz; he works as a policeman but since his income is low he also works as a taxi driver using his car and this supplements his income so that he can improve his standard of living; the loan that he requests will be used to repair his taxi, to change the tires and battery so that he can work with regularity and keep up his income level. His previous history is good and he qualifies to obtain a new loan. Samuel has been our client since 2000.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Samuel vive en casa propia con su hijo en la calle Guillermo Killman de la zona de Alto Chijini de la ciudad de La Paz; trabaja en la policía pero como sus ingresos son mínimos trabaja con su auto como taxi de transporte publico con lo cual aumenta sus ingresos y puede mejorar su nivel de vida; el crédito que solicita es para reparar su taxi cambiar llantas, batería y oros para que pueda trabajar con normalidad y seguir manteniendo su nivel de ingresos. Su antecedente histórico es bueno y califica para obtener un nuevo crédito. Samuel es nuestro cliente desde el año 2000.

loans.use: To maintain his taxi, change the tires, the battery, cables and fluids.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi Antwiwaa is twenty-six years old and single. For the past five years, she has been earning income running her own seamstress shop. Esi is a specialist in various types of female clothing, including kabas, slits, wedding dresses, funeral clothes, etc. Esi currently needs a loan of US$500, which she will use to increase her supplies of sewing material like linen, threads, thimbles, etc. The purchase will allow her to increase the total output and efficiency of the shop. Esi is a member of the community group called Nananom Trust Group, whose members provide a guarantee for one another.

loans.use: Purchase of sewing material like linen, threads, thimbles, etc.

loans.name: Sefiath

texts.fr:
Born in 1977 in the town of Cotonou located in the Department of Littoral in the South of Benin, Mrs.Sefiath L. takes her roots from the Department of the Plateau in the South-East of Benin. She is married and is the mother of two children: Ikbal, who is ten years old and in the 4th grade, and Abdel, who is five years old and is in preschool. Mrs. Sefiath L. runs a hardware and bike accessories shop. She is applying for a second loan to increase her capital and to be better-positioned in the very competitive market of hardware goods.

Translated from French by Anya Ezhevskaya, Kiva volunteer.

Née vers 1977 à Cotonou dans le département du Littoral au Sud du Bénin, dame L. Sefiath est originaire du département du Plateau au Sud-Est du Bénin. Elle est Mariée et mère de deux enfants que sont Ikbal âgé de dix ans et en classe de CE2 et Abdel âgé de cinq ans et en classe de CI. Dame L. Sefiath dispose d'une boutique de quincaillerie et d'accessoires de vélo. Elle sollicite son deuxième crédit pour renforcer son capital et pour mieux se positionner sur le marché combien concurrentiel de la quincaillerie.

loans.use: Purchase several  cans of paint and plumbing materials.

loans.name: Felicitas' Group

texts.en:
Felicitas and Geovina are members of the El Trébol Village Bank. Felicitas is a 48-year-old mother of seven children who, with the help of her daughter, sells breakfast from a cart in the Nazarenas market to businesspeople at their posts. As well, she washes clothing and cooks for various clients.

Meanwhile, Geovina, a 24-year-old mother of two children, operates an ironing and painting workshop with her husband at a rented location. She also works at many different businesses in order to learn more and to eventually have her own workshop. Felicitas and Geovina are requesting the loan to invest in sugar, eggs, oil and paints.

Ffelicitas and Geovina’s dream of their children becoming professionals and expanding their businesses . Geovina also dreams of studying for a technical career.

loans.use: To invest in sugar, eggs, oil and paints.

loans.name: Leoncio De Maria

texts.es:
Mr. Leoncio is 46 years old. He lives in the neighborhood of Lomas Memorial Sandino, and he and his wife live with their two sons ( 9 and 10 years old).

Don Leoncio sells movies, cards and stickers and has twenty years of experience in sales. He began his business (with his own money) by selling cards at first. Like many Nicaraguans, Leoncio needed funding to improve his housing, because the money he earns is not sufficient.

This loan will be used to purchase building materials for the tiled floor of his house. He wishes to fix it to give it a more dignified appearance for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. Leoncio tiene 46 años de edad, habita en el barrio Lomas del Memorial Sandino Es casado y tiene dos hijos de 9 y 10 años de edad, su esposa es ama de casa. Don Leoncio vende películas, tarjetas y calcomanías y tiene veinte años de experiencia en las ventas, inició sólo con las ventas de tarjetas y esto lo hizo con dinero propio. Al igual que muchos nicaragüenses Leoncio necesita de financiamientos para mejora de vivienda, ya que el dinero que él gana es muy poco. El dinero será usado en la compra de materiales de construcción para embaldosar el piso de su vivienda, y así de acuerdo a sus necesidades darle una vivienda más digna a su familia.

loans.use: To fix / replace the tiled floor of his home. (Embaldosar el piso de la sala de su vivienda)

loans.name: Marcial Salvador

texts.es: Don Marcial tiene 57 años de edad,  es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de zapatos, ha estado involucrado en el negocio de las ventas desde hace 31 años. Su esposa también es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos y zapatos. Juntos procrearon seis hijos tres varones y tres mujeres,  los cuales ya son independientes. Empezó trabajando en destace de res, era un negocio bastante rentable,  pero luego las ventas se pusieron  bajas y no estaba generando ganancias, esta inversión que tenia era con dinero propio,  desde ahí toma la iniciativa de cambiar su negocio a venta de zapatos y comenta que le ha ido bien. Con la solicitud del préstamo es para invertir en compra de zapatos deportivos y zapatillas, para no desmejorar la buena oferta que siempre le ha dado a sus clientes, espera poder continuar con este negocio por muchos años más.
texts.en:
Don Marcial is 57 years old and is a merchant who sells shoes. He has been involved in sales for the past 31 years. His wife is also a merchant who sells dairy products and shoes. Together they have raised six children -3 boys and 3 girls- who are now all independent. He began working as a butcher, which was a very profitable business, but later on sales fell and he was not generating any income. This was a business that he had invested in with his own money. After that, he took the initiative to change over to selling shoes and he says that this has gone well. This loan application is to invest in buying different types of sport shoes so as not to diminish the wide selection he has always offered his customers, and he hopes to be able to continue in the business for many more years.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy different types of sport shoes

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es: LA SEÑORA MODESTA NO TIENE CON CASA PROPIA, VIVE EN UNOS PEQUEÑOS CUARTOS EN LAS AFUERAS D. LA CIUDAD, CUMPLIENDO UNA LABOR D. CUIDADORES D. UNA PROPIEDAD, DOND. LE PERMITEN CRIAR UN PAR D. VACAS QUE REPRESENTAN SU UNICO SUSTENTO PARA LA MANUTENCION D. SU FAMILIA, ADMÁS CRIA A SU PEQUEÑO NIETO, YA QUE SU HIJA TUVO QUE IRSE DEL PAIS PARA BUSCAR MEJORES PERSPECTIVAS ECONOMICAS. HACE TODO LO POSIBLE PARA ENSEÑARLE A SU NIETO RESPONSABILIDAD Y DARLE UNA BUENA EDUCACION EN BASE A BUENOS VALORES.
texts.en:
Modesta does not have her own home. She lives in small quarters on the outskirts of the city of La Paz, Bolivia, working as caretaker of a property. There, she is allowed to care for a pair of cows that represent the only sustenance for the family. She also cares for her small grandson since her daughter left the country to seek better financial opportunities. She does everything possible to teach her grandson to be responsible and to give him a good education as a foundation for good values.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fodder for cows

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.en:
Ana is a member of the Ccori Soncco Village Bank, which means “Heart of Gold” in Quechua. Ana is a widow and the mother of two children. She travels to different regional fairs to buy different animals, which she then sells for meat from her home with the help of her daughter. Ana needs a loan of 1200 soles, which she will use to buy sheep and pigs. Ana dreams of educating her children so that they grow up to be working professionals, and of having her own investment capital for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Ana es socia del Banco Comunal Ccori Soncco que significa Corazón de Oro en quechua. Ana es viuda y tiene 2 hijos, Ana viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde compra animales diversos que luego beneficia y vende de casa en casa para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda de hija. Ana necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de oveja, cerdos. Ana sueña con educar a sus hijos para que sean profesionales y mejora su negocio, tener capital propio.

loans.use: Buy sheep and pigs

loans.name: I Komang Sujana

texts.id: Pada musim tanam tahun lalu, I Komang Sujana menekuni usahanya menjual pupuk dan anti hama kepada petani. Selama satu musim tersebut, I Komang Sujana memperoleh cukup keuntungan dan keuntungan itu dipergunakannya untuk memperbaiki rumahnya, khususnya bagian dapur yang belum selesai direnovasi dan sebagian lagi ditabung untuk biaya sekolah anaknya. Karena selama satu musim menekuni usaha berjualan pupuk, lahan miliknya sendiri hampir terbengkelai dan tidak terurus. Saat ini sedang musim hujan dan waktu yang tepat untuk bercocok tanam. I Komang Sujana segera mengambil inisiatif untuk kembali mengerjakan lahan miliknya sambil tetap berjualan pupuk. I Komang Sujana memerlukan dana untuk biaya pengolahan tanah, karena untuk mengolah lahan seluas 1,5 hektar miliknya, ia memerlukan tenaga kerja tambahan yang dibayar per hari sebesar Rp. 25.000.- Biasanya memerlukan waktu selama 5 hari untuk siap ditanami padi. Selain untuk biaya tenaga kerja, dana tersebut dipergunakan untuk membeli bibit padi kwalitas unggul karena I Komang Sujana mengharapkan hasil yang maksimal. Dengan masa panen selama 3 kali setahun, I Komang Sujana optimis usahanya bisa sukses dan segala usaha yang dilakukannya untuk mensejahterakan keluarganya.
texts.en:
In the previous year’s growing season, I Komang Sujana was diligent in his fertilizer and pesticide-selling venture. In the season mentioned, I Komang Sujana acquire adequate income and that income was used to improve his home, specifically the kitchen where the renovation is unfinished and the balance saved for the children’s education expenses. As during the season diligently selling fertilizer, his land is next to uncompleted and derelict. Currently the rainy season is appropriate and suitable time for planting. I Komang Sujana immediately take the initiative to resume working on his land while selling fertilizer. I Komang Sujana require funds to pay for the preparation of the land, as to cultivate the 1.5-hectare land he owned, required extra labor costing Rp. 25.000.- (about USD2.50) per day. Usually requiring a period of 5 days to complete planting with paddy. Besides paying for the labor, the mentioned funds are used to purchase superior quality paddy seedlings as I Komang Sujana hope for maximum yield. With 3 harvests per year, I Komang Sujana is optimistic his venture will be successful and all his effort expended to better the family’s welfare.

Translated from Indonesian by Pheng Tan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Hire labor and purchase superior quality paddy seedlings (menyewa tenaga kerja dan membeli bibit padi kwalitas unggul)

loans.name: Esmeralda De Los Angeles

texts.es:
La Señora de Nombre Esmeralda de los Ángeles Velásquez R., tiene la edad de 31 años, su estado civil es casada, Doña Esmeralda tiene 2 hijos su edades son las siguientes su hijo de 10 años cursa el 6 grado de primaria y su otro hijo tiene la edad de 9 meses y no estudia, su compañero de vida labora en una empresa llamada impelco, los  propósitos son que su negocio crezca para invertir mas en mercadería y mantenerse activa en el mercado para seguir proporcionando a su familia el sustento de diario para ayudarle a su familia sus deseos son de tener salud para seguir trabajando en este medio de sustento y que sus hijos sean personas de bien y tengan un futuro en el plano profesional para que el día de mañana sepan manejar las situaciones que se les presenta.


La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de ropa, cosméticos y perfumes, la ubicación de su negocio es de forma ambulante, el tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de 8 años, ella inicia este negocio trabajando en una tienda en la vendía cosméticos de oriflame y comenzó a esparcir mercadería de ropa y perfumes por lo que no obtuvo mucha afluencia de clientes y necesitaba  sacar adelante a sus hijos  y no le resultaba invertir en algo en lo que no le generara los suficientes ingresos para su familia por lo que decide dedicarse solo dedicarse a la comercialización de ropa ya que esta la distribuye a los diferentes clientes que se lo piden por medio de encargo ya que así logra entregar los productos, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo de prendas de vestir que son encargadas del extranjero y la compra de estas son muy caras por lo que tiene que pagar las deudas de su encargo.
texts.en:
Esmeralda de los Ángeles Velásquez R. is 31 years old, is married and has two children. Her older son is 10 years old and in the sixth grade of primary school and her younger son is nine months old. Her partner works for a company called Impelco. Her goals are to grow her business in order to invest more in merchandise and maintain an active presence in the market. In such a way she will be able to continue to provide support to her family on a daily basis. Her wishes are to have good health in order to continue working and supporting her family. She also wishes that her children grow up to be good people, are able to pursue professional careers, and know how to manage the situations that they will confront in the future. Esmerelda works selling clothing, cosmetics and perfume. She has owned this business for 8 years. She started this business working in a store selling Oriflame cosmetics. She then started to expand to selling clothing and perfume, but did not receive a large quantity of customers. Needing to support her children, it was not worthwhile to invest in something which did not generate sufficient income for her family, and for this reason she decided to concentrate on selling clothes. She distributes clothes to different customers who place orders which she fulfils. The loan is for working capital to purchase clothing which is ordered from overseas. The purchase of these items is very expensive, and for this reason she has to pay the money owing on the order.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Chheang

texts.en: Chheang C., 56, sells grocery products and souvenirs to earn a living and is able to make US$ 8 every day. She lives with her husband in Siem Reap, Cambodia. Her husband works selling wood, making around US$ 5 per day. This couple has three children, two of whom work selling souvenirs while one is in school. Mrs. Chheang C. would like to take out a loan of US$ 700 to purchase various kinds of souvenir products for re-sale.

loans.use: To purchase various kinds of souvenir products for re-sale

loans.name: Chanthol

texts.en: Mr. Chanthol T. lives in the Sophy Village in theTakeo Province. He is employed in a garment factory. He is a 31-year-old father of a child who is too young to work or study. His wife, Mrs. Ney Chorvy, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, she breeds pigs and chickens. Even though they try to work hard, they still earn an insufficient income to support their household. Thus, Mr. Chanthol T. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to breed in order to earn more income. His wife is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Besides being an entrepreneur, Esther A., 51, takes care of her five kids. Currently, one of the males has graduated from the university and others are pursuing education in senior and junior high schools. She wants to make sure that she is financially able to support all of her children to the highest degree of education possible. She lives with her husband, a farmer, and her children in their own house at Kwahu Da, a farming community in the Eastern region of Ghana. She also runs a grocery shop to help her husband provide for the family. She sells products like evaporated milk, candies, toiletries, pomade, bottled water, etc. She has been in business for four years now.

Esther is expecting higher profits if she receives her loan. She will be adding more products to her grocery stall in the community. Her grocery products sell very quickly after she purchases them. Also, she will be adding vegetables and spices on top of table to diversify her trading.

Esther is a member of the community group called ‘Anigyee’ (meaning Happiness). Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support one another in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk

loans.name: Daima

texts.en: Daima A. is a small business woman.  She runs a food shop at Makangarawe ward, in Dar es Salaam, Tanzanian.  She sells different types of cereal and leguminous crops to retail customers.  Business items purchased direct from producers include; beans, cashew nuts, ground nuts and rice.  Others are purchased from wholesales and retail shops.  She needs a loan of Tshs 1,400,000 to purchase more business goods.

loans.use: Purchase more business items to sell.

loans.name: Endurance

texts.en: Endurance is 27 years old and married with one child. She sells provisions and bottles of wine. She hopes to own a big supermarket in future. She hopes for the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more provisions and bottles of wine to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and bottles of wine to sell

loans.name: Abduhamitchon

texts.ru:
Абдухамитчон Бобоев опытный сельскохозяйственный работник. У него есть 0,7 гектаров участка земли, на котором он выращивает дыни и арбузы. Отец Абдухамитчона помогает ему в этом деле.
Сам же клиент, подрабатывает таксистом,  развозит пассажиров по городу.
 Абдухамитчон родился в 1967 году, женат и имеет одного ребенка. .
 Для выращивания бахчевых культур, ему необходима сумма в размере 1500, с целью получения которой он обратился к нам, в Микроинвест.
texts.en:
Abduhamitchon B. is an agricultural worker with good experience. He has 0.7 hectares of land where he grows melons and watermelons. His father is helping him in this business. Abduhamitchon also works as a taxi driver and transports passengers around the town. He was born in 1967, is married and has one child. He needs a sum of 1500 somoni (US$400) to grow melons and has come to MicroInvest with this purpose.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To grow melons

loans.name: Tahira Rana Muhammad Tariq Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy beams for her shuttering business.

Tahira baji is leading the above mentioned lady. They both live in a city named Multan, Pakistan, which is famous for its shrines. Tahira baji runs a boutique in the community. She displays different varieties: simple and designer clothes. People like her collection and give her orders for making dresses.

Tahira baji is out of stock now. Therefore, she is applying for a loan to buy material (beads, colored thread and cloth) to complete the orders of her customers in order to earn a good income and to display the collection in her boutique to get more orders.

loans.use: To buy materials for her embroidery business

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Mrs. Merlyn R. is a second loanee of ASHI. Her first loan was Php 5,000 and now she is applying for a Php 10,000 loan to be used primarily in her livestock-raising and farming business. Since Merlyn had shown very good performance during her first loan, she is qualified to obtain the said amount. There is no doubt she will perform very well again because her husband, Eduardo, has been supporting her endeavor for the future of their six children. They both believe that sending their children to school would require a lot of money. However, the couple still thinks that they can surmount this life's test if they are supported by ASHI.

Through the loan Merlyn has received and will be receiving further, her skill in farming and livestock raising, as well as her husband's, will be put to practice and will be enhanced even more. Therefore, they are pretty sure that they will make their business successful because this kind of business was their parents' source of income when they were both young.

Having capital to grow this kind of business, Merlyn and her husband hope that they will be able to send their children to school until they graduate from college in order for them to have a different kind of living in the future. They know how hard it is being farmers. Small profit because of the low demand during harvest, and absence of a market can not compensate for the expensive farm inputs, plus the requirement of manual labor.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs for raising livestock

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is engaged in a retailing business in the public market of Cauayan City, Isabela.  She is glad that she is able to earn a monthly income of around PHP 25,000. She is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 from the Kiva lenders. She will use this loan to expand her grocery store. She is hoping that her business will grow further and become productive through the loan. 

She is married to Ausencio and they were blessed with a daughter named Chelsea Cristy. She is 14 years old and already a third-year high school student. They are peacefully living in Barangay San Fermin, Cauayan City. The place is semi-urban. Most of the people in this area are hard working, and the major products of their village are monggo, rice, and corn crops.

loans.use: Business expansion

location.town: Barangay San Fermin, Cauayan City, Isabela

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane C. is from the village of Zone 5 in Baikingon, Cagayan De Oro in the Philippines. Mary Jane is married and has one young child. To make a living, Mary Jane sells products from MSE, a company that offers a variety of products like shoes, dresses, bags, perfumes, makeup etc., in the local community. Mary Jane has been a dealer for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Mary Jane joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Jane has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used as additional business capital. Mary Jane is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional MSE products to sell. This will be Mary Jane's 5th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business and supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Zone 5, Baikingon Cagayan De Oro City

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita C. is from the village of Katipa. She is 53 years old. Rita is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Rita owns a tailoring business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general alteration & tailoring services to local community members. Rita has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2001, Rita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Rita is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 14th loan taken out by Rita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.fr: Elisabeth est née vers 1960 à Cotonou, Capitale Economique du Bénin. Elisabeth est mariée à Gabriel, un agent Commercial. Elisabeth est mère de trois enfants. Elisabeth supporte avec son mari les charges de la famille. Elisabeth vend de la farine de manioc, de poissons fumés et des condiments de sauce chez elle à la maison. Elisabeth a déjà quinze  ans d’expérience dans cette activité. Elisabeth a déjà bénéficié de quatre crédits de la part de ALIDé pour ses activités ; crédits que Elisabeth a bien remboursés. Elisabeth sollicite un cinquième crédit pour constituer de grands stocks de ses produits.
texts.en:
Elisabeth was born around 1960 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Elisabeth is married to Gabriel, a commercial agent. Elisabeth is the mother of three children. With her husband, Elisabeth provides for her family. Elisabeth sells manioc flour, smoked fish, and sauce condiments, all at her house. Elisabeth has gained fifteen years of experience in this business. Elisabeth has already received four loans through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners) for her business; these loans were all repaid properly. Elisabeth is seeking a fifth loan to generate large stockpiles of her products.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy manioc flour, boxes of fish, and sauce condiments

loans.name: La Union Group

texts.en:
Prudencia is one of the members of the La Union Village Bank. She is an associate of Esperanza International who is currently looking forward to receiving her fourth loan. She lives in a cement house with a zinc roof in Santiago, a town in the northwest of the Dominican Republic where running water and electricity are unreliable. She lives with her husband and is the mother of three children, ages 24, 28, and 30. 

Prudencia owns a "colmado," a small variety store, that she runs from her home. She has received business training and vocational training to be able to be successful in her job. With the loan, she plans to purchase more yucca, sweet potatoes, meat, chicken, salami, plantains, laundry detergent, and bleach, and to provide a larger selection for her customers. From the increase in business that she expects to get from the loan, she plans to improve her family's nutrition and keep investing in the business. She would like to thank all the donors for their support.

loans.use: Yucca, sweet potatoes, meat

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Al vivienda del señor Jaime T. le está haciendo falta la elaboración de una barde alrededor de su casa ya que tiene poca seguridad para sus hijos, que son de pequeña edad y no quiere prevenir algún  accidenté. 
Don Jaime no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder realizar la barda es por eso que nos esta solicitando un préstamo y realizar la mejor lo más pronto posible y así su familia estará mas segura cuando el esté trabajando. 
Planea pagar el crédito con los ingresos que genera como chofer de una camión de carga para una compañía de trasporte.

loans.use: Elaboración de una barda alrededor de la casa

loans.name: Mai's Group

texts.en:
Mai T. T. P. was born in 1964. ( id: 010105040018). She lives in Lai Da – Dong Hoi – Dong Anh – Ha Noi with her husband and two children. Her two children are still going to school. Her husband is a pilot. She is a tailor. She has got loans from Microfund organization for three years and repaid them on time. She is a group leader. She has a monthly income of about 4.000.000 VND. This time, she wants to borrow 300 USD to buy goods to sell.
 There are 6 other Fund participants in her group . 
 Thúy Thị Ngô was born in 1969. ( id: 010105040023). She sells soup noodle in the morning. She wants to borrow 300 USD to invest her restaurand.
 Thúy Thị Hồng Vương was born in 1983. ( id: 010105040024). She is farming and breeding chicken. She wants to borrow 300 USD to buy food for chicken.
 Nhân Thị Nguyễn was born in 1956. ( id: 010105040022). She is farming and breeding chicken. She wants to borrow 250 USD to buy more chicken to raise.
 Kế Thị Lương was born in 1955. ( id: 010105040019). She is breeding chicken, cows. She wants to borrow 300 USD to buy food for them.
 Toàn Thị Lương was born in 1951. ( id: 010105040020). She wants to borrow 250 USD to breed the pigs and poultry.
 Phòng Thị Ngô was born in 1965. ( id: 010105040021). She is farming and breeding chicken. She wants to borrow 250 USD to buy more chicken to raise.

loans.use: to buy goods to sell

loans.name: Mallku Irpiri Group

texts.es:
Paola H. de 23 años, casada y madre de 2 niños, comenta que ingresó al grupo Mallku Irpiri, por invitación de una amiga ya que ella necesitaba dinero para ampliar su negocio, ella  vende comida en la zona Adrián Castillo que queda cerca al Centro Focal German Busch, vende todos los días de 7  a 11 de la mañana, a veces tiene la ayuda de su esposo, en esta ocasión necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos como arroz, fideo, papa con los cuales prepara la comida.
Las demás integrantes también tienen sus propias actividades económicas como la venta plásticos, alimentos secos y otros. Todas necesitan el préstamo para comprar mercadería.
texts.en:
Paola H. is 23, married, and the mother of 2 children. She says that when she joined the Mallku Irpiri group, it was through the invitation from a friend since she needed money to expand her business. She sells food in the Adrián Castillo zone that is near the German Busch center. She sells every day from 7-11 a.m. Sometimes she has the help of her husband. She needs this loan to buy supplies like rice, noodles, and potatoes, which she will use to prepare her food. The other members also have their own economic activities like plastic sales, dried food sales, etc. All of them need this loan to buy merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Cesar De Jesús

texts.es:
El señor Cesar T. se dedica a laborar en el municipio El Viejo en la actividad de servicio de maquinaria agrícola donde tiene su propia maquinaria y la pone a la disposición (alquiler) de los agricultores para el trabajo agrícola siempre siendo manejada por él mismo. 

El señor Cesar presta servicios agrícolas con su maquinaria pero atraviesa el problema de que necesita los repuestos para continuar trabajándola porque es de importancia realizarle el cambio de piezas a esta maquinaria y darle el respectivo mantenimiento. Por este motivo solicita el crédito en Ceprodel para  comprar a lo inmediato tales piezas de repuestos y a la misma vez para la compra de algunos fertilizantes. Espera muy confiadamente en que el crédito le será otorgado sin inconvenientes.
texts.en:
Cesar Tiberino works providing agricultural machinery services in the El Viejo municipality. He has his own machine, which he rents out to the farmers to do the farming work. He always manages the work himself. Cesar lends his farming services with his machine, but he is experiencing a problem. He needs replacement parts to continue working with the machine. It is important to change the pieces in the machinery and to give it the respective maintenance. That is why he is asking Ceprodel for a loan. He will immediately buy those replacement parts. At the same time, he will buy some fertilizers. He very confidently hopes that the loan will be given without any difficulties.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy replacement parts for his agricultural machine

loans.name: Lucía

texts.es:
Lucía H. C., tiene la edad de 60 años, es casada, y tiene 4 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. Ella quiere reparar la vivienda para ofrecer un mejor servicio, debido a alquilan parte de la casa y además tienen 2 cabinas para alquilar. Además, tienen una pequeña area de café y un proyecto de palma para aceite. Tiene varios años que se dedica a su finca y quiere crecer.
Ella nunca se ha financiado con FUDECOSUR, y está muy contenta de poder acceder a su primer crédito con la fundación,ya que le brindó mayores facilidades y una tasa de interes accesible. Una vez realizó un crédito con el Banco Popular, pero le solicitaron demasiados requisitos, fue muy tedioso a pesar de que era una tasa de interes muy similar.
Lo que más desea es poder brindarle un mayor bienestar a sus hijos y vivir de una manera más estable
texts.en:
Lucía H. C. is 60 years old, married, and has 4 children who are her first priority. She wants to make repairs to their home to be able to offer better service, as they rent out part of the house and they also have 2 cabins to rent. In addition, they have a small coffee area and a palm oil project. She has had the property for several years and wants it to grow.

She has never been funded by FUDECOSUR, and she is very happy to be able to access her first loan with the foundation since it provides her with greater credit facilities and an affordable interest rate. She once took out a loan with Banco Popular, but they had too many requirements. It was very tedious despite having a very similar interest rate.

What she wants most is to be able to provide a better well being for her children and live in a more stable way.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Housing improvements and repair

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is 44 years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Axim, a town along the coastal area in the Western Region of Ghana. Fishing is the major occupation of the people. 

Naomi is a trader. She sells bags of sugar and rice. She buys from nearby towns and supplies to retailers and other food vendors in her locality. Naomi has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of sugar and rice

loans.name: Moruf

texts.en: Moruf is 35 years old and married with three children. He lives in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. His wife sells groceries and she also supports the family. He is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. He sells batteries at retail prices to his customers to make a living. He loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that he has with his customers. He is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more batteries to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more batteries to sell

loans.name: Zafiro Group

texts.es: El grupo “Zafiro” esta representado por la señora Florinda y conformado por 11 miembros los cuales son personas muy alegres y entusiastas todos residen en el mismo barrio por los que son unidas y bien organizadas. Todos los miembros son personas muy trabajadoras como lo demuestran en sus puestos D. venta D. comida, venta D. ropa, venta D. cosméticos, venta D. pan, tienda D. abarrotes, venta D. hamburguesas, libros y material escolar. En cuanto al entorno competitivo las socias aseguran que saben manejar a sus cometidotes gracias a su experiencia a sus ganas D. salir adelante. El crédito será destinado a la ampliación, refacción y mejoramiento D. sus puestos D. trabajo así como a la adquisición D. mercaderías, insumos y materiales para mejorar sus ingresos que se traducirá en una mejor calidad D. vida para sus familias. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia D. los miembros del grupo ya trabajaron bajo la modalidad D. créditos individuales y solidaR. por lo que tienen amplio conocimiento sobre el manejo D. los fondos otorgados, saben invertir en sus negocios y cumplir con sus obligaciones D. forma puntual.
texts.en:
The “Zafiro” (Sapphire) Group is led by Sra. Florinda and consists of eleven members who are all cheerful and full of enthusiasm. Since they all live in the same neighborhood, they are well-organized and get along well with each other. All of the members are hardworking people who have demonstrated this quality through their businesses selling food, clothing, cosmetics, bread, groceries, hamburgers, books, and school supplies. Regarding the competitive environment, the members say they know how to manage the competition because of their experience and desire to succeed.

This loan will be used to expand, renovate, and improve their businesses through the acquisition of merchandise, supplies, and materials that will help improve their incomes and quality of life for their families. Regarding their previous credit experience, the members have worked with both individual and solidarity group loans and have extensive knowledge of how to manage their funds, invest in the businesses, and meet their obligations on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Alexi

texts.es:
En un taller de confecciones en el barrio Campestre de la ciudad de Cartagena, hay una mujer dotada de creatividad, que enseña un arte del que  ha vivido siempre, a jóvenes para que encuentren en él una forma de ganarse la vida honradamente, como lo ha hecho ella ella desde que abrió su taller de Confecciones en su propia casa, con el que devenga un salario para apoyar la gestión de su familia junto a su esposo, que trabaja como vigilante. Esta mujer es Alexi L., tiene 42 años de edad y tres hijos de 22, 16 y 14 años, actualmente estudiando simultáneamente en carreras técnica, profesional y de bachiller; con ellos está asociada su meta principal: “Educarlos y apoyar su formación profesional, para que teniendo acceso a oportunidades  sean unas personas de bien”.     

Para Alexi, la Hermosa ciudad de Cartagena de Indias, la heroica, con su mezcla de arquitectura moderna y Colonial, ha sido el escenario perfecto donde se inició con una vieja maquina de coser y un mercado domestico entre vecinos, familiares y amigos cercanos, que le llevaban las telas para que elaborar sus vestidos; al principio debió pagar el servicio de fileteado, pues no tenia maquinaria para realizar esta operación, que le daba el acabado perfecto a sus productos. Por eso cuando escuchó hablar de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo a sus vecinos, no dudó en solicitar el apoyo de su primer financiamiento para compra la fileteadora que tanto necesitaba  y telas e insumos con los cuales empezó a elaborar sus primeras creaciones, para venderlas con gran aceptación de la clientela; esto hizo que pensara en capacitarse e inició seminarios de diseño de modas para el perfeccionamiento de su técnica y al observar como su negocio crecía gradualmente, se arriesgó a  reemplazar su vieja y apreciada maquina de coser. 

Aunque ella desea profesionalizarse en diseño de modas, dice que su primer compromiso es ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales y ella debe esperar su momento, por eso está apuntándole con esfuerzos entusiastas a su negocio y se mantiene actualizada con cursos cortos que le permiten estar atenta a las nuevas tendencias de la moda y los requerimientos de su mercado.

Alexi ha recibido varios créditos de la Fundación, siete de los cuales en la línea de capital de trabajo y los dos últimos de educación, que consideran son de mucha importancia para que ella no tenga que recurrir a agiotistas y endeude su patrimonio, como lo hacia antes de estar con la Fundación. El crédito al que aplica y con el que espera ser apoyada en pro del bienestar de su familia, esta dirigido a pagarle el último semestre universitario en la carrera de contaduría Publica a James, su hijo mayor, quien sin graduarse trabaja como auxiliar contable y se prepara para ayudar a que sus hermanos alcancen sus sueños educativos.

Desde su vinculación al programa de la Fundación, Alexi ha visto su negocio crecer, pudo renovar su maquinaria de confección y ha sacado a sus hijos adelante especialmente en lo relacionado con la educación. Su principal desafío familiar siempre ha sido el cumplimiento con la multiplicidad de sus rolles como esposa, madre y empresaria; Ella considera que la educación de los hijos es tarea de los padres y no las delega como ocurre cuando ambos padres trabajan.

Alexi y su esposo han levantado a sus hijos en el barrio Campestre, ubicado en el suroccidente de la hermosa Cartagena, este un lugar modesto con calles angostas, vecinos solidarios, muchos escenarios deportivos y una pista de patinaje público, donde la comunidad ha visto de cerca los juegos Centroamericanos y del Caribe. En el escenario del barrio Campestre, es común  ver los vecinos practicando el patinaje, por eso se ha convertido en el semillero de futuras estrellas de este deporte, en el que Colombia se destaca con la muy joven  Cecilia “la Chechi Baena, que se mantiene arrasando con medallas en cada mundial  y ha sido 6 veces campeona en la máxima categoría del patinaje en línea; la Chechi como todos la llaman, es la insignia y el parámetro que impulsa a muchos jóvenes de la comunidad a progresar, este es el ambiente donde también Alexi y su esposo ha educado a sus tres hijos.
texts.en:
In a seamstress shop in the Campestre neighborhood of the city of Cartagena, there is a woman who is gifted with creativity. She teaches the art, which she has always had, to youngsters. She does this so that they can, through their creativity, find an honorable way of earning a living like she has done. She opened her seamstress shop in her own house, and she earns a salary to help her husband support the family. Her husband is a watchman. This woman is Alexi Lópex. She is 42, and she has three children; 22, 16, and 14. The children are currently simultaneously studying a technical career, a professional career, and a high school degree. Her primary goal for them is, “To educate them and support their professional training so that they have access to opportunities and become good people”. For Alexi, the beautiful city of Cartagena de Indias, the heroic, with its mixture of modern and colonial architecture, has been the perfect place to start with an old sewing machine and a domestic market among her neighbors, family, and close friends. They brought her fabrics in order for her to make their clothes. At first she had to pay for the finishing service because she did not have a machine to do this operation and give a perfect finishing to her products. That is why when she heard her neighbors talking about the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation; she did not hesitate in asking for the support of her first loan to buy an overlock sewing machine, which she needed so much. She also needed fabrics and supplies to make her first creations. They were widely accepted by the customers who bought them. This made her think of training, and she started fashion design seminars to perfect her technique. She saw how her business gradually grew, and she took a chance on replacing her prized old sewing machine. Even though she wishes to become a professional in fashion design, she says that her first commitment is to see her children become professionals. She needs to wait for her time. That is why she is enthusiastically putting her efforts into her business. She stays fulfilled with short courses that allow her to be aware of the new fashion trends and the market’s requirements. Alexi has received various loans from the Foundation. Seven of them have been for working capital. The last two have been for education. She considers them to be very important so that she does not have to go to moneylenders and put up her assets for the debt. This is what she did before she was with the Foundation. The loan she is asking for and hopes to receive for her family’s well being is to pay for the last the last semester of study in the university for her oldest son, James. He is studying for a career in Public Accounting. Without graduating he works as an accounting assistant. He is preparing to help his sibling reach their educational dreams. Alexi has seen her business grow since joining the program with the Foundation. She was able to renovate her sewing machinery, and she has been able to get her children ahead, especially in the area of education. Her main family challenge has always been fulfilling her multiple rolls as wife, mother, and business person. She considers the education of the children to be the parents’ job, and she does not delegate that as it happens when both parents work. Alexi and her husband have raised their children in the Campestre neighborhood, which is southwest of the beautiful Cartagena. It is a modest place with narrow streets, united neighbors, many sporting areas, and a public skating rink where the community has seen the Central American games of the Caribbean up close. In the Campestre neighborhood it is common to see the neighbors practicing their skating, and it has become the source of future stars of this sport. Colombia stands out in this sport with the very young Cecilia, “La Chechi Baena”, who keeps winning medals in each world competition. She has been a champion six times in the category of in line skating. “La Chechi”, as everyone calls her, is the symbol and parameter that motivates lots of youngsters of the community to progress. This is the atmosphere in which Alexi and her husband have educated their three children.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For her son's education

loans.name: Nolita

texts.en:
Nolita supports her family with her hog-raising business, owning five pigs in South Cotabato. She is 50 years old and has three children, her eldest being 24 years old. She is thankful for her business because it sustains the education of her children.

Nolita  is now requesting a loan of Php 10,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. This loan will be very helpful in providing the feeds necessary for her pigs.

loans.use: To buy feed for her pigs

loans.name: Kalamera Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the 'Kalamera' group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. These small-scale businesswomen have come to SMT/Kiva lenders for a loan of SLL 1,200,000 for each person in order to expand their businesses in size and quality. In this way, they can make more sales, earn more profit, and consequently improve their families’ well-being.

On the right in the photo is the group’s leader, Rugiatu C.. Rugiatu who was born in Makeni, is age 33, single with 2 children – 1 in primary school and 1 in secondary school. For quite a number of years now, Rugiatu has been selling market food – rice, salt, Maggi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), "gari" (cassava grits), etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy bags of rice, 'gari', salt and packets of Maggi cubes.

loans.use: Buy bags of rice, 'gari', salt and packets of Maggi cubes

loans.name: Amparito Maribel

texts.es: Amparito, de 39 años, está separada, desde hace  tres  años, y solo vive con sus 2  hijos menores, en la casa de su madre.Se dedica a la venta  de abarrotes, en la tienda que está instalada en su casa, ubicada en un barrio muy populoso, de la zona sur de Lima. En este negocio  ya lleva cerca de 8 años, inicialmente su pareja la apoyaba, pero ahora su madre la apoya cuando tiene que salir a realizar compras. Está contenta con esta actividad, porque le es muy rentable, sobre todo por las mañanas, y ya en la tarde se dedica al  bordado de polos de algodón, por invitación de una  amiga. Le gusta bordar porque  puede realizar este trabajo sin descuidar su tienda, y también gana algo de dinero por este trabajo. Por el momento esta empeñada en implementar su bodega, para que en el futuro este mas surtida y obtenga mejores ganancias.Este es su primer crédito, y se compromete a pagar todas sus cuotas de acuerdo a las fechas establecidas, ya que piensa contar con posteriores préstamos, porque sabe son  de mucha ayuda  para su negocio.Amparito invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de  gran cantidad de  abarrotes, de primera necesidad, para mantener su bodega siempre surtida, y así pueda brindar una buena  atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Amparito is 39 years old and was separated three years ago. Now, she lives alone with her two youngest children in her mother's house. She has a grocery business and operates the small store from her home which is in a very populous neighborhood in the south of Lima. She has had this business for nearly eight years. At first her partner would help her but now its her mother who helps out when she has to purchase merchandise. She is happy with this activity because its very successful, particularly in the mornings. In the afternoon, after her friend suggested it, she embroiders cotton polo shirts. She likes her embroidery work because she can do it without leaving her business and is able to earn a little from this labor. At the moment she is very committed to setting up her store so that in the future she has more stock and sees greater profits. This is her first loan and she has promised to make each payment in agreement with the dates established. She knows that they are very helpful in her business. Amparito will use the requested loan to buy a larger quantity of high-priority groceries so that she can keep her store well stocked and so she can provide better service to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Sierra Visher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise to establish her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy equipment for keeping and carrying milk

loans.name: Wazhma Haydar Group

texts.en:
Mier Heydar is the group leader of Wazhma Haydar group. He lives in the 11th district of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and has three children who go to school. He needs this loan because he wants to expand his bakery business. He needs firewood and a new shop for his bakery. He also wants to support his family and help his two daughters to get a better education and go to a better school in order to have a bright future. 

He is very happy with this loan in Afghanistan.

loans.use: to expand his business

loans.name: Vicelino

texts.es: Vicelino V. H., tiene la edad de 81 años, es viudo y tiene 1 hijo de 36 años de edad. El crédito lo quiere para comprar materiales y remodelar la porqueriza, además, de comprar algunos cerdos para la cría. La idea es darle el adecuado mantenimiento a los cerdos para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contenta con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Vicelino tiene varios años en este negocio de cría de cerdos. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Vicelino V. H. is 81 years old, widowed, and has a son who is 36 years old. The loan he needs is to buy materials and remodel his pig sty. In addition, he will buy some pigs to raise. He hopes to provide appropriate maintenance to the pigs so that he can have a better income when he sells them. This is the first time that he has taken a loan with FUDECOSUR, and he is very satisfied with the payment terms that they provide. Don Vincelino has been raising pigs for a number of years. In the future he hopes to provide his family with a better quality of life and better economic stability, and to be able to continue to grow as a person and as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy pigs and make a pig sty

loans.name: Angelica Maria

texts.es:
La señora Angélica es una excelente socia del banco comunal Dulce Amistad que se reúnen en un bello cantón que es reconocido por propios y extraños como el mas dulce de todos, aquí es donde se preparan los mas deliciosos dulces en diferentes sabores y colores, además es una tierra bendita muy productiva para sembrar arroz estamos hablando de Rocafuerte en la provincia de Manabí.

Nuestra socia es una profesional en administración de empresa, por ello a decido tener su propio negocio que consiste en la venta de maquinarias para el agro, el esposo es el que se encarga de llevar a los clientes las maquinas, pero el trabajo de nuestra socia no termina ahí, junto a su hermana han decidió abrir un restáurate en su propia casa han tenido que hacer unos arreglos y acondicionar el lugar para brindarles una mayor comodidad a los posibles clientes, aun no se ha inaugurado pero con este nuevo  crédito que recibirá nuestra socia terminara de hacer los arreglos del lugar y adquirirá sillas y mesas.

La señora Angélica ya tiene definido como administrar su negocio, solo atenderá con almuerzos y en la tarde comida rápida como hot dog, hamburguesa y fritada( plato típico ecuatoriano echo con carne de cerdo);  nuestra socia esta muy animada y tiene la certeza que todo le ira muy bien.
texts.en:
Angélica is an excellent member of the Dulce Amistad (Sweet Friendship) communal bank which meets in a beautiful canton that is known by residents and visitors alike as the sweetest of them all. This is where the most delicious candies of different flavors and colors are made. It is also a very blessed land for rice cultivation. We are referring to Rocafuerte, Manabí province. Our member is a professional in the business administration field. She decided to have a business of her own which consists in agriculture machinery. Her husband brings customers for the machines but our member’s work isn’t over there. Together with her sister she decided to open a restaurant in her home. She has had to make some alterations to the place and equip it to provide more comfort to her diners. It hasn’t opened yet but this new loan will allow her to finish the last details: she will be able to buy tables and chairs. Angélica has already determined how the business will be run. She will open only for lunch but then will provide fast food, like hot-dogs, hamburgers, and “fritada” (a typical Ecuadorean dish made with pork) in the afternoon and early evening. She is very excited about this and sure that everything will turn out well.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For tables, chairs, tablecloths, cutlery, drinking glasses, plates, kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa C.'s main source of income comes from making and selling fish balls and other dim sums in her community. She is 40 years old, married and has three school-age children. They are from the village of Brgy. Roxas, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. Rosa has been in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 4,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2009, Rosa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Rosa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Rosa is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her third loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anna Mae

texts.en:
Anna Mae P. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 24 years old, married and has a 3-year old child. To make a living, Anna Mae plants and harvests rice for sale. Anna Mae has been engaged in her business for over 2 years now. Like other entrepreneurs, she wants to be successful with her business.

Anna Mae joined CEVI to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid previous loans from CEVI. Now she is requesting her eighth loan, for 12000 PHP, which she will use to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. She plans to use the additional revenue to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies & equipment.

loans.name: Auntie Araba

texts.en:
Auntie Araba P. is married and has seven dependents. Her husband is a farmer. She has no educational background.

Auntie Araba sells salted fish in Abura and has been doing this for eight years. She uses her income to support her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.

Auntie Araba will use the loan to purchase more salted fish to sell and to distribute to her customers who want to buy in bulk. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To purchase more salted fish to sell

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
M. Getrude is as lively as they come. The 50-year-old has a sparky sense of humor that close friends say has endeared her to many of her consorts but more importantly, they point out, to her customers.

Being cordial and welcoming is a winning factor that many people operating a business often gloss over. Getrude says no matter how adverse the situation may be, whether in terms of personal moods or a person’s business going through a checkered career, it is always advisable to maintain that cordial, serene and friendly attitude, especially in dealing with new, old and prospective customers.

Getrude’s seventeen-year-old retail shop has, to a large extent, been a benefactor of the aforementioned factors. In a month, Getrude makes profits to the total of 300,000 shillings.

Getrude set forth in business after she got ideas from her husband. Her first business, poultry, also played a leading role in helping her to get established. She used savings from that business to buy many of her first retail items.

With this loan, this married mother of nine wants to restock her shop with purchased items such as sugar, salt, maize flour, rice and soap.

loans.use: The purchase of items such as sugar, salt, maize flour and rice

loans.name: Sergio Fabian

texts.es:
El Sr. Sergio  tiene25 años y esta viviendo con sus Padres, desde pequeño empezó a trabajar con  su Padres en la Profesión de Chaperia y Pinturas de Camiones  y automóviles en el Taller    donde aprendio el oficio y luego fue tomando cursos de capacitación   para especializarse en este campo.  
El Sr. G. sigue trabando con su Padre en el mismo Local que alquilan juntos y prácticamente comparten  todos los gastos  fijos los dividen en dos, pero cada uno tiene sus propia Clientela formada como el caso de nuestro cliente que esta trabajando actualmente con tres Casas de Seguros de Automoviles.                  
El Crédito que retiro es para la compra de Materiales  como Oxigeno, Electrodo, Carburo para la parte de Caperia y para la Parte de Pintura, Masillas sinteticas Pinturas y Varniz.                                                
Con el tiempo  piensan comprar  el local donde estan alquilando ya que esta bien preparado par su trabajo porque cuenta con gran espacio para los vehiculos y un gran tinglado.
texts.en:
Sergio is 25 years old and living with his parents. He began working with them, doing body work and painting on cars and trucks, in the workshop where he learned this trade. He later took courses so that he could specialize in this area. Mr. G. continues to work with his father. They lease a workshop together and share all fixed expenses, dividing them in two, but each of them have their own established customers. Our associate is currently working with three different automobile insurance companies. He is asking for this loan in order to buy supplies such as oxygen, electrodes, carbide for paint and body work, synthetic putty, paint, and varnish. They eventually plan to buy the workshop that they lease because it’s well set up for their work. There is there is lots of space for vehicles and includes a large platform.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Materials and supplies

loans.name: Santos Margarita

texts.es: Santos Margarita es de 53 años de edad, soltera, tiene dos hijos varones y una mujer, es comerciante se dedica a la venta de ropa típica, en la actividad tiene 3 años de experiencia, solicita su tercer préstamo para compra de cortes típicos y delantales, así poder ampliar su negocio, surtir sus ventas y poder competir en el mercado, los prestamos anteriores los pago sin problemas de atraso.
texts.en:
Santos Margarita is 53 years old. She is single and has two adult sons and one daughter. She sells typical clothing and has three years experience. She is asking for her third loan so that she can buy typical cuts of clothing and aprons, allowing her to expand her business, vary her sales, and be able to compete in the marketplace. She repaid her previous loans without falling behind.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua N. cooks beans and gari, popularly called red–red, at Elmina (gari is a couscous-like grain made from grated cassava). She has been in the sale of red-red for five years now.

Efua is married with four children and responsibly helps her husband to take care of the home. She has received junior high education.

Efua’s loan will be used to buy more gari and beans for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build a shop so she can sell other foods in addition to the red-red.

loans.use: To buy more gari and beans to sell

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita M. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 52 years old. Margarita is married to a farmer and has 3 children. Her children are aged 24, 20 and 16. To make a living, Margarita owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. 

Margarita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Margarita has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Margarita is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase young livestock to raise and additional feeds. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase young livestock to raise and buy additional feed

loans.name: Marivel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARY ANTEÑA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Izcuchaca, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Marivel; ella tiene 36 años de edad y es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos secos como quinua, lenteja, maíz y tallarines, ella los lleva a lugares como Anta y Quillabamba y los vende, la socia quiere tener una tienda donde pueda vender los productos secos en algunas oportunidades vende también verduras y papa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos secos al por mayor.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Marivel belongs to the community bank 'Ricchary Anteña', which is located in the district of Izcuchaca, part of the province of Anta and the department of Cusco. 

Marivel is 36 years of age and is a single mother to two children. She alternates her daily tasks with her work selling dried products such as quinoa, lentils, corn and pasta. She takes these products to places including Anta and Quillabamba and sells them there. In the future, Marivel would like to have a store where she could sell her dried products. At times she also sells vegetables and potatoes, but this loan will be used to purchase dried products in bulk.

Marivel is grateful to everyone who contributes to her dream through Kiva and promises to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: Purchase dried products in bulk

loans.name: Leidy Nathaly

texts.es: L. señora Leidy vive en casa D. sus suegros con su esposo y sus dos hijitos tiene un bazar donD. venD. peluches, regalos, ropa  para niños y otros, saco el crédito para surtir su bazar ya que siempre falta algo es lo que indica nunca se tiene lo suficiente, quiere que sus hijos tengan todo lo que elL. no tubo cuando era pequeña quiere mejorar su calidad D. vida D. elL. y D. toda su familia, desea a L. larga poder comprarse una casita y también ver a sus hijos profesionales y esta consciente que trabajara duro pero sabe que saldrá adelante y realiza todos sus deseos, esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por L. confianza brindada.
texts.en:
Sra. Leidy lives at the house of her in-laws with her husband and two young children. She manages a bazaar where she sells plush toys, gifts, children’s clothing, and other items. Leidy is requesting a loan so that she can stock her bazaar because she is always lacking something and never has enough of everything.

She wants her children to have everything because as a girl she wanted to improve the quality of life for herself and her entire family. Leidy wants to be able to buy a small house and see her children become professionals. She is conscious about working hard in order to get ahead and fulfill all of her wishes. Leidy is extremely grateful to Emprender and Kiva for placing their confidence in her.

loans.use: Purchase novelties, gifts, and other products

loans.name: Ma. Loida

texts.en:
Ma. Loida B. is from Mercy Village, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 29 years old. Ma. Loida is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Ma. Loida owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, instant noodles, canned goods and snacks in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Ma. Loida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to buy and sell. This will be the first loan taken by Ma. Loida from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to buy and sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La  Sra..María tiene  49 años  es madre soltera de  3 hijos mayores. Ella posee un comedor dentro del mercado San Lorenzo desde hace 15 años, es un verdadero sacrificio ya que  empieza a trabajar desde muy temprano para tener listo el desayuno ,la media mañana y el almuerzo;gracias a este trabajo logro mantener siempre a su familia y la de su hermana quien trabaja con ella . 
El crédito será de ayuda para la compra de mercaderías en cantidad y así abaratar el costo de sus alimentos. María    anhela  construir un salón en su domicilio   y trabajar  en el mismo .
texts.en:
Maria, 49, is a single mother with 3 grown children.  She has had an eatery inside the San Lorenzo market for 15 years.  It is a true sacrifice for her, as she starts to work very early in the morning to have the breakfasts, mid-morning snacks and lunches ready.  Thanks to this work she has always managed to support her family and her sister, who works with her.

This loan will be used to purchase merchandise in volume, and in this way lower her food costs.  Maria wishes to build a room in her home so that she could work from her home.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, meat, rice, noodles, chicken, tomatoes, onions and bell peppers.

loans.name: Váng

texts.en:
Mrs. Váng K. is 50 years old and she is a villager who lives in Thum village in Kandal province. She is a pork seller in the local market, from which she is able to earn a small income to support her family. Aside from being a butcher in the local market, she also owns a plot of land that she uses to cultivate rice for a living. With the farming effort, she doesn’t have enough money to cultivate. Thus, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides for cultivating rice. 

Mrs. Váng K. is widow with two children: one is a motorbike repairer and the other is student in a local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides for cultivating rice.

loans.name: Vourn

texts.en:
Vourn E., 26, grows rice and raises pigs, earning U.S. $5 per day. E. is married and resides with her husband and two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkor Wat  and other temples.

Her family spends U.S. $50 on food, $10 on electricity, and $90 on other expenses every month. E. is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase pig food and pigs to raise for sale. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit from her business to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: to buy pig food and pigs to raise for sale

loans.name: Pacaycasa Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Pacaycasa inicia su ciclo 22 con 16 socias, las cuales tienen diversos negocios.
Carmen Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 11 y 4 años de edad. Se dedica a la venta de comida los días domingos en Orcasitas. solicita un préstamo para invertir en la compra de insumos para la preparacion de comidad como son: arroz, papa, condimentos y carne.
Carmen Rosa no sólo se dedica a la venta de alimentos, sino también al acopio y venta de Cochinilla, tara y tuna pero solo lo hace por temporadas.  
A Carmen Rosa le gustan las reuniones de su Banco Comunal, porque se practica mucho los valores, le dan préstamos y puede ahorrar.
Su sueño es abrir una tienda de abarrotes en general y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The Pacaycasa community bank is beginning its 22nd loan cycle with 16 members.  All of the women have different businesses.

Carmen Rosa is a member of the community bank.  She is married and has 2 children aged 11 and 4.  She sells meals on Sundays in Orcasitas.  She is requesting this loan to invest in buying supplies to make meals such as: rice, potatoes, condiments and meat.  Carmen Rosa doesn't just sell food.  She also works storing and selling goods in Cochinilla, Tara and Tuna.  However, that work is seasonal.

Carmen Rosa enjoys her community bank's meetings because they promote values, they provide loans and she is able to save.  Her dream is to open a grocery store and for her children to become professionals.

loans.use: To buy rice, potatoes and meat

loans.name: La Victoire Group

texts.fr: Zaina G.  est entrepreneur, secrétaire du groupe la Victoire, âgée de 52 ans, mariée, mère de 2 enfants dont le fils ainé a 36 ans et le cadet 33 ans. Tous sont diplômés et responsables de leurs propres foyers. Son conjoint est technicien mécanographe. La cliente Zaina G.  est couturière et  vendeuse des habits enfants à son domicile.  Elle fut enseignante, elle  commença son business  avec son fonds propre issu de son salaire. Elle a également eu le concours de son mari dans l’évolution de son entreprise.  Il ya 38 ans qu’elle fait la coupe couture. Elle bénéficia le premier crédit de l’IMF Hekima de 50$ au début de  2009. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  des nouveaux matériels de couture (pagnes, fils, broderies, mordoré, dentelle, etc.).  En plus, elle ambitionne construire un grand atelier de référence dans la ville de Goma, bien équipé et former aussi les membres de sa famille en coupe couture. Selon elle, la coupe couture c’est la vie. L’existence de l’homme sur la terre est conditionnée par l’habillement.  La cliente Zaina G.  remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique. Le groupe la Victoire est constitué de 14 membres.
texts.en: Zaina G. is en entrepreneur and the secretary of the "La Victoire" Group. She is 52 years old, married, and the mother of 2 children; the eldest is 36 and the youngest is 33. They are both educated and have their own homes.  Her husband is a mechanic technician. Zaina G. is a seamstress and she sells children's clothing from her home. She was a teacher but she started her own business with money she saved from her salary. She also received support from her husband in the development of her business. It has been 38 years since she started as a seamstress. In early 2009, she accessed her first loan from IMF Hekima (Kiva Field Partner), amounting to $50. Her new loan will be used to purchase more tailoring materials (fabrics, threads, embroidery materials, metallic fabrics, lace, etc.). In addition, she hopes to build a   well equipped large shop in the city of Goma, where she could also train members of the family   in sewing arts According to her, sewing is life. The existence of man on earth is proportioned by clothing. Zaina G. is thankful to Hekima for their support of the poor who are excluded from traditional banks. The "La Victoire" group is made up of 14 members.

loans.use: To purchase sewing materials (fabric, threads, laces, etc.)

loans.name: Zibula Attude Women's Group-Jinja

texts.en: Thirty-six-year-old B. Sarah is affiliated with Zibula Attude Women's Group-Jinja. She operates a three-year-old general merchandise retail shop in Maga Maga. To get established in this business, Sarah says she banked on savings from her poultry business. Sarah, who is happily married with four kids, says she also has a pub business. The retail business generates for her 100,000 shillings on a weekly basis, and she says with this loan she is going to purchase more retail commodities to resell.

loans.use: To purchase more retail commodities to resell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
