Erlinda is 52 years old, married and supports her family by fish vending and buying and selling of firewood.  She lives in Aborlan, Palawan. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her two businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 15,000. Erlinda is borrowing PHP 17,000 to purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 17th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 16,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Erlinda aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco, de 49 años; es un hombre honesto y trabajador. Vive junto a su esposa Marina, con quien tubo 5 hijos, de los cuales solo vive con 2 de ellos en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Sangani (selva central peruana). El trabajo al que se dedica desde hace 20 años, es la agricultura. Todas las mañanas se dirige a Vista alegre, donde tiene sus sembríos de café y plátano, los cuales cuida gracias a la ayuda del personal que contrata en cada campaña agrícola. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es trasladar café de la ciudad de Pichanaki a Pampa Camona, “ahora que comienza la campaña de café, todos los agricultores necesitan trasporte, en esta temporada es donde tengo mayores ganancias”, afirma. La principal dificultad de Francisco son los gastos de educación de sus hijos; por ello existen días donde le falta dinero para fertilizar y cuidar constantemente sus cultivos. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Gedeón de los olivos”, y este es el cuarto crédito que tiene con MFP, institución que le dio el apoyo para mejorar la calidad de sus plantaciones. Francisco, dentro de un mes cosechará los granos de café que cultivó, por ello con el crédito comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico, los cuales esparcirá entre sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Francisco, age 49, is an honest and hardworking gentleman. He lives with his wife Mariana. They have five children, but only two of them live in their home in the town of Sangani in the central Peruvian jungle. Franciso has been working for twenty years as a farmer. Every morning he heads out to Vista Alegre where he has his own coffee and banana crops. He is able to take care of crops with the help of workers he hires each season. What he enjoys most about his work is transporting his coffee to the city of Pichanaki in Pampa Camona. “Now that the coffee season has started, all farmers need to transport their crops so that they can have better earnings,” says Francisco. His main difficulty is paying for his children’s educational expenses. As a result, there are days when he lacks the money to acquire fertilizers so that he can provide constant care for his crops.

Francisco is a member of the Communal Bank “Gedeón de Los Olivos” (Gideon of the Olive Trees). This is his fourth loan with MFP, the institution that has given him support to improve the quality of his crops. Francisco will be harvesting coffee beans in a month. For this reason, he will use this loan to buy several sacks of organic fertilizers to apply on his crops.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Edelyn

texts.en:
Edelyn is a 37-year-old married woman. She has no kids yet but she hopes to have kids soon.

She is a farmer who helps her husband till their land in Banga, South Cotabato, where they also live. They grow rice and corn to sell to the community. She also manages their sari-sari store where they sell soy sauce, detergent soap, and various other products.

Edelyn's loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Kosiom

texts.en:
Kosiom O. S. is 33 years old and the married father of two children. For the past five years, he has been buying and selling cattle at his home and he earns a good income. Kosiom was introduced to KADET LTD by a KADET staffer who came to his home. He is applying for his first loan to purchase more livestock to sell. 

Kosiom will use the profits from his loan to expand his business. He dreams of becoming a famous businessman in his area and being able to provide his kids with a higher level of education.

loans.use: to purchase livestock to sell

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a thirty eight year old married woman with six children and she owns a house in Kasese Uganda. She has been dealing in the sale of cassava flour for two years in which she started with a capital of 200,000 shillings and now has 1,000,000 shillings. Her hardship is price fluctuation and her vision is to own a food store and educate her children. Joyce needs the loan facility to buy cassava flour for sell.

loans.use: To buy cassava to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Remedios

texts.en:
Ma. Remedios is 55 years old and married with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Remedios has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. 

Ma. Remedios requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell to customers

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Père de 05 enfants, kossi vit en famille avec sa femme.il est âgé  de 39 ans et  a appris la maçonnerie. N’ayant pas beaucoup de chantier mais devant l’obligation de s’occuper de sa famille il décide d’ouvrir un kiosque de produits alimentaires à Lomé depuis 2008.Il s’approvisionne au grand marché pour les besoins de son activité. Ce  second prêt  lui servira à augmenter son stock pour satisfaire convenablement la demande.
texts.en:
Kossi is a father of 5 children, he lives with his wife and family. He is 39 years old, and learnt the trade of masonry. Faced with little construction work and the need to provide for his family, he decided to open a  food products kiosk in Lomé in 2008. 

He obtains the supplies he needs for his business at the Grand Market. This second loan will allow him to increase his inventory in order to meet demand.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. Erlinda has a shop that sells canned goods & snacks. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. Erlinda is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Erlinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Hilda Narcisa

texts.es:
La Señora Hilda es socia del banco comunal Arco Iris, vive por el sector Tres Marías, en este lugar la gente se dedica a la cría de animales, agricultura y como está cerca de la ciudad de Cuenca mucha de su gente labora en la ciudad en diferentes actividades.

La Señora. Hilda tiene 21 años, es casada y tiene 1 hija de 10 meses de edad. Su esposo labora como empleado privado, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de su mamá pero independientes.
 
Doña Hilda se dedica a la cría de pollos en su casa y también labora en una fábrica de pantalones  hace 5 meses.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su suegra, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la entrada de una máquina de coser industrial para realizar trabajos de costura.
 
Su meta es  tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Sra. Hilda is a member of the Communal Bank “Arco Iris” (Rainbow). She lives in the sector of Tres Marías, a place where the residents engage in livestock breeding and agriculture. This area is near the city of Cuenca where many of its people work in different business activities.

Sra. Hilda is 21 years old, married, and has a 10-month-old daughter. Her husband works as an employee for a private company. They do not own a home, so they live at her mother’s house and still remain independent.

Doña Hilda raises chickens at home, but she also has a job at a factory that produces trousers. She has worked there for the past five months.

This is her first loan with the Communal Bank, where she was invited to join by her mother-in-law. The money from her loan will be invested in the down payment toward an industrial sewing machine so that she can take in sewing jobs.

Her goal is to have a house of her own.

loans.use: to make a down payment on an industrial sewing machine.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is a hardworking entrepreneur who has operated a fruit vending business in the Philippines for 20 years. She earns more income from coconut farming. Rebecca is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase more bananas to sell. Rebecca has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more bananas to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 30-year-old business lady. She is married to Kenneth, who is a businessman. They are blessed with one child aged 4 years. She has been running a hair salon as a primary business and a boutique as a secondary business for the past 11 years with the monthly income of 12,000 Kenyan shillings, which she uses to support her family members.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Mary will use the loan to buy beauty products like blow dryers and shampoo and will use the rest to add stock of new clothes to her boutique. 

With the anticipated profit from the two businesses, she will expand the salon and employ some workers. Her hopes and dreams are to own many hair salons in different sites, which will help her improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy beauty products like blow dryers and shampoo.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cashew seeds to sell.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: -Madame Aminata  habite au Sénégal. Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant de 7 ans. Elle s’active dans le commerce de produits alimentaires tels que riz, blé, sucre, savon etc. Son mari commerçant  l’a beaucoup influencé a choisir cette activité de commerce.  Elle est sociétaire d’un guichet de l’U-IMCEC depuis 2009 mais n’a jamais emprunté a l’institution. Elle sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de denrées  a revendre pour les besoins de son commerce. Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent de payer le loyer et d assurer les frais de scolarité de son en enfant.
texts.en:
Ms. Aminata lives in Senegal. She is married and the mother of a 7-year-old child. She is active in the commerce of grocery items, such as rice, wheat, sugar, soap, etc. Her husband is a merchant and has influenced her much in choosing this business.

She has been an associate of a U-IMCEC branch since 2009 but has never borrowed from this micro-finance institution. She is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs for buying food items for resale for her business. The revenues earned from her business enable her to pay the rent and to ensure that her child's schooling costs are covered.

loans.use: to buy grocery items for resale

loans.name: Mauricio

texts.es:
El señor Mauricio es un hombre muy trabajador y padre de dos pequeños por quienes sale adelante para ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida. La casa donde actualmente vive esta familia, la construyo con ahorros propios que con el tiempo se le fueron agotando, a la vivienda le faltan algunos detalles, para esto Mauricio quiere un préstamo para arreglar el baño ya que las paredes aun no están enjarradas y le faltan accesorios como las llaves y la regadera, de esta manera se prevendrá de que alguno de sus hijos pueda contagiarse de alguna enfermedad. 
Mauricio y su esposa trabajan en maquiladora todos los días de la semana y en ocasiones los fines de semana para tener un ingreso extra, para poder sustentar los gastos del hogar y de esta manera darles a sus hijos un mejor confort.
texts.en:
Sr. Mauricio is a hardworking gentleman and the father of two small children. He wants to succeed so that he can offer them a better quality of life.

The house where he currently lives with his family was built using his own savings. Over time, his funds were depleted and his home still lacks a few details. For this reason, Mauricio is requesting a loan to repair a bathroom because the walls have not been installed and the room still lacks accessories such as faucets and a shower. This will prevent diseases from spreading to his children.

Mauricio and his wife work at a factory every weekday and occasionally on the weekends to earn extra money. This allows them to maintain their household expenses and provide their children greater comfort.

loans.use: to finish the construction of a bathroom.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is a hardworking business man aged 38.  He is married and blessed with four children.  For the last two years, he has been managing a curio shop (store for tourists) to raise his family.  In the next five years, he wants to open several branches of his business.  He is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings to buy raw materials such as bones, paints, and animal skins to make curios.  Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to expand his business through his previous loans.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as bones, paints, and animal skins to make curios.

loans.name: Dina

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “SILKINCHANY” el banco se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad de Angostura, en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Dina; la socia tiene 33 años de edad, la socia es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 15, 12, 10, 1 años de edad, la socia se dedica al reciclaje, la socia va todos los sábados y domingos a los diferentes barrios y va tocando casa por casa para que le vendan botellas de plástico, metales, ella tiene una pequeña carreta en la cual pone todos los residuos recolectados y sigue su caminar hasta la tarde y la socia luego de esto lo vende. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de residuos sólidos como plásticos y metal para la venta final.
La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “SILKINCHANY” communal bank, located in the Angostura community, in the province of Cusco, Cusco Department.

This is Mrs. Dina; she is 33, married, and has 4 children ages 15, 12, 10 and 1. She works in recycling. Every Saturday and Sunday she goes to the various neighbourhoods, door-to-door, to buy plastic bottles and metal. She has a small wagon for gathering the recyclables, and she keeps walking until the afternoon. She later sells these products. She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of recyclables such as plastics and metal for later sale.
She is grateful for the support that we are offering and promises to repay her quotas in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of recyclables for sale.

loans.name: Dina

texts.es: Dina, de 37 años, es una mujer muy activa, vive en su propia casa junto a su pareja y sus tres queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles un buen porvenir. Dina es una mujer con muchas responsabilidades que cumplir, por ello se despierta muy temprano para dirigirse a su centro de trabajo y abrir las puertas de su negocio en espera de sus primeros consumidores. Desde hace 07 años que se dedica en la de venta de productos de primera necesidad, tales como arroz, azúcar, fideos, detergentes, conservas, entre otros productos. Se siente muy contenta con la tienda que posee, por que gracias a ello, adquirió espacios de terreno para cultivar, en la cual su pareja se dedica al cuidado y del que también obtiene ganancias que son derivados para los gastos de educación de sus hijos. Este será su primer crédito con MFP y por tanto está contenta saber que ustedes la van a apoyar. Con los 3,000 soles, que solicita, comprará una congeladora que le será de gran utilidad en su puesto de ventas, así preservará mejor sus productos.
texts.en:
Dina, 37, is a very active woman.  She lives in her own house with her spouse and three beloved children that she wants to provide a good future for.  Dina is a woman with many responsibilities to fulfill.  Because of that she rises very early to head to her workplace and open the doors to await her first consumers.  

She’s been selling basic need items for the last 7 years; items such as sugar, rice, noodles, detergent, canned goods, among others.  She feels very happy with the store she has because thanks to it she was able to acquire farmland that her spouse works and which also produces income that’s used to pay for her children’s education.  

This will be her first MFP loan and she’s happy to know that you will support her.  She will use the requested 3000 soles to buy a freezer that will be very useful to her in her sales stand because she’ll be able to better preserve her products.

loans.use: to buy a freezer.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es: Maria Mercedes es madre soltera con un hijo de 5 años a su cargo. Ella se dedica a la venta mercadería en general, desde hace mas de 4 años la necesidad de proveerle a su familia ingresos ha hecho que Maria salga adelante. Ella mujer muy trabajadora que se desempeña por lo que hace, además la mayoría de sus encargos los entrega personalmente para saber la opinión de sus clientes. Ella solicita el préstamo para invertir en pantalones, camisas, faldas, vestidos, shorts, trajes, cosméticos, calzado, bolsos, sabanas, prendas de oro laminado y plata.
texts.en:
Maria Mercedes is a single mother with a five-year-old son under her care. She has been selling general merchandise for more than four years. The need to provide for her family’s income has spurred Maria to move forward. She is a very hardworking woman who strives to achieve everything she can. Most of her orders are delivered personally so that she can get the opinions of her customers.

Maria is requesting a loan to invest in trousers, shirts, skirts, suits, shorts, dresses, cosmetics, shoes, bags, bed sheets, and gold and silver-plated jewelry.

loans.use: to buy trousers, shirts, skirts, suits, shorts, dresses, cosmetics, shoes, bags, bed sheets, and gold and silver-plated jewelry.

loans.name: Lkhagvadorj

texts.en: Lkhagvadorj, 43, a carpenter since 2006 with a steadily increasing clientele, resides with his wife and four children in the slum district of Erdenet, Mongolia's third largest city. Because of the increasing volume of his business, Lkhagvadorj wants to make some renovations to his workshop and purchase some new tools to better meet his customers' needs. His loan will be used for these purposes.

loans.use: to purchase some building materials to renovate his workshop and purchase some new carpentry tools.

loans.name: Charlene

texts.en:
Charlene is 42 years old and is married with 5 children.

Charlene works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock for her store.

Charlene has previously borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF. She has been running the sari-sari store for 10 years and also earns an income from buying and selling ready-to-wear items.

Charlene aspires to renovate her store.

loans.use: To buy more products for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 36 years old and a mixed crop farmer. He is married to Keziah, who is a business lady. They are blessed with one child, aged one year. He has been in the farming business for the past seven years with the monthly income of about KES 6,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan term from KADET LTD after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Stephen will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for his farm.

With the anticipated profit from the business he will buy another piece of land. His hope and dreams are to export his farm produce, which will help him improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Dip C Group

texts.en:
William is the facilitator of Dip C group. William and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

 William is a father of three children. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, William had a good maize yield, harvesting 6 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  he was only able to harvest 1 1/2 bags of maize on ½ an acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to William and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, William will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing. 

In 2012, the members of Dip C group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land. 

William is pictured in the photograph with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Namushiya B Group

texts.en:
Margaret is the facilitator of the Namushiya B group. Margaret and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Margaret takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices and to ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Margaret had a good maize yield harvesting five bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Margaret was only able to harvest one bag of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Margaret and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Margaret will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Namushiya B group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Margaret is pictured with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal   ”LOS ANGELES”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra Maria Reyna;  La socia tiene 32años de edad, La socia es casada, La socia tiene 2 hijos de 11, 7 años de edad; La socia se dedica a la atención de su tienda de abarrotes, la socia se dedica a la compra y venta de productos de primera necesidad, la socia tiene una tienda de abarrotes, y en ella vende arroz, azúcar, fideos, harinas, leche, aceite, mazamorras, gelatinas y otros productos de consumo, la socia también desea invertir en la compra de panetones aprovechando las fiestas navideñas, La socia en esta ocasión desea invertir el crédito en la compra de productos como arroz al por mayor, azúcar, harinas, fideos, panetones y otros, para implementar su tienda.

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "Los Angeles" communal bank. This bank is located in the Huanchac district in the province and department of Cusco.
This is Sra. Maria Reyna. She is 32, married, and has two children ages 7 and 11. She runs her own grocery store; she sells basic staples such as rice, sugar, pasta, flour, milk, oil, maize soup, and Jell-O. She also wants to invest in the purchase of Christmas pastries for the Christmas season. She would like to invest this loan in the wholesale purchase of products such as rice, sugar, flour, pasta, and Christmas pastries to stock her store.
She is grateful for this loan and promises to pay her quotas on time.

loans.use: to purchase products wholesale, such as rice, sugar, flour, pasta, Christmas pastries and other items for her store.

loans.name: Lydiah

texts.en:
Lydia is a married lady who sells clothes and lives in Mombasa. The business has been in operation for three years. 
After being introduced to Milango by her friends, she is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to purchase new clothes for sale. 
Lydia looks forward to owning a free mark in the future despite the challenge of some customers not paying on time and high cost of materials.

loans.use: To purchase new clothes for sale.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Rosario tiene 41 años, es madre soltera tiene 3 hijos. Juntos viven en el centro poblado de canayre del distrito de LLochegua. Desde que Rosario se separó de su esposo, tomó las riendas de la familia como madre y padre a la vez. Posee un pequeño negocio, que es uan tienda de abarrotes, ubicado en el centro de su ciudad. Asimismo posee una vivienda amplia y espaciosa por lo que aprovechó en amueblarla y abrir un pequeño hospedaje, de esa manera obtiene un ingreso más. Y como si fuera poco tambiñen cuenta con una peluquería, usualmente trabaja en compañía de su hija, quien la apoya en la atención al cliente. Por todo ello es que Rosario se encuentra muy contenta, y ahora lo que importa es abastecer su tienda con diversos productos, pues el poco capital que tenía lo invirtió para amueblar su hospedaje. Este será su primer credito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de mas productos.
texts.en: Rosario is 41 years old. She is a single mother of 3 children. They live in the center of the town of Canayre in the district of LLochegua. Since Rosario separated from her husband, she took the reins of the family as a mother and a father at the same time. She has a business, a small grocery store in the center of town. She also has a large, spacious house which she has furnished and opened for a small inn, to make more income. And as if that weren't enough, she also has a hair salon. She usually works with her daughter, who helps her with serving customers. With all of this, Rosario is very happy. Now she has to stock her store with different products, because what little capital she had she invested in furnishing her inn. This is her first loan with MFP, and she is committed to making her payments on time. With the 1,500 nuevos soles, she will invest in buying more products.

loans.use: to buy more products to stock her store.

loans.name: Evalyne

texts.en:
Evalyne is married and has children between the ages of two and 25. Seven of her children attend school. She has been in farming for six years producing milk, maize, and vegetables, which she sells locally in her hometown of Kitale.

Evalyne is requesting a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo, which she will use to buy and insure a dairy cow. Dairy farming has always been her source of income to support her family. Some of the milk supplements her family's meals as well as earns income for other basic needs for her large family. She aspires to have more dairy cows to ease her family's needs. Her farming challenge remains the high cost of the management of diseases.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Kotognogontala. Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe KOTOGNOGONTALA sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 36  ans  et  en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygamiques à HAMDALLAYE un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts antérieures ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait l’achat et la vente de vêtements, de pagnes en bazin teintés, du bois de chauffes et d’articles divers.
KADIA, assise à gauche sur la photo, fait le commerce de pagnes de bazins teintés dans ce groupe de femmes KOTOGNOGONTALA. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt une soixantaine de mètre en pagne bazins de divers motifs qu’elle fait teinter. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Sikasso ville.  Elle les revend de façon ambulante dans les différents quartiers de la viIle de Sikasso, sur commande et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 37.000 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.

loans.use: Pour acheter des pagnes bazins

loans.name: Santiago

texts.en:
Santiago, 53, and his wife Margarita live in the village of Indian Creek, close to the highway connecting southern Belize to the ex capital of Belize City. Road infrastructure means connection to the electric grid, but also higher expenses due to power bills.

Santiago, a father of six, lives with his wife and their youngest, a 17-year-old son. Having initially tried to manage a teaching job alongside farming, he opted to join the ranks of many farmers making their land their full-time job and are looking sustain their families by tapping into new markets for cash crops. To diversify his income stream, Santiago has kept his eyes and ears open about different market opportunities, this has led him to expand to pumpkin, a high-demand crop on the neighboring Guatemala market. Moreover, there is pre-harvest financing for pumpkin, whereas until now there were virtually no financing mechanisms in place for cacao farmers. Santiago has been investing his income in home improvement and diversifying his food supply, such as his recently installed small-scale tilapia ponds.

Cacao farming has proved to be risky business for Santiago, whose crop was devastated by Hurricane Iris in 2001, and again in 2007 by a fire that spread from a neighboring farm. Persistent in his efforts, however, he replanted every time, and even transplanted 500 new seedlings in September of 2012 to expand his cacao farm, which has 30-year-old trees. Cacao trees take three to five years to begin producing pods and continue at full capacity for 60-70 years. Farmers have to routinely clean and prune their cacao trees to ease access for harvesting, prevent spread of mold infestation and increase yields in the coming harvest season.

loans.use: To clean his cacao farm of close to 1,000 mature trees and 500 seedlings.

loans.name: Rwibaale Traders Group

texts.en:
Annet is a married mother with three children. She lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She is a peasant growing cereal crops like millet, sorghum, rice, and g.nuts. She buys and sells to other produce dealers in the rural areas of Kyenjojo. She also operates a retail shop for additional income. She has been a member of a village Bank Group where members save and guarantee one another to get a loan. She experiences low capital to buy her products, accompanied by price changes. Her vision is to become a model farmer in her area. 

Annet needs the loan to buy irish (potatoes) and bananas to sell.

loans.use: to buy irish (potatoes) and bananas to sell

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is a maize farmer from Makada village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Jonathan would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cover his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Jonathan can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Jonathan, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing for his family, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Las Nenas Group

texts.es:
En Oaxaca hay una localidad incrustada en medio de varios cerros, el más famoso es conocido como "La Pedrera". Anteriormente este cerro era una cantera de donde se extraía el material para construir los cimientos de las viviendas. También es una comunidad rica en tradiciones y festividades como el Día de la Virgen de Guadalupe que los habitantes celebran en la ermita del pueblo. 

  El grupo Las Nenas está integrado por ocho personas, en su mayoría mujeres, ellos son: Ernestina quien vende carne de pollo y cerdo; María y Lauriano, antojitos típicos; Virginia, artículos de plata; Lucero y Elizabeth, calzado por catálogo; María Isabel, cocteles de camarón; Rocío, comida y Mariel, recipientes de plástico. 

   Virginia, o Viky como la llaman de cariño, es una mujer activa y emprendedora. Después de separarse, ella se hizo responsable de sus dos hijos, un joven de doce años y un pequeño de nueve. Ellos son su principal motor y motivo por el cual decidió dedicarse a la venta de artículos de plata, oro laminado y acero inoxidable, “Mis hijos son mi principal inspiración, inicie con mi actividad para que nada les falte” comenta con seguridad Doña Viky. Los principales clientes son trabajadores de la industria cañera así como maestros de la comunidad. Por otro lado, también ayuda a su hermana en un negocio de comida con el propósito de mejorar su calidad de vida.

   Con la oportunidad del préstamo podrá comprar anillos, pulseras, aretes y relojes. Espera que con las ventas de sus productos pueda iniciar un negocio de ropa por catálogo, cuidando ante todo la estabilidad de su actividad. 

El grupo Las Nenas agradece a VisionFund México y KIVA por la confianza y oportunidad de poder obtener el préstamo que les ayuda a cumplir con sus metas. 

*La fotografía fue tomada en el patio de la casa de María Isabel, Viky tiene en las manos el catálogo con su mercancía.

loans.use: Comprara:anillos, pulseras, aretes y relojes

loans.name: Laidou Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe LAIDOU ont en moyenne 42 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à TENE/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités  d’achat et de vente des condiments, des céréales et de la boisson.
 Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe LAIDOU sont à leur 9ème prêt solidaire. LOBO, femme debout au milieu sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  10 casiers de COCACOLA, 10 casiers de FANTA, 10 casiers de SPRINT et 8 casiers de jus d’ananas. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.

loans.use: Achat  de soda

loans.name: Iris Noemi

texts.es:
Iris opta por un nuevo crédito para reactivar su negocio, piensa comprar diversos productos como cosméticos, lociones, carteras, ropa, etc., ofrecerá un inventario renovado en la temporada navideña, su objetivo es atender a sus clientes lo mejor posible para tener mayores ventas y ganancias.
El crédito anterior le ha dado un resultado positivo, al utilizarlo para mejorar su negocio pudo incluir la venta de nuevos productos y estabilizarse económicamente, su familia se mantiene.

loans.use: comprar diversos productos como cosméticos, lociones, carteras, ropa, etc., ofrecerá un inventario renovado en la temporada navideña

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria Ortiz who is a 49 year-old originally from Cañar, Ecuador has two children and runs a small music store. Ms. Ortiz lost her husband a few years ago and is completely in charge of managing the business and supporting her young ones. Her store which is in the Municipal Enrique Grau has 25 years of experience and sells CDs and Ecuadorian music recordings to members of the community. Every day from 6 a.m. until 6 p.m. Maria takes care of the store. She is asking for a $355 loan to be able to buy different products in cash, so that she can get a discount from her supplier. She wants lenders to know that she is industrious and emprendedora – or entrepreneurial.

loans.use: Maria needs this $355 loan to purchase media from her suppliers in bulk so that she can get discounts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand the production of beehives

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.en:
Lorenza lives on a farm with her husband and her only child who is now 17. Together they all work to produce rice. She has lived in Baba her entire life and she has survived from her agricultural production. She hopes to take out a loan in order to buy fertilizer and pesticides that will help her nurture her crops. With the profits, she hopes to make some improvements to her home.

Communal Banking in Baba

This borrower is part of one the new Communal Banks formed in the recently developed Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the Progresista Baba Communal Bank are part of an association of rice farmers in the county of Baba in rural Ecuador. Their organization, La Asociacion Montubia Progresista, works cooperatively to help their members cultivate rice and commercialize the product after it has grown. Specifically, they help farmers by providing access to machinery and training services. The farmers from Montubia Progresista have received special instruction on financial responsibility and accounting from Codemicro, an organization that specializes in training programs geared towards the rural sector.

The members of La Asociacion Montubia Progresista de Baba will use the micro-loans to prepare their lands and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each others' guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many micro-finance programs, but Mifex believes that is imperative for the communities we works with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Below is more information about Baba compiled by Luis Crespo and Robert Edgar of the Mifex team when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program.

Economy of Baba

The people of Baba have been organized since the days of Gran Colombia when Ecuador was yet to be a country. The area has always been popular because of the extremely productive lands that gave way to cultivation of cacao for decades. Now Baba is a county in the province of Los Rios in the coastal region of Ecuador. For most of the latter part of the 20th Century it was a cacao and banana producing sector. Most of the surrounding areas of Baba in Los Rios are owned by large mulitnational companies such as Dole, but Baba is a sector characterized by the small and informal farms.

Rice production has now turned into the main economic activity of the sector as about 80% of the people are rice farmers. Cacao is still very popular in the area, but because of the long cultivation cycle people prefer to invest in rice. The lands in Baba are very fertile though, and most farmers in the sector often grow other crops, such as plantains and soy beans as secondary sources of income. Many farmers also keep livestock as emergency sources of food and income, commonly resorting to selling a chicken or pig if they are in need of cash.

Rice Farming in Baba

Most of the people in the Baba area are small farmers. They produce about 80 sacks of rice per hectare of land. In order to farm they first must prepare the lands by removing weeds, plowing and leveling the lands. This is the most difficult part for the farmers in Baba, who often lack the necessary machinery to properly plow the lands for rice production. After appropriately preparing the lands, the farmers fill an area with water to form what is known as a paddy field, because rice is a very water intensive crop. The rice seeds are either dispersed freely (the process is known as boleo in Spanish) or hand sowed. Once the rice has grown, most farmers rent machinery that helps them gather their production.

Access to Credit

One of the biggest struggles in the area has been the lack of credit due to the absence of any type of financial institution. Because people do not count on formal financial finance, they have turned to loan sharks for financing. They have been affected by expensive lines of credit that exceed 100% interest a year and can be as expensive as 240%. Intermediaries also exploit the farmers because of their outstanding debt. Farmers also lack skills and knowledge to commercialize their products and pay fair prices for their crops.

Risks

The largest risk in the sector is due to absence of watering systems. Although Baba is in the province “Los Rios” (the rivers) there is severe problem with access to water. The lack of infrastructure in the sector does not allow the small farmers to benefit from the presence of the many rivers in the area. If the winter season is too dry, it is likely that the lands will not be sufficiently fertile for rice production in the summer. On the other hand, if there is too much rain there are not any drainage systems to prevent flooding and the crops are often ruined. Generally speaking though, Baba is a very productive sector where the lands yield all types of crops including rice, cacao, corn, watermelons, plantains, and soy beans.

Loan Use

The loans in this sector will mostly be used to to buy soil, seeds, fertilizer and insecticides. Many clients will use the capital towards renting machinery and equipment necessary to effectively work and prepare the fields. Clients also typically use a part of the loan to buy livestock in order to raise and have as reserves. The loan repayment schedule is different from the typical micro-entrepreneur because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures. Mifex asks our rural clients only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 6 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the seventh and final month.

loans.use: Rice cultivation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his lemon-selling business

loans.name: Justa

texts.es:
Justa C., mother of three children, has been a member of Pro Mujer for 3 years. She belongs to the Mujeres del Futuro (Women of the Future) association in the Villa Adela neighborhood.

She works making clothing and other articles out of silk. All her work is handcrafted, made by hand and with a sewing machine. At present she brings all her products to the city of Oruro, where she has the necessary contacts to sell her products. Sometimes she works by special order, but generally she has buyers who wait for her arrival.

At present, Justa is responding to a great demand for clothing, working day and night, which is the only way to fill the demand of her customers. For this reason, she needs capital in order to buy more basic materials. This is the only way she can work peacefully, knowing she will fill the orders from her buyers.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Justa C., madre de tres niños, es socia de Pro Mujer hace 3 años, pertenece a la asociación Mujeres del Futuro de la zona de Villa Adela.

Se dedica a la confección de artículos y prendas de ceda, todos sus trabajos son artesanales y realizados a mano y una máquina de coser. Actualmente lleva toda su producción a la ciudad de Oruro, donde ya tiene los contactos necesarios para poder vender sus productos, en ocasiones trabaja a pedido, pero generalmente tiene ya compradoras que esperan la llegada de Justa.

Actualmente Justa responde a una gran demanda de prendas, trabajando día y noche, la única forma de cumplir con sus clientes. Por tal motivo, ella precisa de capital para poder comprar más materia prima, solo de esta forma podrá trabajar con la tranquilidad necesaria, de saber que va a cumplir con sus compradores.

loans.use: To buy more basic materials so she can work peacefully, knowing she can meet the needs of her buyers.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Mrs. Sam S., age 42, grows and sells green beans at the market to earn $6.50 per day in revenue. Her husband, age 50, works selling ice cream, making about $6 per day in income. They have nine children. Three children are students, three work at a garment factory earning about $150 per month collectively, and three are married and live away from home. Mrs. Sam would like to borrow $700 to purchase ice cream ingredients for her husband's business and to buy fertilizer and seeds for her bean plantation.

loans.use: To purchase ice cream ingredients and agriculture supplies.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary is a 32-year-old widow.  She lives in Sagam, Siaya Kenya. She used the funds from her first two loans to invest in this small corner shop (pictured) adjacent to her home, where she sells the daily necessities like bread, flour, cooking oil and soap and fresh milk.  She has since increased her daily income by 90% and managed to save a bit of her profits.  She plans to move her business into a larger space and a more lucrative location with US $600 she has applied for. She will use this money to pay rent for a larger shop, to increase her stock and to obtain supplies that are in high demand within her community.

loans.use: Increase stock in her retail shop and pay rent for a larger space.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase shoe stock for her business

loans.name: Arzu

texts.en: Arzu is an Internally Displaced Person from the Zangilan region situated in the southwest part of the country known as the Azerbaijan-Armenian conflict zone. She lives in Sumgayit town now. She and her husband Adalat (shown in the picture) rent a shop and sell male clothing and shoes. They have had this business for more than 4 years. They want to increase the number and variety of goods but they have little of their own funds. They want to borrow $600, with a repayment period of 12 months, for investing in their business.

loans.use: To increase the variety of goods

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort A. is a married mother of five children. She helps support her family and her husband, who is a mason, by selling plantains. Plantains are very popular in Ghana and are used to prepare a dish called “Fufu”.

Comfort is requesting $275 to buy plantains in bulk.

Comfort is also a member of a lending group called “Wisdom Group”, which consists of 14 members in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy plantains in bulk.

loans.name: Yndalesia

texts.en:
Yndalesia is forty-four years old and mother of two sons and one daughter, all of whom attend school. Yndalesia sells homemade sweets and cakes to teachers and students of a public high school located in the Felicita community of Yamasá.

Yndalesia says that her children would like to become professionals someday, and she adds that she’d do everything to help them achieve this goal. With her loan, she will buy more raw materials to keep preparing her delicious sweets and cakes in order to increase her revenue and better fend for her family.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials for her pastry shop

loans.name: María

texts.en:
María is a young entrepreneur and the proud mother of a lovely son. She struggles to earn a living and take care of her family. Shortly after her child’s birth, María was forced to leave school in order to get a job to support her child. As her son’s father doesn’t have a good job, María started a business selling pastelitos (meat or chicken turnovers) in her neighborhood. She explains that this venture has been very profitable because she cooks like nobody’s business.

María is requesting this loan (her second from FSMA) to buy more ingredients so that she can move her business forward and lift her family out of poverty.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to keep producing her delicious 'pastelitos'

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes N. is forty-five years old, married, and has two children, one of whom is in senior high school, while the other one is in primary school. Agnes is hard-working and dedicated, and therefore successful in her business. For the past twelve years, she has been working as a retail seller of eggs and onions, financially supporting her family. Agnes is now in need of a loan to be able to increase her supply of onions and eggs and to serve her customers throughout the season, especially in the face of increasing prices due to the current food crisis in the country. Agnes is a member of the trust group called Anyidado (Hope) Trust Group, whose members provide a guarantee for one another as social collateral to help access and repay loans.

loans.use: Purchase of maize and eggs for sale

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.fr:
Ms. Antoinette H. is married to François MITCHODJEHOUN, a city taxi driver who became mentally ill three or more years ago. She is the mother of five children, three of whom are in her care and attending school in grades 7, 5, and 2, respectively. Ms. Antoinette H. was born on October 25, 1976 in COTONOU and resides in the same city, in the GBEDJEWIN district. Her main business was selling porridge for four years. Last September, she requested a loan of 20,000 (francs) to increase her business by selling cakes. Her daily receipts come to at least 3,500 francs CFA. Thanks to her improvements, she is presently requesting a fifth loan of 100,000 francs CFA to make bulk purchases and to improve her family's situation.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Dame H. Antoinette est mariée à MITCHODJEHOUN François qui fût conducteur de taxi urbain mais devenu malade mental depuis plus de 3 ans. Elle est mère de 5 enfants dont 3 sont à sa charge et tous scolarisés respectivement en classe de 5ème, CM2 et CEI. Dame H. Antoinette est née le 25 octobre 1976 à COTONOU et réside dans la même ville au quartier GBEDJEWIN. Elle avait pour activité principale la vente de bouillie depuis 4 ans. Elle a sollicité au mois de septembre dernier un prêt de 20000 pour augmenter son activité par la vente de gâteaux. Elle fait une recette journalière de 3500fcfa au moins. Grâce à son évolution, elle sollicite à présent un 5ème crédit de 100000 FCFA pour effectuer des achats en gros et pour améliorer la situation de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy two sacks of corn, one sack of sugar, one sack of flour, and 10 kg of peanuts

loans.name: Livestock And Woodwork Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. Kinh Thi N. is 52 years old. The four other members in her group has participated in the first round and have been very good at handling the repayments. Mrs. N. works for the Women’s Association; she is very hardworking and industrious. Her family has many occupations including: raising pigs and chicken, farming, making and selling buns. Her son makes wooden art. In this round of funding she is requesting 4,704,000 VND to supplement her investments in buying breeding chickens.

Her group includes:

  • Mrs. Huong Thi N. is requesting 2,464,000 VND to buy breeding pigs.
  • Mrs. Thuy Thi N. is requesting 354,000 VND to buy feed for chickens.
  • Mrs. Dang Thi N. is requesting 4,256,000 VND to buy breeding chickens.
  • Mrs. Lien Thi N. is requesting 2,245,000VND to supplement her capital in a woodworking business.

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Chi N., Kiva volunteer.

    Cô Nguyễn Thị Kình (MS: 11040001), năm nay 52 tuổi. Bốn thành viên trong nhóm cô đã tham gia chu kỳ một và đã hoàn trả rất tốt. Bản thân cô làm cán bộ Hội Phu Nữ rất chăm chỉ và năng động. Gia đình cô làm rất nhiều nghề như: nuôi lợn, gà, làm ruộng, làm bánh bán, con trai cô còn làm gỗ mỹ nghệ. Lần nay cô vay 4.704.000 VND để bổ sung vốn mua gà giống.

    Trong nhóm cô còn có:

  • Chị Nguyễn Thị Hường (MS: 040004), vay 2.464.000 VND để mua lợn giống.
  • Chị Nguyễn Thị Thủy (MS: 040003), vay 354.000 VND để mua cám cho gà.
  • Chị Nguyễn Thị Đang (MS: 040002), vay 4.256.000 VND để buôn gà giống.
  • Chị Nguyễn Thị Liên (MS: 040026), vay 2.242.000 VND để bổ sung vốn làm đồ gỗ.

loans.use: Buying breeding animals, invest in woodworking business

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca is 24 years old and completed her primary school. She lives with her husband and 3 children in the center of Ccotos. She has been a member of the communal bank of Juchuy Nino in Capachica for 6 years. With her first loan she was able to purchase fish which she sold at a profit. With the second loan she was able to purchase a small boat.

She and her husband work together fishing, and Francisca sells the fish on Wednesdays in the market of Coata and on Sundays in the plaza of Capachica. Two years ago she also began to make handicrafts which she can also sell.

With the new loan, which she will repay in 4 payments, she will invest in the fishing business including the maintenance of the boat, as well purchase supplies for the handicrafts she makes and sells.

Her dream is to have her own handicraft shop in the center of Ccotos, because tourism is growing in this area. She would be able to send her children to school in Puno, so that they are able to get a better education than she did.

Francisca tiene 24 años de edad, estudió primaria completa, es casada madre de tres hijos, ella vive en el Centro Poblado de Ccotos sector Nº 4. Es socia del Banco Comunal Juchuy Niño – Capachica, hace siete años, con su primer préstamo compró malla de pescar 04 redes, con el siguiente crédito pudo comprar un bote haciendo realidad su meta, ahora ella trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo en la pesca y ella vende pescado los miércoles en el mercado de Coata y los domingos en la plaza de Capachica, así fue aumentando su capital, hace dos años se dedica a la artesanía de tejido de chompas, chalinas y otros. Con este crédito de S/. 2,000.00 Nuevos Soles, que pagará en 04 cuotas, invertirá S/. 750.00 Nuevos Soles en malla de pescar, S/. 120.00 en el pintado del bote y para su artesanía comprará 08 conos de lana de alpaca y lana sintética para la combinación de colores. Su sueño es tener una tienda propia de artesanía, en el mismo Centro Poblado de Ccotos porque el turismo a aumentado en esa zona, así podrá educar a sus hijos en la ciudad de Puno para que sea mejor que ella. Doña Francisca confía en el Banco Comunal porque gracias a los préstamos pudo salir adelante y le da mucha suerte, manifestó muy alegre.

loans.use: TO INVEST IN THEIR FISHING BUSINESS, AS WELL AS PURCHASE SUPPLIES FOR THE HANDICRAFTS SHE MAKES AND SELLS.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Khekh Niakk  qui signifie lutter contre la pauvreté en wolof  est un groupe de quatre personne qui s'active communément dans la couture. ce pret Contribue au renforcement de leur capital pour satisfaire la demande de clientèle dans les préparatifs des fetes de korité et tabaski.
texts.en:
Khekh Niakk which means struggle against poverty in Wolof is a group of four people who are working together in the field of selling dressmaking. This loan will contribute to bolstering their capital so as to satisfy the demand of their clientele as people prepare for the holidays of "korité" and "tabaski" (Muslim Feast of the Sacrifice).

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: dressmaking

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La señora Nancy pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Auroras en Acción, tiene 40 años de edad y vive en la calle Manuel Seoane manzana 8 lote 2 Aurora Díaz,  distrito de Salaverry, provincia de Trujillo, La Libertad, Perú. Es presidenta del banco comunal y pertenece también al comedor popular de su sector.
Nancy estudió hasta tercer año de secundaria, sus padres la apoyaron hasta el sexto grado de primaria. Como toda mujer emprendedora continuó estudiando y trabajando, pero le fue imposible continuar el cuarto y quinto de secundaria.  Se casó con Ángel Carranza con quien tiene un hijo y una hija, los cuales aún están estudiando.
Empezó su negocio vendiendo marcianos y alquilando su pequeña piscina, luego empezó a vender menú y ahora está ampliando su negocio con miras de abrir uno en Virú.
Actualmente su negocio se ubica en el local del comedor popular Purísima Concepción donde es tesorera y se encuentra frente a su domicilio.
Su primer préstamo fue de 300 soles, el cual devolvió en 4 cuotas y con el que amplió su negocio.
Con este crédito de 1,500 soles, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, arreglará su nevera y comprará una refrigeradora de segunda mano para ir implementando su negocio de Virú.
Nancy sueña con poner un gran restaurant turístico en Salaverry.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nancy belongs to the Auroras in action community bank. She is 40 years old and lives at 8 Manuel Seoane lot 2 Aurora Diaz, in the district of Salaverry, in the province of Trujillo, La Libertad, Perú. She is president of the community bank and also belongs to the popular cafeteria of her area. Nancy studied through the third year of secondary school and her parents supported her through the 6th grade. Like any enterprising woman, Nancy continued studying and working but it was impossible to finish the 4th and 5th year of secondary school. She married Angel Carranza, with whom she has one daughter and one son, who are still students. Nancy began her business by selling martians and renting her small pool. Later she began to sell food, and is currently expanding her business with aims of opening one in Virú. Currently her business is located in the building of the popular cafeteria Purísima Concepcíon, where she is the treasurer, and is located across from her house. Her first loan of 300 soles, which she returned in 4 months, she used to expand her business. With this loan of 1,500 soles, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will fix the freezer and purchase a second-hand refrigerator to use in her Virú location. Nancy dreams of opening a large tourist restaurant in Salaverry.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fix freezer and purchase second-hand refrigerator

loans.name: Sarann

texts.en: Mrs. Sarann C. is 18 years old and lives with her husband, Mr. Prum Lakna, in Trapeang Kok village in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a pig breeder and he is a motorbike driver.  Mrs. Sarann C. faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money to expand her business. In order to deal with this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to buy five piglets. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions as a result of this loan.

loans.use: To buy five piglets

loans.name: Mrs. Korn Chuon Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank consists of ten people who all live in Trapang Pring Village in Kampong Chhnang Province.  Mrs. Korn C. is a village bank president who has been selected by the members.  She is a cow breeder.  She is a 51-year-old widow with four children, two of whom are firewood collectors who usually go into the forest and gather firewood to sell, while the other two are attending the local school. 

Although she and her children have different businesses, they still live in an old house and poor conditions.  In order to provide better conditions, Mrs. Korn C. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to build a new house for her family.
 
This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans.  Two members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. These two are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term.  End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor.  It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to.  Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term.  Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time.  AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To add to her savings to build a new house for her family.

loans.name: Mariana

texts.es: Mariana tiene 28 años, es madre soltera, vive con su madre y su hija. Hace 6 años quedó embarazada y tuvo que iniciar un trabajo para mantener a su hija, su madre la apoyó para instalar una tienda en su casa, y gracias a ella pudo  tener su negocio propio, en el cual se ocupa durante todo el día tratando de mejorar constantemente y tener la mercadería necesaria para el consumo diario de los pobladores, y gracias a ser la única tienda en los alrededores de su localidad le da buenos beneficios. Durante el día es cuando hay más clientela y mayores ventas, pero lo difícil es trasladar la mercadería necesaria desde la ciudad hasta su pueblo. Mariana es nueva en MFP, y espera nivelar su trabajo con las demás personas de su grupo, con respecto a su responsabilidad y compromiso. Con la cantidad que solicita invertirá en la compra de mercadería para surtir su  negocio.
texts.en:
Mariana is 28 years old, a single mother who lives with her mother and her daughter. Six years ago, she got pregnant and had to find a job to support her daughter. Her mother helped her open a store in her home. Thanks to her mother, she was able to have her own business at which she works all day in order to improve her situation. She wants to have all the goods needed for the villagers' daily consumption, and because hers is the only store in the vicinity she does well. She gets most of her clients and most of her sales during the day. She says it is difficult to transport the needed goods from the city to her village. Mariana is a new member of MFP, and she expects that she will live up to the other people in her group in terms of her responsibility and commitment. She will invest this loan in goods to stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the merchandise in her store.

loans.name: Hadjah Nankya‘S Group

texts.en:
Hadjah is a leader of 4 members of a group. She is a 36-year-old married woman with 8 children aged between 9 and 23 years. All her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She owns a five-room house where she lives with ten people. They have electricity and piped water at home. The family gets three meals a day.

She works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She sells matooke (bananas) in Ndeeba Market near Kampala city. Hadjah works seven days a week and doesn’t incur any extra transport costs because she buys from her home. Hadjah sells to an average of 15 customers a day. She is faced with a challenge in the rainy season because she sells from an open place. Hadjah has been in this business for the last three years and has been in MCDT for six years, servicing her twelfth loan and working all this long with the same group mates. Hadjah's monthly expenses include the license fee for her business and school fees. She wants to use this loan to increase the stock of her banana business Hadjah is aspiring to see her business expanding so that she can start buying a whole lorry-full of bananas

loans.use: To buy more bananas

loans.name: Moeun

texts.en:
Moeun R., 52, is married and lives with her husband in the Kampong Cham province. She has a business as a wedding planner and makes around US$3 per day. Her work is to prepare clothes for the groom and bride, and then take photos for them when they get married.

Her husband is a painter and he typically makes US$8 a day. This couple has five children, three of whom are in school and two who are employed.

Mrs. Moeun would like to take out a loan to purchase a printer and wedding equipment.

loans.use: To purchase wedding props and a printer

loans.name: Safina's Group

texts.en: N. Safina is the chairperson of Kajekaire group in Jinja. This is the first loan the group is getting from Pearl Microfinance and they decided to do so because they wanted to improve their livelihood through recapitalizing their businesses.  Safina has a business selling new clothes for young girls and children. She moves around the trading centers in her village and to a few nearby daily markets. This is because she does not have enough stock to cater to the bigger market yet; there is a lot of taxation once you go to many markets. She has two children and she would like to see them grow into responsible citizens by educating them. Safina needs a loan to buy more clothes from Iganga.

loans.use: To buy more bales of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa A. is forty-two years old. She is married and has two children. One of her children is in junior high school. The other has completed junior high school and is currently working for a while before he continues. Her husband is a farmer. Adwoa is a food vendor. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Mampong in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

Adwoa prepares and sells sugar kenkey (dumpling). It is produced from corn dough. She buys bags of maize from farmers in the nearby villages to prepare the kenkey. She adds the sugar to the dough and cooks it. She sells the kenkey in the local market square and also distributes it to retailers.

Adwoa has been in the kenkey business for ten years. She wants a loan to buy maize in bulk to be able to supply more customers. She hopes to sponsor her children in school to high levels.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: Kate is 47 years old and she is married with one child.  She sells clothes, bags and shoes. Kate has been in this business for a long time. She hopes to get a loan loan of N100,000 to purchase more clothes, bags and shoes to sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes, bags and shoes to sell

loans.name: Furkat

texts.en:
With three children and the responsibility of providing food for his family, M. Furkat has raised cattle and farmed for 5 years. He has been able to improve his family’s financial situation thanks to the excellent care that he has given his animals. Today Furkat finds himself in need of more calves to raise, to sell them when necessary, or when their sale will be most advantageous. Furkat is borrowing a loan from IMON International in order to obtain these animals and raise them so that in time they can be used to support his family.

Tajikistan
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, once serving as a key post along the Silk Road and marking the end of Alexander the Great's extensive rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet influence, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON International's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of young cattle

loans.name: Gulbodom

texts.en:
Gulbodom K. is 27 years-old and married with 2 children. She started her own business 8 years ago because her husband was unemployed at the time.  To earn extra income for her family, Gulbodom sells confectionery like candies, cookies, and pastries at the local market. Gulbodom dreams for all her children to receive higher education. Today she requests 5000 TJS to expand the range of goods that she sells at the market.  Gulbodom will use the extra income from expanding her product selection to improve her family's living situation and pay for her children's education.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy more types of confectionery to sell at the market.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Ruzimo

texts.en:
Ruzimo O. lives in the Djabbar Rasulov region of Sugd. Her husband works far away from home. Together they have three children of school age. Ruzimo has to spend a lot of money on their education because her husband doesn’t earn enough money. She is responsible for caring for four cows. Now Ruzimo wants to borrow $800 to buy more calves. She hopes that way to earn more and to be able to cover all the expenses of her dearest children. 
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing small cattle in order to expand the business and improve the living conditions of the family

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina L. is from the village of Tumapagon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 33 years old. Gina is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Gina owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling viands, binignit (a local delicacy) and barbecue (grilled meat) in the local community. Gina has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Gina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business and some funds were used for their daily needs. Gina is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering and engage in the buying and selling of gold dust in their local community. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Gina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children and supplement the income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Julius Mburu

texts.en: Julius K. is 29 years old, married to Lucy Njeri, and together they have one school-going child. Julius has been in the motorcycle transportation business for three years, operating in a place called Kwa-muhia, on the outskirts of Naivasha town. Julius heard about KADET through a friend and this will be his first loan with the organization. With this loan, he plans to buy a new motorbike. Julius’s future dream is to excel in the public transportation business. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 39 years old. She is married to Abelardo Sta. A., who works as a factory worker abroad to provide his family with enough financial support. Because of life difficulties, the couple decided to sacrifice by being far from each other for about two to three years to sustain the needs of their children. They have two children, one of whom is in school. Their youngest will be entering school by the next school year, thus Teresita is really doing her best to maintain her general store.  

Wanting to develop and sustain her business, she decided to borrow a loan amounting to PHP 7,000 to have additional business capital. This will be very helpful for the sustainability of their daily needs.

loans.use: To finance her general store

loans.name: One Work #19 Group

texts.en:
One Work #19 is a group of 5 borrowers led by Bandu B.. They live in Kolahu, Lofa County, Liberia. Bandu is 38 years old and married. She has 2 children, ages 15 and 20. Her oldest is in the 8th grade. Bandu attended high school but was forced to drop out of high school in the 10th grade. She lives in the remote city of Kolahu in rural Lofa County, the breadbasket of Liberia. 

Bandu’s sells retail dry goods, including onions, vitta, and pasta that she buys wholesale in nearby Guinea and sells in a temporary market stall in the Kolahu Central Market. She has run her business for 3 years and is successful because of the way she treats her customers. She’s taking the loan to increase her inventory to meet increased demand. Her dream is to expand her business so that, one day, she can have the biggest table in the central market. With the profits from her business, Bandu dreams of sending her youngest child to university.

loans.use: Purchase onions, vitta, and pasta

loans.name: La Amistad Group

texts.es:
el grupo la Amistad son mujeres muy trabajadoras, se caracterizan por tener una actitud positiva y tambien tienen muchos deseos de superarse en esta vida. 
a continuacion se detalla las actividades que ellas realizan;
la sra. REINA MARCELINA M.: se dedica al comercio y su negocio es la venta de pan , frijoles y goloisinas tambien siembra granos basicos tales como ser maiz , frijoles y café. Durante todo este tiempo ha sabido administrar su negocio lo que le ha permitido salir adelante. doña Marcelina se ha 
esforzado para salir adelante a pesar que todos sus hijos ya no dependen de ella pues ya estan casados pero se ha esmerado para dejarles un patrimonio a sus hijos y sobre todo un buen ejemplo de trabajo y superacion.
la sra.
