MERCEDES DEL CARMEN M.: Ella  elabora y vende golosinas tales como nacatamales , tamalitos , paletas, tiene mas de 5 años de dedicarse a esta actividad economica la que le genera ingresos para cubrir sus compromisos financieros y contribuir en parte en los gastos del hogar , de esta manera doña Mercedes apoya a su esposo Guillermo que se dedica a la agricultura solo tiene una hija que depende de ellos y cursa la secundaria pues los demas trabajan.
Mercedes se siente muy motivada y esto le permite seguir esforzandose para salir adelante 
la sra. SANTOS RAYMUNDA G. L. : se dedica al comercio cuenta con una pulperia donde vende 
productos de consumo de la canasta basica familiar tiene mas de un año de haber instalado su pequeño negocio ya que  anteriormente vendia golosinas tales como nacatamales , tacos y enchiladas , el cambio de negocio le ha dado gran beneficio porque vende diariamente y le genera mayor rentabilidad, esto le permite obtener mejores ganancias. 
su esposo cultiva y vende hortalizas es una pareja muy activa ya que se esfuerzan mutuamente para sacar  adelante  a su familia, forman parte de su familia dos hijos el niño mayor a Temprana edad le diagnosticaron Diabetes y tiene que estar con un tratamiento medico a doña munda como se le conoce en la aldea su negocio le genera ingresos para estar al cuidado de su hijo ya que esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion.

loans.use: compra de carnes de res, pollo y cerdo , harina de maiz, vegetales, tortillas, quesos, mantequilla, manteca, aceite, jabones, salsas,

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine sells groceries at the front of her house in Sapele, Delta state, Nigeria.She hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. She is 50 years old and married with 8 children.she says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery to sell

loans.name: Roman

texts.es: El señor Román vive con su esposa la señora María Luisa Téllez y juntos forman una familia integrada por 2 hijos en edad escolar. El labora para una empresa en el área de vigilancia desde hace un año y su esposa por su parte trabaja en una residencia realizando labores domesticas desde hace 2 años. Juntos como una familia unida iniciaron un negocio  de venta de hamburguesas y burritos de nombre “El cuadro“los fines de semana para poder atenderlo eficientemente. Por una situación de enfermedad de uno de sus hijos tuvieron que cerrar el negocio y por tal motivo solicitan este crédito ahora que su situación ha mejorado desean invertir nuevamente en su negocio ya que la clientela los sigue buscando.
texts.en:
Román lives with his wife María Luisa Téllez. They form a family together with their two school-aged children. Román has worked for a security company for a year, and his wife has worked as a housekeeper in a private residence for two years. As a close family they started up a business together, selling hamburgers and burritos under the name “El cuadro“ (The block) during weekends when they had the opportunity to tend to their stall efficiently. When one of their children fell ill they had to close the business, but now that they have recuperated Román and María Luisa are applying for a loan so that they can set up their business again since their customers continue to ask after them.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in the purchase of products to make and sell food

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es:
la señora Feliciana L. tiene 64 años de edad,  es soltera, se separo de su esposo hace muchos años atras, tiene tres hijos y todos son profesionales, ya no dependen de ella.
desde que su esposo se separo de ella su vida cambio totalmente, a tenido que sacar adelante su hogar sola, pero este negocio le ayuda a sustentar los gastos de su hogar. 
su casa es de adobe, pintada,  su condicion de vida es muy alentadora, tambien tiene un negocio de venta de pan y pulperia desde hace unos años y le esta llendo muy bien.
esta es su unica fuente de ingresos.
Feliciana solicita el credito para poder comprar mas mercaderia y asi poder tener mas variedad de productos en su negocio.
texts.en:
Señora Feliciana L. is 64 years old and single, having separated from her husband many years ago. She has 3 children; all of them are professionals and do not depend on her. Since she separated from her husband her life changed totally; she now must provide for her own needs, but this business helps to cover the household expenses. She has had a business selling bread and a small grocery store for some years, and it is going very well; her house is painted adobe and her living conditions are very encouraging. Her business is her only source of income. Feliciana is requesting a loan so that she can buy more merchandise and in this way have a greater variety of products in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a variety of goods including soups, pastas, salsas, condiments, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La señora TERESA G. C., tiene 45 años, vive en el distrito del Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal SEMILLITAS CREATIVAS.
Ella presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria, tiene 3 hijos quienes dependen económicamente de ella. TERESA se dedica a la fabricación y perfilado de calzado en un pequeño taller que tiene con su tío en su domicilio.
Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles, compró materiales para la fabricación de sus zapatos, sandalias, zapatillas y carteras como: cuero, plantas, cuerina, plantilla, hebillas, etc. 
Con este crédito de 1,000 nuevos soles comprará cuero, plantillas, pegamento, hilos, etc. 
Teresa sueña con tener su propio stand en un centro comercial de Trujillo en donde vender su calzado al por mayor y menor.
texts.en:
Mrs. Teresa G. C. is 45 years old and lives in the district of Porvenir, in the Trujillo province which is part of the La Libertad region of Peru. She belongs to the communal bank “Semillitas Creativas” (Creative Little Seeds). She attended school through grade 11 and has 3 dependent children. Along with her uncle, Teresa designs and manufactures footwear in a small workshop in her home. With her first loan of 300 Nuevos Soles, she bought materials such as leather, soles, suede, insoles, buckles etc. in order to make shoes, sandals, slippers and handbags. With this loan of 1000 Nuevos Soles, she hopes to purchase leather, insoles, glue, thread etc. Teresa dreams of having her own booth at a shopping center where she can sell shoes wholesale and retail.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase leather, insoles, glue etc.

loans.name: Kayunga Basooka Group 2, Jinja

texts.en: S. Amina is 46 years old and married with six children aged 22 to 4 years. She is a business lady making and selling samosas and clothes. She started making samosas with 2 kgs of cowpeas but now uses 6 kgs of cowpeas, and her main challenge is that during the fruit seasons, she does not make a lot of profits since the customers have a lot of choices to make. She also serves breakfast at home, and she would like to transform it into a tea/restaurant business plus starting up a retail shop for more expansion. She is successful now because of loans that have increased her capital base. She is able to put good spices in her samosas and the clothes she sells are of good quality. Amina would also like to build another building apart from that of her husband's house. Amina needs a loan to help her stock more clothes for Christmas sales and from this, she hopes to be able to save for her children's education.

loans.use: Buying more clothes to be sold during the christmas season.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth S., age 32, is a rice farmer. She owns a small rice field, which provides her with a modest income, allowing her to support her family with an adequate supply of food, clothing, and other basic provisions. Her rice farm is doing well at present, and she hopes it will continue to yield an abundant harvest so that she can continue to meet the needs of her family. She has been married since 1999.

She is asking for a loan in the amount of Php 12,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She likes the CEVI program because she is covered with a micro insurance package. Her loan will be used to buy much-needed farm supplies to ensure a successful and ongoing harvest from her field.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase four calves

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr: Monsieur Mamadou D. est un marie de 36 ans père d’un enfant et habitant à Yoff dans le quartier de Ndennatte.Il est sociétaire de la caisse de yoff depuis 2001 et a déjà bénéficié de 6 crédits antérieurs au sein de l’institution. Il est spécialisé dans le commerce de cosmétiques depuis 2001.le choix de son activité a été surtout influence par un de ses frères commerçant. Monsieur D. emprunte  500 000 frs pour renforcer son stock de lait de toilette et de parfums. Son crédita va lui permettre de mieux rentabiliser son activité et de mieux supporter financièrement l’amélioration de s conditions de vie sociale de la famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Mamadou D. is 36 year-old and the married father of a child. He lives in Yoff, in the neighborhood of Ndennatte. He has been a member of the Yoff credit union since 2001 and has already benefited from six prior loans from this institution. Since 2001, he specializes in the trade of cosmetics. His choice of activity was mainly influenced by one of his brothers, himself a merchant. Mr. D. is borrowing 500,000 francs to increase his stock of cleansing milk and perfume. This loan will allow him to make his business more profitable and to better support the improvement of his family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Charlotte Buecheler, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase in working capital

loans.name: Alice Ligare

texts.en:
Alice Ligare E. is married to Ezekiel Nyambane and they have three children. Evans, who is the first-born, just joined secondary school this year; while Samsom, the second born, is in 6th grade of primary school. Jenipher, who is the last born, is in kindergarten. They live in Nyalenda area in Kisumu city.
 
Alice has been running the pharmacy store for the past four years and her business has been doing well. She has managed to access two loans from Kadet Ltd., which she paid well without any difficulties. She is a client with a good credit history with us. She is looking for Kiva lenders to enable her to get a loan which will help her buy more medicine for her chemist business.

She hopes to own a big chemist in the future and have contracts with Insurance companies. This will enable her to increase her clientele, which in return will boost her business. She also hopes that when her first son finishes high school, he will take medical training so as to take up the business and expand it.

loans.use: To buy more medicine to stock her pharmacy.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is 45 years old. She is a single mother of two children who attend school. She has been selling livestock for five years. She is also employed to earn extra income. She hopes to buy good breeds of goats and cows. She has requested a loan of kes 40,000 to add to her stock of cows and goats. She describes herself as hard-working and social.

loans.use: To buy more livestock

loans.name: Lester Alexander

texts.es: El Sr. Lester Alexander Méndez  M.. Es de oficio profesor de educación secundaria, padre de dos hijos uno en edad escolar, es casado actualmente esta estudiando en la universidad para mejorar su nivel académico. Ha tenido  cinco créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha hecho para realizar mejoras en su vivienda y de esta manera llegar a terminar de construir su casa porque esta es la única forma de llegar a tener una vivienda con un techo digno.
texts.en:
Sr. Lester Alexander Méndez M. is a high school teacher. He is married and the father of two children, one of whom is in school. Lester is currently studying at the university to improve upon his academic level. He has taken five loans with CEPRODEL and each one has been used for making improvements to his home. Lester hopes to finish the construction of his house because it is the only way for him to achieve a decent home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to continue with the construction of his house

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita B. is from the village of Cabuan, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 47 years-old and a widow with five school-aged children. Florita owns and operates a specialized retail business buying and selling of bananas in the local community. Florita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Florita joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Florita is requesting a first loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Jamhorait Group

texts.en:
Taiba, the daughter of G. H., is a 35-year-old married woman. She has four children (two sons and two daughters), and she lives with her family in Kabul, Afghanistan.

She is the leader of the Jamhorait group. To earn a living, she operates a carpet-weaving business. She has a great deal of business experience; for instance, she has been engaged in her carpet-weaving business for more than 4 years. She is now seeking a loan in the amount of $875 (40,000 AFN) to build and organize a room to operate the carpet-weaving business and to purchase a new carpet frame. In turn, she expects to generate an increase in her monthly income to better support her family. She explains that she is happy to be able to improve her business in this way.

loans.use: To improve her work space and to purchase a new carpet frame

loans.name: Rita Natalia

texts.es:
La señora Rita es una de las Fundadoras del Banco Comunal Junín, esta casada tiene 6 hijos ella es comerciante junto con su esposo tiene una distribuidora de llantas, ya han pasado 15 años desde que decidieron abrir este negocio, un día el esposo decide que le gustaría tener su propio negocio y decide por este, que lo han sabido mantener, sin necesidad de salir de casa o alquilar algún local ellos decidieron que sea en su propia casa.
Con el crédito que recibirá nuestra socia Rita invertirá en surtir su negocio, la mayoría de las personas que habitan el sector va a comprar para sus vehículos llantas, tubos de escape, aceites, ya tiene sus propios clientes sin necesidad de buscarlos.

La señora Rita es la que esta siempre al pendiente de los detalles, pero también se da su tiempito para hacer una labor que le gusta mucho como lo es la preparación de dulces típicos de la región como, galletas de almidón, rompope, dulces de frutas y mas, cuenta nuestra socia que es por hobbies que hace esto pero así también tiene sus clientes que le viene a comprar de otras partes que le compran por libras. Con todo lo que le pasa a la señora Rita dice que esta muy agradecida porque sus sueños se le han hecho realidad es una mujer felizmente realizada.
texts.en:
Rita is one of the founders of the Junín Communal Bank. She is married and has six children. She and her husband are merchants; they have a tire distributorship. It has been 15 years since they decided to open this business. One day her husband decided that he would like to have his own business. He decided on this one. They knew how to maintain it without having to leave the house or rent a location. They decided it would be in their own house. Rita will use the loan she receives to stock her business. Most of the people who live in the area are going to buy tires, exhaust pipes, and oil. They already have their own customers without having to look for them. Rita always watches out for the details, but she also spends a little time doing what she really likes doing. She makes typical regional sweets like meringues, rum cookies, sweets from fruit, and more. She says that she does this as a hobby, but she has customers who come from other places who buy them by the pound. With everything that happens to Rita, she says that she is very grateful because her dreams have come true. She is a happily fulfilled woman.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tires, exhaust pipes, and oil

loans.name: Adelia

texts.es:
Adelia F. P. es una mujer  que vive con su cónyuge en el barrio Boyacá de la ciudad de Bogotá. Ella tiene dos hijos en las edades de 23 y 24 años, que a este minuto están en la universidad estudiando ciencias sociales y matemáticas. Adelia y su   cónyuge trabajan  en la tapicería, restaurando y fabricando muebles hechos de maderas y telas. Ellos llevan 24 años en este sector, su negocio es familiar e inició  solamente  con el tapizado de muebles, pero después fue creciendo e incluyeron la fabricación de estos, para finalmente adicionar las cortinas tipo isabelina que hoy fabrican. 
Ella está aplicando a un crédito por valor de $600.000, para que esta empresa siga creciendo y  piensa comprar materias primas como tela y madera. Este es justamente su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con su próximo financiamiento Adelia  planea hacer la adecuación de un local, para poder exhibir sus productos como cortinas, muebles para el hogar, exhibidores domésticos, mesas, juegos de comedor, y hasta Puff  o almohadas de gran tamaño que se usan para sentarse, pues en la actualidad   solo cuenta con su taller de fabricación. Su sueño es ampliar la infraestructura de su negocio, tener un punto de venta  y diversificar los productos que ofrece para incluir otros tipos de muebles y cortinas. Ella también espera comprar una casa, por eso está haciendo su ahorro programado, para poder acceder al subsidio que otorga el estado y es que esto es precisamente su mayor desafío.
texts.en:
Adelia F. P. is a woman who lives with her spouse in the Boyacá neighborhood of the city of Bogotá. She has two children who are 23 and 24 years old and who, at this time, are studying social sciences and mathematics at the university. Adelia and her spouse work in upholstery; restoring and making wood and fabric furniture. They have been in this line of work for 24 years. It is a family business, and they began solely upholstering furniture, but the business grew to include making the furniture, and finally added Elizabethan style curtains which they now make as well. She is applying for a loan worth $600.000 so that her business can continue to grow and to purchase raw materials like fabric and wood. This is just her first loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. With her next loan, Adelia plans to acquire a place of business to display her products: curtains, household furniture, household displays, tables, dining room sets and even Puffs (large pillows used for sitting on), because for now she only has her workshop. Her dream is to expand the infrastructure of her business, to have a point of sale and to diversify the products that she offers to include other types of furniture and curtains. She also hopes to buy a house, the reason for her scheduled savings, and to be able to take advantage of the subsidy granted by the state, and that, precisely, is her biggest challenge.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw materials like fabric and wood.

loans.name: Lindie

texts.en: Lindie G. is from the village of Mitiomos. She is 30 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Lindie owns and operates a business selling assorted household items in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month. In 2006, Lindie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Lindie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used for house repair. This loan will be her 6th from PMPC. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use for house repair

loans.name: Mardilyn

texts.en:
Mardilyn S. is 35 and married. She supports her family by operating two business ventures: buying and selling goats and an Avon dealership. She lives in Prk. Lawis-wis Kawayan, Brgy. Bagacay, Dumaguete City, Negros Oriental. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2003 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard at her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average income of PHP16,000. 

Mardilyn is now borrowing PHP 29,000 so that she could expand her goat business. This will be her 15th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP17,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Mardilyn aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon — a title of esteem bestowed on a commumnity member who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional Working Capital

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama G. produces gari for sale in Abura. To be able to prepare gari, she buys raw, fresh cassava from the market, washes it to remove any dirt, peels it, and sends it to the mill to be milled into dough. She puts the dough in a sack with heavy stones placed on it to drain the starch out of the dough and leaves the dough for a day or two depending on the weight of the stones. After this process she stir-fries it in a pan on the fire for some time to produce gari. The gari is then left to cool and is bagged into sacks for sale.

Gari is one of the starchy foods in Ghana that is mostly enjoyed by students and families at large. Students eat gari a lot because it is a quick and easy food to prepare. They use it for soakings (gari mixed with sugar, milk and water and sometimes peanuts). Some students also prepare gari in the form of a dough and eat it with pepper sauces and sardines.

Families also eat gari as lunch or supper with soups or sauces. The soups that are mostly used with gari are okra soup, groundnut (peanut) soup, palm nut soup, vegetable soups and so on. On the other hand, various sauces can also be used with gari such as pepper sauce, curry sauce, tomato sauce and other varieties of sauce, depending on the family. Any kind of meat or fish can also be eaten with these soups and sauces.

Ama has no educational background. She is married and takes care of her six dependents. Her loan will be invested into her gari business to expand it. This she will do by buying more cassava to process into gari to distribute. She plans to build a storehouse in which to keep her increased amount of gari.

loans.use: To buy more cassava to process into gari to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Juan Israel

texts.es:
El señor Juan A. tiene su propia pulpería en el mercado Mayoreo en Managua donde atiende a diario desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana buscando la manera de suplir la demanda de sus clientes. 

Actualmente ha reconocido que necesita invertir por medio de productos para la pulpería y en especial algunos productos medicinales para también venderlos.

Espera que el crédito le sea otorgado y de esta manera continuar llevando a su casa el sustento e ir proyectándose como gran comerciante.
texts.en:
Juan A. has a general store in the wholesale market of Managua where he sells everyday since early in the morning to fulfill the demand from his clients. He has recently realized that he needs to invest through products for the store, particularly medicinal products to sell. He hopes that the loan will be granted to him so that this way he can continue to support his house and grow as a businessman.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for general store

loans.name: Andrei

texts.en:
Andrei is a retail businessman from Zaporozhye. He sells dishware in one of the local marketplaces. He has been in this business for five months. However, he has already gained a loyal clientele. Andrei offers competitive prices. Presently, he has 90,000 invested in this venture. His turnover capital is about 19,000 Grivnyas.  

Andrei is seeking a loan of 6,000 Grivnyas to purchase additional merchandise for his vending kiosk. The trade is prosperous as dishware is a marketable type of product and always sells well. Andrei is full of ideas for development and further expansion of his enterprise. The current loan will assist him in his endeavors and implementation of his business plans.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: Miriam, de 37 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y su querido hijo menor, a quien desea brindarles una mejor calida de vida. El negocio al que Miriam se dedica es la elaboración de tejidos artesanales, su trabajo comienza muy temprano por la mañana, cuando junto a su esposo empiezan a trabajar en los modelos especiales que le han pedido. Ella es una tejedora muy buena, motivo por el cual sus confecciones son muy bonitas y llamativas. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es tejer y más aun si son artesanías, lleva 12 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar todo el día para cumplir con los pedidos que le realizan. Para el futuro, espera poder comprar nuevas maquinas, para avanzar más rápido en la producción Es el cuarto crédito con MFP, esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, aunque para eso tenga que ir ahorrando poco a poco, en su banco comunal es una socia muy querida. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más lana para incrementar la producción que tiene actualmente.
texts.en:
Miriam is 37 years old and is a very happy and hard working woman. She lives in a home of her own along with her husband and young son, to whom she wants to give a good quality of life. Mariam knits various types of crafts and she and her husband begin their work early each morning, working to fill orders that they’ve received. She is a good knitter, so her creations are very nice and attractive. What he enjoys most about her work is the knitting, especially if she is working on crafts. She’s been doing this for 12 years and feels that the most challenging part is having to work all day to fill her orders. In the future she hopes to be able to buy new machinery that will allow her to decrease her production time. This will be her fourth loan through MFP and she is prepared to make all of her payments on time, and she knows that it means that she will have to save little by little. She is well liked in her communal bank. She will use the 2,000 PEN ($725) from this loan to buy more yarn in order to increase her current production.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Soum

texts.en:
Soum S., 38, is a widow with two children. They all live in the Takeo province. 

She is a farmer who works for less than US$1 per day. She also receives support from one of her children, who works in a garment factory. 

Soum S. is asking for a loan of US$500 to purchase a motorbike for her child to commute to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Maricela

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARY ANTEÑA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Izcuchaca, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Maricela; ella tiene 44 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta y compra de carne de res y cordero, ella tiene un pequeño puesto en el mercado de Anta donde vende las diferentes carnes desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m y por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar carne de vaca y cordero al por mayor.


 La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Maricela is a member of the community bank named "Ricchary Antena". It is located in the district of Izcuchaca in the province of Anta in Cusco. 

Maricela is 44 years old, she is married, and she has 4 children. Her business is the buying and selling of beef and pork meat. She has a small stand in the market in Anta from where she sells various types of meats from 7:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. She is able to support her children through this business. She wants to expand her business and to this end she requests a loan. She will purchase beef and lamb meats. 

She is grateful to all of those who will contribute towards her dream and she is committed to the payment terms of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase beef and lamb meats in wholesale.

loans.name: Dolores Marilu

texts.es:
En la ciudadela La California de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Las Divinas.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Dolores,  ella tiene 48 años de edad, está divorciada pero de esta relación ha tenido tres hijos ya todos mayores de edad, uno de sus hijos vive con ella el mismo que estudia en la Universidad en Manta. Desde hace mucho le gusto la costura, por eso estudio corte y confección y obtuvo un titulo de modista en la asociación de modista en Portoviejo.

Tiene un taller de costura en su casa, confecciona todo tipo de ropa, pero confiesa que lo que más le gusta es  confeccionar ropa de mujer, les cose a las personas que necesitan de sus servicios,  trabaja todos los días desde las 8am hasta las 20h00 pero que a veces se queda trabajando hasta más tarde cuando tiene mucho trabajo. Trabaja con la ayuda de su hermana y otra ayudante.

Este crédito es para comprar una maquina y materiales para la costura. Este es su séptimo ciclo en el Banco  Comunal y la gusta porque los créditos los entregan sin muchos trámites.
 
Su sueño es tener su propia casa ya que donde vive es alquilado.
texts.en:
Members of the Las Divinas (The Divine Ones) communal bank meet every two weeks in the La California neighborhood of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí province, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds.

Here we find Dolores, 48, who is divorced but who had three children in the relationship; all the children are now adults but one of them still lives with her and is studying at the University of Manta.  She has enjoyed sewing for a long time so she studied Tailoring and Dressmaking obtaining a degree in Dressmaking from the Portoviejo Dressmaking Association.

She has a sewing workshop in her home.  She makes all kinds of clothes but she confesses that what she likes best is making women’s clothes. She sews for everyone who needs her services and works every day from 8am until 8pm although sometimes stays working until much later when she has a lot of work to complete.  Her sister and another person help her.

This loan is to buy a sewing machine and sewing supplies.  It’s her 7th loan in the communal bank and she likes it because the loans are delivered with a minimum of paper work.

Her dream is to have a house of her own because she currently lives in a rental.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en:
Gideon has been practicing mixed farming for 12 years in Kisii town, western Kenya. He has employed one permanent employee and two casual laborers. His farm produces maize, beans, tea, milk, vegetables and onions, which are sold through the Kenya Tea Development Authority and the local market. He is also a photographer and additionally earns income from renting his oxen out for plowing to the local farmers. 

He has requested this loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will enable him to purchase a quality dairy cow that will produce enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. The extra income from this loan will go toward the education of his children. His biggest challenges have been pests and diseases, which affect his production, and transport problems. In the future, he hopes to own at least three quality dairy cows and open a mini studio in his town.

Gideon is 36 years old. He is married with three children, ages 4 months and 5 and 8 years. Two of the children are currently attending school.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma, de 56 años, está casada con Prudencio, de 56 años de edad. En unión familiar ellos viven con Omar, su hijo, de 26 años de edad. Los tres viven en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Sanchirio. El trabajo al que se dedica Norma, es la venta de dulces, comestibles y bebidas, que realiza en su localidad en horas de la mañana. Mientras que por las tardes, se dedica a la venta de comida y diversos picadillos a base de las diferentes variedades de carne de la zona. Ya tienen 30 años dedicándose a ello y su exquisita sazón es el deleite de los habitantes de su comunidad. Por ello siempre esperan a Norma, para la hora de comida. En todo este tiempo tiene gran acogida y por ello desea más adelante, juntar más capital para poder acondicionar su propio establecimiento; una tienda y un restaurante grande con buena decoración, ya que Norma, solo vende en la calle. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP, y está agradecida por el apoyo que recibe junto a su banco comunal, de la misma manera menciona que será puntual en sus pagos. Es por ello que ya ha pensado invertir el crédito en la compra de insumos como dulces, y diferentes materiales elaborados de plásticos.
texts.en:
Norma is 56 years old. She is married to Prudencio, who is 56 years old. They live with their son, Omar, who is 26 years old. The three of them live in their own house, which is located in the community of Sanchirio. 

Norma sells sweets, food, and drinks at her store in the mornings. In the afternoons, she sells food and a variety of minced meats made from the different types of meats in the area. She has been doing this for 30 years, and her excellent cooking is the delight of the people who live in the community. They always wait for Norma when it’s time to eat. Her food has been well received all this time, and so she would like, eventually, to set up her own place—a store and a big restaurant with nice decoration. Norma currently sells on the street. 

This is her fourth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and she is grateful for the support she has received from her communal bank. She says she will be punctual with her payments. She plans to use the loan to buy products such as sweets and different items made of plastic.

loans.use: Comprar dulces y materiales de plásticos.

loans.name: Nazik

texts.en:
Nazik G. was born in Yerevan in 1968. She is married and has a son and a daughter. Her husband works in an ice-cream factory. At present, her son is in the army, protecting the Armenian state boarder. Her daughter is a student. For 10 years Nazik has been engaged inthis business. Nazik rents a stall in a trade center in Yerevan, near her house, where she resells fruits and vegetables, which she buys from the Malatia food market. Nazik is  very lively person. She works very hard and thanks to that she has a large quantity of clients who are glad to do their shopping from Nazik's stall. The profits from the sales allow her to take care of the needs of her family, support her son's needs in army and pay for daughter education. 

Nazik has requested a 400.000 AMD loan to increase the fruits and vegetables assortment in her stall in advance of New Year’s holidays, when the trade is very active
	
This is Nazik’s second loan from Kiva and Nor Horizon.

loans.use: To increase the fruit and vegetable assortment in her stall in advance of New Year’s holidays

loans.name: Mrs. Nol Dieng Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nol D. is a mother of four children, two of whom are employed in garment factories while another one is a weaver and the youngest is 15 years old. She is the  village bank president who has been selected by sixteen people who make up a village bank in Krang Chamraeun village, Takeo province. They are asking for a  loan in which each of their portion of the loan can improve their family living conditions. 

Mrs. Nol D. is a weaver who earns  money to support her family while her husband, Mr. Sum Hing, is a village chief and a farmer.He owns a half-hectare plot of land to grow rice to sell and  also supports the family. Now that her business is going well Mrs. Nol D. wants to expand. For this purpose, Mrs. Nol D. is seeking  a loan to buy more silk.

loans.use: To buy more silk

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es: Sandra, de 41 años, vive en su casa que es propia en compañía de su esposo, y sus cinco  hijos, los cuales aún estudian en el colegio.Desde hace 5 años, esta laboriosa mujer, se dedica  a la venta de juguetes, pero realizando esta labor descubrió un taller de  producción de zapatillas de buenas marcas. Es así que ingresa a la venta de zapatillas de marcas,  en un puesto ambulante en  las periferias de un  mercado muy concurrido  de su ciudad. En esta labor  ya lleva  siete  años y le va muy bien por lo que se siente contenta, pero se siente muy fastidiada porque con frecuencia debe cambiar de ubicación, pues los trabajadores  de la municipalidad no dejan que permanezca en un mismo sitio mucho tiempo . Como es una mujer emprendedora para  más adelante anhela comprarse un puesto en el  mercado donde vende, pues no quiere perder a sus clientes.Es el décimo crédito que tiene con MFP, y se compromete a ser responsable con el pago de sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando.Sandra tiene planeado invertir el dinero  del préstamo en la compra de zapatillas y sandalias pues quiere comercializarlas durante la temporada de verano, de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Sandra is 41 years old.  She lives in her own home with her husband and five children who are still studying in school.

This hard-working woman has been selling toys for five years.  However, in carrying out her work she discovered a workshop which makes brand-name sneakers.  Now she sells brand-name sneakers as a street vendor on the outskirts of a very busy market in the city.  She has been in this business for seven years and it is doing very well which makes her feel happy.  However, she also feels very annoyed because she frequently has to change location as the people who work for the city don't allow her to stay in the same place for long.

As Sandra is an enterprising woman, in the future she would like to buy a stall in the market where she can sell her products as she doesn't want to lose her customers.

This is Sandra's tenth loan from MFP and she pledges to be responsible in making her repayments as she doesn't want to let down the people who have made it possible for her to receive the money that will allow her to keep working.  Sandra plans to invest her loan money in buying sneakers and sandals as she would like to sell them during the summer season.  In this way, she hopes to improve her profits.

loans.use: To buy sneakers and sandals to sell

loans.name: Musingi Bora Group

texts.fr: Antoinette K. B.  est entrepreneur, leader du groupe Musingi Bora, âgée de 44 ans, mariée, mère de 11 enfants.  Son conjoint est menuisier. La cliente Antoinette K. B.  est vendeuse des  farines de manioc et de haricot. Elle expose des produits dans un entrepôt agricole et parfois au long de la route, sur la voie publique.il ya 7 ans qu’elle fait ce business.  Elle  demarra cette affaire  avec son fonds propre reçu de son mari avec un capital de 50$. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le premier crédit de l’IMF Hekima de 50$ au début de  2010. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  des nouveaux produits (8 sacs de farines de manioc, 1 sac de haricots,  à revendre, etc.).  En plus, elle ambitionne voir ses enfants  finir leurs études, acheter une parcelle, avoir un entrepôt autonome pour ses marchandises. La cliente Antoinette K. B.  remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique. Le groupe Musingi Bora est constitué de 26 membres.
texts.en: Antoinette K. B. is an entrepreneur and the leader of the "Musingi Bora" group. She is 44 years old, married, and the mother of 11 children. Her husband is a carpenter. Antoinette K. B. is a merchant who sells cassava and bean flour. She displays her products for sale at an agricultural depot and sometimes along a stretch of road, for the general public. She has 7 years in the business. She started her business with her own funds, which she received from her husband. Her capital fund was $50. In early 2010, she accessed her first loan through IMF Hekima (Kiva Field Partner), amounting to $50. Her new loan will be used to purchase new products (8 sacks of cassava flour, and 1 sack of beans for resale etc.). In addition, she endeavors to see her children complete their schooling, to purchase parcel of land, and to have an independent depot for her merchandise. Antoinette K. B. is thankful to Hekima for their support to the poor who are excluded from traditional banks. The Musingi Bora group is made up of 26 members.

loans.use: To purchase 8 sacks of cassava flour and 1 sack of beans.

loans.name: Mwanamani

texts.en:
Mwanamina is a married woman with seven children, four of whom attend school, while three have graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is paying school fees for her children.

For the past fourteen years, she has operated a retail shop, selling at the market and from home to her neighbours and passersby.  Mwanamina faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation, especially during rainy season. 

With the Kshs 15,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sacks of rice for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and educate her children.

loans.use: To  purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sacks of rice for sale.

loans.name: Kazoora

texts.en:
Kazoora M. is an individual client from Rukungiri. He is 38 years old and married with four children, all of them in school. M. is involved in agriculture. He has a banana plantation enterprise and he sells matooke (green bananas) for a living. M. employs one laborer in his "shamba" (fields) and his major customers are the local community.

On average, he makes 100,000/= as monthly profits and in addition, he is also involved in the sale of alcohol, goats and other produce. He has been in business for over 6 years and he needs a loan to be able to upgrade his banana plantation by buying manure and pesticides for the plantation. M. hopes to be a model farmer in his area due to his determination.

loans.use: Upgrading his banana plantation by buying manure and pesticides for the plantation

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA VICTORIA - CHINCHERO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Chinchero, provincia de Urubamba, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Leonarda; La socia tiene 43 años de edad, la socia  es casada; la socia tiene 3 hijos de (18,15,13) años de edad; la socia se dedica la ganadería y a la agricultura, la socia tiene sus vacas, toros, ovejas, animales menores, la socia compra vacas, las cría y cuando alcanzan su madures las vende, ella tiene este negocio desde hace 20 años, ella también vende sus animales menores, la socia también eventualmente extrae leche de sus vacas adultas y elabora quesos, mantequillas caseras con el derivados de la leche y los vende a pedido, hace en pocas cantidades debido a que no llevan persevantes y debe venderlos de inmediato. La socia deseas invertiré el crédito en la compra de 2 vacas terneritas. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de dos vacas terneras. 

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the community bank “NUEVA VICTORIA - CHINCHERO”; located in Chinchero District, Urubamba Province, Cusco.

Leonarda is 43, married and has 3 children (18,15,13 years old).  This borrower practices agriculture and raises cattle, bulls, sheep and other farm animals.  She buys the animals to grow and sells them when they mature; she has engaged in this business for the last twenty years. Leonarda also sells milk, butter and cheese produced from her cows, and does so in small quantities since they are perishable items.  Leonarda wishes to buy 2 small calves with the requested loan, and is committed to prompt repayment of the credit.

loans.use: To buy two calves

loans.name: Kageni

texts.en:
Kageni E. G., 51, is married with six children, three of whom are still in school. She has been in the agriculture industry for the last ten years and gets good returns from her harvest. 

Kageni has been a good client who repays her loans without any complications. This will be her third loan with KADET. She plans to use the loan to purchase farming supplies. She hopes to generate income from the loan which she can use to build a permanent house for her family.

In the future, Kageni hopes she will live a better life and see her children prosper.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies.

loans.name: Juan Eric

texts.es:
Juan, reside en San Rafael Oriente departamento de San Miguel, es agricultor, vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 7 y 5 años de edad, Juan tiene 7 años de dedicarse a las actividades agrícolas, también atiende la ganadería desde hace 4 años, le dedica un tiempo diario todos los días de 5:00am a 3:00pm.
Por el tiempo que se acerca que es la entrada del invierno, los agricultores como Juan, inician sus labores de preparación de tierras para sembrar, también él está en este proceso para lo que solicita un préstamo e invertirlo en abonos y fertilizantes.
Su objetivo es continuar con su trabajo, realizándolo cada día mejor, para ayudar a su familia y educar a sus hijos para el futuro.
texts.en:
Juan lives in East San Rafael in the department of San Miguel with his wife and two children, ages 7 and 5.  He has worked in agricultural activies for seven years and as a livestock farmer for four years.  He works from 5:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m.

With the approach of winter, farmers like Juan begin to prepare their land for planting.  As part of this process he needs to buy fertilizer for which he is requesting the loan.

His goal is to continue working, getting better at it every day, in order to help his family and provide an education for his children.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia forma parte del banco comunal “Newen” perteneciente a la ciudad de Penco. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y accesorios en su propia casa. Desde hace 3 años. Sin embargo, debido al terremoto del 27 de febrero del año 2010, la población quedó muy asustada y debió darle prioridad a cubrir las necesidades más básicas, por lo tanto la compra de ropa fue disminuyendo, por lo que debió añadir a su negocio la producción de pan dulce, integral y amasado, estos productos los vende a particulares en una fabrica. Por lo que sus clientes ya son frecuentes. Su mercadería de ropa y accesorios, la compra en la ciudad de Santiago, y los insumos de amasandería los compra en la ciudad de Concepción. También se dedica a la artesanía en joyas de fantasía y cristales. Éste rubro lo practica desde hace 19 años. En la actualidad también se encuentra tejiendo y vendiendo bufandas con diseños innovadores y diferentes a los del mercado. Lamentablemente el terremoto asoló su vivienda completamente, lo que le significó la perdida de todos sus materiales de trabajo y debió comenzar de cero. Tuvo que comprar de todo y además se cambió de domicilio.
Con el préstamo comprará ropa, harina de trigo y blanca, además de aceite y sal.
Sus principales sueños son pagar sus cuentas mensuales y vivir tranquila y en armonía junto a su familia. Por ende sus motivaciones de continuar con estos diversos negocios. 
Patricia vive junto a sus hijas de 28 y 27 años de edad, además su nieta de 4 años. Ella se siente muy apoyada por su entorno familiar. 
Patricia está muy contenta y agradecida del crédito obtenido por Fondo Esperanza, ya que éste le servirá para invertir en todos sus negocios y generar mejores ganancias. Además comenta que Fondo Esperanza, le brindó mucha ayuda, para el terremoto. Respecto a las reuniones, existe mucha camaradería, además le sirve para distraerse y pasar un momento agradable. Penco es una comuna cercana a la ciudad de Concepción, al sur de Chile, región del Bíobío. Su nombre  viene del mapudungun y significa "agua de peumo". Es una de las comunas con mayor cantidad de habitantes en la región. Cuenta con centros industriales y un puerto.
texts.en:
Patricia is part of the community bank "Newen" which is located in the city of Penco. She works selling clothes and accessories from her home and has been doing this for 3 years. However, owing to the earthquake of February 27th, 2010, the people here have been very scared and have had to give greater priority to more basic necessities, and therefore clothes sales have diminished. As a result she has had to expand her business by making sweet breads, wholewheat bread, and kneaded bread, and she sells these goods to the workers at a factory which means she has frequent customers. 
She buys her clothes and accessories supplies in the city of Santiago and the supplies for her baking she buys in the city of Concepción. She also makes costume jewelry. She has been doing this for 19 years. She currently also knits and sells scarves with innovative designs that are different from the ones found in the market. Lamentably, the earthquake completely devastated her home and she lost all her work materials and had to start again with nothing. She had to buy everything and also had to move home. 
She will use the loan to buy clothes, white and wholemeal flour, and oil and salt. 
Her greatest dreams are to pay her monthly expenses and live quietly and in harmony with her family. Hence her motivation to continue with these different businesses. 
Patricia lives with her daughters who are 28 and 27 years old as well as her 4 year old granddaughter. She feels very supported by her entire family.
Patricia is very happy and grateful for the loan from Fondo Esperanza, as this will be invested in all her businesses and generate greater income. She also comments that Fondo Esperanza offered her a lot of help after the earthquake. With respect to the bank meetings, there is much camaraderie, and they serve as a distraction and opportunity to pass some pleasant time together. Penco is a community close to the city of Concepción, in the south of Chile, in the Bíobío region. Its name comes from the Mapudungun and means laurel water. This is one of the most populous communities in the region and it has industrial centers and a port.

loans.use: to buy rope, wheat flour and white flour, as well as oil and salt.

loans.name: Zacharia

texts.en: Zacharia is 26 years old, married to Gladys and the father of one child who is one month old. For the past two years he has operated a retail shop at Nderi trading center, which is on the outskirts of Nairobi, and earns good profits.  This will be Zacharia's fourth loan from KADET, and he will use it to buy maize flour, tea leaves, sugar, margarine and milk for his shop in order to get better returns. He hopes to own a better business premise in the near future.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, sugar, cakes and rice for the shop.

loans.name: Mungunzul

texts.en:
Mungunzul, 31, is married and lives with her husband and daughter, aged 9, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family lives in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian felt tent, in the backyard of her husband’s workplace. Her daughter goes to primary school.  

Mungunzul helps support her family by operating a retail stall at “Undram” center.  When she first began her business in 2010, she had 1,000,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) in working capital but she has since expanded it to 1,800,000 MNT in working capital and she sells bags, wallets and remembrances. She purchases her products from Ereen, a border city in China. She is applying for a loan of 600,000 MNT to buy more bags, wallets, presents and remembrances to sell to her customers before “Mothers and children holiday”. 

Her main goal is expand her business and then to be able to buy her own small house and yard.

loans.use: To purchase more bags, wallets and presents before "Mother and Children holiday".

loans.name: Viateur

texts.fr: Viateur est client d’ACB depuis 2010. Il est célibataire  âge de 30 ans.  Il est né au  Rwanda. Il est sentinelle d’une église locale et il est en même temps étudiant dans l’option mécanique  automobile. C’est son cinquième cycle de prêt avec ACB et il a eu bon historique de remboursement. Il va utiliser le prêt pour payer son minerval. Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire  est d’étudier avec courage et terminer avec distinction en classe. Dans l’avenir il voudrait termine ses études en mécanique et cherche le permis de conduire et pouvoir fonder son propre foyer.
texts.en: Viateur has been a client of ACB since 2010. He is a single man aged 30. He was born in Rwanda. He is a security guard at a local church, and he also studies to become an auto mechanic. This is his fifth loan cycle with ACB, and he has a good payment history. He will use the loan to buy his tuition fees. His strategy is to persevere with in his studies and graduate on top of his class. In the future he would like to become a mechanic, obtain a driver’s license and be able to start his own family.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is married with two grown-up sons. Ludmila sells womens clothing at the central market in Nova Kahovka town. She has been in this business for five years. She has 7,000 hryvnias invested in inventory. Her monthly income is about 7,000 hryvnias. Ludmila is a hard working person who enjoys her business very much and would like to develop it further.

Ludmila is requesting a loan of 15,000 Ukrainian hryvnia to purchase assorted merchandise for the summer season. She hopes to make additional income and invest most of it back into the business.

loans.use: to purchase assorted merchandise for the summer season

loans.name: Vong

texts.en:
Vong, 46 years old, is a pig breeder and a farmer in the rainy season.  Her income is $4.  She is a single mother with 3 children who are  20, 17, and 16 years old. All of them are working as construction workers and can make $3 per day each.   Every month, Vong has to spend $75 on food, and $15 on transportation.

She would like  a loan of $800 to buy pig food and fertilizer for her field. She hopes to raise more pigs to make more income and be able to send all of her children to study.

loans.use: to buy pig food and fertilizer for her field

loans.name: Pascual

texts.es:
El Sr Pascual vive en la ciudad de Santaní, tiene casa propia, es casado, es propietario de una despensa y carniceria,en su propio domicilio, bien surtidos con clientela bien formada.
El señor manifesto que empezo con una pequeña casilla, ventas de empanadas, milanesas, marineras y bebidas en general, siempre soñaba con tener una despensa y una carnicería. Su sueño es de ampliar su local para surtir mas su negocios, porque aveces le faltan las mercaderías y sus clientes tienen que buscar en otros lugares.
El se define como una persona muy responsable, trabajador, humilde y muy honesto.
El solicita el credito para la compra de carne, lácteos, bebidas en general y demás productos para la posterior venta.
texts.en:
Pascual lives in the city of Santaní.  He has a house of his own, is married and owns a home-based, well stocked general store and butcher shop with a well-established clientele.

He stated that he started out with a small kiosk selling turnovers, breaded steak, “marineras” (veal and seafood patties) and beverages.  He always dreamed with having a general store and butcher shop.  His dream is to expand the locale to have more stock because sometimes he lacks merchandise and his customers have to go elsewhere to look for it.

He defines himself as a very responsible, hardworking, humble and honest person.

He asked for the loan to buy meat, dairy products, assorted beverages and other products to resell.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es:
Natalia siempre ha vivido en el campo y desde hace 9 que se casó con su esposo pusieron la cría de pollo y la venta de huevos para el sustento de su familia.

Ella tiene 2 hijos que le ayudan luego de estudiar en la escuela para así poder enseñarles esta labor para cuando sena grandes.

Natalia quiere tener un galpón mas grande para pollos y así poder tener muchos mas para el engorde y al venderlos se incrementaran sus ingresos y mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Natalia has always lived in the country, and after marrying nine years ago she and her husband began raising chickens and selling eggs as a means of family income.

She has two children who help her after school so she can teach them the trade for when they grow up.

Natalia wants to have a larger  so she can raise more to increase her income and improve her family's lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy chickens.

loans.name: La Granada Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama la granada y se integra de cuatro señoras quien cada una se dedica a su respectiva actividad, la persona quien se le tomo la entrevista se llama Cristina es ella es casada con el señor  Guillermo y con quien procreo cuatro hijos quienes a un están a su responsabilidad.

     Ella invirtió el préstamo en la compra de de material para su carpintería, en ello lleva cinco años y comenta que el va bien ya que con ello ha tenido un mejor ingreso que es con lo que ha estado sacando adelante a su pequeña familia.

     Lo que lo motivo a esta actividad fue su esposo quien es la que dedica a elaborar la los muebles y ella también la apoya a barnizar dando el acabado mas bonito, aun así también busca otro tipo de cómo apoyar a su esposo.

    Lo que más desea es que con ello pueda  seguir trabajando, como también espera que  la sigan apoyando con el  crédito  para agrandar su  carpintería y así continuar a y dando a sus hijos a que estudiando.

     Los integrantes del grupo son loas siguientes señoras: María de Lourdes  invertido el préstamo en la compra de marranos para engordarlo y después venderlo, así también se integra la señora Guadalupe quien se dedica a la compra y venta de ropas para venderlo en la misma localidad y por último la señora  Rosalía quien también invertirá el préstamo en la compra de marranos para engordarlo y después venderlo.
texts.en:
The group named “La Granada” consists of four women who engage in their respective business activities. The person being interviewed is Cristina. She is married to Sr. Guillermo and has four children who are her responsibility.

Cristina will invest her loan in materials for her carpentry shop. She has been in business for five years and says that she has done well. Her business has resulted in a better income, which has allowed her small family to move forward.

Cristina’s husband convinced her to start this business even though he is the one making the furniture. She helps him by varnishing the furniture to give the pieces a nice finish. Cristina is also looking for other ways to support her husband. What she wants most is to continue working. With the support from this loan, she hopes to expand her carpentry shop and continue providing an education for her children.

The other members are as follows: • María de Lourdes will invest her loan in pigs for fattening and eventual resale. • Sra. Guadalupe buys and sells clothes in town. • Sra. Rosalia will also buy pigs for fattening and eventual resale.

loans.use: to buy varnish and wood for her carpentry shop.

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
La señora Liliana y su esposo el señor Sergio tienen dos hijos que actual mente están estudiando. 
Solicitan un préstamo para poder pagar la colegiatura, compra de uniformes y útiles escolares que son libros, plumas, cuadernos, lápices, carpetas y mochilas. Ya que no cuentan con el dinero necesario para poder cubrir esta necesidad escolar que sus hijos necesitan para iniciar el siclo. 
Dona Liliana y Don Sergio trabaja de encargados de una ranchos cerca de la ciudad con una parte se los sueldos  planean pagar el crédito ya que es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para la familia. 
Desean que sus hijos tengan una buena educación escolar para su futuro.
texts.en:
Liliana and her husband Sergio have two children who are currently in school. They are asking for a loan to pay for high school, to buy uniforms and school supplies such as books, pens, notebooks, pencils, folders and backpacks. They don't have enough money to pay for what their children need to start the term. Liliana and Sergio work as the caretakers of a farm close to town. They plan on paying off the loan with a part of their salaries, since that is the income source for the family. 

They want their children to have a good education for the future.

loans.use: to pay for school expenses.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en: Fredrick is a focused businessman who is 19 years old and single. For the last two years, he has been baking and supplying cakes and bread to make a living. He uses his motorbike to transport the cakes and bread to his customers. He also does dairy farming for more income. In the next five years, he wants to become the major supplier of cakes and bread in his region. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy wheat flour as an ingredient for baking cakes and bread.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour as an ingredient for baking

loans.name: Maritza Rocío

texts.es:
La Señora Roció vive por la parroquia de Quinta Chica en la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales, agricultura y muchos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades económicas, son personas muy amables y gentiles.

Doña Roció tiene 20 años, vive en unión libre y ha concebido 2 hijos de 4 y 1 año de edad. Su esposo labora como empleado privado, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
La Señora. Roció se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catalogo de la marca Yanbal, esta labor la realiza hace 2 años y labora en esta actividad por lo que le da la oportunidad de cuidar de sus hijos que aun están pequeños. 

Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su tía. Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de perfumes, cosméticos, cremas y bisutería para continuar con su negocio. 

Su meta es sacar en adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Roció lives in Quinta Chica parish, in the city of Cuenca.  The local people work in commerce, raise animals, farm and many work in the city in different business activities.  They are a very kind and friendly people.

Roció is 20 years old, lives with her partner, and has two children aged 4 and 1.  Her husband works as a private employee.  They don't own their own home but rent instead.

Roció's business is selling Yanbal-brand cosmetics through a catalog.  She has been doing this work for two years and it gives her the opportunity to care for her children who are still young.

This is Roció's first loan through her community bank which she was invited to join by her aunt.  She will invest her loan in buying perfume, cosmetics, creams and costume jewelry so that she can continue in her business.  Her goal is to get her family ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy perfume, cosmetics, creams and costume jewelry

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 45 years old and lives in the town of Luwero in the Luwero region of Uganda. He is married and has 5 children with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Joseph has been working hard to manage his small farm, which rears chickens. 

To help expand his business, Joseph has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase poultry feed, and will help Joseph to generate greater profits and have enough feed for his chickens. Joseph hopes that in the future he will be able to continue to grow his business. 

Joseph is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Joseph, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase poultry feed

loans.name: Kinereta

texts.en:
Kinereta is 28 years old. She is married and has two children. Kinereta owns and operates a business venture selling fruits and vegetables to the local community. She has 2 years of experience in this business. 
 
Kinereta needs a loan of 1,000 WST to purchase additional seeds and a fence to replace the old one.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 200 talas or US $83 per week) to improve and expand her business.

Kinereta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Kinereta's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds and a fence.

loans.name: Lola

texts.ru: Лола замужем имеет троих детей. Муж работает водителем. Лола занимается продажей и сушкой сухофруктов. Содержать семью в достатке требует больших усилий.  Полученные доходы идут на образование и содержание детей. Она хочет получить займ для расширения своего бизнеса. Она хочет закупить по оптовым ценам сухофрукты и зимой перепродавать их. Она надеется получить займ и заранее благодарна вам за вашу помощь и поощрение.
texts.en: Lola is married and has three children.  Her husband works as a driver.  Lola is involved in selling and drying dried fruits.  Providing plenitude for her family requires a lot of effort.  Income, resulting from the business, goes toward education and support for her children.  Lola wants to obtain this loan to expand her business.  She wants to buy dried fruits at wholesale prices and resell them in the winter.  She hopes to receive this loan and thanks you in advance for your help and support.

loans.use: to purchase dried fruits

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en:
Alphonsine is 31 years old, married, and has three children between 3 and 12 years old. Alphonsine owns a business selling cooking oil in the market and she is in front of others. She has been in this business for ten years. 

The hours of her work are from 7:00 AM until 8:00 PM every day except Saturday. She currently employs one person to help her.

Alphonsine has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more cooking oil to sell. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future, reinvest in her business, and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is 30 years old and married to Bakari. They have three school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past six years she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of establishing a restaurant in the future.

With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase one sack of potatoes and cooking fat oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase one sack of potatoes and cooking fat oil

loans.name: Toshmat

texts.ru: Тошмат более трех лет занимается купле -продажей скота. Он трудолюбивый и добросовестный человек, он женат и ответственный отец четверых детей. Тошмат хорошо ухаживает за скотом и дома имеет большой участок земли для содержания скота. У него имеется 2 голов крупнорогатого скота, 2 теленка и 10 голов овец. В запасе имеет корм  на зиму. Кроме того он занимается перевозкой пассажиров, то есть услугами такси. От этих видов бизнеса он получает хорошую прибыль. Тошмат хочет расширить свой бизнес и для этого хочет купить скот. С этой целью он запрашивает займ в размере 2000$ США.
texts.en: Toshmat has been buying and selling cattle for more than three years. He is a hardworking, conscientious man. He is married and the responsible father of four children. Toshmat takes care of his cattle well and has a large piece of land at home for them. He has 2 cattle, 2 calves and 10 sheep. In stock, he has food for winter. Besides this he also offers taxi services. From this work he earns a good income. Toshmat wants to expand his business and for this he would like to purchase cattle. To this end, he is requesting a loan of $2,000.

loans.use: buy cattle and expand his business

loans.name: Omurbek

texts.ru:
Омурбек родился в селе Панфиловское (Панфиловский район, Чуйская обл., Кыргызская Республика). Омурбек вырос в большой семье, у него 3 брата и 3 сестры, родители были простыми рабочими.  После окончания школы Омурбек поступил в училище, получив специальность тракториста, помогал семье по хозяйству. В 1985 году Омурбек женился и остался жить со своими родителями, где основным источником дохода семьи являлось разведение скотины и полеводство. В 1989 году родилась первая дочь, а в 1995 году у Омурбека родилась вторая дочь. Проработав в родном колхозе 3 года, он решает заняться своим делом. Стартовые сбережения его семьи составляли 10,000 сом (KGS), на которые решено было начать разведение скота, купив для начала одну корову. Были тяжелые времена, семья к концу 90х годов состояла уже из 6 человек, детей нужно было одеть, обуть, супруга была дома, занималась домашними хлопотами.  С развалом Советского Союза колхоза уже не стало, заработанных денег еле хватало на еду. И вот тогда Омурбек решает заняться и полеводством, начав с собственного огорода, где он начал выращивать свеклу. Полученный урожай Омурбек стал сдавать на сахарный завод, а на вырученные деньги - закупать скот. На сегодняшний день, в хозяйстве Омурбека  2 дойные коровы, 2 телочки и 1 бычок, также, в сезон,  он предоставляет услуги тракториста местному населению.  По хозяйству ему помогает жена, супруги воспитывают пятерых детей – двое из них студенты, трое – школьники. Сам Омурбек не только хороший человек, но и замечательный, любящий отец и муж. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Омурбек обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партанеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительного скота. Омурбек мечтает в будущем развить свою ферму и купить новую технику.
texts.en:
Omburek was born in the Panfilov village, of the Chuy region in Kyrgystan. He grew up in a very large family, with 3 sisters and 3 brothers while his parents were simple workers. After finishing high school Omburek was trained as a tractor driver and helped his parents with their farm. In 1985 Omburek  married and chose to remain living with his parents who were raising cattle and farming at the time. His first daughter was born in 1985 and in 1995 Omburek became a father of a second girl. After working with the community farm (kolhoz) for three years Omburek decided to start his own farm. He used a starting sum of 10,000 som (KGS) to purchase a cow and start his cattle raising business. At first Omburek has fallen on hard times, as towards the end of the 90s his family grew to six people and he was struggling to provide for clothing and shoes, while his wife had to stay home and take care of the little ones. After the fall of the Soviet Union his community farm fell apart and the money Omburek was making was barely enough to purchase food for everyone. At that time Omburek decided to also start farming, and began growing sugar beets at his house plot. He was selling his harvest to the local sugar factory and using the profits to purchase more livestock. Now Omburek's household has flourished and he owns two milk cows, two heifers and a calf and he also offers his tractor driving skills during the planting season to the other local farmers. His wife is now able to help a lot more with the farm as two of his five children are already in college while the youngest three are all attending school. Omburek himself is not only a good businessman but also a wonderful loving husband and father.

In order to further expand his livestock business and purchase more animals, Omburek has turned to "Bai-Tushum and partners" for a loan of 60,000 som (KGS). In the future Omburek dreams of expanding his farm as well and buying new farming equipment for himself.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: La señora Gladys es cliente antigua de la institución,  ya trabaja tres secuencias, en sus anteriores créditos pago puntualmente, en su permanencia en la institución demostró responsabilidad, la señora se dedica a la elaboración de banderines y arreglos de nylon, para adornar las casas en especial para las fiestas de carnaval,  la señora trabaja junto a su esposo elaboran gran cantidad de adornos, la pareja actualmente no tiene hijos pero en un futuro quieren tener muchos hijos para darle un buen hogar, el trabajo de la señora es por temporadas ella tiene mas trabajo en fiestas y en estas ocasiones elabora en gran cantidad, la señora invertirá el crédito en la compra de nylon por rollos	 para la elaboración de sus artesanías, la Sra. Gladys se siente agradecida con la institución  por la confianza brindada.
texts.en: Sra. Gladys is a long-time customer and this is her third loan from the bank.  She repaid her past loans on time and has demonstrated that she is a responsible borrower.  She owns a business making and selling bunting.  She makes the bunting from strings of nylon and sells it to buyers who use it to decorate their houses for Carnaval and other celebrations.  Sra. Gladys and her husband work together to make the decorations.  They don't have children now, but they would like have many children in the future.  Her business is seasonal so she has to work especially hard this time of year to meet demand.  Sra. Gladys will use this loan to buy rolls of nylon string for making bunting.  She says that she is grateful to the bank for the support they provide.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her crafts business.

loans.name: Nam

texts.en:
Mrs. Nam is a 57-year-old married woman who resides in the Pouk district. Besides farming, she is skilled in making bamboo baskets to generate additional income of $1.50 per day. She has been involved in her business for more than 10 years. She has 5 children, two of whom are still students and depend on her income. 

And now she is looking for a loan from HKL, one of Kiva's partners, to purchase a piece of farmland from her neighbor. She hopes that she’ll be able to increase her rice productivity next year to satisfy the basic necessities of the whole family.

loans.use: to purchase a piece of farmland.

loans.name: Idalia Asunción

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en la parroquia Sequita en Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

En este lugar vive la señora Idalia, tiene 53 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tuvo 10 hijos, 9 de ellos ya son mayores de edad y el ultimo tiene 16 años que estudia en colegio,  seis de sus hijosd son solteros y viven con ellos. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Ella y su esposo y con la ayuda de sus hijos siembran  todo tipo de legumbres, maíz, frutas como melón y sandias, trabajan de lunes a viernes desde  las 6h30 hasta las 15h00 en el sembrío, el esposo también se dedica tres días a la semana a vender frutas  y legumbres las cuales compra a agricultores de su zona o en el mercado mayorista en Portoviejo, él recorre con sus productos en un triciclo por las calles de Montecristi. Lleva toda su vida dedicado a las faenas del campo y de comerciante más de 15 años.

Este crédito es para comprar, semillas e insumos agrícolas ya que se avecina el invierno y quieren estar preparado para sembrar con las primeras lluvias. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otras instituciones de crédito. 

Su sueño es tener buena salud ella y los suyos.
texts.en:
The “María Auxiliadora” communal bank meets in Sequita Parish in Montecristi, a prosperous canton in Manabí full of hardworking, dedicated people who are proud of their roots.  La Sequita is a parish whose residents are honest people who know only work and dedication to family.

Idalia, 53, lives here.  She’s married and had ten children.  Nine of them are already adults and the youngest is a 16-year-old attending secondary school.  Six of her children are single and still living with them.   Her husband’s a farmer.
