She and her husband with help from their children grow all sorts of vegetables, corn and fruit like melons and watermelons.  They work Monday through Friday from 6:30am until 3pm in the fields.  Her husband also works three days a week selling fruit and vegetables that he buys from local farmers or at the wholesale market in Portoviejo.  He goes through Montecristi’s streets on his three-wheeled cart with his products.  He’s been working his entire life in farming and has been a merchant for more than fifteen years.

This loan is to buy seeds and farm supplies because winter is approaching and they want to be prepared to plant with the first spring rains.  She is a founding member of the communal bank and likes it because interest rates are lower than at other credit institutions.  Her dream is for her and her loved ones to have good health.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm supplies.

loans.name: Amparo Del Socorro

texts.es:
Amparo es una persona que siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajadora y siempre querer ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Amparo se encuentra casada y es madre de 1 hijo a quien siempre quiso sacar adelante y ofrecerle un buen estudio. Amparo se dedica a la actividad de la confección y paralelamente ofrece productos de belleza, lo que le generar ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Inició con esta actividad debido a que su esposo quedó sin empleo y debía garantizar el dinero necesario para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Fue así como durante 5 años sacó su familia adelante debido a las dificultades de su esposo para poder conseguir trabajo. Con el ánimo de sacar su negocio de la confección adelante, al cual le han hecho un gran pedido, Amparo busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de insumos y materias primas que requiere para la elaboración de un pedido que le ha hecho un cliente. 
Amparo espera que de esta manera sus ingresos aumenten y pueda seguir aumentando el tamaño de su taller, el cual ha venido presentando muy buenos resultados. Además, Amparo espera que su taller salga adelante para ofrecer a su esposo y a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida. Amparo sueña con tener un gran taller donde pueda ofrecer trabajo para las personas más necesitadas y con el que le pueda ofrecer a su hijo una estabilidad económica.

loans.use: Compra de insumos y materias primas que requiere para la elaboración de un pedido que le ha hecho un cliente.

loans.name: Virgencita De Guadalupe Group

texts.es:
La señora BENJAMINA es socia de la alcancía comunal VIRGENCITA DE GUADALUPE del distrito de El Tambo, ella es madre soltera, y tuvo que trabajar muy duro logrando así sacar adelante  a sus hijos, todos ya con mayoría de edad.
Benjamina se dedica a la venta de ropa, siempre la ha caracterizado sus ganas de surgir y tiene un gran objetivo que es la de contar con un local cómodo y amplio para expender su mercadería, por eso es que solicita el préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de más ropa y así surtir su negocio. Benjamina es la sexta persona de la izquierda, viste chompa verde clara y pantalón azul.
texts.en:
Benjamina is a member of the “Virgencita de Guadalupe” communal bank in El Tambo District.  She’s a single mother and had to work very hard to move her children ahead; they are all now adults.

Benjamina works selling used clothes.  She’s always been noted for her drive to surge forward and she has a great objective which is to have a comfortable, spacious locale in which to sell her merchandise which is why she’s asking for the loan to be able to invest in her prosperous business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Sabougnouman Vii Group

texts.fr:
Les huit  membres du groupe SABOUGNOUMAN VII sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Zagnanabougou, un des villages de la commune de Guegneka,  préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont le mil, l’arachide et le fonio. Elles sont à leur sixième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, FANTA deuxième personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,75 hectare de mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Fana,  après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 125 000F CFA environs par campagne.

loans.use: Labour, semence, engrais, herbicide, sarclage et petits équipements

loans.name: Diana Mireya

texts.es:
DIANA CAÑON nació en una de las ciudades grandes del país de Colombia BOGOTA. En su inicio de vida fue criada en un hogar llamado jardín donde su mamá trabajaba en una empresa de flores y el horario era muy extenso el cual no le daba tiempo de compartir con sus hijos, pues ella era la menor de dos hombres varones.  Un día conoció a un muchacho quien pensó que sería el hombre de su vida con el tuvo un pequeño niño, fue la gran decepción para la familia pues era la única mujer  y aun no había terminado el bachillerato. Su mamá decidió apoyarla para que terminara el bachillerato y termino con gran orgullo pues el padre del niño nunca lo reconoció. Decidió empezar a trabajar en una empresa de flores donde adquiriría un poco más de experiencia laboral allí fue contratada por una temporal, al año y medio le realizaron exámenes para ingresar por empresa pues después de un mes de este proceso conoció a otro muchacho del cual lo quiso muchísimo y volvió a quedar embarazada. Nació otro pequeño niño, este hombre si lo reconoció y le colabora con la alimentación de ellos, pero aun así no vive con ellos pues era un hombre con bastantes mujeres. Ella muy desilusionada de esta situación decidió levantar cabeza y salir adelante y estudiar una carrera técnica. La que le llamo la atención fue ADMINISTRACION EN SALUD puesto que cada vez que ella iba a sus controles ella admiraba al personal administrativo que la atendía siempre fueron muy amables y cariñosas con ella y así fue como le empezó a gustar esta carrera. El propósito de ella es estudiar y entrar a una clínica u hospital, para así con el mayor compromiso sacar su casa y brindarles a sus dos pequeños hijos un hogar digno y acogedor donde no tengan que aguantar regaños ni humillaciones de otras personas de igual manera apoyara a sus dos hijos en el estudio para que sean hijos ejemplares en la vida.                                
Por este motivo ella estudia emotivamente con ganas y fuerzas para ser un buen ejemplo de madre e hija.
texts.en:
Diana was born in Bogotá, one of the big cities of Colombia. At the start of her life she was brought up in a home known as a garden where her mother worked for a flower company. Her hours of work were very long so she did not have time to spend with her children, Diana and her 2 older brothers. One day Diana met a man who she thought would be the man in her life and she had a little boy with him. It was a big disappointment for the family because she was the only girl and she still had not finished her high school education. Her mother decided to help her finish her certificate of secondary education and she was very proud to finish her studies, since the father of her child never accepted him. 

Diana decided to work in a flower company where she would get a bit more work experience and was taken on there as a temporary worker. After a year and a half she took exams to join the company. A month after this she met another boy who she liked very much and she became pregnant again. She had another little boy and this time the father accepted him and helps her to buy food for the children. He does not live with them, however, since he is a man with a lot of girlfriends. 

Feeling very disappointed by this situation, Diana decided to pick herself up and improve her situation in life by studying for a technical degree. What attracted her was Health Administration since every time she went for her check-ups she admired the administrative staff who dealt with her. They were always kind and affectionate with her and so this career began to appeal to her. 

Diana's aim is to study and start work at a clinic or hospital so that, with great commitment, she can keep her household going and give her 2 little boys a decent and welcoming home where they will not have to put up with being scolded or humiliated by other people. She will also support her 2 sons in their studies so that they become model sons. For this reason Diana studies with great enthusiasm and determination to be an exemplary mother and daughter.

loans.use: to pay for studies in health administration at Campoalto.

loans.name: Nivo

texts.fr:
Nivo est une femme âgée de 34 ans. Elle vit à la campagne avec son mari et ses 4 enfants. Elle vend des divers articles utiles à la vie de tous les jours comme des radios, des piles, des montres et des vernis à ongles. Elle fait aussi de la confection de vêtements.
Elle a déjà pris des prêts auparavant chez Vahatra qui a fait améliorer la condition de vie de sa famille. Pour ce prêt, elle pense acheter quelques articles et des tissus afin de coudre des vêtements à la mode. En effet, c’est bientôt les fêtes et elle espère gagner beaucoup de bénéfices.
Elle espère épargner pour assurer l’étude et l’avenir de sa famille.

loans.use: Acheter des radios, des piles, des montres pour vendre et des tissus à coudre

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
This is a group loan request submitted by the twenty-four members of the women’s tontine Balindite, represented by Jacqueline D..  Founded over ten years ago in the southern village of Mlomp, the Balindite group engages in a variety of commercial activities, including: 

  • Transportation and sale of produce grown in their household gardens as far away as the bordering countries of Gambia and Guinea-Bissau 
  • Traditional local crafts: soap making, batik cloth-dying, and mat and basket weaving 

The loan requested by the group would be invested in materials and supplies for their gardening and craft activities, and the transportation of the finished goods to market.   

 

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group.  Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines.  Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities.  Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members.  However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income.  This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities.  Senegal Ecovillage Microfinance (SEM) works with our partner organization CRESP to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loans.use: Purchase of materials for gardening and craft production, transportation to market

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Rebbecca would like to buy a water tank

loans.name: Elisapeta

texts.en:
Elisapeta is one of the old ladies in the Faleula Fou 4 Center. Despite her age, she works actively in the vegetable garden with the help of her husband. When the vegetables are ripe, Elisapeta and her children sell them to the village shops or at the market.

Fishing is another source of income for the family. Elisapeta’s sons are good fishermen who go out four days a week, depending on the weather. The fish are sold at the village near the road, or at the fish market.

Elisapeta decided that having two businesses was insurance against setbacks, such as a slow or low yield, or an illness that would prevent her sons from fishing for a week.

There are eleven people in Elisapeta’s family, and the sons don’t have permanent jobs. Through her two businesses, they generate revenue that helps cover family expenses and other faalavelaves (communal family events or obligations such as births, funerals, repairing or building a home).

loans.use: Purchase of vegetable seeds, fertilizer, fishing equipment, and tools

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
Motorbikes are the main means of transport in Vietnam. Mrs. N., 48, and her family make a living by selling spare parts and repairing bikes. Mrs. N.'s husband and her 2 sons (23 and 18) are doing the repairs and ordering the spare parts, while she is selling and keeping track of the money.

Mrs. N., who also has a 15-year-old daughter, is the Leader of the TYM Center in her small town, where 45 women meet each month to share their experiences and discuss their business and loans.

loans.use: buy spare parts

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio G., 38, is a hard worker and has various sources of income. Besides owning a despensa (Spanish for 'pantry') with his wife, he also buys and sells coal. His wife helps him with the despensa, which they started after they got married about ten years ago. They sell all types of products at their despensa, including bread, drinks, pasta, sauces, brooms, carrots, and cleaners. They are open everyday from 5 in the morning until 7 at night and purchase their merchandise from the market in Itá. They sold very few products when they first started their despensa. However, over the years, they have been able to expand their despensa. Thanks to the loans they have received, they have been able to increase their inventory and business.

Antonion also owns farm animals: chickens, pigs, and cows. He owns over 40 chickens, 5 cows, and 2 pigs in his backyard. He is requesting a $1,000 loan to maintain his farm animals, purchase coal in large quantities to resell, and to purchase more merchandise (drinks, sugar, pasta) for his despensa.

loans.use: Maintain his farm animals and to purchase coal.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos is a 21-year-old youth, and at his young age, he is the owner of a bakery. He learned this trade from his beloved and selfless father, from whom he also inherited the virtues of hard work and dedication. Currently, Carlos lives with his parents in a rented house, where he also set up his bakery. The desire that this enterprising young man has is to be able to have a larger bakery and to put it in a more strategic place. This is why he works tirelessly every day, starting very early.

Carlos is willing to put forth the effort every day to make his business stronger with the goal of providing his elderly parents with a better quality of life and to be able to make his dream a reality. Carlos is requesting a loan of $400.

Let's help this prosperous, enterprising young man set up a larger bakery.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer.

Carlos es un joven de 21 años y a su corta edad ya es propietario de una panadería, gracias a que este oficio lo aprendió de su querido y abnegado padre, de quién también heredó las virtudes de trabajo y dedicación.En la actualidad vive junto a sus padres en una casa alquilada lugar en el que también montó su panadería y el anhelo que posee este joven emprendedor es llegar a tener una panificadora más grande y ubicarla en un lugar más estratégico, para ello trabaja incansablemente todos los días desde muy temprano. Carlos está dispuesto a esforzarse día a día y a fortalecer más su negocio con el fin de ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida a sus ancianos padres y para hacer realidad su sueño este joven entusiasta esta solicitando un préstamo 400 dólares. Apoyemos a poder montar una panadería más grande a este joven próspero empresario.

loans.use: Purchase of raw material to increase his production

loans.name: Sujeidy

texts.en:
Sujeidy is twenty seven years old, and she and her partner have three children.  The youngest, one year old, does not wander too far from mom, while Sujeidy’s elder children, seven and four, attend school.  

Sujeidy is very humble, and quickly points out that her business is quite new, having only started in the last few weeks.  Currently, she sells men's and women’s clothing; mostly shoes and sneakers, along with a variety of bedtime wear.  With her loan, Sujeidy plans on focusing on women’s sleepwear and adding more shoes and sneakers to her selection.  Even though she is “just getting started,” Sujeidy explains that her enterprise will help her maintain a comfortable lifestyle for her family.  She hopes that her business will someday grow into a fully stocked clothing shop.

loans.use: Purchase of Women's Sleepwear and Men's and Women's shoes for sale

loans.name: Khaidarhoja

texts.en: Khaidarhoja N. lives in Gonjy; he is married and has 1 child. Khaidarhoja N. has been a client of MicroInvest since 2007 and recommends himself as a serious and strongly motivated client. Loan sums are permanently increased to those who show business stability and an income increase. He  has a wide business including livestock raising and selling as well as milk production. He wants to purchase a horn pedigree bull and milk cow for further meat and dairy goods production (to supply to bazaars). It is planned to add to the assortment the following milk products: pasteurized milk, sour milk, sour cream, curds, etc. Now Mr. N. requests a loan of 1,800 TJS (US$525) for a horn pedigree bull and a pedigree milk cow, which will allow him to increase significantly the family income and to  further widen the business.

loans.use: horn pedigree bull and pedigree milk cow purchase

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
I am Nasreen R. and I live in Pakpattan, a small town in Pakistan. My loan group and I are borrowing for the second time. Last year, we took out a loan to start a bicycle repair shop. The profit from this business is small but we have managed to repay our loan. This year I plan to start a cosmetics store. I believe this business will do well because there is a high demand for such a store in our community.

The other members of my group are: Anwer B., who wants to expand her sewing business and start a sewing school. Mumtaz B. will buy a rickshaw with the loan. Razia B. needs the loan for her son, who is a tailor. Shamim A. needs the loan to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farm.

loans.use: Open a cosmetics store and expand several other businesses

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Mrs. Ny P. , 44, is a widow with six children-- four sons and two daughters. She was only able to complete the fourth grade in primary school. However, she is polite, friendly and clever in her business. There are five children living under her custody, all of them are working except one who is studying. The family lives approximately thirteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. P. has been selling fruit with her daughter, Noun Chanda, at the Ta Kmao market since 2000. She purchases the fruit from a farm in her village. She is requesting her second loan in the amount of $1100. She will use this money to buy more fruit for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit for resale

loans.name: Ilza Buenaventura

texts.es:
Señora Ilza Buenaventura G. V. is 42 years old. She finished up to the 4th grade. She has 3 children who still depend on her financially. She lives in the district of Florencia Mora in La Libertad, Peru. She belongs to the communal bank called "God Guides Our Steps II".

She used to sell beauty products and made handbags, but since she wasn't able to spend time with her family, she decided to only sell beauty products. Señora Ilza has been selling beauty products for the past 3 years. She was acquiring clients little by little, and a lot of them wanted for her to sell to them through credit. She accepted her mother-in-law's invitation to become a member of the communal bank called "God Guides Our Steps".

She purchased beauty products with her previous loan so that she could have enough in inventory for the holiday season.

with this loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase products such as perfumes, colognes, and cosmetics. Señora Ilza would like to keep her sales up so that one day she can afford to install a cement roof over her house.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Ilza Buenaventura G. V. tiene 42 años, solo estudió hasta 4º grado de secundaria, tiene tres hijos y actualmente 2 dependen de ella, vive en el Distrito de Florencia de Mora, Provincia de Trujillo, Departamento de La Libertad – Perú, pertenece al banco comunal “Dios guía nuestros Pasos II”. Ella anteriormente se dedicaba a vender productos de belleza y a confeccionar carteras pero con el tiempo limitado que tenia para atender a su familia decidió dedicarse solo a la venta de productos de belleza. La señora se dedica a este negocio hace más de 3 años; poco a poco fue aumentando la cantidad de sus clientes y muchos le solicitaban que les vendiera al crédito por lo que tenía necesidad de mayor capital por eso aceptó la invitación de su suegra de integrarse al Banco Comunal “Dios Guía Nuestros Pasos” El anterior préstamo de S/. 500.00 lo invirtió en la compra de productos de belleza para tener en stock ya que por campaña navideña le solicitaban varios de éstos productos. Con el préstamo de S/. 700.00 el cual cancelara en cuatro meses comprará sus productos: perfumes, colonias y cosméticos. La señora Ilza quiere seguir incrementando sus ventas, así también anhela mucho construir el techo de cemento que le hace falta a su vivienda.

loans.use: To purchase more beauty products for her business

loans.name: Milpa 1 Group

texts.es:
Mrs. Catarina does not know her age, but she is an elderly woman with many years of work experience. Since she was little she has worked making and embroidering traditional clothing as an artisan. She is sad that, due to many of life’s hardships, she never had the chance to go to school so she does not know how to read. She sees very little at this age.

Currently, she purchases raw materials which other women make and embroider into handicrafts which Mrs. Catarina then sells. With the loan, she would like to purchase spools of colored thread and fabric.

The other members of the group are Maria P. H., who sells fruit and vegetables in Tuxtla Gutierrez; and Catarina P. A., who is an artisan.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

DOÑA CATARINA NO SABE SU EDAD , ES UNA MUJER DE EDAD AVANZADA Y CON MUCHOS AÑOS DE TRABAJO, DESDE QUE ES PEQUEÑA SE DEDICA A BORDAR Y ELABORAR ROPA TIPÍCA, ES ARTESANA, LE DA TRISTEZA QUE NO PUDO IR A LA ESCUELA NO SABE LEER Y CUENTA POR QUE LA VIDA SE LO EXIGIO, ACTUALMENTE YA NO VE MAS QUE SOMBRAS LO QUE HACE QUE COMPRE LA MATERIA PRIMA Y OTRAS MUJERES TRABAJEN EN LA ELABORACION DE LA ARTESANIA PARA QUE ELLA LA VENDA, CON EL CREDITO LE GUSTARIA COMPRAR MUCHOS CONOS DE HILOS DE COLORES Y TELA, LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON: MARIA PÉREZ H., VENDE FRUTAS Y VERDURAS EN TUXTLA GUTIERREZ Y CATARINA PÉREZ A. ES ARTESANA.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials (thread and fabric)

loans.name: Uliya

texts.en:
Uliya has a business creating beautiful synthetic flower arrangements used in funerals and as gravesite decorations. These arrangements are very common in the Ukraine as a way to memorialize and honor loved ones who have passed away. Uliya has extensive experience in this business. She has been working for herself for over seven years. She is married and has two young sons. Uliya makes about $400 per month from her business.

Uliya has requested a loan of 5000 Ukrainian Griven to buy materials used in making her flower arrangements. She has been a client with HOPE Intl-Nadiya Ukraine since 2004. We are happy to have another opportunity to help this hard-working entrepreneur as she works to provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: Purchase materials to make synthetic flower arrangements

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Irene is 39 years old and lives in the Ticuantepe area. She is married and has two children who are 16 and 21 years of age. Her husband works as a credit promotor and he takes care of the family's bills. Irene buys and sells pigs and already has several years experience with this business. The loan she is requesting is to replace her home's roof since it is in disrepair. Her goals are to expand her business buying and selling pigs.

 Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer. 


La Sra. Irene tiene 39 años de edad, habita en el municipio Ticuantepe, es casada y tiene dos hijos de 16 y 21 años de edad, su esposo trabaja como promotor de crédito y aporta a los gastos del hogar. 

Doña Irene vende y compra cerdos,  lleva ya varios años  en el negocio, con este préstamo que esta solicitando es para cambio de techo de su vivienda ya que esta en mal estado. Sus planes son poder expandirse el negocio de la compra y venta de cerdos.

loans.use: Replace her home's roof.

loans.name: Deborah Nsereko's Group

texts.en:
Deborah N., the leader of a group of five women, is 47 and married with three children who are 27, 25 and 22 years old. All of her children are in school. Deborah lives in a semi-urban slum on the outskirts of Kampala that is prone to flooding during the rainy season. She has been selling old clothes for the past 21 years, and the market for her business is fair. She sells her clothes at Owino market, the largest market in Kampala.

Deborah plans on using this loan to increase her stock of used clothing. Since she began working with MCDT, she has repaid 24 loans. With these loans, her business has prospered and her profits have enabled her to educate her children. Deborah hopes to one day be able to buy a plot of land and build a house for her family.

loans.use: To increase her stock of old clothes.

loans.name: Las Tulipanes Group

texts.es:
This is the Communal Bank “Las Tulipanes,” formed of 18 members, all of whom are women from the same area. The neighborhood is called Julio Leigue and is behind the Industiral Park, a neighborhood inhabited by the same big-hearted people. The meetings take place in the President, Mrs. Yris Libertad’s house. She is a very sensible woman who just gave birth to her first child, she is dedicated to selling cosmetics. She is punctual and has strong character. The treasurer is Mrs. Cinthia, the Secretary Mrs. Jaquelin. The majority of the members are dedicated to selling cosmetics from various brands, for example: Esika, Avon, Yanbal. The Secretary is dedicated to selling clothes. They are in their first cycle and up to now everything has con regularly, and they have a good idea of the punctuality and responsibility that they should have for the loans that they have been granted. Mrs. Chelita makes homemaD. bread, Mrs. Fabiola sells fast food in her own home. The group has chosen to meet Tuesday mornings.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva volunteer.

Este es el Banco Comunal " LAS TULIPANES" Conformado por 18 socias todas son mujeres D. la misma zona, El barrio se llama Julio Leigue queda detrás del Parque Industrial, un barrio acogedor donD. habitan las mismas con gente D. gran corazón, las reuniones se llevan a cabo en la casa D. la Presidenta Sra. Yris Libertad una señora muy sencilla que acaba D. dar a luz a su primer hijo ella se dedica a ser promotora D. cosméticos, puntual, D. carácter fuerte, la Tesorera es la Señora Cinthia, la Secretaria la Sra. Jaquelin, la gran mayoría D. las socias se dedican a ser Promotoras D. Cosméticos en diferentes líneas D. como por ejemplo Esika, Avon, Yanbal, la Secretaria se dedica a la venta D. ropa. Ellas están en un primer Ciclo y hasta el momento todo marcha con regularidad, además que tienen bien presente que la puntualidad y responsabilidad que deben tener para el créditos que se les otorgó. La Sra. Chelita hace pan casero, la Sra. Fabiola se dedica a la venta D. comida Rápida en su propio domicilio. Los días D. reunión escogido por el grupo es el día martes por las mañanas.

loans.use: Operational Captial

loans.name: Jader Antonio

texts.es: El joven Jader Antonio L., de 27 años de edad, casado con la joven Marlin Gurdián Trujillo, ingeniero agrónomo, con un hijo de 3 años, él trabaja como fontanero en ENACAL desde hace 11 años, alquilan una casita, su hijo es cuidado en un C.D.I donde ella también trabaja. El señor L. está solicitando su crédito, el que utilizará para la instalación del agua y la luz de su vivienda, construcción de una letrina y cancelará unos perlines que utilizó para su casa, la que ha ido construyendo poco a poco con los créditos que AFODENIC le ha otorgado. Agradece a AFODENIC, porque con los créditos brindados pronto estará habitando su propia casa y su hijo y su esposa tendrán un techo propio y digno, espera continuar trabajando con la institución para posteriormente hacerle otro detalles a su casa que son de menos importancia, pues con este crédito tendrán los servicios básicos y ya podrán habitar en su propia casa.
texts.en:
The young Jader Antonio L. is 27 years old, married to Marlin Gurdián Trujillo, agricultural engineer, with one 3-year old child. He has worked as a plumber at ENACAL for the past 11 years. They rent a small house, and their young son is cared for at a C.D.I. where she also works. Mr. L. is seeking a loan which he will use to install running water, electricity and a bathroom in their home. He will also cancel some beams that he used for his house, which he has been building little by little with the loans which AFODENIC has granted him. He thanks AFODENIC because, with the loans they have provided to him, he will soon be living in his own house and his wife and child will have their own roof over their heads and live with more dignity. He hopes to continue working with the institution subsequently, to add other details to his house which are of less importance. With this loan they will be able to have the most basic services and live in their very own home.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a bathroom, and install electricity and running water in his house.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana, a sus 24 años tiene un hogar muy constituido, ella y su esposo tratan de trabajar en cualquier actividad para que sus dos hijos no tengan que pasar necesidades.  Desde que se casó trabaja en la chacra, después del medio día, viendo a los operarios y de paso apoya a su esposo, tiene en sus chacras sembradas dos hectáreas de plátanos, que están cosechando, asimismo ahora piensa incursionar en la siembra del café, aunque dice que el café se cosecha una vez al año.  Lo que mas le agrada de su actividad como agricultora es el tiempo de la cosecha, porque llega la oportunidad de llevar al mercado y ganar dinero y es la oportunidad de comprar lo que falta es un hogar. Pero le disgusta que ha veces se queda con su carga en la chacra por falta de movilidad, y además cobran muy caro el transporte, a veces esto lo desanima.  El motivo de su esfuerzo es adquirir cosas de primera necesidad para su hogar, y para su casa de madera, le gustaría renovarla, por una casa de material noble, es su mayor anhelo.  Ella tiene en mente de sembrar el café por primera vez,  este préstamo para ella, dice que es una bendición, de ese modo logrará su objetivo, de aquí a un año, podrá cosechar y negociar su café, de ese modo pueda crecer como familia.
texts.en:
Ana, 24, runs a model home. She and her husband try working at whatever they can find to make sure that their two children don't have to go without the things they need. Since her marriage, Ana has worked on the farm in the afternoons, overseeing the workers and helping her husband. She has two hectares of plantains that are being harvested and she's now thinking of jumping in to coffee growing though she says that coffee can only be harvested once a year. The thing she most likes about being a farmer is the harvest because it's the time of year when she can go to market, sell her crop and buy the things she needs at home. She hasn't liked having to remain behind at times because of a lack of transport, something that's very expensive. The motive for her efforts is buying the basic goods that she needs at home. Her greatest goal is to rebuild her wooden house with a better material. Her idea is to plant coffee for the first time. She says that this loan is a blessing for her, a way to fulfill her goal of being able to harvest and sell her coffee and, ultimately, help her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Plant a coffee crop for the first time.

loans.name: Milica

texts.en:
Milica is 24 years old and lives in Kalenderovci, a village in Bosnia.  She lives with her husband, her parents-in-law, and her two children, ages 3 years and 15 months.  Her husband’s work is seasonal, and they struggle to support their family when he is between projects.  Milica grows vegetables and sells them in the local market, but she does not generate enough income to sustain 4 people over the periods that her husband is between work.  She relies heavily on her parents-in-law for financial support.

Milica wants to become financially independent and create a better life for her family.  She requests a loan of 1,200KM from Women for Women, International, which she will use to purchase a cow.  She will sell the milk and milk products in the local market, and hopes that the income will help her family survive.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Suor's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Suor C. is a group leader of six people who all live in Tro Ngel village in Kampong Chhnang province.  She is a grocer who owns a small store in the local market.  

She now wants to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions.  Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to purchase grocery goods.  

Her husband, Mr. Ouk Sanh, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables.  Mrs. Suor C. is 51 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is a farmer while the others are attending the local school.

This is a group loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans.  Five members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans.  These five members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term.  End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor.  It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to.  Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term.  Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time.  AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To add to her savings to purchase grocery goods.

loans.name: Ruta

texts.en: Ruta M., 46, is married with 8 children.  She has many years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the villagers and general public 3 days per week. She has 2 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~208 USD).  SPBD loans are Ruta’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase plant sprayer, chemicals, bush knives, and sacks of  fertilizer

loans.name: Shahnaz Javed Iqbal Group

texts.en:
"I am Shahnaz and I’m 45 years old and a married lady. I have been a citizen of a city called Borewala, Pakistan for the past 17 years. I couldn’t get an education because my parents couldn’t afford my education expenses. I got married at the age of 18 to a man whose name is J. I.. He is a clothes merchant with experience of 15 years. He buys clothes from a famous bazaar in the city of Multan and sells them in his native city. My son also works with my husband. I help my husband in his clothes-selling business. I sell his garment collections in the community. I have successfully repaid my two loans from Asasah (a micro-finance institute in Pakistan). Now I am applying again for a loan to expand my husband’s clothes-selling business.

I’m the group leader for some more women. Another Shahnaz baji and Shaheen baji each want a loan to buy garments to re-sell. Rashida baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruit for her fruit-selling business. Shamim Akhtar baji wants a loan to buy wood to re-sell."

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Melvin

texts.en:
Melvin M. is a rice farmer. Every day he touches the wet soil and works under the heat of the sun to ensure that there is enough food for his family. He has gained a wealth of farming experience by tilling his land for 23 years. He wants to increase his yield to support all three of his children. 

He needs a loan of Php 10,000 to buy fertilizer and other farm inputs. He dreams of expanding his farm by purchasing another lot of land to plant more rice and earn a greater harvest yield. This loan will provide immense help to Melvin to increase his harvest.

CEVI helps their clients expand their businesses. CEVI provides credit assistance, training and insurance coverage to all their clients.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia D. is thirty-four years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, two males and one female. All of her children are currently in basic school. As a resourceful wife, Lydia trades to support her husband financially. Her husband is a professional electrician. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the dwellers, the men in particular, is farming.

Lydia is into trading. She runs a cold store in her community. She procures her goods from big cold store operators in Kumasi, a nearby city, at wholesale prices and sells at retail prices to her customers. She says nearby smaller townfolk come to buy in cartons to retail. The majority of her customers are food vendors. Her cold store is situated by the road side.

Lydia makes good sales because of the strategic location of her store. She has been in business for eight years. She wants a bigger working capital to increase the quantity of stocks she procures. It is her dream to help her husband put up a structure for the family.

loans.use: To procure fresh fish and meat

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth C. is 34 years old. She is married and the mother of three children. Currently, all of her children are in school. Her husband is a professional carpenter. They live together at Eguase in the central region of Ghana.

Elizabeth has been operating a drinking bar or spot in her neighborhood for four years. She sells items like Coke products, Pepsi products, and assorted paper and canned drinks. Lots of people buy from her bar because of its competitive prices. There is a guy who sells kebabs besides her bar and that has attracted many customers to buy from her.

She is facing financial problem in restocking her inventory, so she is requesting a loan to realize her dreams. She belongs to the village bank called Awake.

loans.use: To buy assorted drinks like Pepsi, Coca-Cola products etc.

loans.name: Vero

texts.en: Vero is 59 years old and is married with 6 children. She sells firewood at Warri, in Delta state, Nigeria. She has been in this business for a long time. She has applied for and hopes to get a loan of N100,000 to purchase more firewood to sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more firewood to sell

loans.name: Mouminatou

texts.fr:
Mouminatou D., 55 ans, est membre du banc villageois de Sinthiang Coundara depuis 2 ans et demi. Son activité est la restauration et la  vente de fruits (oranges, mangues et autres). 
Elle veut renforcer son capital pour rendre son activité plus rentable.
texts.en:
Mouminatou D., age 55, has been a member of the village lending group of Sinthiang Coundara for two and a half years. Her business involves food catering and selling fruit (oranges, mangos, and more). She wants to boost her capital to make her business more profitable.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy goods for his restaurant business and for selling fruit

loans.name: Vero

texts.en: Vero is 46 years-old and married with 7 children.  To make a living, Vero sells beef.  She has been in this business for a long time.  Vero is requesting a loan in the amount of N100,000 to purchase more beef to sell.  She would like to thank all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more beef to sell.

loans.name: Phul

texts.en: C. Phul, 29, is married and stays at home to look after her two school-aged children. Her husband has been a motor-taxi driver for 8 years with a daily income of $2. Phul also takes care of her aged mother. After facing the great hardship of using an old motorbike in the business for a long time, Phul has decided to take a loan from KIVA of $700 to buy a new motorbike for her husband’s business. She hopes all of her children will have a chance to study at a good university when they finish high school.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike.

loans.name: Americo

texts.en:
Americo A. is 61 years old and is originally from Gaza province. He moved to Maputo many years ago in search of work. He never had the opportunity to go to school because his father died when he was very young and he never knew his mother. He is the father of nine children and he supports another three nephews. 

Americo has been employed as a security guard for the past six years. This will be Americo's second loan with Hluvuku. Americo heard about Hluvuku through friends and family. He intends to use this loan to make improvements to his home in hopes of providing better living conditions for his children and nephews.

loans.use: construction materials

loans.name: Parveen Muhammad Munir Group

texts.en:
Parveen baji is the wife of M. M.. She has resided in Borewala, Pakistan, for the past 15 years. Borewala city is famous for its shrines. Her husband runs a timber-selling business. He chose this business because there’s no gas available and people use timber for cooking. He has been involved in this business for more than five years. Parveen baji is applying for a loan to buy timber to grow her husband’s business.

This loan consists of two additional people: Elizabeth baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) and Irshad baji wants a loan to buy goats for her butcher shop. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible. 

Note: Parveen baji is seated in the middle of the bajis. Baji means "older sister" and is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy timber to sell

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely S. is from the village of Biasong. She is 63 years old. Fely is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Fely owns and operates a business manufacturing and selling clay products to local businesses and community members. Fely has been in business for over 39 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Fely joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fely has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. Fely is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Fely from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory for her clay manufacturing shop

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen A. is 43 years old and a rice grower. She has one child. She said that her only dream is to be successsful in her business to be able to provide for the needs of her family. Currently, she is actively attending the cluster meetings in CEVI, and she is happy doing it because she learns a lot from other entrepreneurs who also obtained CEVI's services. 

She would like to request a loan of PHP 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. she will use the loan to buy quality rice seeds, pesticides, fertilizers and provide payment to the laborers. 

Now that she is in her seventh loan in CEVI, she wished to obtain more of its services. She likes CEVI so much because it has only 2% interest rate, which she thinks is very affordable to repay.

loans.use: To buy quality rice seeds, pesticides, fertilizers and provide payment to laborers

loans.name: Unity Group #1

texts.en:
Bandu is a 45-year-old married woman with three children between the ages of 10 and 20. She also cares for one child who was orphaned in the war. All of her children are in school. Bandu’s business is a cook shop: a fast food roadside café for workers in the fields and other general laborers. She has run her business for 10 years and is successful because her customers like her personality and work ethic (she stays open long hours for them), and the way she prepares the food.

Bandu was unable to attend school because, although she enjoyed it, the cultural norm was for girls to rely on their husbands to provide, and therefore school was considered unnecessary. She lives in remote Kolahu city in rural Lofa County – the breadbasket of Liberia. She’s taking out this loan to increase her food stores of rice, oil, salt and meat to meet the demands of the growing local economy. Her dream is to grow her business so that she can have a real restaurant in town one day. With the profits from her business, Bandu dreams of sending her kids to college.

Bandu M. leads a group of five borrowers living in Kolahu, Lofa County, Liberia – Unity Group #1.

loans.use: To purchase rice, oil and salt

loans.name: Fight For Progress Group

texts.en:
These are members of the Fight For Progress Group. They are small-scale business people in the township of Magburaka, in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT for the first time to seek a loan of Le 2,500,000 (or Le 500,000 for each) to boost their businesses. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make a better profit and consequently improve their living standard. 

Alimany K. (left) is the leader of this group. He was born in Magburaka town. He is 28 years old and married to a businesswoman. They have one child together. Alimany has been a businessman for three years now. He is the manager of an Internet café in Magburaka town. With this loan, he will expand his business by buying a bigger photocopier.  

(Attached on the left is a group member who was not present for a snapshot).

loans.use: To buy a bigger photocopier

loans.name: Un

texts.en: Un T., 49 years old, lives with her family members in the province of Pursat, Cambodia. Un T. and her husband are local farmers and they have four children. Two of them are married and have ready started new family homes, while the other two are attending school and under their control. This couple works hard everyday at their business activities: planting rice, fruit, and some vegetables from their village. They typically generate an average of $2 per day. To help meet their hard physical labors during the plowing process, Un T. is looking for a loan to buy a pair of oxen which she will use them to plow the farmland.

loans.use: To buy a pair of oxen which she will use them to plow the farmland

loans.name: Crusanita

texts.en:
Crusanita E. is from the village of Bobontugan, Jasaan Misamis Oriental. She is 36 years old. Crusanita is single. To make a living, Crusanita sells seafood products like fish and shrimp in the local community. Crusanita has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Crusanita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Crusanita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from HSPFI. Crusanita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fishing nets. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Crusanita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fishing nets

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam tiene 31 años, está separada y vive con sus tres hijos en su casa propia. 
Tras el abandono de su pareja ella es padre y madre para sus pequeños, por ello trabaja arduamente en sus chacras de café y plátanos, pero como mucha veces no le alcanza el dinero de sus cosechas, busca trabajar para sus vecinos, donde la pagan 13 soles el día, sin incluir el almuerzo.
Miriam tiene la esperanza de que cuando crezcan sus hijos le puedan ayudara con sus cultivos, y de ese modo lograr sembrar en mayor cantidad, sobre todo el café que es un producto muy rentable y así se evitaría trabajar para otras personas y se dedicaría íntegramente a sus cultivos. Además se podrá reunir más dinero para la educación de sus hijos, que es su mayor deseo como madre.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, donde ha demostrado puntualidad en sus pagos, ya que todo lo que va ganando lo reúne poco a poco, porque no le gusta caer en morosidad. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos, también adquirirá plantitas de café.
texts.en:
Miriam is 31 and separated. She lives with her three children in her own house. Due to her life partner’s abandonment, she is mother and father to her little ones. Therefore, she works arduously in her coffee and banana fields. Sometimes the money from the harvests does not suffice. She looks for work with her neighbors, where they pay 13 PEN a day without including lunch. Miriam has the hope that when her children grow they will be able to help with her crops. This way she will be able to plant in greater quantities. Above all, she wants to plant coffee, which is a very profitable product. That way she can avoid working for other people and work entirely on her crops. Also, she would be able to get together more money for her children’s education, which is her greatest desire as a mother. This is her second loan with MFP, where she has demonstrated punctuality in her payments. Little by little she gets together her earnings because she does not like to be delinquent. The money that she is now asking for is to buy chemical fertilizers. She will also get some coffee plants.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers and coffee plants

loans.name: Mujeres Virtuosas Group

texts.en:
This Women's Entrepreneurship Committee will use their loan to buy meat, pies, bakery, vegetables, napkins, vegetables, coal, oil, rowers, divers, jackets, trousers, blouses, fruits, cell phone accessories, lingerie, candy, jewelry, soft drinks, beer, plastic storage containers, etc. 

Alejandra E. sells food, investing her loan in buying ingredients to offer her patrons a better variety of food and more diverse menus.  
  
Angela B. sells clothing, investing her loan to buy a greater variety for different seasons to satisfy the demands of her customers.

Clotilde D. sells clothing, investing her loan to buy a greater variety for different seasons to satisfy the demands of her customers such as shirts, jackets, trousers, blouses, etc. 

Jacquelin Chaves sells fruit and invested her loan to buy various wholesale fruit for later sale for greater profit. 

M. Innocence sells fruit and invested her loan to buy various wholesale fruit for later sale for greater profit. 

Marisol C. sells food, investing her loan in buying ingredients to offer her patrons a better variety of food and more diverse menus.  

Isabel F. sells cellular accessories and invested her loan to purchase various goods for re-sale. 

Francisca V. sells lingerie and invests her loan to buy more and higher quality products. 

Maria Luisa F. sells candy and invests her loan to purchase goods for sale. 

Eugenia F. is dedicated to the sale of drinks and spent the money on buying drinks in bulk for subsequent sale 

Inocencia B. sells cellular accessories and invested her loan to purchase various goods for re-sale. 
 
Sandra M. sells bijouterie and invested her loan to buy wholesale jewelery increase her sales and profits.

Daisy C. sells fruit and is using her loan to buy a greater amount of fruit at wholesale prices to increase her profits. 

Mary Matilda B. sells candy and is investing her loan to purchase a greater variety of goods. 

Simona G. sells clothes and is investing her loan to purchase shirts, jackets, shorts, and other seasonal clothing items to satisfy the demands of her customers. 

Ninfa S. sells lingerie and invests her loan to buy more and higher quality products. 

Digna B. sells plastic products and invested her loan to buy merchandise to increase her number of sales. 

Graciela F. sells clothes and is investing her loan to purchase shirts, jackets, shorts, and other seasonal clothing items to satisfy the demands of her customers.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to resell

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda G. is from the village of Migpange Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old and married with three adult children. To make a living, Luzminda operates a business selling coconut wine ("tuba") to use as vinegar in the local community. Luzminda has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $72 a month from this activity.

In 2008, Luzminda joined the Kiva field partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Luzminda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mohira

texts.en:
K. Mohira is the 32-year-old loving mother of two children. Her husband is an electrician. For more than 7 years Mohira has sold fish in the central fish market of the city. When she started she made only a little money in turnover. With time her business expanded and today it is quite a stable business. Mohira requests a loan of $1500 USD. She wants to purchase a lot of fish at wholesale prices in order to have stock to sell in winter. Mohira has already been provided with three loans by IMON and has shown herself to be a reliable client. She would to thank everyone for their support.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase fish wholesale.

loans.name: Rafaela Carolina

texts.es:
La Señora Rafaela Carolina S. M., Labora como colectora de ruta en el Mercado Mayoreo de Managua, ella tiene una hija a su cargo, la que   se encuentran en edad escolar, es 
casada, ha trabajado créditos con CEPRODEL durante cuatro años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido 4 créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  ella es una cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: ladrillos, cemento, etc. El cual utilizara para el piso de su  casa de habitación, el que le Brindara mejores  condición de vida a sus hijos.
Rafaela dijo que gracias a los préstamos otorgados por ceprodel ha podido mejorar su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rafaela Carolina S. M. works as a custodian at Managua's Wholesale Market. She is married and has one school-age daughter. She has been working with CEPRODEL for four years, during which time she's received four CEPRODEL loans and used them to improve her home. She is an excellent client. The loan requested will be used to purchase construction materials such as bricks, cement, etc., which she will use for the floor of her house. In this way she will be able to offer her children better living conditions. Rafaela says that CEPRODEL's loans have made it possible for her to improve her home.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improving and expanding her home

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en: Alejandra B., 51, is a fish vendor. She works every day to sell her fish in their village. Sometimes she sells it door-to-door so as to save time. She earns an income by doing this business and she uses her earnings to buy the basic needs of her family. Aside from fish she plants seaweed. She would like to apply for a loan of PHP 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy more fish to resell and seaweed seedlings as well.

loans.use: Obtain more fish to resell and buy seaweed plants.

loans.name: Abduaziz

texts.ru: Иноятов Абдуазиз проживает в городе Душанбе. Возраст, 27 лет. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Жена, работает в компании сотовой связи МЛТ. Сам Абдуазиз торгует в магазине. Он в основном продает сувиниры. В этой деятельности более 3 лет. Абдуазиз имеет высшее образование. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота, т.е. увеличение ассортимента своего товара.
texts.en:
Abduaziz I. lives in the city of Dushanbe. He is 27 years old, married and has 2 children. His wife works at the MLT cellular communications company. Abduaziz is involved in retail sales at a store. He primarily sells souvenirs. He has been in this business for over 3 years. Abduaziz has a higher education. He is requesting this loan in order to increase goods turnover, i.e. expand his merchandise selection.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Luis Emilio

texts.es: El Señor Luis Emilio tiene la edad 47 años. La actividad económica de Don Luis es la venta de productos lácteos, pues es una manera de sufragar los gastos de su familia. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio. Sus inicios se dan por que la mayoría de sus vecinos compraban leche, pero la persona que se las ofrecía, no se las proporcionaba a un precio favorable ademas el la vende en un humilde carreton en donde tranporta su leche, cuajada, crema entre otros productos. Es por eso Luis se empeña es obtener este medio de vida para mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Es por eso que siente la necesidad de acudir a un financiamiento con el objetivo de invertirlo en capital de trabajo que es necesario en su negocio. Su deseo es obtener otro medio de ingreso que le ayude.
texts.en:
Mr. Luis Emilio is 47 years old. Don Luis sells milk products since this is a way to take care of his family's expenses. He has had this business for more than ten years. He got started in this because most of his neighbor's bought milk, but the person selling it didn't give them a good price. In addition, he sells it from a humble cart he transports his milk, curd, cream and other products on. Don Luis does this sort of work to improve his living conditions. He feels the need to ask for a loan so he can invest it in the working capital necessary for his business. He would like to find another way of earning an income to help him out.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Petronila

texts.es:
La Sra. Petronila B. presta servicio de taxi  los usuarios, ella vive en el municipio del Viejo.

Ella va a utilizar el crédito en la compra de algunos repuestos para reparar el taxi como llantas, pie de vías, Reparación de caja de cambios, etc. Y a la vez darle mantenimiento ya que es él, el que le proviene la alimentación diaria. 

Este es el segundo  crédito que tiene con la Institución y el primero lo pago muy bien en tiempo y forma y espera seguir trabajando con la Institución ya que dice estar muy agradecida con CEPRODEL, por el apoyo que le ha brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. Petronila B. provides taxi service to those who want to use it. She lives in the town of El Viejo. Petronila will use this loan to buy spare parts because there a few items on her taxi that need to be repaired such as the rims, tire treads, gearbox, etc. Her vehicle needs to be maintained because it provides for her daily needs.

This is the second loan she has received from the Institution. She repaid her first loan on time and hopes to continue working with the Institution. Petronila says she is very grateful to CEPRODEL for the support that has been provided to her.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for maintenance & repairs to her taxi

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en: Eduardo B. is from Murry Village, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 46 years old and is single. Eduardo owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over eight years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Eduardo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. Eduardo plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth B., from the town of San Antonio, Katipunan, is 45 years old, married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Elizabeth owns and operates a business venture selling seafood products such as fish and shrimp in the local community. Engaged in her business for over five years, she earns approximately 5,000.00 PHP a month.

In 2006, Elizabeth joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 6,000.00 PHP from PMPC that was used to purchase house construction materials, she is now requesting a new loan, her seventh, of 6,000.00 PHP which will be used for the house completion.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To complete her house construction

loans.name: Virginia's Group

texts.en:
Virginia D. is from the village of Calaocan,Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 38 years old. Virginia is the group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Virginia is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Virginia owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing manicure and pedicure services in the local community. Virginia has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 2,300 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2008, Virginia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide services. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Virginia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisher folk and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide services.

loans.name: Karla Gabriela

texts.es: La señora Karla tiene 34 años, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos, que son menores de edad. La señora Karla tiene un negocio de venta de ropa nueva, en la cual además vende electrodomésticos y cosméticos, este negocio está localizado en su casa de habitación. Ella ya tiene 7 años de tener este negocio, el cual dio inicio cuando ella no tenía trabajo. Ahora en día, ella trabaja como secretaria en Managua, y el negocio en el día es atendido por su mama, los fines de semana ella está a cargo del negocio. La señora posee buena clientela sus ventas son más o menos un 70% a contado y un 30% a crédito. Ella está solicitando este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de mercadería, ya que se acerca la fecha del día de la madre y quiere surtir con producto nuevo el negocio. Su sueño siempre ha sido tener un negocio grande para tener las disponibilidades para que sus hijos puedan tener una educación universitaria en la universidad y que se preparen bien.
texts.en:
Mrs. Karla is a thirty-four year old, single mother of two young kids. Mrs. Karla has a home-business selling new clothes, appliances, and cosmetics. She began this business seven years ago when she was unemployed. She works as a secretary in Managua while her mother takes care of the business during the week. She takes care of it on the weekends and has many customers and sells about 70% cash and 30% on credit. She is taking out a loan to buy merchandise since it's almost Mother's Day and she wants to stock her business. Her dream has always been to have a large enough business to pay for her kids' university education so they will be prepared for life.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working captial

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en: Criselda D. is from the village of Parog-Parog, Solana, Cagayan. She is 42 years old, is married, and has six school-aged children. Criselda owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Criselda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from ASKI. Criselda is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be her third from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Mary Anne

texts.en:
Mary Anne D. is from the village of Naawan Misamis Oriental. She is 35 years old. Mary Anne is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Anne owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Mary Anne has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Mary Anne joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Mary Anne is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Mary Anne from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Margot Marisol

texts.es:
Margot de 39 años, vive en el Fortín de Guayaquil( zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y lomas en disolución), ella tiene una tienda de víveres, desde hace 15 años atrás para poder mantener a sus dos hijos. 

Ella empezó a vender arroz, azúcar y enlatados a sus conocidos y vecinos para tener dinero suficiente, cuando sus hijos llegan de la escuela le ayudan atender la tienda y después de hacer los deberes ellos se encargan hasta que termina de hacer la comida desde las 06h30 hasta las 21h00pm de lunes a viernes. 

Para poder incrementar su tienda quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, fideos y enlatados, en el futuro comprar un terreno para trasladar su tienda a un mejor sector.
texts.en:
Margot, 39, lives in Fortín de Guayaquil (a periurban area with unpaved streets and eroding hillsides). She has had a grocery store for over 15 years that provides support for her two children. She started out selling rice, sugar and canned goods to acquaintances and neighbors in order to make enough money. When her children return home from school they help her tend to the store and once they finish their homework they watch the store while she prepares the meal. She is open for business from 6:30am until 9pm, Monday through Friday. To increase her stock inventory, she wants to use the loan to buy rice, pasta and canned goods. In the future she’d like to buy a piece of property to move her store into a better neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For rice, pasta, beverages.

loans.name: Grisel

texts.es:
Grisel nació y vive en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo.  La mayoría de pobladores que viven en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo se dedican al turismo y otros pobladores que viven alrededor se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería. Grisel hace varios años atrás abrió un puesto de venta de artesanía, en la plaza de principal de Ollantaytambo, donde vende artesanía como por ejemplo chompas de lana, sombreros, bordarnos, ponchos, etc. Ella y su esposo Fredy tienen un hijo. Le pueden encontrar en su puesto de venta, que está equipado con regular mercadería, los 7 días de la semana, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta bastante tarde en la noche. Grisel desprende una imagen de amabilidad y alegría. Un flujo regular de turistas vistan su puesto de venta y el negocio se anima durante los meses de mayo, junio, julio y agosto. 

Con  su próximo préstamo, Grisel espera recibir $300 USD. Por el momento, su puesto esta modestamente equipado con las necesidades más básicas. Le gustaría emplear el dinero de este préstamo para en comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo sombreros, chompas, ponchos.
          
Grisel es una mujer emprendedora, responsable y puntual y por ese motivo sus amigas la invitaron a participar del banco comunal “La Amistad de Ollantaytambo” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Grisel was born and lives within the city of Ollantaytambo. Most of Ollantaytambo’s inhabitants work in the tourist industry and those living in the surrounding area work in agriculture; farming and raising livestock. Several years ago Grisel opened a store to sell arts and crafts in the city’s main plaza, where she sells things such as wool sweaters, hats, embroidery, ponchos, etc. She and her husband Fredy have one son. One can find her at her store, which is stocked with regular merchandise, seven days a week from 8:00 am until well into the night. Grisel presents an air of friendship and happiness. A regular flow of tourists visit her store and the store is lively during the months of May, June, July, and August. Grisel is hoping to receive a $300 loan. For the time being her store is modestly stocked with the basic necessities, but she would like to use the money from this loan to buy more merchandise, such as hats, sweaters, and ponchos. She is a very entrepreneurial, responsible, and punctual woman, so her friends invited her to participate in the “La Amistad de Ollantaytambo” (Friend of Ollantaytambo) communal bank of the “Asociación Arariwa.”

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise for resale

loans.name: Paula Benita

texts.es: Paula Benita tiene la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 15 años que tiene esta actividad, por lo que inicialmente  su Mama se hacía cargo del negocio, con el paso del tiempo es que ha ido incrementando su mercadería, por lo que sus vecinos, amigos y familiares son sus clientes, pero Paula se esfuerza cada día más por mejorar el número de clientes. Por lo que siempre sueña con poner una tienda en donde sus clientes puedan apreciar todo lo que ella ofrece. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo y comprar ropa interior, cosméticos, calzado entre otras.
texts.en:
Paula Benita sells general merchandise. She has been in this line of work for over 15 years. At the beginning her mother was in charge of the business but as time has passed her stock has grown. Her customers are her neighbors, acquaintances and family members. Paula strives to increase her customer base daily. This is why she dreams with having a store where her customers can examine everything she has on offer. The funding will be used to buy underwear, cosmetics and shoes, among other things.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy underwear, cosmetics and shoes, among others.

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
