El comité se Denomina “Mujeres Activas”  están  en el Cuarto Ciclo   con 24 integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas, solidarias  y responsables realizan labores para la comunidas y el comité,  ellas tienen actividades productivas  y otras que están emprendiendo una nueva labor.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Claudelina quien es la presidenta del grupo y se dedica al negocio de ventas de productos de uso domestico.
Ella es una señora muy activa y constantemente anima a sus compañeras   a realizar actividades para recaudar fondos y también para fortalecer el grupo.
Su negocio le genera un ingreso que comenta ella cubre todos los gasto de  alimentación de su familia y considera esto muy importante por lo que desea invertir en la compra de productos que ella vende en su negocio como son arroz, fideos, azúcar, panificados, y otros.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres Activas" committee has 24 members and is now on its fourth loan. It is a group well known in its neighborhood for being very close, united and responsible, and for working for the community. Some of the women are engaged in productive activities, and others are employed in new work. One member is Claudelina, who is the president of the group and who sells products for domestic consumption. She is a very active woman, and she is constantly encouraging her comrades to do things to raise money and strengthen the group. Her business generates an income which allows her to cover all the costs of feeding her family. This is very important to her. She wants to use the loan to buy the products she sells in her business, such as rice, noodles, sugar, pastries, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Ross Forman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy noodles, sugar, pastries, milk products, rice, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: La Central Group

texts.es:
La señora Sofía Velázquez Rodríguez, vive en Coapilla Estado de Chiapas México, tiene setenta años de edad. Es casada con el señor, Alberto Rodríguez Ramírez, en el cual tuvo cinco hijos quienes ya están casados y algunos viven fuera del pueblo.

   Ella se dedica a su hogar y a la venta de pollos desde hace trece años donde la va bien desde que inicio con esta actividad, en donde ha obtenido buenos ingresos para su hogar, a un así cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que trabaja en el campo sembrando maíz para venderlo en el mercado y también aportar con los gastos que se tiene del diario.

  Lo que la motivo a realizar este trabajo es obtener mejores ingresos en su hogar y solicitó el préstamo para trabajarlo criando pollos de rancho y venderlo aliñado (destazado) o en pie (vivos) y con eso tener de donde poder pagar el préstamo solicitado.

    Con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio, lo ahorra  para comprarles alimento a sus pollos y estén en buenas condiciones cuando lo compren y su clientela se sienta satisfecha con su compra realizada.

    Su sueño es que con su venta logre ahorrar para tener una vida mejor durante Dios le siga dando vida, como también construir un cuartito amplio donde pasar los días que le queda por vivir.

   Formo parte del grupo "La Central" por una invitación que le hizo la representante del grupo Doña  Lucita, para que trabajaran el préstamo y obtuvieran donde dedicar su tiempo. El grupo se llama la central la razón del nombre es por que donde se integra el grupo es en el centro.

   Las personas que integran el grupo son tres señoras cada una con diferente actividad:

   Sofía Velázquez Rodríguez: invierte el préstamo en la compra y venta de pollos para venderlo aliñados o en pie.
   María Lucita Rodríguez C.: invierte el préstamo en la compra y venta de pollos para venderlo aliñados.
    Teresita de Jesús E. García: invierte el préstamo en la compra y venta de catálogos como son: perfumes, cremas, desodorantes, entre otros.
texts.en:
Sra. Sofia Velázquez Rodríguez lives in Coapilla in the State of Chiapas, Mexico. She is 70 years old and married to Sr. Alberto Rodríguez Ramírez. They have five children who are already married and some of them live outside of town.

She has been working from home selling chickens for thirteen years and has done very well since starting this business. Sofia earns good income working from home and has the support of her husband, who works in the fields growing corn to sell at the market. He also helps with the daily expenses.

Sofia was motivated to work because she needed more income for her household. She is requesting a loan so that she can continue producing farm-raised chickens to sell either butchered or live. The earnings she generates will allow her to repay this requested loan. With her business income, Sofia is able to save so that she can buy feed for her chickens and provide them with good conditions so that her customers will be satisfied with their purchases.

Her dream is that her business will allow her to save enough money so that she can have a better life, God willing, and also build an expanded room where she can spend the rest of her days.

Sofia was invited to become a member of the group “La Central” by Doña Lucita, the group representative, so that they could work together and spend the time required to obtain the loan. The group is named “La Central” because everyone in the group gathers in the center. The group consists of three ladies, each of whom is involved in a different business activity:

• Sofía Velázquez Rodríguez will invest her loan in the purchase and sale of chickens, both butchered and live. • María Lucita Rodríguez C. will invest her loan in the purchase and sale of butchered chickens. • Teresita de Jesús E. García will invest her loan in the purchase of catalog products such as perfumes, crèmes, deodorants, and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase butchered & live chickens

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy different kinds of thread and cloth for her business

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria, de 41 años, vive en su casa propia a lado de su hijo Ehisnover de 12 años y de sus padres; juntos se esfuerzan cada día para salir adelante. Todos los días se despierta muy temprano para atender a su hijo y después se dirige al centro educativo donde se desempeña como profesora. Le gusta mucho enseñar y educar a sus alumnos y aunque a veces se siente cansada continua trabajando ya que tiene muchos planes futuros. Para esta trabajadora mujer nunca es tarde en la vida pues antes se dedicaba a la venta de comida en la puerta de su casa; luego estudio educación en un instituto y hace 1 año se convirtió en profesora. También realiza material educativo en material corospun (microporoso parecido al plástico) y es una experta preparando figuras de personajes animados que cobran vida con el trazo de la mano de victoria. Como es una mujer emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado instalar una librería en su casa, pues por la zona donde vive no hay una que abastezca a los niños de material educativo. Es el noveno crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete cancelar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar laborando en busca del progreso. Victoria tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de corospun, que es el material que necesita para continuar produciendo sus diseños educativos, también desea comprar algunos libros para actualizarse.
texts.en:
Victoria, 41, lives in her own house with her son, Ehisnover, 12, and her parents.  Together they struggle daily to get ahead in life.

Every day she rises very early in the morning to care for her son and then head for the school where she’s a teacher.  She enjoys teaching very much and, even though she often feels quite tiered, she continues working because she has many plans for the future.

For this very hard working woman it’s never too late in life.  She used to work selling food from her doorstep.  Later, she studied Education at an institute and a year ago became a teacher.  She also makes teaching aids from Corrospum (a micro porous material similar to plastic) and she’s expert in making figures of cartoon characters that come to life thanks to Victoria’s skills.

Because she’s an enterprising woman she plans to set up a bookstore in her home in the future because there is no place in her neighborhood supplying educational materials to the children.

This is her 9th loan with MFP and she pledges to repay on time because she does not want to disappoint the people who made the money that will allow her to continue working toward progress possible.

Victoria plans to use the money to buy Corrospum which is the material she needs to continue making her teaching aids.  She also wants to buy a few texts to upgrade her skills.

loans.use: To buy Corrospum (a micro porous material similar to plastic) to make educational items as well as to buy books to upgrade her skills.

loans.name: Rosa Carmen

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Las Orquídeas  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal los Ceibos, esta es una zona urbana marginal donde las personas se dedican a diversas actividades.

La señora Rosa tiene 48 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación a tenido 5 hijos ya todos sus hijos son mayores de edad aunque tres de ellos aun viven en su casan. Su esposo se dedica a la  albañilería.

Es un ama de casa que para ayudarse en sus gastos y a los de su familia decidió montar una mini papelería en su casa, además de productos de papelería también vende artículos de bazar ya que como nos dice hay que ayudarse con lo que se pueda vender. Trabaja todos los días desde las 7am hasta las 18h00 y a veces hasta más tarde ya que como su negocio está en su casa  esto no le incomoda, sus productos los compra en distribuidoras en el centro de la ciudad.

Este crédito es para comprar más productos tanto en papelería como artículos de bisutería y bazar. Esta en el Banco Comunal hace ya cinco ciclos y le gusta porque los créditos dan sin muchos requisitos.

Su sueño es terminar su casa ya que esta construyendo un segundo piso.
texts.en:
Every 15 days, the Los Ceibos Communal Bank meets in the Las Orquídeas neighborhood of the city of Portoviejo. This is an area on the edge of the city where people are engaged in a variety of businesses.

Señora Rosa, age 48, is married and has 5 children who are all adults, though three of them still live in her house. Her husband works as a bricklayer. She is a housewife who, in order to help with expenses, decided to open a small stationery shop in her house. In addition to paper products, she also sells miscellaneous items since, as she tells us, this helps her with her sales. She works every day from 7:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. and sometimes until later. Since her business is in her house this doesn’t inconvenience her. She buys her products from distributors in the center of the city.

This loan is for the purchase of more stationary, costume jewelry and miscellaneous items. She has been a member of the communal bank for five loan cycles and likes it because the loans are given without many conditions. Her dream is to finish her house since she is constructing a second floor.

loans.use: To purchase stationary, costume jewelry, and miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul K. is a 36 year-old horticultural farmer in Jomvu Mombasa. He is married to Ethel Mwaka, and they have  four children.

Paul has been in this business for the last twenty one years and has done well. With his first loan from KADET, he would like to purchase water pipes and seeds for his nursery and use the anticipated profit to boost his wife’s grocery business. 

He hopes to succeed through KADET loans.

loans.use: To purchase water pipes and seeds for his nursery.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal  “HUCHUY QOSQO ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Lamay perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Daniel; El socio tiene 29 años de edad, el socio es conviviente y tiene  3 hijos el socio trabaja en el ministerio de cultura, el socio también en sus ratos libres sse dedica a la compra y venta de ganados, el socio tiene pasión por los animales y cada cierto tiempo compra ganados vacunos y toros, estos son engordados e incluso participan en ferias locales y nacionales, el socio desea invertir en la compra de un par de ganados nuevos. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar ganados vacunos tiernos.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su cuota en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the community bank "Huchuy Qosqo", which is located in the district of Lamay, belonging to the province of Calca and department of Cusco. The member's name is Daniel, and he is 29 years old. He lives with his wife, has three children, and works in the ministry of culture. In his free time, he also buys and sells livestock. He has a passion for animals and from time to time he buys cattle and bulls, which he fattens up. He also participates in local and national markets. Daniel hopes to invest in the purchase of a pair of new cattle. He is requesting the loan to buy young cattle livestock.

Daniel is thankful for and values the loan granted to him through these means, and therefore he commits to complete the payments owed in the established time frame.

loans.use: The member is requesting the loan to buy new cattle livestock.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine R. is a married woman who lives in Hda. Vallesteros, Brgy. Caradio-an, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures: selling toddy and a general store. Her husband Elorde, 44 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have two children who are 18 and 21 years old. Josephine joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she hoped for something better for her family. With the help of her past 4 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon and her own efforts, Josephine has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty. Her previous loan of PHP 9,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 9,500, thus raising the family's standard of living. This time, for her 5th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000 which she intends to use as additional capital for her toddy and general store businesses so that she can continue to save up for her youngest son's future education and get a job. Josephine R. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team. "

loans.use: to fund the operations of her toddy and general store businesses

loans.name: Garegin

texts.en:
Garegin Z. is 56 years old. He lives in the Ddmashen Village, Sevan area with his wife and two school-aged children. His wife doesn't work, but cares for their children. 

Garegin has a higher education. He is a physicist and, for about 19 years, he worked in his specialty. But after 1996, because of changes in Armenia's economic situation, he lost his job. So he organized his own petrol and diesel oil business, which he runs from his garage. At the same time, Garegin is engaging in animal farming. Thanks to his two occupations, Garegin supports his family and saves money for his children's higher education.
    
Garegin is asking for a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams to buy petrol and diesel oil for his business.

loans.use: To buy petrol and diesel oil for his business

loans.name: Marleg España

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Av. Del Ejército.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Marleg, tiene 50 años de edad, está separada pero de esa relación tiene 4 hijos dos de los cuales ya son mayores de edad, tiene una hija de 17 años y el menor tiene 14 años que estudia en colegio los dos viven con ella.

Ella tiene una tienda de viveras de consumo,  como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, además también vende útiles escolares y productos Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días desde las 6 am hasta las 22h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, sus hijos le ayudan en su trabajo, los productos los compra en el centro de Portoviejo aunque la mayoría de sus productos los recibe en su local.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 7 años y le gusta porque ha hecho más amigas en el grupo. Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The “Avenida del Ejército” communal bank meets every two weeks in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the City of Royal Tamarinds.

This is where we met Marleg, 50.  She is separated but has four children.  Two of them are already adults.  She has a 17 year old daughter and her youngest is 14 and still in school; both live with her.  

She has a foodstuffs store.  She sells rice, sugar, oils, and detergents.  She also sells school supplies and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, women’s accessories).  She works every day from 6am until 10pm and sometimes even later.  Her children help her with her work.  She buys her products in downtown Portoviejo although most of them are delivered to her store.

She will use this loan to stock her store.  She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, cured meats and other basic need items.  She’s been in the communal bank for 7 years and she likes it because she has made friendships in the group.  Her goals are to continue forward in her business and that her store grows more every day.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, cured meats and other basic need items.

loans.name: Kamissa

texts.fr:
Madame Kamissa C. est une femme âgée de 32 ans qui vit avec ses 4 enfants et son époux dans une famille nucléaire à N’Tentou, un des quartiers de la ville de Ouelessebougou, préfecture de Kati,  Région de Koulikoro(deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Kamissa n’a pas eu la chance de fréquenter l’école  pour des raisons familiales,  alors très tôt elle s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente d’articles divers  tels les habits, les pochettes, les chaussures, les parures, les condiments alimentaires, etc. 
Après avoir correctement remboursé le  premier prêt, Kamissa est à son deuxième prêt individuel, qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter, quelques douzaines d’habits pour enfants et 50 paires de chaussures de différentes sortes, auprès des grossistes du marché de Ouelessebougou. Elle effectue sa vente à la maison, au  marché de Ouelesseboubou et en ambulant dans les différents quartiers de la ville, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Madame Kamissa C. espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 40.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt, aider le mari à subvenir aux dépenses de la famille et réinvestir le reste dans les activités. 
Kamissa ambitionne diversifier davantage ses activités et devenir grossiste en habillements et chaussures à Ouelessebougou
texts.en:
Mrs. Kamissa C. is a 32-year old woman who lives with her 4 children and her husband in a nuclear family in N'Tentou. It is a quarter in the city of Ouelessebougou, a prefecture of Kati in the region of Koulikoro (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). 

Kamissa did not have the chance to go to school for family circumstances. Therefore she became   interested in revenue generating activities since she was very young, especially the buying and   selling of various merchandise, such as clothing, purses, shoes, jewelry, condiments, etc.

After she successfully repaid her first loan, Kamissa is requesting a second individual loan.   She plans on using it to purchase a few dozen pieces of children's clothing and 50 pairs of various types of shoes from a wholesaler in the market in Ouelessebougou. She carries out her sales from her house, in the market in Ouelessebougou, an itinerantly to the various quarters of the city. Her business is a retail business and she completes her sales in cash and credit, to a clientele made up of women and men. 

Mrs. Kamissa C. expects to earn a monthly income of 40.000 FCFA which will be used to repay the loan, to help her husband meet the household expenses, and the remaining part will be reinvested into the business. 

Kamissa endeavors to further diversify her business and to become a clothing and shoe wholesaler in Ouelessebougou.

loans.use: To purchase clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Elsy Noemy

texts.es:
Elsy, reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, tiene 30 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de tortillas, vive con su esposo y su hija, tienen casa propia, el negocio de Elsy tiene 5 años de existir, y este es la fuente de ingreso con la que cuenta diariamente.
Ella necesita comprar materia prima para realizar la venta como maíz y leña, dichos materiales los necesita tener en abundancia para disponer de ellos todos los días, Elsy solicita un préstamo que le permita realizar la compra y fortalecer las ventas.
Su propósito es velar por el buen funcionamiento del negocio, ya que de él dependen los ingresos del hogar, así también desea en un futuro vender comida al mismo tiempo.
texts.en:
Elsy lives in Jiquilisco in the department of Usulután.  She is 30 years old and sells tortillas for a living.  She lives with her husband and daughter in their own home.  Elsy has been running this business for 5 years and counts on this daily source of income.  She needs to purchase raw materials such as corn and firewood to keep up with her S..  She needs these materials in abundance in order to prepare her tortillas daily.  

Elsy is requesting a loan to purchase these items to strengthen her S..  Her aim to is to ensure the operation of her business since her family depends on the income.  In the future, she would also like to sell food.

loans.use: To purchase corn and firewood

loans.name: Bo

texts.en:
Bo V. is a 49-year-old farmer who lives in Phnom Penh City. Bo V. is married to Mr. Seng Sorl, age 48, who is a motorcycle-taxi driver in the busy market. This family usually earns an income about $5 each day to use for the family expenses. 

The daily profit in Bo V.’s family comes from her husband's business. Unfortunately, an existing motorbike often has broken down while providing the motorcycle-taxi service. Because of that, Bo V. has decided to seek a loan of $1200 from Kiva, which she will use to change the broken motorcycle for her husband. With the loan, she will be able to mend her house. 

This couple is blessed with three children, two of whom work in a variety of jobs for a profit while the other one is still young.

 Note: Bo V. and her young kid are pictured in the photo.

loans.use: To change the broken motorcycle for her husband

loans.name: Consolee

texts.en: Consolee is 67 years old, married, and has four children between the ages of 18 and 24. Two of her children are in school, and the other two have already completed secondary school. Consolee’s husband is a farmer and she herself sells sorghum. She has run this business for eleven years, and with this loan she wants to buy more sorghum to sell.  With the profits, Consolee plans to save some, feed her family, and stock a few sacks of sorghum as well.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farming inputs and pay laborers on her potato farm.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 58 años. Vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Isaac de 59 años y con uno de sus hijos, de los 6 que tiene en total. Hace 4 años, María junto a su esposo fabrican adobe, debido a que posee tierra especial para la elaboración de adobe; desde entonces le esta yendo bien en este negocio. Una vez elaborado el adobe quemado, material que fabrica, lo hace por millares, cantidad que es vendida y le genera buenas ganancias. Ella se siente satisfecha con su trabajo, ahora para aumentar la producción ha contratado a 3 personas más, quienes son expertos en este trabajo, de esa manera fabrican más en menor tiempo. Ahora sólo se preocupa en colocar lo producido y de las ganancias pagar a sus trabajadores. Ante esto, María se intensificará en este negocio, con el tiempo espera cultivar sobre sus tierras productos y vivir de ello. Ingresa a su octavo crédito que tiene con MFP, y se compromete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente. Asimismo está feliz de trabajar con sus compañeras de su grupo, porque son personas muy responsables. Con el crédito que solicita, pagará a sus trabajadores, para que puedan trabajar más horas y lograr cumplir con el pedido de sus clientes.
texts.en:
María, 58, lives in her own house with her husband, Isaac, 59, and one of her six children.  She and her husband have been manufacturing adobe for the last four years because they own special soil that is appropriate for adobe making; she has been doing well in this business since then.

Once the baked adobes are made, a production that numbers in the thousands, it is sold for good profits.  She feels satisfied with her work and in order to increase production now she’s hired three more people who are experts in the field in order to manufacture more in less time.  Her only concern now is to sell what’s been produced and to use the profits to pay her workers. In face of this, María will become stronger in the business and in time she hopes to plant crops in her fields to support herself with.

This is her 8th loan with MFP and she commits to repay on time.  She is also happy to work with her fellow group members because they are very responsible people.  She will use the requested loan to pay her workers so that they can work more hours and be able to fill customer orders.

loans.use: to pay her workmen.

loans.name: Santos Alexander

texts.es: Santos Alexander M. A., de 30 años de edad, habita en casa alquilada con su compañera de vida y su pequeña hijastra que por el momento  se encuentra estudiando. Posee un negocio en el que vende diversidad de productos como: cinchos, accesorios para celulares, brazaletes, relojes, corbos, cumas,  etc.  Ubicado en la calle principal del mercado Municipal de San Vicente del Departamento del mismo nombre.  Durante mucho tiempo ha trabajado para sacar adelante a su familia y sueña con ver a su hijastra convertida en una gran profesional. Este negocio es la única fuente de ingresos de Santos,  es por ello que lucha para mantenerlo activo y seguir recibiendo los ingresos que hasta el momento le ha brindado. Esto lo ha impulsado a solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL con el objetivo de invertir en su negocio y poder surtirlo con diversidad de artículos como: variedad de accesorios para celulares, cinchos, brazaletes, corbos, cumas,  etc.  Con la fe puesta en Dios que de esta manera lograra su sueño y podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Santos Alexander M. A., who is 30 years old, lives in a rented house with his life partner and their little girl who, for the moment, is studying. He owns a business in which he sells a variety of products such as belts, cell phone accessories, bracelets, watches, knives, etc. His business is located in the main street of the market Municipal de San Vicente in the department of the same name. For a long time he has worked to move forward for his family and he dreams of seeing his daughter become a great professional. This business is the only source of income for Santos, and because of that he is fighting to keep it active and continue receiving income, which up to this point he has been given. This has driven him to ask for this loan with INTEGRAL with the objective of investing in his business and to being able to supply it with a variety of products such as: a variety of cell phone accessories, belts, bracelets, knives, etc. He puts faith in God that in this way he will be able to accomplish his dream and improve the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of accessories for cell phones, belts, bracelets, knives, etc.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda C. is from the village of Lintugop, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 38 years old, married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Rosalinda owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising fish for sale. Rosalinda has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2011, Rosalinda joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalinda is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase nursing fry/fingerling to raise and sell in the future. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase nursing fry/fingerling to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les sept membres du groupe BENKADI sont toutes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, et ont en moyenne  4 enfants. Elles vivent dans des  familles polygames à BOUGOULA HAMEAU un des villages de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur Huitième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, les prêts passés ont été remboursés dans de bonne condition. Ce groupe de femmes fait de la restauration  à travers de LALA, la présidente.
LALA compte acheter avec son  prêt, 550 Kg  de de riz et quatre cartons de cube maggi. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Sikasso.  Elle fait sa restauration sur place à BOUGOULA HAMEAU  et vend ses plats alimentaires, famille et au marché, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 100.000 FCFA, qui sera utilisé  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille 
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The seven members of the Benkadi group, all married women, average 40 years of age, with at least four children each. They live in polygamous families in Bougoula Hameau, a village in Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. They are on their eighth collaboration with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, with the goal of meeting customer demand. The prior loans have been properly reimbursed. The group members cook food for sale, as Lala (the group’s leader) does, for example.

Lala plans to use her loan to buy 550 kg [1210 lbs] of rice and four boxes of Maggi bouillon cubes. She stocks up at the big market of Sikasso. She prepares food locally in her village, selling her dishes out of her home and at the market, to a customer bas composed of men and women, for cash. She plans to achieve an average monthly income of 100,000 West African Francs, which will be used for everyday family expenses.

Her goal is to increase her sales volume and better meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for food preparation

loans.name: Aileen Mae

texts.en:
Aileen Mae is from the town of Palayan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 29 years old. Aileen Mae is married and has one school-aged child. Aileen Mae has a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling food & daily use products in the local community. Aileen Mae has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 6000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2011, Aileen Mae joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business.  Aileen Mae is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, and beverages for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Aileen Mae from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About GDMPC: 

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, and beverages for sale

loans.name: Robiya

texts.ru: Робия жительница района Дангары. Ей 31 год. Она замужем, имеет 7 детей. Ее муж водитель. Он предоставляет услугу, такси. Сама Робия занимается торговлей на рынке. У нее имеется магазин, где она продает продукты питания. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 6 лет. Кредит берет для покупки муки, макаронов, конфет, колбасных изделий, сахара и молочных продуктов.
texts.en: Robiya lives in Dangara. She is 31 years old.  She is married and has seven children. Her husband is a driver. He has a taxi service.  Robiya trades in the market.  She has a shop where she sells groceries. She has been doing this for more than six years.  She is taking out a loan to buy flour, pasta, sweets, sausages, sugar, and dairy products.

loans.use: to buy flour, pasta, sweets, sausages, sugar, and dairy products.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 59 years old and married with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Violeta has a business in which she buys and sells soft drinks in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years. 

Violeta has requested a loan amount of PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of soft drink to sell. Violeta would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of soft drink to sell

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet lives in Uganda. She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school. She lives in a home that she rents. She has no access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.
Harriet has a food stall business. She has been in this business for four years, and she works one day a week. Harriet sells her products at the market by means of wholesale/retail. Harriet has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of beans, bunches of bananas and Irish potatoes. Her business challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start growing beans herself and also to sell on a wholesale basis only.

loans.use: to buy more bags of beans, bunches of bananas and Irish potatoes.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca tiene  38 años D. edad, vive con su conviviente y  tiene 02 hijos  menores D. edad, el vive en el distrito Pomahuaca, en el departamento D. Cajamarca 

Francisca cuenta con un restaurante, el cual a instalado en su domicilio a 30 minutos del distrito D. Pucará.  Francisca ofrece diversas comidas y bebidas heladas   ElL. cuenta con varios años D. experiencia en el rubro y con clienteL. fija y fidelizada a su negocio  

Francisca esta solicitando un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa D. 1500 nuevos soles para comprar insumos como arroz, azúcar, menestras o carnes, etc.para L. preparación D. su platos y así pueda ofrecer una variedad D. comidas y no unas cuantas, también para L. compra D. bebidas  para que las personas que lleguen a comer allí se sientan satisfechos con L. atención y el servicio. 

Francisca tiene muchas ganas D. salir adelante se ha ganado L. confianza y el respeto D. las personas que laconocen, demostrando empeño y esfuerzo.
texts.en:
Francisca, age 38, lives with her life partner and her two children.  She lives in the Pomahuaca district, Cajamarca department.

Francisca has a restaurant set up in her home, which is 30 minutes from the Pucará district.  Francisca sells a variety of food and cold drinks.  She has several years of experience in this field, and she has fixed and loyal customers in her business.

Francisca is requesting a loan for 1,500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  The loan is to buy ingredients like rice, sugar, mixed vegetables, and meat, etc. to prepare her dishes.  This way she will be able to sell a variety of food and not just a few dishes.  She will also buy drinks so that the people who come to eat at her restaurant fell satisfied with the care and service they receive.

Francisca has a great desire to get ahead.  She has won the trust and respect of the people that know her by demonstrating determination and effort.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like rice, sugar, mixed vegetables, and meat, etc. in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Carmelina

texts.en: Carmelina lives with her husband in a village in Choluteca, Honduras near the Salvadoran border.  For the last twenty years, Carmelina has made a living by renting out rooms in her home to guests. She is requesting a loan of HNL 10,000 to purchase new beds for a number of the rooms. In her free time Carmelina raises chickens and pigs at home.

loans.use: to purchase beds for rooms in her home that she rents out.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan soltero, trabajador, sus hijos ya mayores, sus planes mejora su nivel de vida, artesano desde hace un tiempo elabora vitrina. Se ha presentado dificultades con la salud, sus proyecto es establecer un modulo en el mercado. Inicio  con fondos propios y para con el objetivo  de salir  adelante.  El  Préstamo será invertido en la comprara materia prima como: laminas de vidrio, silicón, entre otros productos. Generándole mayores utilidades para invertir en las mejoras de la infraestructura del negocio. Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo al desarrollo socio económico de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is a hardworking gentleman. He is single and his children are grown. His plans include improving his standard of living.

Juan is a craftsman who spends his time making display cabinets. He has experienced health problems, but he still has plans to establish a vending post at the market. Juan started his business with his own funds and has plans to move forward. This loan will be invested in raw materials such as sheets of glass, silicon, and other supplies. He hopes to generate better profits so that he can invest in improvements to the infrastructure of his business.

Juan is grateful for the financial support that has aided in the socio-economic development of his family.

loans.use: to buy glass, silicon, and other materials for making display cabinets.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
Ana, se dedica a la venta D. tortillas, vive con su familia y es madre D. un niño D. 10 años D. edad, ella trabaja D. lunes a sábado D. 7:00am a 3:00pm en la elaboración D. tortillas, tiene 10 años D. estar en el negocio, cuneta con experiencia y con muchos clientes.
Ella necesita un préstamo para invertirlo en maíz y gas propano, esto para incrementar la producción y abastecer el negocio D. gas que por el momento ha subido D. precio, esta inversión será una gran ayuda para mejorara el negocio.
El objetivo D. Ana es que su clientela este satisfecha y reciba un buen trato, ya que depenD. D. las ventas para alimentar a su familia.
texts.en:
Ana sells tortillas. She lives with her family, and is the mother of a 10 year old son.  She works Monday to Saturday from 7:00am to 3:00pm, making tortillas. 

She has worked in her business for 10 years, so she has experience and many customers.  She needs a loan to buy corn and propane gas, in order to increase her production and stock her business with gas, which for the time being has risen in price. 

This investment will be a great help in improving the business.  Ana's goal is to satisfy her clientele, and give them good service, since she depends on her sales to feed her family.

loans.use: To buy corn and propane gas, in order to make tortillas.

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es: Zoila tiene 57 años, es una mujer alegre, amable y muy entusiasta, es madre pero separada de su pareja. Tiene cinco hijos, y solo uno vive con ella, por tanto se encarga de su educación y alimentación. Juntos habitan en su casa que es propia. El trabajo al que se dedica es la agrícultura, que desde muy temprano se dirige a su chacra para cultivar, regar y arar la tierra y cuidar de sus plantas. Tiene 30 años ejerciendo esta actividad y con ello educo a sus hijos. Ahora ella se encarga de enseñar estos conocimientos agrarios a su menor hijo, quien después de volver del colegio se va a ayudarla y así aprenden del negocio familiar. Ella espera poder mantenerse así y mas adelante empezar con otra siembra. Este será el crédito número 16 con MFP, por lo que espera la ayuda de todos ustedes para segui creciendo y fortaleciendo su negocio. Con el monto solicitado, comprará semillas, y contratará jornaleros para arar la tierra para la siguiente siembra.
texts.en:
Zoila, 57 years old, is a happy, friendly, and very enthusiastic woman. She is a mother, but is separated from her husband. She has five children, and only one still lives with her, so she is responsible for his care and education. Zoila owns the house they live in. 

She does agricultural work; since she was very young she worked her farm to cultivate, water and plow the land and care for her plants. For 30 years she has done this, and through this work she educated her children. Now she is passing on all this agrarian knowledge by teaching her youngest son. After he comes back from school he is going to help her and learn the family business. She hopes to be able to get by this way and later begin with another planting season. 

This will be loan number 16 for her with MFP, and she awaits the help of all of you so she can keep on growing and strengthening her business. With the requested amount, she will buy seeds and hire farm workers to plow the land for the next planting.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and hire farm workers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a large variety of cosmetics as well as women's clothes and underwear

loans.name: Wilfredo Antonio

texts.es: El señor Wilfredo se dedica a brindar el servicio de enderezado y pintado de vehículos. Hace más de 8 que se dedica a este negocio, el tiene a personas que le ayudan a realizar este trabajo a pesar de que últimamente no ha sido fácil, pues las constantes lluvias ocasionan que Wilfredo no pueda trabajar porque con este clima la pintura no se seca bien. El motivo de su crédito es para la compra aerosoles, pinturas, herramientas entre otros productos. Vive en casa propia desea realizarle modificaciones para dejársela a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sr. Wilfredo provides auto body repair and paint services. He has been in this business for more than eight years. Wilfredo has employees who help with the work. However, things have not been easy lately because of the constant rains. On occasion, Wilfredo is not able to work because the paint does not dry well in this type of weather.

This loan will be used to buy sprayers, paints, tools, and other supplies. Wilfredo lives in his own home, but he wants to make modifications so that he can leave it to his children.

loans.use: to buy sprayers, paints, tools, and other supplies.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is 28 years old and married, and his children are ages three and seven years old. His wife Susan is a house wife. Nicholas buys and sells tea leaves from the local farmers, which he then sells to the Chebut tea factory for processing. He has been in operation for a period of two years, earning a monthly income of  25,000 Kenya shillings (KES).

He requests a loan of 76,000 KES as his second term loan and wishes to use this money to purchase more bags of tea leaves from the local farmers.

The profits will be used to plough back into the business, and to extend his buying centers and explore new ones. His dream is to prosper in business and educate his children to higher levels.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of tea leaves from the farmers for resale.

loans.name: Lona

texts.en:
Lona is a 30-year-old married woman who has five children. Four of them are in school. She has a business selling clothes in Yei, South Sudan.
Lona requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase clothes for sale. In the future, she hopes to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Seoun

texts.en:
Seoun, 39, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean sites. 

Seoun sells rice and vegetables, and her husband is a teacher at a public school. This couple works so hard every day for incomes to help cover the family expenses. 

Seoun is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase more rice to resell. By doing so, she is able to generate more income. 

In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to purchase more rice to resell.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
This is Eric, 40, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Medeline, a housewife and mother to their three children. Eric, together with his wife, manages their household while operating the business. He works hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Eric maintains a tricycle business. He owns and drives one tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar) that carries up to four passengers. He starts working as early as 5 in the morning and goes until 11 in the evening. There are times when he drives into the wee hours to increase profit. His regular customers are neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of Php300 every day.

To help him continue business operations he is requesting a loan of Php10,000. He will use the loan to buy motorcycle parts for the maintenance of his tricycle. He has to maintain it in good condition to have a regular income for the daily needs of his family. 

Eric hopes to buy another tricycle and to support his children's schooling up to college level. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of his tricycle

loans.name: Kibeu B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Kibeu B Group in Western Kenya! Yunia is the facilitator of the Kibeu B group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Yunia takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Yunia had an excellent maize yield harvesting 36 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Yunia was only able to harvest five bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Yunia and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Yunia will educate her children.

In 2012, the members of Kibeu B group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Saray Y Responsabilidad Group

texts.en:
Teresa is a 47-year-old borrower who lives in San Pedro de Macorís, Dominican Republic. Teresa is the coordinator for her group, Saray y Responsabilidad 1 and 4 (Saray is a biblical name and Responsabilidad means responsibility). Her story is representative of the other borrowers in the group.

Teresa lives in a neighborhood in the city of San Pedro. She lives in a simple home structure with her long term partner and their two children. She is running a small clothing and shoe sales business from her home. She also sells her merchandise on foot looking for new clients and visiting her old customers to show them new products. 

Teresa is happy that she has had access to loans for seven years. This is her 14th one. All the years and loans have brought positive changes in her life. Her family has been blessed like other members of the group. One of Teresa's dreams is to have her own very comfortable and safe house.

loans.use: To buy clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua is married to a farmer, has six children and earns a living by selling peppers in a local market. She has been in this line of work for 10 years and uses her income to help support her family. She is applying for this loan to buy vegetables and more peppers to sell to her customers. She hopes to earn enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy peppers and vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Carmen Maribel

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita en Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

La señora Carmen es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por los beneficios adicionales que les brinda la institución. Tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tuvo 4 hijos pero dos de ellos fallecieron, los que viven con ella tienen 18 y 13 años de edad  y estudian en  colegio. Su esposo es artesano.

Ella realiza el crédito para el esposo el cual es artesano y tiene un taller en su casa en el cual realiza una gran variedad de figuras hechas en resina y cerámica, él elabora llaveros, escapularios, pendientes, entre otras muchas figuras,  realiza estos trabajos a base de pedidos que le realizan comerciantes que luego los llevan  a otras ciudades donde son muy apreciados. Su esposo lleva más de 17 años con este negocio y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar resina colombiana y estuches para sus obras.
  
Su sueño es terminar su casa.
texts.en:
The communal bank María Auxiliadora meets in the Sequita parish in Montecristi, a prosperous canton in the Manabí province full of hardworking, dedicated people who are proud of their roots. Sequita is a parish where the inhabitants are honest people who only know how to work and take care of their families. 

Carmen is a founding member of the communal bank and likes it because of the benefits that the institution gives them. She is 43 years old, married, and from this relationship had 4 children, although two of them have passed away. The ones living with her are 13 and 18 years old and studying in school. Her husband is an artisan. 

She is getting this loan for her husband, who is an artisan and has a workshop in the house where he makes a wide variety of figures made of resin and ceramics. He makes keychains, scapulars, earrings, and many other figures. He makes these on an order basis for vendors who then take them to other cities, where they are highly appreciated. Her husband has been doing this for more than 17 years and it is going very well. 

This loan is for the purchase of Colombian resin and cases for his work. 

Her dream is to finish their house.

loans.use: to buy Colombian resin and cases.

loans.name: Zam

texts.en:
Zam lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children, and all of her children go to school. Her house has no electricity nor piped water. School fees and feeding the family comprise her major monthly expenses.

For the past year Zam has sold charcoal at the market, working seven days a week. She also has a hardware shop there. Transportation and the increasing price of charcoal are her major challenges.

Zam has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal to sell. Her aspiration is to educate her children up to university level and own a delivery van to ease her transportation problems.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Sop Sa Dieukeur 2 Group

texts.fr: Les femmes membres du groupe "SOPE SA DIEUKEUR 2" sont des commerçantes qui vendent des produits alimentaires.Elles s'approvisionnent tôt le matin au grand marché de la ville en légumes frais, en poisson et en divers condiments.Ces produits sont revendus aux femmes de leur quartiers sur des tables  installées devant leurs domiciles respectives.Ce commerce leur rapporte des revenus assez consistants qui leur permettent de s'occuper de leurs enfants et de prendre en charge leurs propres besoins.Afin de renforcer leurs fonds de commerce, elles sollicitent un pret de 450 000f pour acheter des produits alimentaires.
texts.en: The [female] members of the "SOPE SA DIEUKEUR 2" group are vendors who sell food products.  They stock up early in the morning in the town's main market, buying fresh vegetables, fish and a range of seasonings.  The women then sell these products in their neighborhoods on tables that they set up in front of their own homes.  This work makes them a fairly solid income and it allows them to take care of their children and cover their own needs.  In order to strengthen their working capital, they are requesting a loan for 450,000 francs to buy food products.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Beatriz Elizabeth

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Juventud y  Progreso se reúnen cada 15 días en Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su riqueza cultural y por su gran artesanía como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país.
En este lugar vive la señora Beatriz,  tiene 20 años de edad, está casada y de esta  relación tienen un hijo de  1 año y tres meses  de edad. Su esposo es artesano.
Doña Beatriz es una muy buena esposa que para ayudarle a su marido realiza el crédito para que él lo utilice en su trabajo, él se dedica a la fabricación de ladrillos (material utilizado en la construcción de viviendas), trabaja de lunes a sábado en la fabricación y venta de sus productos los mismos que entrega en el sitio a comerciantes que llegan hasta el lugar para trasladarlos hasta las ciudades cercanas donde son utilizados.
Este crédito es para comprar  madera,  tierra y varios materiales más que utiliza el esposo para elaborar los ladrillos. Lleva dos años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos salen adelante. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su familia.

loans.use: comprar  madera,  tierra y otros materiales para fabricar ladrillos.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es: Jose de 43 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus cinco hijos, el se dedica a realizar viajes en su pick up desde hace mas de un año, tiene muchos clientes que lo prefieren por la responsabilidad que tiene a la hora de manejar, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de llantas y darle mantenimiento a su vehículo ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y poder tener mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: para la compra de llantas y darle mantenimiento a su vehículo

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is married with 6 children. Three of them are in school; one is in Nairobi University while the last-born is in standard six. Margaret is the vice secretary in her group and an active member of Catholic Women Association, Nairobi Archdiocese.

Back home, she is both the secretary in her local church and at Saint Samuel Small Christian Community. (Jumuiya)

Margaret has dairy cows and grows kales, spinach and carrots in her plot near Kanunga shopping centre. Currently, she has 3 dairy cows, which produce more than 30 litres of milk daily. She sells her milk to Kiamba Dairy Cooperative Society. Residents around the area buy her vegetables. Her business can’t raise $ 300 at once and thus the need for a loan.

loans.use: Margaret would like to pay her daughter’s tuition; she is in second year at Nairobi University.

loans.name: Shovle

texts.en: Shovle K. has a computer salon in the town of Khachmaz located in the North Eastern part of Azerbaijan. Shovle is one of Azerbaijan’s increasing number of women entrepreneurs. Shovle is looking for funding so that she can purchase more computers which will allow her to increase her client base.

loans.use: Purchase of new computers

loans.name: Tua

texts.en: Tua is the mother of four school-age children. She operates a food stall and sells to the general public at the local market. She sells cakes and drinks. Her stall is open six days a week, and she realizes an average profit of 250 tala per week.

loans.use: Purchase of flour and flavoring for cakes and drinks

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en: A university graduate, Vladimir K. has operated a taxi service from Ivano-Frankovsk, Ukraine for the past six years. He and his wife, Oksana, have three children together. Vladimir’s taxi service business provides the main source of income for his family. Vladimir is hard working and reliable – he utilizes radio communication in his taxi to ensure high quality, efficient transportation services for his clients. His dedication and responsible work ethic have helped him to obtain a good reputation among his co-workers. Previously, Vladimir has received two loans from Nadiya Ukraine to develop and operate his business. Vladimir repaid both loans in full and on schedule. He has requested a new loan for $600 to complete repairs on his taxi. With the loan, he will be able to continue offering quality services to his clients. In the future, Vladimir plans to purchase a newer car to improve his taxi services and expand his business.

loans.use: Taxi repairs

loans.name: Anibal

texts.en:
Anibal is 37 years old and has lived with his 48 year old common-law wife, Nelly, for about 20 years. Nelly is a seamstress who makes clothing to order. The couple have an 11 year old daughter who attends the 5th grade.

Anibal makes slingshots from a workshop in his home and he sells them wholesale to retail shop owners. He has been in the business for 12 years, having learned this trade after losing his job in a horse tack shop. Since he didn't attend school, he needed a trade that would allow him to support his wife and daughter, and he thanks God that he's done well.

He gets up at 4 AM every day and works well into the evening to fill the orders he receives each week. When the work proves to be more than he can handle, his wife and daughter help him out.

He is requesting this loan to buy hides, which are the main raw material he uses to make the slingshots, as well as rubber bands, which he would get a lower prices if he had enough capital to buy them wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Anibal tiene 37 años. Vive en pareja con Nelly de 48 años desde aproximadamente 20 años. Su pareja es modista y confecciona ropas sobre pedido. La pareja tiene 1 hija de 11 años de edad que está estudiando el 5to. Grado de la escuela primaria. Anibal se dedica a la fabricación de resorteras que luego vende a los comerciantes que retiran la mercadería de su propia casa. Hace 12 años que se dedica a la misma actividad, aprendió el oficio luego de quedarse sin trabajo ya que anteriormente trabajaba en una talabartería. Debido a que no cuenta con estudios tuvo que buscar una profesión con la cual poder salir adelante y lograr mantener a su esposa e hija y gracias a Dios le va bien en su trabajo actual. Todos los días se levanta a las 4 a.m. y trabaja hasta muy entrada la noche para poder cumplir con la demanda que tiene todas las semanas, cuando ya no puede sólo con el trabajo, le ayudan su esposa e hija en la tarea de fabricar las resorteras. Solicita un préstamo para comprar de las curtiembres los restos de cuero que utiliza como materia prima para la fabricación de sus productos, además de adquirir también las gomas que comprando en cantidad le ofertan a un mejor precio.

loans.use: To purchase hides and rubber bands

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred K. is 50 years old and owns the guest house, Mambo Kwisha. The day I visited, Fred was ill but his daughter Ruth and her baby greeted me. There are 6 rooms at the guest house and there is a covered area for guests to visit. Mr. K. also offers the use of his grounds to the lending group for their weekly meetings. He has 10 children and has taken care of as many as 6 dependents. He has been in business for three years and has been receiving loans for one and a half years. He has had no problem in making his payments.
He would like to offer soft drinks and some snack foods for his guests with his loan and he intends on doing some remodeling of his meeting area.

loans.use: Fred plans to use his loan to add beverages and snacks and to improve his meeting areas

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Blanca is a woman determined to search for the best things in life, and offer them to her dearly loved children. This eagerness means that she is always on the lookout for profitable new activities. Driven by the love of her family, she works hard traveling round to different town markets and selling clothes. She is accompanied and helped by her sister, who encouraged her to do this two years ago, when she moved to settle in her home town. She devoted herself to selling clothes, and now she is satisfied as her business selling girls’ clothes provides her with sufficient income to cover the cost of primary and secondary education for her four young children. And now Blanca has a new reason to be happy: twenty days ago she gave birth to her latest child, and is currently at home recovering her strength before returning to her work, accompanied by her new bundle of joy. Now she has even greater desires and intends to work even harder for her little ones.

Blanca is requesting your help in getting a loan to set up a small shop in her home, so that she can keep an eye on her baby and also look after the rest of her family. Your support means a great deal to Blanca; please offer her your help.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer.

Blanca es una mujer decidida a buscar lo mejor para ofrecérselos a sus queridos hijos y por este afán siempre está en búsqueda de nuevas y ventajosas ocupaciones, impulsada por el amor de su familia se esfuerza trabajando en la venta de prendas de vestir de manera ambulante en las ferias de cada centro poblado que encuentre y lo hace con la compañía y ayuda de su hermana; quien la animó hace dos años a que lo hiciera cuando se mudo para establecerse en su tierra natal. Se dedicaba a la venta de vestidos y hoy se siente satisfecha porque su negocio de venta de vestidos para niñas le otorga las ganancias suficientes para cubrir los gastos primarios y secundarios de sus cuatro pequeños hijos y ahora tiene una nueva alegría más debido a que hace veinte días alumbró al íltimo de sus retoños y se está en casa hasta que se reponga completamente para continuar con su labor en compañía de su nueva alegría. Ahora tiene muchos más deseos y espera trabajar aún más por sus pequeños.

Recurre en tu ayuda con el objetivo de obtener un préstamo a fin de establecerse en una pequeña tienda que habilitará en las inmediaciones de su casa para estar al pendiente de su bebé y también al cuidado del resto de su familia.Recuerda tu apoyo será muy significativo e importante para Blanca, decídete a brindarle tu ayuda.

loans.use: To set up an area in her home as a shop, so that she can sell clothes while taking care of her baby.

loans.name: Chheng

texts.en: Mrs. Chheng L., 37, is a mother of five children and lives in Bathambong province, Cambodia. She runs a stand at a busy market selling desserts and makes about $5/day. Her husband works at a hospital making about $3 each day and four of her children are enrolled in school. Mrs. Chheng L. would like to expand her business by buying one of her children another stand at the market to sell desserts like her.

loans.use: To open a new stand for one of her children to sell desserts.

loans.name: Nasuti C(I) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for one year and a half. Maria is 38 years old and married with seven children. Her current business is brick laying. With the extra business profits, Maria intends to buy a plot of land and pay school fees for her children.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand the current business

loans.name: Mach

texts.en:
Mrs. Mach P. and her husband, Kheav Boran, have been married since 1983. They have four children; two sons and two daughters. Her eldest son is married and lives outside the family home. One of her daughters has full time employment and the other stays at home. The youngest son is in school. Her family lives in a Phnom Penh suburb.

Mrs. P. has been in the business of renting houses to local workers and selling jackfruit since 1999. She purchases the fruit from the Neak Meas Market (fruit market) to sell at her shop in Phnom Penh. Her husband is a motor taxi driver. She is requesting her first loan in the amount of $500. She will use this money to purchase a motorbike for her sons to become motor taxi drivers.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Yessy Lidia

texts.es:
Yessy Lidia Rodríguez Ángeles is 27 years old, single and does not have children. She studied to be a primary school teacher and she works at a private school. She also owns her own business. She lives in the district of Florencia de Mora, in the province of Trujillo and in the department of La libertad, Perú.

She has a small store where she sells items that everyone needs and wants, like soft drinks, beer and school supplies. In addition, she prepares and sells treats. Since she finished her education at the university, she began to save the salary that she made as a teacher and invest the money in starting her store. By doing this she has been able to help her mother and brothers.

She belongs to the communal bank “Dios Guía Nuestros Pasos” (God Guide Our Steps). She obtained her first loan for 300 Soles through this bank and she was able to purchase five boxes of beer and soft drinks.

With a loan of 700 Soles, which she will pay back in four months, she will buy school supplies to resell, since the school year in just beginning Perú. She will also buy four boxes of soft drinks and various food items, like milk, oils, sugar, rice, noodles, etc.

Her dream is to be the principal of the school where she is presently a teacher.

Translated from Spanish by Kendra of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

La señora Yessy Lidia Rodríguez Ángeles tiene 27 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene ningún hijo; estudio superior completa la carrera de educación primaria, actualmente se encuentra laborando en un colegio particular, además de tener su propio negocio. Vive en el distrito de Florencia de Mora en la provincia de Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad - Perú.

Tiene una bodega en la que ofrece productos de primera necesidad, gaseosas, cerveza y un poco de útiles escolares. Además prepara marcianos y raspadillas. Desde que termino su carrera universitaria se dedico a ejercerla con el sueldo que ganaba fue ahorrando para implementar una bodega, de esa manera ayuda económicamente a su madre y hermanos.

Ella pertenece al Banco Comunal “Dios Guía Nuestros Pasos” lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero compró cinco cajas de cerveza y gaseosas.

Con el préstamo de S/. 700.00 que los cancelara en cuatro meses comprara útiles escolares ya que aprovechara la campaña escolar además comprará cuatro cajas de gaseosas y una variedad de abarrotes: leche, aceite, azúcar, arroz, fideos, etc.

Su mayor sueño es ser directora del colegio en el que actualmente trabaja.

loans.use: With this loan she will buy more merchandise for her business

loans.name: Casitas 2 Group

texts.es: MARIA MARGARITA DE 33 AÑOS DE EDAD ES MADRE SOLTERA DE 2 NIÑOS Y DECEA INICIAR UN NEGOCIO DE VENTA DE FRUTAS EN UN LOCAL QUE DECEA RENTAR FRENTE AL PARQUE CENTRAL DEL ALTAMIRANO, CON  EL CREDITO  DECEA INVERTIR EN LA RENTA DEL LOCAL Y EN LA COMPRA DE UNA BASCULA ASI COMO DE LA FRUTA QUE DECEA VENDER, CON LAS GANACIAS QUE ADQUIERA PAGARA EL CREDITO, COMPRARA FRUTA Y MANTENDRA A SUS HIJOS, LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON ANITA PÉREZ PÉREZ VENDE ABARROTES, MARIA VIRGINIA R. J. VENDE FRUTAS Y VERDURAS, DOMINGA L. PÉREZ Y YSODORA LUZ G. Y.,  VENTA DE ROPA Y LETICIA DEL CARMEN H. VENDE ANTOJITOS TRADICIONALES.

loans.use: RENTAR UN LOCAL , COMPRAR UNA VASCULA Y VERDURAS PARA VENDER.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: urchase of clothing in bulk for her business.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok S., 33, is a mother of two children who are students. She lives in Kampong Cham province in Cambodia and she works in a vegetable store in a busy market, typically earning around $5 each day. Her husband, Ben Saroeun, makes approximately $10 every day from his taxi business. To help her and her husband's businesses, Mrs. Sok would like to apply for a loan of $1,000. She would like to purchase more vegetables for her store as well as provide her husband with the funds necessary to repair his car. She sees this loan as a way to increase their cumulative income and is confident that their business ventures can be successful with this help. The couple is pictured above.

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services throughout both rural and urban communities in Cambodia.

loans.use: To repair the taxi and invest in the vegetable store business.

loans.name: Koman

texts.fr:
Mr. Koman Konaté is 52 years old and lives with his wife and six children in Bougouni in the district of Torakabougou in the prefecture Bougouni within the region of Sikasso in the Republic of Mali. Having received a diploma from the higher education institution of Bamako (where he received a Masters in Education Psychology), Mr. Konaté managed several business of an intellectual nature within many fields such as community health, formal and informal education, governance and decentralization, and natural resource management without success.

He decided to devote himself to agriculture, which he learned from his parents at the young age of three.

In order to access the capital for the equipment, he will join the Soro Yiriwaso credit program. It will be his first loan with this institution. With this loan, he will buy two loads of organic fertilizer, four drums of insecticide, four drums of herbicide, and five hoes. This is sold at Bougouni, nearby the blacksmiths and the phytosanitary stores.

He sells his production in Bougouni and a large part in Bamako, where the products sell for a higher value. His clients are, for the most part, sellers of condiments and vegetables and also some housewives.

Koman hopes to have a monthly profit of 10,000 FCFA, which will serve to pay interest on the loan, provide for the expenses of his family and prepare for the next season.

Translated from French by Lucia Franzese, Kiva volunteer.

Monsieur Koman Konaté a 52 ans et vit avec sa femme et ses 6 enfants à Bougouni dans le quartier Torakabougou Préfecture de Bougouni Région de Sikasso République de Mali.. Diplômé de l’école normale supérieure de Bamako (ou il obtient une maitrise en psycho pédagogie) Monsieur Konaté ména plusieurs activités d’ordre intellectuelle dans beaucoup de domaines tels la santé communautaire, l’éducation formelle et non formelle,la gouvernance et la décentralisation,la gestion des réssources naturelle...sans réussite. Il décida de se consacrer à l’agriclture qu’il a appris auprès de ses parents dès son bas age, il y’a de cela 3 ans. Afin d’obtenir un fond pour s’équiper il intégra le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui, il est à sa premiere expérience. Avec ce pret il achétera 2 chargements de fumure organique, 4 bidons d’insecticides, 4 bidons d’herbicides et 5 houes. Il s’aprovisionne sur place à Bougouni auprès des forgerons et des boutiques de phyto sanitaire. La vente de sa production se fait à bougouni et une grande partie à Bamako ou les produits sont plus rénumerés. Ses clients sont essentiellement les vendeuses de condiments, légumes et quelques ménagères. Koman compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuelle de 70 000FCFA qui servira à payer les interêts du prêt, assurer les dépenses de la famille et préparer la saison prochaine.

loans.use: Purchase organic fertilizer, insecticide, and hoes

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es:
Yovana was born in the community Checca, Llave. She is 23 years, and studied until the fifth year of secondary school. She lives with her partner, is mother to two daughters, aged 3 and 5, and currently lives in Jr. Santa Cruz s / n, Mazocruz. For a year now she has been a member of Banco Julia Jiménez, Santa Rosa, Collao, Puno. Six years ago she set up a carpentry workshop which she runs together with her husband, generally creating furniture such as wardrobes, tables, chairs, kitchen units and other items. With this loan S/.1700.00 Nuevos Soles, which she will pay in 4 installments, she will buy wood worth a thousand nuevos soles, 20 boxes of triplay. His dream is to have a furniture store and a hardware store in Mazocruz, and offer her children a good education so they can become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Yovana nació en la comunidad de Checca – Distrito de Ilave, tiene 23 años de edad estudió quinto de secundaria, es conviviente, madre de dos hijas de 03 y 05 años, actualmente vive en el Jr. Santa Cruz s/n, Mazocruz. Es socia hace un año del Banco Julia Jiménez distrito de Santa Rosa Provincia del Collao – Puno, hace seis años instaló su taller de carpintería donde trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo, generalmente confecciona muebles como: roperos, mesas, sillas, reposteros y otros. Con este préstamo de S/.1,700.00 Nuevos Soles, que pagará en 04 cuotas, comprará madera valor de mil nuevos soles, 20 planchas de triplay . Su sueño es tener una tienda de muebles y una ferretería en la misma población de Mazocruz, y así poder educar a sus hijos para que sean profesionales.

loans.use: To buy wood and triplay

loans.name: Luis Humberto

texts.es: Luis Humberto tiene 21 años de edad, habita en el barrio Reparto Shick de la ciudad de Managua, es soltero. Luis se dedica a la zapatería, trabaja reparando zapatos y tiene ocho años de experiencia, el inició desde que tenia doce años aprendiendo el oficio de su papá. Con el préstamo que está solicitando es para compra de materia prima para el trabajo que desempeña, por ejemplo tacones, hilo, pega. Y así poder ofrecer más servicios a sus clientes y por ende tener más ganancias. Sus planes son poder apoyar a su familia siempre en los gastos del hogar porque él dice que le debe a su papá toda la experiencia que ha adquirido y espera poder ayudar a sus papás en la vejez.
texts.en:
Luis Humberto is 21 years old. He lives in the Reparto Shick neighborhood in the city of Managua and is single. Luis is a cobbler, he repairs shoes and has eight years of experience. He started when he was 12 years old and learned this trade from his father. The loan he is requesting is to buy supplies for the work he does, for example, heels, thread, glue, so that he can offer more services to his clients and have more earnings. His plans are to always be able help his family with household expenses because it´s owing to his father that he has the experience he has acquired, and he hopes to be able to help his parents in their old age.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for his cobbler shop

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 43-year-old Christina D. from Mwanza. She is widowed with three children, between the ages of eleven and twenty-three. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependants because their parents died. Christina has been running a business since 1996, selling maize. She works at the business for twelve hours per day, six days per week. Christina currently earns about 100USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to buy more maize. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and stock of maize. Christina thanks you for supporting her!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback micro-finance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow large sums in the future.
