loans.use: To buy more maize

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
Mrs. Pheap P. was born in 1960 and now lives in Preak Thom village in Kandal Province. She is a fish seller who buys her fish from other people to sell for a living. 

Her husband, Mr. Chhem Channath, is a construction worker who earns a small salary. They are the parents of eight children, two of whom are fishermen while the other six children are attending the local school. 

Now they face an obstacle, because they do not have much money to support their living expenses. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Pheap P. decided to ask for a loan to buy a boat and fish net to support her children’s business. 

She hopes to increase the family's income and improve her living conditions with this loan. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a boat and fish net to support her children’s business.

loans.name: Vannak

texts.en:
Mr. Vannak S., 42, and his wife, Mrs. Chanthou Yorn , 41, who live along National Road Number One about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh, married in 1985 and have five children: four sons and one daughter, all of whom attend school.

Mr. Vannak and his wife have been growing rice for fifteen years. Besides rice farming, he is employed by villagers to plow their rice fields with his tractor, for pay. He has been running this business for five years as well. Now his tractor is broken and he lacks the money to repair it. Therefore, Vannak is requesting a loan of US$ 1000 to repair his tractor and to use for their rice farm business.

loans.use: To repair his tractor and to purchase rice seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Akenese

texts.en: Akenese U., 46, is married with 6 children.  She has many years of experience in the ice candy business. She sells to the villagers 4 days per week. She has had 2 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (about $145 USD).  SPBD loans are Akenese’s only access to capital because she does not qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase coolio, sugar, foam cups, plastic papers and Chinese lollies for her ice candy business

loans.name: Abbass

texts.en:
Abbass is a 28-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, southern Lebanon. Abbass has owned an electrical shop for 15 years. He sells tools and supplies for the extension of electricity. Abbass is requesting a loan of $1000 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a car for his work. This is the first time that Abbass has requested a loan.

His clients are his friends and neighbors. When Abbass first started his business, he had difficulty building a network of clients. He decided to start his business because he wanted to improve his financial condition. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: Purchase a car for the business

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
44-year-old Epifania V. owns a small rice farm. She lives in Norala, South Cotabato, a town of 40,744 people and 8,263 households. She loves growing rice because her work feeds her three children. Her husband, Joselito V. is also a farmer. They work together to support their daily needs. Aside from farming, they also raise pigs to earn a small profit. 

Epifania is requesting a loan of Php 5,000 to buy fertilizer and seeds. Part of her loan will be used to buy feed for her pigs. One day, she dreams of having a bigger income to send all her children to college.

CEVI supports entrepreneurs to grow their businesses. CEVI provides credit assistance, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Margarita,

texts.es:
Desde hace quince años Margarita maneja su negocio de alquiler de videojuegos y venta de bebidas. Al inicio, su esposo era el encargado de este negocio, no obstante cuando él consiguió un puesto de trabajo en otro lugar, fue Margarita quien se hizo cargo del negocio.

Tiempo después, tuvo que hacerse cargo también del cuidado de sus dos hijos, muy pequeños en ese entonces, motivo por el cual abandono la atención en su negocio, pues la casa donde vivía quedaba muy lejos de donde estaba el quiosco. Una vez que su esposo se fue a trabajar al extranjero, hace casi diez años aproximadamente, ella se mudo a vivir con su suegra, gracias a la ayuda de ella retomo su negocio. Ahora solo sale a trabajar por las tardes.

Hoy en día tiene planes de mudar el local de su negocio a su actual vivienda, para lo cual necesita construir un espacio más y trasladar los equipos de videojuegos a su casa. De este modo, alquilaría la otra casa que quedaría libre para ser habitada por algunos inquilinos.

Las ganancias de su trabajo las destina para los gastos básicos del día a día. Su esposo es quien se encarga de mantener el hogar enviándole dinero del extranjero.
texts.en:
For fifteen years Margarita has managed her videogame rental and beverage sales business. At the beginning, her husband was in charge of running the business, however when he found a job in another place, it was Margarita who took over. A little while later, she had to take charge of the care of her two children, very young in those days, and for this reason she had to give up her business, because the house where she lived was very far away from the store. Once her husband went to work in another country, about ten years ago, she moved to live with her mother in law, and thanks to her help, Margarita returned to her videogame rental business. Now she goes to work in the afternoon. Today she has plans to move her store into her current home, so she needs to build a bigger space and bring the videogame machines to her house. This way, she will rent the other building, which will be free for her to rent out to some tenants. Margarita uses the earnings from her work to pay her basic day-to-day expenses. Her husband is the one who maintains the home, sending her money from the exterior.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Hospital debts due to her daughter's illness.

loans.name: Mujeres Del Nuevo Renacer Group

texts.en:
Francelina E. R. is the leader of the group called “Nuevo Renacer”, which means “New Birth” in English.  Francelina is the mother of five, ranging in age from three months old to fourteen.  She owns a salon and will buy a hair dryer and more products with her loan.  Her business started up as a bag full of supplies that she used to bring to houses of clients. It has grown into a community salon that has a physical location thanks to her Esperanza loan and good old-fashioned hard work.  She eventually hopes to be able to offer all of the offerings of a spa including massage.

She hopes her children can grow up to be professionals and be strong in their Christian faith.  Francelina does not have much free time between her five children and business, but when she does get to relax, she enjoys watching telenovelas (soap operas, which are very popular here in Latin America) on TV.

Because of Francelina’s hard work and diligence in repaying her previous two loans, this loan will be for a bigger amount.  She hopes this one will help her business as much as the previous loans have.  

On behalf of Esperanza International, thank you for supporting these entrepreneurs!

loans.use: A hair dryer and personal products for her salon

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Adjo K. est âgée de 37 ans, mariée et mère d’une petite fille. Elle est propriétaire d’un magasin de distribution d’eaux minérales à Lomé. Pour satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle, Adjo souhaite avec ce crédit augmenter la taille de son commerce en alimentant son magasin. Ce secteur est très prometteur car les demandes sont importantes et il y a peu de personnes qui s’y opèrent.
texts.en:
Adjo K., age37, is married, the mother of a little daughter, and the owner of a store for distributing mineral water in Lomé. To satisfy the needs of her customers, she would like to use this loan to expand her business by stocking her store. This field is very promising because the demand is significant, and there are few people who operate in it.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply her store

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a mother of four children and farms cassava, ginger and yams. Margaret’s farm is located in Bafut, an area in Bamenda, Cameroon. With this loan, she plans to buy labor to clear and weed her farm; firewood; ginger and yams for planting; as well as pay for transportation costs to get her produce to the market.

This is Margaret’s second loan from GHAPE since she became a beneficiary in 2008. Margaret believes her business is successful because, in her area, there is a high demand for cassava and ginger. Cassava is used to make local dishes such as garri (a fermented and fried cassava mash) and water fufu (fermented, boiled cassava). Ginger is popularly used to make soft drinks, like ginger ale, which are very strong.

Margaret has faced setbacks with her money, such as thievery in her home, stealing her money. She continues to push on with the help of her loans. As she sees profits, Margaret plans to add capital to her business, purchase text books for her children’s education and provide her family with their basic needs. She takes out GHAPE loans because of the preferable loan conditions and the valuable teachings on loan management.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy firewood and ginger and to hire labor for land clearing

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary I. is a hair stylist and she also sells hair extensions. She is 36 years-old and married with 3 children.  Mary is requesting a loan amount of N50,000 which she will use to purchase more hair extensions to sell.  She wants to say thank you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions to sell.

loans.name: Hamidan Riaz Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Parveen baji wants a loan to buy cigarettes to sell.

Azra baji and Allah rakhi baji each want a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

Farzana baji wants a loan to pay off the installments of a tractor.

Hamidan baji is a very hardworking and responsible lady. She gets up early in the morning and prepares breakfast for her family. Then she readies her children for school and cleans the whole house. She performs her duties very efficiently. She is also the group leader of these above mentioned ladies. Her members respect her a lot because of her good nature.

Her husband’s name is R. A. and he runs a business making and selling plastic brushes. His brushes are used to clean washrooms. He sells the brushes to the market and earns income. Hamidan baji helps him by making the plastic brushes. She is applying for a loan to buy plastic beans and shapes for her husband’s plastic-brush business.

loans.use: To buy material for making plastic brushes

loans.name: Sira

texts.fr: Sira B. est une dame de 62 ans, mariée, avec 10 enfants  en charge. Elle voudrait renforcer son commerce de colas et de tabac afin d’améliorer les conditions de vie, de santé, de scolarité de sa famille.
texts.en:
Sira B., 62, is married and responsible for 10 children. She would like to bolster her business selling kola nuts and tobacco so that she can improve the living conditions and the health and pay school fees for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: selling kola nuts

loans.name: Esau Masinde

texts.en: Esau S. is a thirty-three-year-old single man who runs a makeshift shop in Bukembe Market, Western Kenya. He sells mainly household items like cooking utensils, cooking pots, and brooms. Esau has been managing his business very well and has attracted many regular clients who come from Bukembe Village and its environs. He is taking his third loan from KADET and intends to use it to relocate the business to a permanent building and open a shop. Esau’s desire is to diversify his business by opening a posho mill (a grain-grinding mill) to meet the demands of local residents and also to create job opportunities for others in his community. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To relocate his business to a permanent building

loans.name: Mr. Mus Nhoem Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This Village Bank Group loan consists of 21 people who all live in Tuol Pongro village in Takeo province. Mr. Mus N. is the Village Bank Group president who has been selected by the members. He is a farmer who has a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn for a living. He now faces a small problem because his field has infertile soil. He decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support the field. With the rest of the money, he will hire a laborer to plow the field. His wife, Mrs. Khon Khaem, also helps him with planting. Mr. Mus N. is 46 years old and the father of four children who are all attending the local school. 

Fourteen members in this group loans are End-of-Term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-Term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his rice field

loans.name: Mejos

texts.en: Mejos M. is from the village of Tinagaan, Salay, Misamis Oriental. She is 32 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Mejos owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. She is just starting this business. In 2009, Mejos joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
La señora Juliana es socia del Banco Comunal “La Ilaveñita”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 36 años de edad, estado civil soltera y madre de una niña Juliana estudio educación superior técnica Administración, vive en Ilave.

La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 2 años,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invirtió compra venta de ropa. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 800.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de ropa de abrigo, todo por pedido y entrega inmediata, Juliana comparte con su mama otros negocios ellas se turnan y tienen una tienda de venta de abarrotes.

Su sueño es poner una tienda grande de venta de ropa en Tacna.

A ella le gustan las facilidades en los préstamos y los ahorros

loans.use: Para la compra de ropa de abrigo casacas.

loans.name: El - Shadai Group

texts.en: Agyei is forty – two years old. She is married and has four children. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town. Agyei is a trader. He deals in hard wares such as cement, paints, etc.  He is the leader of a trust bank group called El – Shadai. The group members are engaged either in farming and/or trading activities. They sell/supply in their local market and nearby communities. They sometimes trek to nearby community markets. They want a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Etaroghene

texts.en: B. is 44 years old and the married mother of four children. She sells wood and hopes for the loan amount of N120000 to purchase more wood to sell. She thanks all her Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more wood  to sell

loans.name: Hermogenes

texts.en:
Hermogenes T. is from the village of Dullan. He is 60 years old. Hermogenes is a widower and has five adult children. To make a living, Hermogenes raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Hermogenes has been engaged in his business for over 40 years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2009, Hermogenes joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hermogenes has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC. Hermogenes is requesting a new loan of 42,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the second loan taken out by Hermogenes from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Mrs. Sim Sam Ol Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank consists of sixteen people that all live in Damrei Chhlang village in Kandal province. Mrs. Sim S. O. was elected by members to be president of the village bank.

Mrs. Sim S. O. is 31 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are attending the local schoO.. Her husband, Mr. Khun Khom, raises cows while she sells fish at the local market. Since her business is going well, she wants to increase her income and expand her business by purchasing more fish to sell.

loans.use: To increase her income and expand her business by purchasing more fish to sell.

loans.name: Hector

texts.en:
Hector O. is 46 years old, and has been married for over 23 years to Petrona Fleitas, who is 50 years old. Together they have 5 children, 3 of whom are fully grown and independent and 2 of whom are of school age. Twenty years ago, Hector started a pantry from their home, which his wife helped him run while he was finishing his studies to become a teacher. Together they earned enough profit to support their family. Now they own a nice house and a successful pantry in the city.

They will use their loan to buy more goods such as drinks and necessities, such as flour, sugar, herbs, oil and noodles.

loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria C. is currently in the business of selling soap, sugar, biscuits etc, in a small shop. She is requesting a loan to buy supplies of boxes of powdered milk, blue band rice etc.  Victoria is 32 years old and is married. Her husband is a security guard. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent out.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to buy supplies of boxes of powdered milk, blue band rice etc.for resale

loans.name: Ayoni

texts.en: Ayoni is 57 years old and is married with 4 children. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. She is a Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. She sells palm kernels at retail prices to her customers to make a living. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more palm kernels to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more palm kernels to sell

loans.name: Silvia Juana

texts.es:
Silvia es socia del Banco Comunal Ccori Ayllu que significa Familia de Oro.
Silvia es separada, tiene 40 años y 1 hijo, Silvia compra cereales en los mercados de la ciudad, productos que procesa en harinas, sus ventas los realiza en los mercados. Además Silvia compra y vende animales menores, en algunas oportunidades se dedica al engorde de animales.
Silvia necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cerdos para engorde.
Los sueños de Silvia son que su hijo sea profesional y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Silvia is a member of the Communal Bank “Ccori Ayllu”, which means “Golden Family”. She is 40 years old, separated from her spouse, and has one child. Silvia buys grain at the city markets and processes it into flour. She then sells her products at the markets. Silvia also buys and sells small animals, and takes the opportunity to fatten them. Silvia needs a loan of 800 soles to purchase pigs for fattening. She dreams of seeing her child become a professional and improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pigs for fattening

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
A 36-year-old, Josephine S. is a woman with the determination and faith needed to get out from the ties of poverty. She is the mother of five dependent children, all of whom need her support. She is married to Orlando Soriano, who is 37 years old and a mechanic, but his income is not enough for their daily needs. That is why Josephine has the initiative to engage in selling small goods to help her husband in supporting and raising their big family.

In 2008, as a mother of big dreams, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), which means ”To rise up from poverty”, an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines. Since her membership, she opened a general store and it truly helps them to meet their needs.

Now on her third loan, she is requesting the amount of 15,000 PHP to pay for two sacks of sugar, liquor, five sacks of rice, two sacks of charcoal, two containers of cooking oil and other groceries for her store.

She hopes that, with the help of ASHI and KIVA, she can have a successful mini-grocery in the future in order to pay for the needs of her children until they finish school with a degree. Her greatest dream is to reach her aspiration of stepping out from poverty.

NOTE: Please disregard the date appearing on the picture. The camera internal date was not set on the right date.

loans.use: To pay for groceries for her store.

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en:
Philomena is 43 years old and married with seven children. She lives with her family in Benin City, Edo state. Her husband sells building materials to support their home. She is a hardworking woman and she hopes to lift her business and family above poverty. 

She sells firewood at retail prices to her customers. Philomena hopes to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 80,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more firewood to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more firewood to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: House improvement

loans.name: Ananius

texts.en:
M. Ananius is a courteous and approachable married man of 56 years with six children, all going to school. He resides in Bikungu Cell of Rukungiri.

Ananius sells produce, principally rice, to his customers who are mostly traders who come from all over the area and some of them with trucks. He has been banking on this business for over twelve years and he is grateful that his business has been able to support him and his family.

However, Ananius has had to bear with a number of setbacks ranging from fluctuating prices, falling demand for rice sold in open markets to low yields from farmers. In a good period, though, when his business is booming, he notes that he can sell over 350 kilograms of rice a day.

With the loan that he is seeking from Kiva, he believes he will be able to buy more sacks of rice for his store.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: God's Children Group

texts.en:
Musu S., holding the sign, is the leader of the group of five borrowers called God Children. She is 56 years old and married with six children aged nine to 33. She did not have the opportunity to go to school. For two years, Musu has sold charcoal at the Gbengbar town community in Paynesville, Liberia. She sells dry charcoal that people need which keeps customers returning. She began her business selling 30 bags of charcoal but now sells about 50 bags. Musu plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more charcoal. Her goal is to get more wood to make charcoal.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal.

loans.name: Pang

texts.en: Pang Y., 58, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorian temples. She sells boiled corn for an income of about USD 3 per day. Her husband sells dish washing liquid for an income of USD 3 per day. Y. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a machine to wash cars and a motorbike for the children to run a business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to expand her children’s businesses. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike and a machine to wash cars.

loans.name: Rashidan

texts.en:
Rashidan is a 54-year-old married woman who lives in the mid-sized city of Riwind, Pakistan. She is a very humble lady. She owns a three-room brick house and has been living in it with her family for over twenty years.

Rashidan has given birth to four children: two sons and two daughters. Her sons work in a local factory on monthly wage; her elder daughter helps her in her dairy business and the younger daughter is fifteen years old and studies in 9th standard grade.

Rashidan and her family operate a dairy business and are very hardworking. Their business is renowned in their community. They get up early in the morning to get milk from their dairy cows and sell to the milk shops and in the community. Now, their dairy business has become their family business. They enjoy their work a lot and they are happy to help each other to grow their business.

Presently, Rashidan has two dairy cows at home. She is a regular client of Asasah (a micro-finance institute in Pakistan). She has successfully repaid her four loans from Asasah and now she is applying for the fifth time to purchase another dairy cow to expand her dairy business.

Rashidan has a dream to have her own milk shop in future so her family earns good profits and improves its living standard.

loans.use: To purchase another dairy cow for her dairy business

loans.name: Ercilia Julisa

texts.es:
La señora Julissa tiene 40 años esta casada desde hace 10 años, es tan dedicada a su trabajo que consiste en la venta de confitería, snack, stikers, etc trabajo que lo realiza en un triciclo al igual que su esposo en las afuera de esuelas y colegios, de lunes a viernes, sale de casa desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde y regresa ya cansada, cuenta que es ella quien maneja su triciclo y que el esposo tiene otro y trabajan por separado, nuestra socia es nacida en la capital de los ecuatorianos y desde que se caso se radicó en la ciudad de Portoviejo hace 10 años, tiene 4 hijos, solo uno vive con ellos y los demás viven en Quito, ya son independientes; aparte de la venta en triciclo la señora Julissa tiene otro negocio una tienda de víveres y su hijo es el encargado de atender mientras  ella esta fuera de casa.


La señora Julissa con este nuevo crédito podrá invertir en sus dos negocios, surtirá cada uno de ellos,  en la venta de confitería, en esta época escolar le va muy bien y tiene que incrementar sus productos, y por otra parte a la tienda la tiene que surtir, nuestra socia esta muy contenta porque podrá seguir manteniendo firme sus negocios. El sueño para ella es tener su casa propia y ya no seguir alquilando.
texts.en:
Julissa is 40 years old, and has been married for 10 years. She is very dedicated to her work, which is the sale of sweets, snacks, stickers, etc. She does this work on a tricycle, as does her husband, outside of schools from Monday to Friday. She leaves the house at 6:00 in the morning and works until 6 in the evening, when she returns home tired, since she drives her own tricycle while her husband has another and they split up. Our partner was born in the Ecuadoran capital but since her marriage 10 years ago, she has lived in Portoviejo. She has 4 children, but only one of them lives with her. The rest live in Quito and are already on their own. Aside from tricycle sales, Julissa has another business; a food store which her son watches while she's out. With this new loan, Julissa will be able to invest in her two businesses and advance them both. During the school year, confectionery sales are very successful and she needs to increase her stock, and the store also needs investment. Our partner is very happy to be able to keep both her businesses stable. Her dream is to have her own home and stop renting.

Translated from Spanish by Nadine Riopel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Candy, gum, potato chips, oil, rice, sugar, soda pop

loans.name: Ney

texts.en: Mrs. Ney P., 47, is a villager who lives in Chambak Tuem village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a hectare of land to cultivate rice. To support her farm, Mrs. Ney P. decided to ask for a loan to purchase a harvesting machine, fertilizer, and pesticide. Aside from farming, she  also sells vegetables which adds a little to the family income. Mrs. Ney P. is a widow and does not have any children.

loans.use: To purchase a harvesting machine, fertilizer, and pesticide

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
Celestina A. is a 45 year old married woman who supports her family by engaging in a fish vending business.  She lives in Prk. Guiwanon, Brgy Poblacion, Dalaguete, Cebu City with her husband who has a job.  They have seven children who are 10-24 years old.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fish vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable.  She now earns an average monthly income of Php 12,000.

Celestina is now borrowing Php 19,000 as additional working capital for her fish vending business.  This will be her 6th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon.  Her previous loan of Php 16,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Celestina aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

-----------------------------
About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Oscar Amilcar

texts.es: Oscar Amilcar O. G. de 40 años de edad, posee una tienda en la cual se comercializan productos de primera necesidad para las personas como: sopas instantáneas, shampoo, cremas para el cabello, pan, jugos, desinfectantes, y otros más. El vive en Zacatecoluca, ubicado en el departamento de La paz, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposa quien invierte su tiempo a las labores del hogar y al cuido de sus dos hijos de 15 y 12 años de edad, los cuales son el mayor motivo de Oscar para salir adelante y mejorar su trabajo. A pesar que el negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación el posee muy buenas ventas, las cuales pretende mejorar para obtener una mayor estabilidad económica por medio de la cual le brinde todo lo necesario a sus dos hijos. Oscar solicita un préstamo a través del cual cuente con el dinero necesario para comprar productos de primera necesidad por mayor, de manera que los obtenga a menores precios y así mismo brinde una basta variedad de productos, así también desea poder comprar zapatos para comercializar en su tienda. Oscar es un hombre muy responsable y trabajador el cual tiene como muy bien marcada su mayor prioridad en la vida la cual es el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Oscar Amilcar O. G. is 40 years old and owns a store where he sells basic necessities and personal products such as instant soups, shampoo, hair creams, bread, juices, disinfectants, and other items. He lives in Zacatecoluca, which is located in the Department of La Paz. His wife spends her time doing housework and caring for their two children, ages 15 and 12, who are the main reason behind Oscar’s desire to succeed and improve in his work. Even though his business is located in his house, he is still able to generate good sales. He aims to achieve greater financial stability so that he can provide everything necessary for his two children. Oscar is requesting a loan so that he will have the required funds to buy basic necessity products in bulk. This will allow him to acquire them for a lower price and at the same offer enough variety. He also wants to buy shoes to sell in his store. Oscar is a hardworking and responsible man who considers the welfare of his family to be a top priority in life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for his store

loans.name: Argentina Piedad

texts.es:
Argentina Piedad S. V., tiene 73 años.  Es viuda y vive con los hijos,  vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 5 hijos,  German (45), Luis (60), Gloria (56), Maricela (45), Nancy (40)  y Gabriel (50). 

Argentina es una socia de la ventanilla rural la “Y”, que está ubicada a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 17 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Argentina  se dedica a la agricultura, siembra banano, cacao, café, maíz. Realiza sus compras cada mes en Echeandia y vende la misma localidad y los alrededores.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de banano, cacao, café, maíz para sembrar y vender. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es tener un negocio propio e incrementar los ingresos. Enfrenta desafíos es la falta de dinero y las plagas y enfermedades que afectan los cultivos.

Le gusta trabajar en el campo y pasear con la familia.
texts.en:
Argentina Piedad S. V. is 73 years old and lives with her sons in the Ventanas province in Los Ríos. She has 6 children: German (45), Luis (60), Gloria (56), Maricela (45) Nancy (40) and Gabriel (50). Argentina is a member of the communal bank 'Y', which is located 1 1/2 hours from Ventanas. There are 17 members in total and the majority work in agriculture. This is the first loan that they are seeking from Cooperativa San José. Argentina works in agriculture, cultivating bananas, cocoa, coffee and maize. She makes her monthly purchases in Echeandia and sells in the same locations and surrounds. She is seeking a loan to invest in the purchase of bananas, cocoa, coffee and maize to sow and sell. She thinks that this loan is an opportunity to improve their situation. Her dreams are to have her own business and increase her earnings. Preventing her from realising her goals is the lack of money and the plagues and diseases that affect the crops. Argentina likes to work in the countryside and spend time with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase banana, cocoa, coffee and maize to sow/grow

loans.name: Francisco Alcides

texts.es:
El señor Francisco labora para Alcaldía de Managua como responsable de recaudaciones de impuestos, es casado tiene dos hijos.
El señor Francisco Alcides solicito crédito en CEPRODEL para mejorar su casa, reparar el techo de su vivienda y cancelar algún material que ya había obtenido al crédito para reparar parte de su vivienda.
Por lo que será de un gran impacto el préstamo otorgado por CEPRODEL para beneficio de su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Francisco works for the City of Managua as a tax collector. He is married and has two children.

Sr. Francisco is requesting a loan from CEPRODEL to make improvements to his house. He plans to repair the roof of his home and pay off a previous loan he obtained to buy materials needed to make other repairs to his house.

This loan from CEPRODEL will have a great impact and provide benefits for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair the roof of his house & pay off a previous home improvement loan

loans.name: Rosa Margarita

texts.es: La señora Rosa Margarita T. C., tiene la edad de 53 años, y es casada y con su esposo habita en el Reparto Juan Ramón Padilla, ellos tienen 3 hijos mayores  de edad todos habitan de manera independiente, trabajan y apoyan a su familia con un aporte económico para su economía domestica, ellos tienen una pequeña tienda de abarrotes, productos del hogar y personal,  desde hace mas de 15 años, una de los problemas a los que se ha enfrentado ha sido la delincuencia que habita en la zona y que amenaza con su negocio y tranquilidad para los habitantes que ahí moran, por ahora solicitan un préstamo para la compra de un mayor inventario de mercadería que aumente las ventas del negocio y permita tomar medidas de seguridad para la protección de su familia y el negocio, así mismo la mejoría de las condiciones socio-económicas para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa Margarita T. C. is 53-years-old. She's married and lives with her husband in Reparto Juan Ramón Padilla. They have 3 grown children who are independent. They work and support their family with social security money for domestic expenses. For 15 years they've had a small general store that sells groceries and household products. One of the problems they've faced is the delinquency of the area that threatens their peace and business. She's currently requesting a loan to buy more merchandise that will improve her sales and allow her to invest in security measures for the protection of her family and business so that they can improve their quality of life and well being.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expansion of inventory

loans.name: Hermegilda

texts.es: Hermegilda, de 40 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es trabajar muy duro para sobresalir en la vida. Sus días los pasa trabajando en sus cultivos, ella es muy dedicada y pone todo su esfuerzo en que sus cultivos tengan la mayor calidad posible, esta actitud ha hecho que sus cultivos de plátano y café, sean muy solicitados en el mercado de La Merced, que es donde lleva a vender sus productos.  Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos ya que los sacos de cultivos son muy pesados. Para más adelante, espera comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar su producción. Son tres ya los préstamos que Hermegilda tiene con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos y nunca a tenido problemas con su banco comunal, en donde es la encargada de poner la cuota de alegría que mantiene a las demás socias muy felices. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para fertilizar sus cultivos
texts.en:
Hermegilda is 40 years old, she is a simple hard-working woman, owns her own home, and wishes to work hard in order to get ahead in life. Her days are spent working on her crops. She is a very dedicated woman and puts forth all her effort so that her crops will have the highest quality possible. This attitude has made her banana and coffee crops very sought after in the market in La Merced which is where she takes her product for sale. What she likes most about her job is planting and she does it with great care. She's been doing this for 15 years and considers transporting her products to be the most difficult because the harvest sacks are very heavy. In the future she hopes to purchase new land in order to increase production. Hermegilda now has 3 loans with MFP, she has been very punctual with her payments and she's never had any problems with her communal bank where she is in charge of setting the standard for happiness and keeps the group's members very happy. With the 2,000 PEN (725 USD) she is requesting she will purchase fertilizer for her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Gustavo Gutierrez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer for her crops

loans.name: Bayanmunh

texts.en: Bayanmunh B. lives with his wife and two teenage daughters in Huvsgul province, Mongolia. His daughters both attend the local high school, while his wife works as a cook. Bayanmunh owns a successful taxi service. He has been driving a taxi since 1988 and has gained a lot of experience as a driver. He is a modest, open-minded and hard-working businessman and is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to improve his car that uses as a taxi.

loans.use: To improve his car

loans.name: Celia

texts.es: Celia tiene 47 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Tiene una amplia experiencia de 20 años en las ventas, vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad desde golosinas y abarrotes, en sus inicios vendía en una caseta ahora vende en su casa que le permite mayor comodidad en el desarrollo de su negocio. Además su esposo y sus hijos  también aportan significativamente en la atención de este negocio ya que gracias a ella tienen grandes oportunidades. Su tienda esta ubicada en el paradero de una línea de transportes cuyos choferes son sus potenciales clientes, también vende carne, por lo que también le resulta rentable. Para el futuro desea suministrarse de varios productos, de esa manera podrá mejorar sus ganancias. Este es su crédito número 18 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que conocen de su persona que es responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería para su tienda y para aprovechar algunas temporadas que se vienen.
texts.en:
Celia, 47, lives with her husband and three children in her own house.  She has been in sales for 20 years.  She sells all kinds of basic need items from sweets to groceries.  At the beginning she used to sell from a small booth but now she sells from home which is more comfortable and better for the development of her business.  Besides, her husband and children contribute significantly to running the business since it offers great opportunities to them.

Her store is located at a transportation hub and the drivers are her main customers.  She also sells meat which makes it still more profitable.  For the future she’d like to stock various products to improve profits.

This is her 18th loan with MFP and she is happy to know that she can count on financial support since they know she’s a responsible person with respect to repayments.  Besides, she enjoys being part of a communal bank because all the members are people known to her, they are responsible and mutually supportive.

She is very grateful to all those who will fund the requested loan that will be very useful for her business.

She will use the requested loan to buy more merchandise to stock the store and to take advantage of the approaching seasons.

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase fertilizers & supplies to protect against pests and diseases

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline Y.  is currently in the business of selling beans and simsim (sesame) at the market  and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of beans and simsim.  Jackline is 27 years old and married. Her husband is a soldier. She has three children, two of whom attend school.  With the extra profits generated from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: Stock more bags of beans and simsim (sesame)

loans.name: Gladys Teresa

texts.es:
Gladys de 36 años, vende habas (frijoles conocidos por sus propiedades alimentarias medicinales). Vive en una casa de caña con su esposo y tres hijos en una zona periurbana llamada Paraíso de la flor zona caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y montañas.

Hace 6 años para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares y darles una mejor vida a sus hijos empezó a vender habas. Ella comprar las habas con su cascara pero para poderlas vender el procedimiento que hace es sacarlos de la cascara ponerlos a remojar y limpiarlo para ubicarlos en unas pequeñas fundas y venderlos. Su esposo es albañil pero después que termina su trabajo vende en un mercado llamado “Montebello” las habas. 

Con el préstamo quieren comprar hablas para poder procesarlas y venderlas y otra parte del préstamo dirigirla a la casa ya que ahora es de caña comprando, cemento. En el futuro quiere tener un negocio bien establecido.
texts.en:
Gladys is 36 years old. She sells fava beans ( beans known for their medicinal and culinary properties). She lives in a cane house with her husband and three children on the outskirts of Guayaquil. They live in an area called Paraíso de la flor characterized for its dirt roads and mountains.

Six years ago, in order to help her husband with the household expenses and to give her children a better life, Gladys started selling fava beans. She buys the beans in their shells. To prepare them for selling she follows a certain procedure. She takes them out of their shells to soak and clean them. She puts them in small containers and sells them. Her husband is a construction worker but after work, he sells the fava beans in the “Montebello” market.

With this loan, they want to buy fava beans to process and sell. The other part of the loan will go to their cane house, to buy cement. In the future, Gladys wants to have a well established business.

loans.use: to buy fava beans and cement

loans.name: Nunik

texts.en: Nunik D. was born in 1962 in Ljevan city. She is married and has three children and two grandchildren. Since 1995, she has made a living by buying and selling clothing. Every week she goes to Yerevan to buy merchandise for her business and make sure she has a good assortment of items to sell to her customers. Thanks to her hard work, she has been able to pay for the education of her children, her oldest daughter’s wedding and the costs her son incurred when he entered the army. She is applying for a loan for 600,000 AMD loan to buy more items to sell to her customers, including suits, blouses and sweaters. Business is always strong just before New Year’s Day, and this loan will allow her to earn a good profit and pay for the wedding of her younger daughter. This will be her tenth loan, and she was never late making a payment on the previous nine.

loans.use: To buy suits, blouses and sweaters to sell to her customers

loans.name: Chor

texts.en: Chor C., 31, is a garment factory worker in Kampong Chhnang province. She is married with one child who is still living at home, and her husband is a farmer. She typically makes about US$ 3 each day, and would like a loan of US$ 400 to purchase a cow to help with farm work.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Badiru

texts.en:
Badiru W. is 37 years old and lives in the town of Bugiri in the Iganga region of Uganda.  He is married and has 5 children.  All of his children are currently in school.  Badiru has a business of a restaurant, which he has had for less than one year.         

To help expand his business, Badiru has requested a loan of 1,600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase and store more food, which he will eventually cook for his clients.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Badiru hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees.  In the future, Badiru hopes to turn his business into a hotel.

loans.use: To purchase and store food for restaurant

loans.name: Dramane

texts.fr:
Monsieur Dramane Traoré  est  âgé de 51 ans et vit avec ses 3 enfants et son épouse dans une famille traditionnelle au quartier N’tentou de la ville de Ouelessebougou, préfecture de Kati,  Région de Koulikoro.
Dramane Traoré n’a pas eu la chance  de réussir à l’école.  Alors il s’initie très rapidement au métier de menuisier. Il a appris cette activité auprès de son oncle. Avec une expérience de….. ans, Monsieur Dramane Traoré jouit d’une grande renommée et est très sollicité à Ouelessebougou et environs.
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, il décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Après avoir correctement remboursé les 2 premiers prêts il est à son troisième prêt individuel  qui servira à acheter,  des planches, pointes, colles, vernis, tissus, contreplaqués, matelas, etc, auprès des grossistes de la place. Il fabrique des  meubles, armoires, chaises, souvent sur commande et effectue sa vente à une clientèle diverse et variée, au comptant et quelques fois à crédit.
Dramane espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 40.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et  être réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
Mr. Dramane Traore is 51 years old and he lives with his 3 children and his wife in a traditional family in the quarter of N'Tentou of the city of Ouelessebougou. It is located in the Kati prefecture in the Koulikoro region. 

Dramane Traore did not have the opportunity to attend school, so he set out very quickly in the carpentry trade.  He learned the trade from this uncle. Given his several years' experience in the field, Mr. Dramane Traore enjoys a high reputation and is highly solicited in Ouelessebougou and the environs. 

IN order to satisfy his ever growing clientele, he decided to join Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner). Following the successful repayment of the first 2 loans, he is now on his third individual loan. He will use it to purchase planks of wood, clamps, glue, varnish, fabrics, plywood, cushioning materials, etc. from the wholesalers in the area. He makes furniture, armoires, and chairs, often taking orders. He sells to a diverse and varied clientele, completing his sales in cash and sometimes on credit. 

Dramane expects to earn a monthly loan of 40.000 FCFA which will be used to repay this loan and to reinvest the remaining portion into his business.

loans.use: To purchase carpentry materials.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila tiene 40 años de edad, reside junto a sus dos hijos en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial conocida como la capital del limón; que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo. 

Ella se dedica hace 10 años a la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno; ella cría  a su ganado en un ambiente cercano a su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta al público en general y a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona. Adicionalmente se dedica a la agricultura. Con el ingreso q ella percibe de estas actividades se encarga de sacar adelante a sus hijos.

Lucila desea ampliar su negocio comprando más ganado y ofrecerlo a buen precio asimismo poder incrementar sus ventas. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Lucila es una madre de familia responsable y activa que desea brindar a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Lucila is 40 years old and lives with her two children in the district of Olmos.  It is an agricultural area with considerable trade and is known as the lemon capital.  It is located in the province of Lambayeque, an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

She has been raising and selling cattle for 10 years.  She cares for her livestock in a location close to her home.  Once they are fully grown she sells them to the general public or merchants who visit the area.  She also is involved in farming.  Her business provides an income for her children.

Lucila wants to expand her business by buying more livestock so she can lower her prices and increase sales.  She has requested a loan for 1000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa.

She is a responsible, active mother who wants to give her children the best quality of life.

loans.use: To buy more livestock to expand business

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a 25-year-old married man with two children. He lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is charged with the responsibility of looking after his family. His desire is to build a permanent house, as he currently lives in a semi-permanent house. 

For six years he has been involved in a butcher business, which has helped him to provide for the basic needs of his family. His business challenge is employees who do not remit their daily sales promptly. He plans to buy land and start raising animals. Richard needs this loan to buy land.

loans.use: To buy land

loans.name: Eduarda

texts.es: Eduarda tiene  62 años vive en compañía de una de sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. Se dedica a la crianza de animales y también a la agricultura desde su niñez, en la actualidad recibe la ayuda de sus hijos que ya son personas mayores que vienen en cada temporada de siembra y cosecha para apoyarla en este trabajo. De esta manera ha mejorado su situación que le permite seguir adelante ya que en muchas ocasiones este trabajo suele ser muy esforzado y requiere de alquilar maquinarias como tractor o bueyes para yunta que es básico para optimizar el tiempo, sus cosechas las lleva a vender al por mayor en el mercado central de la ciudad mas cercana a su localidad y en estos últimos años ha recuperado lo invertido, pero su mayor deseo es el de incursionar de manera mas formal el comercio de sus cultivos. Es la octavo crédito con MFP y le ha agradado durante este tiempo ser parte del banco comunal donde integraba por la solidaridad  de cada uno de sus miembros. En la actualidad ha optado por solicitar un crédito comunal por sus constantes viajes. Con el crédito que solicita, podrá comprar semillas mejoradas y también sacos de abono para esta temporada de siembra.
texts.en:
Eduarda is 62 years old and lives with one of her four children in her own home.  Her business is raising animals and farming.  She has been doing this since she was a child.  Eduarda receives help from her children.  They are grown up and come to support her in her work every planting and harvest season.  This has helped her to improve her situation and get ahead since this work is often very hard and requires her to hire machinery such as a tractor or a yoke of oxen which are essential in order to optimize her time.

Eduarda sells her harvested crops wholesale in the central market of the city nearest her town.  Over recent years she has recovered what she has invested but her greatest wish is to make more formal inroads into selling her crops.

This is Eduarda's eighth loan from MFP and she has always enjoyed being a member of her community bank which she joined because of the solidarity between all of its members.  She will use the loan she is requesting to buy improved seeds and also sacks of manure for the coming planting season.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and sacks of manure

loans.name: María Ofelia

texts.es:
La falta de oportunidades laborales y la necesidad de generar ingresos para contribuir al cubrimiento de los gastos familiares, obligaron a María Ofelia G. C. a iniciar su negocio, una tienda de productos de la canasta familiar que puso en la sala de su casa. 

Desde las 8:00 de la mañana hasta las 10:00 de la noche, María Ofelia abre las puertas de su negocio con la esperanza de vender cada vez más. Actualmente esta emprendedora necesita de un préstamo para comprar surtido y así incrementar sus ventas y mejorar su calidad de vida, pues a sus 56 años espera tener una vejez tranquila.
texts.en: Lack of work opportunities and the need to create an income to cover household expenses forced Maria Ofelia Gonzalez C. to start her business; a store she has out of her livingroom selling household goods.  From 8AM to 10PM, Maria Ofelia opens her doors for business with the hopes of increasing sales each time.  Currently, this entrepreneur needs a loan to purchase supply and increase sales and improve her quality of life.  At her 56 years of age she hopes to have a peaceful retirement.

loans.use: to purchase supply

loans.name: Alma Muriel

texts.es:
Alma, tiene 28 años D. edad, resiD. en la ciudad D. San Miguel, donD. vive junto a su esposo y sus hijos D. 11 y 13 años D. edad, ella se dedica a la venta D. tortillas, pupusas y bebidas; dicho negocio le ayuda para tener sus propios ingresos y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, su horario D. atención es D. 9:00am a 2:00pm, tiene 6 años D. estar atendiéndolo.

Ella necesita un préstamo para darle mantenimiento a la cocina donD. elabora las pupusas y tortillas,  también comprara maíz y leña, espera que poder tener un avance en el negocio, al lograr salir con esta necesidad, cree que su condición será mejor.

Tiene como objetivo mejorar el negocio, la atención y el servicio a los clientes, contando con una mejor solvencia económica para su familia.
texts.en:
Alma is 28 years old and lives in the city of San Miguel with her husband and children aged 11 and 13.  Alma's business is selling tortillas, pupusas and drinks.  The business helps her to make her own income and she helps her husband cover their household expenses.  Alma works from 9.00am to 2.00pm.  She has been running her business for six years.

Alma needs a loan so that she can do some maintenance work on the stove where she makes her pupusas and tortillas.  She will also buy corn and firewood.  She hopes that she can take a step forward in her business and get out of this difficult situation.  She believes that she will then be in a better position.

Alma's goal is to improve her business and her customer service, and to be more financially solvent for her family's sake.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood, and to do maintenance work on her stove

loans.name: Juana Maribel

texts.es: Juana Maribel A. de 43 años de edad vive  en su casa con su esposo, cuatro hijos y una nieta. Doña Juana se dedica a la venta de pan dulce en diferentes zonas de San Salvador. Ella reside en el Municipio de Cojutepeque pero todos los días se traslada en un Pick up  a las zonas de San Martin, Soyapango y San Bartolo que son Municipios de la capital del país: San Salvador. Para ofrecer el rico pan que con tanto amor prepara.  Es muy conocida y muchas personas la prefieren por ser una persona amable y muy  entregada en su negocio, además para ella lo más importante es que sus clientes encuentren un producto de buena calidad y al mejor precio. Sueña con ampliar su negocio y poder ofrecer a sus clientes mayor variedad de pan. Esto la ha impulsado a solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL con la esperanza que de esta manera su situación económica mejorará. Desea invertir en la materia prima para la producción del pan como: harina, azúcar, huevos, canela, agua, y demás insumos que le sean útiles para mejorar la variedad de pan que ofrece.
texts.en:
Juana Maribel A. is 43 years old and lives at home with her husband, four children, and a granddaughter. Doña Juana sells sweet breads in different areas of San Salvador. She resides in the town of Cujutepeque, but every day she travels in her pickup truck to different areas of the capital city of San Salvador, such as San Martin, Soyapango, and San Bartolo. Juana is well-known and many people prefer to do business with her because she is a kind person who is dedicated to her work. For her the most important thing is that her customers receive a good quality product at the best price. She dreams of expanding her business so that she can offer her customers a wider variety of bread. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral in hopes to improving her financial situation.

Juana wants to invest in supplies used in her production such as flour, sugar, eggs, cinnamon, water, and other items that will improve the variety of breads that she offers.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, eggs, cinnamon, water, and other supplies.

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Thadee

texts.en:
Thadee B. is 44 years old and is married with five children between the ages 6 and 15 years old. 

He sells bananas in his business. Thadee has four year's experience and he employees two people to help him.

Thadee has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to buy more quantity of bananas to sell. With the profits, Thadee  will purchase a field and build his own house.

loans.use: To buy more quantity of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 49 years old.  He is married to Leah, who is an assistant chief.  They are blessed with four children: Mary aged 22, Edward aged 20, Mumbi aged 16, and Gakuru aged 13.

Peter's primary business is farming but he also sells timber alongside, which he has been doing for the last six years.  The businesses earn him a monthly income of KES 40,000.

This is Peter's third loan cycle from KADET LTD.  He has managed to successfully repay his previous loans.  He will use this loan to buy more timber to resell.

Peter intends to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and increase his savings.  He hopes to supply timber to other towns in the future.

loans.use: To buy timber to resell

loans.name: Takku Liggey Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Takku Liggey est créé le 12 mai 2010 il en est à son troisième cycle; il est composé de neuf femmes qui mènent des activités de petit commerce et de coiffure.



La responsable Madame YAWMA est est âgée de 24ans elle divorcée sans enfant. Elle gère un salon de coiffure qu'elle a ouvert avec son premier financement. Sur la photo elle est debout à droite habillée en marron orange et a levé la main gauche.

Elle a une bonne expérience car elle a su très tôt faire des tresses et différentes coiffures pour dames. Les financements obtenus l'ont aidé à mieux s'équiper et rendre agréable son lieu de travail en achetant des chaises,un tapis, un miroir et autres accessoires de coiffure.

Son prêt lui servira à acheter des mèches pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et gagner plus de revenus.

Avec les bénéfices obtenus, elle paie la location et aide sa grande sœur avec qui elle vit dans la gestion de la maison.Elle s'occupe également de ses besoins et souhaite renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
The solidarity group called Takku Liggey was created on May 12, 2010. It is composed of nine women who have small businesses or do hairdressing. 

The group leader,  Madame YAWMA, is 24 and divorced with no children.  She manages a beauty shop that she was able to open using her first loan. In the photo, she is the person standing on the right, dressed in chestnut and orange, raising her left hand. 

She has a good deal of experience as she learned early on to do braids and various hairstyles for ladies. The loans she has received have helped her to buy equipment and make her workplace pleasant, buying chairs, a carpet, a mirror, and other beauty salon accessories. 

This loan will allow her to buy hair extensions so as to better satisfy her clientele and earn more money. With her earnings, she pays rent and helps her older sister, with whom she lives, with household expenses. She supports herself and hopes to put aside more in savings.

loans.use: To buy materials for her beauty shop.

loans.name: Delma

texts.en:
Delma is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with one child. 

Delma has a retail shop that sells electronic loads of several networks like GLOBE & SMART. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional electronic loads from several networks.

Delma is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Delma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional electronic loads from several networks

loans.name: Lasiti

texts.en:
Lasiti is 40 years old. He is married and a father of two children. He is a farmer and he has been doing this for the last four years. His farm is in a productive area that has proved to be good for wheat farming. He learned about KADET through a KADET customer who was already registered. This will be his first loan, which he is planning to use to prepare his wheat farm.

He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to increase his wheat production and educate his children.

His hope and dream is to become a large-scale farmer, buy a bigger piece of land and build a plot. He is an energetic man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to prepare his land for wheat farming

loans.name: Danson

texts.en:
Danson is a hardworking 38-year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with three children ages six, eight and 11. His children attend school. Danson has been providing for his family for the last 14 years by selling households goods. He supplements his income by providing transport with his hand cart. 

Danson is requesting an 80,000 KES loan to buy shoes, slippers, mats, batteries, energy-saving cookers, soap, and electronic sockets to sell. In the next five years he hopes to expand his business by at least 50% from its current value. Danson’s dreams and aspirations are to own a big business and become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a variety of goods to sell

loans.name: Giovanni

texts.en:
Giovanni is 37 years old and single. His occupation is selling all types of wood such as firewood and wood planks. First, he buys the wood and then he drives it in a truck a couple hours from his house to sell. Giovanni continues this cycle of buying and selling all year. 

He is asking for a loan so that he can buy the wood and then sell it for profit. He has had this business for about three years and has been very successful. He promises to pay the loan back because he has a set amount of income from his business. In this way, his loan is very risk-free.

loans.use: to buy more wood to sell.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora  Margarita se dedica a la venta de  abarrotes desde hace cinco años  es una señora muy trabajadora, también se dedica a la  venta  de comida  ya que le deja  muy buenas ganancias.
Tiene  cuarenta y dos  años de edad  es una persona muy reconocida   ya que  atiende muy bien a  sus clientes.
La señora Margarita  tiene la cantidad  de  dos hijos  Fernando de  diez años de edad y  Gustavo de  veinte  dos años de edad.
Esta muy contenta  por que sus sueños  se están haciendo realidad  gracias a su esfuerzo y  trabajo.
Ella pidió el préstamo para  para  la compra de mas mercancía para que cuando sus clientes vayan a comprar vean que  su tienda esta bien surtida.
Le da las gracias a fundacion por el apoyo que le ha dado para  salir adelante  y cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Margarita is a hardworking woman who has been selling groceries for the past five years. She also sells prepared foods, especially because she is able to earn good profits. She is forty-two years old and she is a very well-known person, given that she attends her clients so well.

Margarita has two children: Fernando is ten years old, and Gustavo is twenty-two years old. 

She is very happy because she is attaining her dreams, thanks to her efforts and handwork. She requested a loan to purchase more merchandise so that when her clients come to shop they will find the store well-stocked.

She is thankful to Fundacion (Kiva Field Partner) for the support given to her to move forward and to attain her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase grocery store merchandise to stock her business.

loans.name: Concepción Lastenia

texts.es:
La Señora Concepción es socia del banco comunal Bankito Progresista, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es muy visitada por la belleza de su centro colonial, esta bañada por 4 ríos, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones, la gran variedad en su gastronomía cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños.
 
La Señora. Concepción tiene 35 años, vive en unión libre y ha concebido 3 hijos de 14, 10 y 2 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en el colegio y su segunda hija estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como albañil, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
Doña Concepción se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de la marca Yanbal hace 5 años, vende todo el tiempo que tiene libre ya que labora en los quehaceres de una casa medio día y lleva en este trabajo 5 años.

En el banco comunal se encuentra en su tercer crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos para incrementar sus productos.

Su meta es llegar a ser directora de la marca Yanbal.
texts.en:
Sra. Concepción is a member of the Communal Bank “Bankito Progresista” (Little Progressive Bank). She lives in Cuenca, which is the most visited city because of the beauty of its colonial center. Cuenca is surrounded by four rivers and its people have maintained their culture and traditions. A large variety of cuisines are available to captivate the taste buds of both locals and foreigners alike.

Sra. Concepción is 35 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has three children (ages 14, 10, and 2). Her eldest daughter is a high school student and the second daughter attends an elementary school in the city. Her husband works as a bricklayer. They do not own a home, so they live in a rental property.

Doña Concepción has been selling Yanbal cosmetics for five years. She sells on a full-time basis, but whenever she has free time she will work half a day as a housekeeper at a private home. Concepción has also had this job for five years.

Concepción is receiving her fifth loan with the Communal Bank and will invest the money in the purchase of cosmetics so that she can increase her inventory. Her goal is to become a sales director for the Yanbal brand.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Verónica

texts.es:
La Sra. Verónica es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, es madre soltera de dos hijas a las que crió con esfuerzo propio de su trabajo, adquirió su pequeña vivienda. Actualmente se desempeña como maestra de educación primaria en un colegio de la localidad donde tiene muchos años de laborar.
Tiene varios años de trabajar con Ceprodel donde se le han otorgado 5 créditos todos para mejorar su vivienda. Una de las necesidades que tiene en estos momentos es adquirir un préstamo para la compra de ladrillos, puertas, verjas y ventanas para mejorar dicha vivienda en cuanto a sus condiciones y seguridad.
texts.en:
Verónica is from the town of El Sauce. She is a single mother with two daughters that she has brought up on her own, and with her own income she bought a little house. Right now she works as teacher in a local primary school where she has worked for many years.

She is a member of Ceprodel and she has had five loans in order to make improvements to her home. Right now, in this very moment, what she really needs is a loan in order to buy bricks, doors, iron gates, and windows in order to upgrade the house for the security of the family.

loans.use: to buy bricks, doors, iron gates, and windows

loans.name: Carmelina

texts.en:
Carmelina is married, with 5 children. Carmelina is 60 years old and lives in San Miguel, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.  Carmelina planned to have a sari-sari store to earn a living, and this is her new business.  She has requested a loan of PHP20,000 to build a store and purchase groceries to sell as her new business.
Carmelina has been a member of PMPC for more than 1 year. In the future, Carmelina hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to build a store and purchase groceries to sell as her new business

location.town: Liloy-San Miguel, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: María Fernanda

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Unidas Por Un Futuro Mejor se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora María Fernanda. Tiene 35años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 4  hijos de 14, 10, 7 y 5 años, el  mayor  estudian en  colegio y los menores en escuela. Su esposo es taxista.

Doña María Fernanda es maestra por contrato y trabaja en una escuela de la localidad desde hace dos años, pero ella para ganar dinero extra también se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, lo que más vende es ropa de niños ya que la mayoría de sus clientes son padres de familia de la escuela donde ella labora y compañeras de universidad ya que está estudiando su último semestre para sacar su licenciatura y con esto tener mas posibilidades de conseguir un nombramiento del estado en la escuela donde trabaja. Ella lleva tres años dedicada a sus ventas y le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio   y le gusta porque los créditos le han ayudado a salir de muchas situaciones difíciles. 

Sus sueños es obtener su licenciatura y conseguir un nombramiento en una institución educativa.
texts.en:
The community bank "Unidas Por Un Futuro Mejor" (United for a better future) meets every fortnight in the Montecristi canton, which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts which are recognised on a national and international level as being the birthplace of the famous straw panama hats.  

This is where María Fernanda lives. She is 35 years old, married and has 4 children of 14, 10, 7 and 5 years of age. The older children study at high school and the younger ones go to primary school. Her husband is a taxi driver. 

María Fernanda is a teacher and has worked in a school in the neighbourhood for two years on a contract. However, to get some extra money she sells all types of clothing, but she mostly sells children's clothing to the parents of the children who go to the school where she works and to her classmates at university where she is in the last semester of her degree. This degree will open up more possibilities of receiving a letter of appointment to the school where she works. She has been selling clothing for three years and she has done very well with it.

This loan will be used to buy pants, shirts, tops and children's clothing. Maria Fernanda has been with the community bank since it began and she likes to use their services because their loans have helped her out of many difficult situations. 

Her dream is to get a degree and be appointed to an educational institution.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, tops and children's clothing.

loans.name: Layla Del Socorro

texts.es:
Doña Layla es madre de tres hijos, tiene la edad de 40 años, hoy en dia cuenta con dos trabajos para apoyarse economicamente, labora como docente en un preescolar y elabora piñatas en donde por largos años ha venido trabajando. Sus tres hijos estan estudiando, y espera que se formen en la educacion para un porvenir mejor.
Ella ha venido mejorando su casa de concreto, aun falta mucho por hacer, ya que todo esta caro y va trabajando por parte, con este nuevo financiamiento hara el baño, y la compra de un inodoro, tubos para las aguas negras, y poder lograr una higiene mejor, cada mejora la esta haciendo con los prestamos en Afodenic, y asi poder equilibrar los gastos basicos del hogar, gastos escolares, gastos personales. Medicina. Contenta por que atraves de las dificultades, esta saliendo adelante con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Doña Layla is the mother of 3 children. She is 40 years old and works 2 jobs in order to support herself. She works as a teacher in preschool and makes piñatas, something she has been doing for many years now. Her 3 children study and she hopes that they will have a good education so as to have a better future.

She has been improving her concrete house but still has a lot to do as everything is expensive and she is doing it a little at a time. With this new loan she is going to build the bathroom, buy a toilet and sewage pipes to have better hygene.
