She is making each improvement with the loans from Afodenic and in this way she can balance the basic household expenses, school fees, personal expenses and medicine. She is happy that despite diffiuclties she is moving ahead with her children.

loans.use: to build a bathroom and buy a toilet and sewage pipes.

loans.name: Liliane

texts.en:
Liliane is 30 years old and is married with two child who are 7 and 8 years old. She has owned a small boutique (store) selling soap, sugar, books, pens etc. for the past of 3 years. Her business is well-organized and she works from 6am until 6pm every day, except Saturdays.

Liliane has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more soap, bread, juice, cooking oil, and others. She plans to reinvest the profit in her business and to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more soap, bread, juice, and cooking oil

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo lives with his family in the village of Disimuray, Cauayan City, Isabela. He is 50 years old and a father of three children. Two of the children are currently in school. Eduardo is a farmer who grows corn. He has 35 years of experience in this field and, through his harvests, he manages to provide food for their family needs. 

At this time, Eduardo is requesting a loan of PHP 40,000 to buy fertilizers and seedlings for his farm business. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings for his farm business

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is 38 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala South region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past three years, Rosemary has been working hard to manage her video store, which sells video tapes. 

To help expand her business, Rosemary has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more video CDs and DVDs for resale, and will help Rosemary generate greater profits to buy food for her family. Rosemary hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Rosemary is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Rosemary who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more video CDs and DVDS for resale

loans.name: Cidalia

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Matutuine, Província de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, viuva e mãe de 7  filhos todos maiores de idade. Nunca te oportunidade de estudar porque os pais nao a deixaram quando era crianca. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta mais um neto que vive com ela. 

Saiu de Matutuine para o Distrito de Boane quando casou, é negociante dedica-se a venda de produtos diversos ha mais de 20 anos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 3.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria(BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amigo que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu sexto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para dar continuidade a obra  da sua casa(ferro, areia, cimento, pedra,blocos  e outros).Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 6.000.00mt, 7.000.00mt, 10.000.00mt, 12.000.00mt, e 15.000.00mt,para o negocio e habitação.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende terminar a obra da sua casa e ampliar o seu negocio construindo um estabelecimento comercial, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Cidalia was born in the Matutuine district, Maputo Province, in southern Mozambique.  She is a widow and has 7 children who are all grown. She never had the opportunity to attend school because her parents did not allow her to attend when she was a child.  She owns the home where she lives with her family and she also supports a grandson who lives with her.   

She left Matutuine for the Boane district when she got married.  She is a merchant and has sold a variety of products for over 20 years.  She earns around 3.000.00mt per month, which she uses for household expenses and savings in her bank account (BIM).

She has never had a loan with other banks.  She learned about Hluvuku from a friend who is also a client.  This is her sixth loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 20.000.00mt, which she plans to use to purchase construction materials to continue building her home (iron, sand, cement, stones, concrete block, etc.).  The prior loans were for 6.000.00mt, 7.000.00mt, 10.000.00mt, 12.000.00mt, and 15.000.00mt, for her business and housing.  

She promises to make her payments on time.  In the future she plans to finish construction on her home and to expand her business by building a shop.  She plans to request additional loans from Hluvuku for these purposes.

loans.use: to purchase materials to continue construction on her home (iron, sand, cement, stones, concrete block, etc.)

loans.name: Sao

texts.en: Sao is 48 years old and a loving father of eight children. It’s quite a big family, so Sao has to try hard in his farming work to be able to raise his children. His current profits can’t satisfy his family’s needs. In order to solve this living condition, he decided to start another business, collecting and selling firewood throughout the community. And now he is looking for some funds from HKL and Kiva to buy two buffaloes for use in his new business.

loans.use: to buy two buffaloes for use in his new firewood business.

loans.name: Takk Ndingue Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 09juillet 2002. Il  est  composé de onze femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le commerce.

Madame Mouskeba qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 63
 ans. Elle est mariée sans enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge quatre autres enfants confiés par ses parents.

Elle s’active dans la vente de petit déjeuner. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, qu'elle  pratique depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was set up on 9th July 2002 and is made up of eleven women who live in the same district. Their main activity is trading.

Mouskeba, who is on the right of the photo and raising her hand, is in charge of the group. She is 63 years old and married with no children. She does, however, have four other children entrusted to her care by relatives.

She sells breakfasts and has good experience in this domain, as she has been doing this for several years. This loan will allow her to strengthen her capital and develop her business more easily. The profits she makes will allow her to improve her family's living conditions (health, food, clothing, etc.) and to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar and coffee

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El comité “San Cayetano, se conformo con la iniciativa de una de las miembros, actualmente se encuentran  en el segundo ciclo de programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya, con doce integrantes. Ellas demuestran unión y solidaridad las unas con las otras. Todas ellas son mujeres muy sacrificadas,y de escasos recursos.
Una de las miembros es la señora Antolina, quien nos cuenta que tiene una despensa pequeña pero bien surtida, donde acuden sus vecinos para poder surtirse. Comenta que tiene muy buena venta, lo cual la ayuda a poder tener los ingresos necesarios para mantener sus familias.
Antolina solicita el crédito para la compra la compra de bebidas, comestibles, panificados y demás insumos necesarios para poder surtir su local. Agradece por la oportunidad que se le esta dando.
texts.en: The San Cayetano Group was formed by one of its 12 members, and they are currently in their second loan cycle for women in business with the Fundación Paraguaya.  The have shown unity and solidarity amongst themselves.  They are all very giving women of humble means.  One of the members is Antolina, who shares with us that she has a small, but well-stocked, grocery store where her neighbors come to buy supplies.  She says that she has very good sales, which lets her have the needed income to provide for her family.  Antolina is asking for a loan to buy beverages, food, bread, and also fertilizer to stock her store.  She is thankful for the opportunity that has been provided.

loans.use: buy beverages, food, bread, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 49 years old and married. She is from Labuyo, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. To make a living, Monica raises and breeds pigs to sell. 

Monica has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. Monica joined GDMPC in 2009 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase pig feed. In the future, Monica plans to improve the general living conditions of her family and have children.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed

loans.name: Believe In God Group

texts.en:
Umu is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Umu was born in Makeni city. She is married to a retired councilor and the couple has five children, three of whom are attending primary or secondary school.

For eleven years now, Umu has been selling “gara lappers” (locally dyed cloth). Umu and her group members have collectively applied for a loan of 3,200,000 SLL from SMT and Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Umu is going to use her share of the loan (800,000 SLL) to buy gara lapper-making materials – ink, caustic soda, powder, white cotton cloths, etc. in order to produce a large quantity of gara cloths for sale.

loans.use: to buy materials to make gara lapper - a locally dyed cloth.

loans.name: Rosa Ma

texts.es:
Rosa es clienta de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia:

Rosa es casada, su esposo se llama Fidel, y tiene cuatro hijos. Ella es una persona que lucha para salir adelante, quiere tener una estabilidad económica y pretende con ello en unos años más tener una vida tranquila.

Ella tiene un negocio de venta de artículos religiosos desde hace 15 años donde elabora rosarios, lazos, pulseras y cristos. Todos sus productos los realiza manualmente con ayuda de su esposo e hijo, sus clientes son negocios de casas de novias en diferentes estados del país como Michoacán, Morelos, Veracruz e Hidalgo. Aparte, en sus ratos libres le dedica tiempo a la iglesia.

Con este préstamo pretende invertir en su negocio comprando cristal cortado, cadena, alambre, cristos, broches, madonas y cristal de segunda. Gracias al trabajo en su negocio Rosa ha logrado terminar de construir su casa y hacer prosperar su negocio; su principal reto es seguir hacer creciendo su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the group “Kubo Financiero”, and this is her story: She is married, her husband’s name is Fidel, and they have 4 children. She is a person who works hard to get ahead, and she wishes to obtain economic stability, so that her life in the coming years may be more pleasant.

During the last 15 years she has been running a business of religious artifacts, making rosaries, bows, bracelets and crosses. These are all hand-made items that she makes with the help of her husband and their son. Her customers mainly include bridal shops in different regions of the country (like Michoacán, Morelos, Veracruz e Hidalgo). She dedicates her free time to activities in the church.

Rosa plans to use this loan to invest in buying supplies for her business, like lead glass, decorative chains, wire, crosses, brooches, virgin statues, and second-hand lead glass.

Thanks to her work Rosa was able to finish with the construction of her house, while also developing her business. Her main challenge is to continue to make her business grow.

loans.use: to buy supplies like lead glass, wire, crosses, brooches, etc.

loans.name: Bejamin

texts.en:
Most Kenyan rural smallholder farmers like Bejamin practice mixed farming for subsistence. As a result, they earn very little and live hand-to-mouth. It is imperative that the approach to this farming needs to be changed by way of educating farmers and guiding them financially, practically as well as commercially which will help them to economize their methods, enabling them to make a better return on investment.

Bejamin is a mixed farmer with a wife and six children. He lives in Ndaragwa, which is a rural village in Kenya with a very cool climate. For the last 20 years he has been doing farming, consuming and selling milk, eggs and a variety of food crops into the local market.

Bejamin finds dairy farming to be the most enjoyable. After attending Juhudi Kilimo agribusiness training, he is seeking a loan to purchase a high quality breed dairy cow to boost dairy production.

With your funding, Bejamin is set to start making real profits from commercial farming. The milk market has no direct competition from foreign counterparts. Bejamin is also planning to save costs and make additional income from by-products. He will get fertilizer from composting manure, which is useful in agriculture, biogas will be produced to run household cooking and dung can be used for plastering hut walls. In the future, Bejamin is looking at the possibility of generating electricity if the number of animals is sizable.

Extra income from this expansion, however, will first meet the education expenses of his children. The family will also enjoy improved diet from the increased milk production.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 39 years old, married, and has five children, who are all in school.

Jocelyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Jocelyn has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. 

Jocelyn requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Norayma Isabel

texts.es:
Norayma una persona emprendedora desde siempre, quien ha emprendido varios negocios con el fin de encontrar una sostenibilidad económica y sobre todo poder dedicar su tiempo a su hija, está incursionando en el mundo de la belleza con sus servicios a domicilios de cepillado, maquillaje, arreglo de uñas, etc. Con el cual ha generado ingresos para sostener su hogar.

Espera crecer mucho más su negocio, en un futuro poder tener su propio local de belleza y posicionarse en el mercado de un forma segura.
El crédito será utilizado para adquirir productos de belleza (maquillaje, plancha, sprays, cremas de peinar, etc.) con los que podrá ofrecer un servicio de mejor calidad.

loans.use: adquirir productos de belleza (maquillaje, plancha, sprays, cremas de peinar, etc.) con los que podrá ofrecer un servicio de mejor calidad.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 38 years of age, married and a mother of four. Her children are all in primary school. She has been a member of mercury women group for the last two years. She saves with group and her savings have accumulated to $225. She sells mainly maize grains, beans, Irish potatoes and vegetables. She earns about $28 a day and this helps her to buy the necessary items to be used at home. She is working very hard to give her children a better life than what she got.

loans.use: Mary has been saving some money and she wants a top up to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Sedaget

texts.en: Sedaget F. has recently opened a new internet café in the town of Khachmaz located in the North Eastern part of Azerbaijan. She is another one of Azerbaijan’s growing number of young women entrepreneurs. Sedaget is looking for funding so that she can purchase new computers to serve a growing client base.

loans.use: Computers for internet cafe

loans.name: Foini

texts.en: Foini recounts the story of her and her husband’s taro plantation:  Her family had always relied on remittances from sisters and brothers overseas for income.  But three years ago, she and her husband became determined to stop depending on the money their family sent.  They started planting taro in their backyard as a way to earn their own independent income and support their children.  Foini is applying for a loan to help support the growth of her plantation.  Already she and her husband are able to sell three to four bags of taro at the local Fugalei Market twice each week.  Their hard work brings them a weekly income of ST 250 – 300 (approximately USD 100 – 120), which allows them to provide independently for the basic necessities of their large family.

loans.use: Buy equipment: fencing, knives, gloves

loans.name: Maria Ninfa

texts.es:
Maria is married and her husband works as a machine operator. They have 3 small children ages 3, 1 1/2 and 6 months. Her husband's low salary does not allow them to provide for the family's needs. For this reason, Maria decided to start her own business selling gold jewelry two years ago. At first she received some sales help from her sister-in-law and then went out on her own. With three children, her expenses have increased considerably. She now has various customers who enjoy her products as well as the payment plans she offers to help them make purchases.

Maria is seeking a loan in the amount of $200 to acquire merchandise and therefore continue her growth and increase her sales, particularly to help cover the very high costs of supporting her youngest son. She is offering to repay the loan in 3 months. She very much appreciates your assistance with helping her support her family and grow her business, which will allow her to offer them a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

María esta casada y su esposo trabaja como operario, tienen 3 hijos pequeños de 3 años de edad, 1.5 años de edad y 6 meses, con el sueldo bajo que percibe su esposo no pueden sustentar a las necesidades de su familia, por ello María decidió empezar con su negocio de venta de joyería de oro hace dos años atrás, inicialmente le ayudaba a su cuñada en las ventas y después ya se abrió de manera independiente, ya que con tres hijos el gasto se incremento considerablemente y ahora ya tiene varios clientes que gustan de los productos que ella ofrece y los planes de pago que les da para que puedan adquirir sus productos.

María esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 200 para poder comprar mercadería y así continuar con su crecimiento e incrementar su ventas especialmente para la manutención de su hijo más pequeño que son muy altos, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 3 meses y ella te agradece mucho el apoyo que le das para poder mantener a su familia, crecer y así poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

loans.use: Acquire merchandise

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel is married and lives in the town of Cadereyta in Nuevo Leon. After getting laid from his previous job and finding it difficult to find employment, the family's expenses started to accumulate and he started his own business selling sweets and fried foods.

That was 18 years ago. Little by little he started stocking more products and based on his customers requests added items such as soft drinks and videogames.

Manuel is requesting a loan in the amount of $925, to be repaid over 6 months, to remodel and expand his shop, allowing him to offer better service to his customers. He and his family thank you for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Manuel es casado y vive en la localidad de Cadereyta en Nuevo León, después de que lo liquidaron de su anterior empleo y al ver la dificultad para encontrar otro trabajo, las deudas familiares comenzaron a acumularse y para poder cubrirlas inició su propio negocio con la venta de frituras y dulces desde hace 18 años, poco a poco fue surtiendo mejor y a petición de sus clientes fue incorporando la venta de otros productos, como refrescos y el servicio de máquinas de videojuegos.

Para darle un nuevo impulso a su negocio ahora Manuel está solicitando un préstamo de $ 925 dólares que empleará en la remodelación de su tienda para ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, él se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. En tus manos está el bienestar de esta familia, no lo pienses más, Manuel agradece sinceramente tu apoyo.

loans.use: Remodeling of his shop

loans.name: Mumbeja

texts.en:
Mumbeja is a 52 year old widowed mother of 7 children and with her big heart she cares for 15 other children. In a gated, railed corral, she sells charcoal. She is known by everyone, for everyone uses charcoal for cooking. She has been in business for 13 years. The bags that she is standing next  to are 100kg each. Customers come in with half gallon plastic containers, which she then fills and sells.

With her loan she hopes to buy more charcoal and her dream is to expand her business for her children.

loans.use: Mumbeja plans to use her loan to buy more bags of Charcoal

loans.name: Felicita Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea has a very successful catering business in Lima. People call her to cater birthdays, business lunches, and other special occasions. Up until two years ago, she also worked for a restaurant where she learned everything about the business, but had to quit that job because of painful arthritis in her leg. She has also had to reduce the amount of her loans due to the expensive treatment she is receiving for this problem.

Even though Andrea is facing tough medical challenges, her zest and determination for her business won’t let anything stop her. When she has a catering job, she prepares what she can ahead of time from her kitchen in her home, and then she transports everything to the catering location by taxi. She has a set of pans and appliances that she brings with her to prepare the rest of the food on location, and has four or five people to help her, depending on the size of the catering job. She prepares a lot of Italian and Chinese food, but the most common is the popular Peruvian ‘comida Criolla’. Christmas is a very busy time for her: she receives many requests for cooking Christmas day turkeys, and she can currently prepare six turkeys, for which she charges 60 Soles ($20) a piece. She would love to have the capability to prepare more!

Andrea has five children, ages 32, 31, 29, 27, and 25, all now independent and working in Lima. Andrea’s dream is to expand her kitchen to enable her to prepare more food at once. She would especially like more counter space and a larger oven. She is also in the process of designing business cards to hand out and has very creative ideas for her logo! When asked if the loans help her, her eyes light up and she gives a very enthusiastic ‘yes!’. She says they help her immensely, and she is very excited for this loan of $350 to be able to invest in her business cards, more pans, and a blender.

loans.use: To invest in business cards, more pans, and a blender.

loans.name: Khanim

texts.en: Khanim (her husband is pictured) was born in 1957 and is the mother of 3 children.  Khanim breeds sheep to sell. Now she needs a loan of $725 to buy 10 additional sheep for improving her business.

loans.use: To buy 10 sheep

loans.name: Kigombya A(Ii) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for one year. Doren is 40 years old and married with nine children. She sells charcoal for a living. She wants to use the extra profits to pay school fees for the children and build rental houses. Jane and Peace have retail businesses and want to use the loan to increase their stock. Peace sells second-hand clothes. Aidah lays bricks.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To add in stock in the charcoal business

loans.name: Rashid's Group

texts.en: Since 1984, Rashid, together with some of his group members, has been going as far as Masindi, Tanzania, in search of business. They are involved in buying goats, cows, and sheep for sale in Busaana, their hometown. From the way things are going, they are in business but only with the boost given by loans, which they have been getting for 3 years now. The rest of the members each have businesses of their own. Rashid is 34 years old and married with 13 children, as he cares for 3 children that belong to his late brother.

loans.use: Rashid plans to buy more goats, cows, and sheep with the loan.

loans.name: Sophoin

texts.en:
Miss Sophoin C., 34, is single and lives with her sister. The family lives on Koh Dach Island on the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Miss C. is in the business of weaving silk. She has been a silk weaver for twenty two years. It’s a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products in her village.

Miss C. is requesting her third loan, asking for $200 to purchase silk for weaving. Based on her business success so far, she will have no problem in repaying the loan to MAXIMA.

loans.use: To purchase silk for weaving

loans.name: Maria Trinidad

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria Trinidad Guervara L. is a member of the “Vision 2000” Communal Bank. She sells groceries, vegetables, and other products is her own home located on Marginal Avenue, Fernando Belaunde Terri Nº 374 Road, in the district of San Hilarión, Picota Province. She studied infirmary technology, but she always like business, so she decided to start her own business to support her two children. With a loan of $925.00 which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy a variety of groceries such as: sacks of rice, sugar, various soups, boxes of different brands of soap, packaged toilet paper, canned fish, oil by the liter, cartons of eggs, and boxes of milk. She is 41-years-old and she always stood out as a fighter -- responsible, hard-working and persistent. She dreams of being a dairy producer and selling to other cities.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Maria Trinidad G. L., socia del Banco Comunal “Vision 2000”, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, verduras y otros productos, su negocio esta ubicado en su propia casa ubicada en la av. Marginal , carretera Fernando Belaunde Terri Nº 374, del distrito de San Hilarión ,departamento de San Martín, Provincia de Picota. Estudió enfermería técnica, pero a ella siempre le gustó el negocio, así que decidió poner algo propio y así sacar adelante a sus 2 hijos. Con el crédito de S/. 2500.00, para ser pagado en 6 meses, comprará, diversos abarrotes como: sacos de arroz, azúcar, menestras de diversos variedades, cajas de jabón de diferentes marcas, papel higiénico en paquetes, conservas de pescado, aceite por litros, huevos en javas, leche en cajas. Tiene 41 años siempre se a destacado por ser una mujer luchadora, muy trabajadora responsable y perseverante, sueña con ser productora de leche y comercializar a otras ciudades.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her general store.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.fr:
Mr. Daniel K. was born in 1974 in Lomé where he currently lives. He abandoned his schooling early on, and began an apprenticeship as an upholsterer. He is currently practicing this trade with great difficulty. He is married and the father of 1 child. He is applying for a loan to buy tools for his work and raw material that he will use to practice his trade.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Monsieur Daniel K. est né en 1974 à Lomé où il réside actuellement. Ayant très tôt abandonné ses études, il entre en apprentissage comme tapissier ; métier qu’il exerce actuellement avec beaucoup de difficultés. Il est marié et père d’un (01) enfant. Il sollicite un prêt pour acheter ses outils de travail et les matières qu’il utilise dans l’exercice de son activité.

loans.use:
Purchase of tools for the trade

Achat de materiels de travail

loans.name: Suon

texts.en:
Mr. Suon D., 45 years old, offloads cement from trucks into factories. Normally, he hires some laborers to help him with the process, paying them when he is remunerated by the factory owner. Suon’s wife has a business making and selling food to the workers from a food stand, earning, on average, $5 per day. Suon’s wife is a good cook and in the future she wants to open a small restaurant. He has requested a loan of $1,000 from Kiva to expand his wife’s food stand, with the remaining money to be used to pay for his laborers’ wages until the factory owner pays him later in the month.

His wife is pictured because Mr. Suon Dara was not available.

loans.use: To expand his wife's food stand and pay for his laborer's wage.

loans.name: El Ceibo Group

texts.es:
The group called “El Ceibo” has been working with Pro-Mujer for the last several years, finishing their tenth cycle. Currently it has 13 active associates who have shown to be a well organized group as it relates to their loan quotas. Within the group, the majority are married with an average of 6 children. They feel in need to look for additional sources of income since the necessities of their children are always increasing.

There are various businesses within the organization such as sales of food, dairy products, and cereals; the main activity, however, is the making of wool skirts (polleras) and other clothing for the local women (typical clothing used in the altiplano region). They sell their clothing at the 16th of July fair, which only allows them to sell twice a week, for this reason they need a loan to rent store space where they can offer their clothing all the days of the week. This will enable them to generate more income and continue to maintain the well being of their children.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

La asociación denominada “El Ceibo ” trabaja junto a Pro-Mujer hace ya varios años cumpliendo su décimo ciclo, a la fecha cuenta con 13 socias activas que han demostrado ser un grupo organizado en cuanto a sus cuotas de crédito. Dentro el grupo la mayoría son casadas y con un promedio de 6 hijos, se ven en la necesidad de buscar otras fuentes de ingresos ya que las necesidades de sus hijos aumentan cada día mas.

Existen diferentes negocios dentro la asociación como ser; la venta de comida, de lácteos, cereales, pero la actividad principal es la confección de polleras y ropa en general para cholitas (vestimenta típica en algunas regiones del altiplano ) luego venden sus productos en la feria de la 16 de julio, pero esta feria solo les permite vender dos veces por semana por lo que necesitan crédito para poder alquilar tiendas para ofrecer sus prendas todos los días, de esta manera generar mayores ingresos que les permita ofrecer bienestar a sus hijos.

loans.use: They need a loan to be able to rent spaces for their businesses.

loans.name: Mrs. Dul Sam Arth Village Bank Group

texts.en: This group consists of eight members in Boeng Krum Kraom Village in Kandal Province and Mrs. Dul S. A. is the group president. She works as a fish seller in the local market. She sells the fish which her husband catches. However, Mr. Sao Ven now faces a problem because he does not have enough nets to catch his fish. Therefore, his wife, Mrs. Dul S. A. has decided to ask for a loan to buy more fishing nets so that he can catch more fish. Mrs. Dul S. A. is 29 years old and the mother of two. One of her children attends school whilst the other is only three years old.

loans.use: to buy more fishing nets in order to gather fish to sell.

loans.name: Ludith

texts.es:
La señora Ludith, socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Organizadas”, vive en el Departamento de San Martín y Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Distrito de Huicungo. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a  la venta de cosméticos y  comidas en el kiosco de la escuela Nº 0419, sus clientes son los alumnos y profesores.
 
Con este crédito de S/. 3,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará productos de belleza en oferta como perfumes, colonias, desodorantes, joyas, esmaltes, talcos, etc., de esa manera poder surtir su negocio y luego los vende al precio de catalogo, generando un mayor margen de utilidad a su favor. También comprará arroz, plátano, papa, huevos, panes, galletas, caramelos, dulces, gaseosa, Kekes, frugos (pulpin, cifrut). Y los insumos que a diario necesita para preparar los platos que oferta a sus clientes.

Judith tiene 43 años y es soltera. Siempre se ha destacado por ser una mujer trabajadora y buena administradora. Su meta es continuar con sus negocios para aumentar sus ingresos y seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Mrs. Judith, member of the "Organized Women" community bank, lives in the suburb of San Martin, in the province of Mariscal Cáceres in the district of Huicungo. For three years she has been selling cosmetics and food in the school corner shop # 0416. Her clients are students and teachers. With the 3,000 soles loan which will be repaid in 6 months, she will purchase on-sale beauty products, such as perfumes, colognes, deodorant, jewelry, nail polish, and talc. In this way, she will be able to supply her business with products to later sell at catalogue-price, and generate a greater profit margin. She will also purchase rice, bananas, potatoes, eggs, breads, crackers, candy, sweets, soda, kekes (andean pastry), frugos, and other products which she needs to cook the dishes she sells. Judith is 43 years old and is single. She has always stood out for being a hard-working woman and a good manager. Her goal is to continue with her business to increase her income and continue ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase on-sale beauty products as well as rice, bananas, potatoes, eggs, breads, crackers, candy, sweets, soda, etc.

loans.name: Khalida's Group

texts.en:
Khalida baji is the wife of M. A. and lives in an area called Riwind in city Kasur, Pakistan. She has been living in this area for the last 11 years. She is the mother of five children: two sons and three daughters. All of her children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Khalida baji's husband works in a factory. Khalida baji herself has a clothes sales business. She has been in this business for the last 5 years. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more clothes to resell.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Ashia baji wants a loan to repair an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Samina baji wants a loan to buy more clothes to resell. Irshad baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to resell

loans.name: Adiza

texts.fr: Née le 15 septembre 1985 à Lomé, Mlle S. Adiza est revendeuse de pains. Très dynamique et travailleuse, elle s’est très tôt lancée dans ce commerce pour vite se prendre en charge. C’est une activité très rentable mais qui nécessite de moyens financiers ce qui lui manque cruellement. Elle sollicite un financement pour acheter en grande quantité afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et dégager plus de profit.
texts.en:
Born on September 15, 1985 in Lomé, Miss S. Adiza is a bread saleswoman. Very dynamic and hard working, she started out in this trade very early on in order to be able to quickly take care of herself. It is a very profitable activity, but one that requires financial means which she painfully lacks. She is requesting financing to buy large quantities of supplies in order to better satisfy her customers and to bring in more profit.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying bags of wheat flour for bread manufacture

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of cloth for sewing clothing

loans.name: Baroat

texts.ru: Бароат кредитор в Микроинвест уже пятый год.Она пунктуально работает с нами.Её ассортимент товара детская одежда.Она хочет пополнить свой товар зимней детской одеждой и обувью.Бароат благодарна за финансирование всем инвесторам.Её бизнес увеличился во много раз благодаря кредитам.
texts.en:
Baroat has been a client of MicroInvest for the past five years, and she makes her payments on time. She has an assortment of children's clothing, and hopes to expand her line of children's winter clothing and shoes. Baroat is grateful to all the investors for their financial assistance. Thanks to these loans, her business has grown many times over.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Children's Clothes

loans.name: Jamil

texts.en:
Jamil L. is a hard-working man, aged 46. He is married with 5 children. L. runs a metal workshop in Zana which he set up in 2001. With a need to expand his business, he is using the loan proceeds in purchasing steel bars and metal sheets.

L. is skilled at making gates, doors, windows, fence poles and metallic furniture. The income from the business enables him to sustain his family. He has a plan to set up a poultry farm in his village so as to supplement the income he earns from the metal workshop. He hopes that the income from the two businesses will enable him to educate his children.

loans.use: Purchasing steel bars and metal sheets

loans.name: Presley

texts.en:
Presley C. is from the village of San Lorenzo, Ilagan, Isabela. He is 29 years old and married to Jonalyn who works as an elementary teacher in their public school. They already have a daughter named Alyssa Preslyn, one year old. The couple works hand in hand for the progress of their family.

Presley decided to join ASKI, the MFI providing the loan, in order to improve his store. He came up with this kind of business because he wanted to help his wife to earn a living because her income is limited. He would like to receive a loan of PHP 6,000 that he can use to purchase more stock for his store, and he also plans to buy a piglet to start in the hog-raising business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en:
Augustina D. is a widowed mother of five children: three girls and two boys. The first-born is in senior high school while the rest are in the junior high and primary schools. She is 39 years old.

Augustina lost her husband barely a month ago and is still in the period of mourning, hence her dark dress. She lives with the children in a rented apartment in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the residents, the men in particular, is farming.

Augustina runs a provisions shop to make some earnings to provide for the children. She sells provisions like milo (a chocolate malt milk beverage), milk, bread, tea bags, oats, etc. Augustina’s shop is by the roadside. She also trades in other goods such as cosmetics, fabrics, slippers, etc., from the nearby towns. She procures her goods from Kumasi and Accra at cost-effective prices. Augustina has been in business for 24 years.

She says she wants a loan to buy the materials in bulk and expand her business. It is her dream to help her children to have access to a good education.

loans.use: To procure provisions

loans.name: Jairo Jose

texts.es: Don Jairo es agente de la Policía Nacional, desde hace seis años, brinda su servicio de seguridad a los Nicaragüense las desventaja es que el salario es bajo, tiene 30 años, reside en el barrio Enrique Bermúdez, su esposa le tiene dos hijos los cuales estudian, ella se dedica a la venta de cosmético ambulante para apoyar a las necesidades de su familia. Con este crédito va a comprar materiales de construcción para hacer un muro en la parte de atrás de su casa para tener  seguridad para su familia ya que lo tiene con zinc y desea que sea mas seguro. Sus planes es poder hacer las mejoras necesarias en su casa para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Jairo has been a member of the Nicaragua National Police Force for six years. The disadvantage is that wages are low. Jairo is 30 and he lives in the Enrique Bermúdez district.

He and his wife have two children, both at school. His wife sells cosmetics door to door to support the family.

He will use the loan to build a wall behind his house to provide his family with more security, since the current wall is made of zinc is not so secure.

He plans to make necessary improvements in his home for his family's welfare.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to build a wall behind his house

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es: Leonor tiene 37 años, es casada y tiene dos hijos con los que vive en su casa del campo. Se dedica a la compra y venta de verduras que compra por chacra, para ella toda planta es negociable, y lo hace semanalmente en cada una de las ferias de su zona. Cada martes corta y prepara las plantas o verduras que venderá en el mercado de Tarma, su esposo la apoya con el transporte hasta el mercado, y de ese modo, con esta actividad puede cubrir la educación de su hijo mayor que está forjándose en una carrera técnica en la ciudad. Leonor se siente muy feliz y dichosa por el trabajo organizado que lleva con su pareja, ahora están viendo la posibilidad de comprarse un terreno en la ciudad, para evitarse trasnochar y salir de madrugada de su pueblo cuando llevan sus productos, asimismo poder darle mejor comodidad a su hijo. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y está muy motivada de ingresar en su banco comunal, para aprender a manejar su negocio y sus ahorros, por lo que hace compromisos de pagar puntualmente cada una de las cuotas señaladas. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de una chacra de alverjas, para después venderlas al por menor, así reunirá las ganancias para solventar la educación de su hijo.
texts.en:
Leonor is 37 years old, is married and has 2 children who live at her house in the country. She purchases and sells vegetables that she buys for the farm, for her every plant is negotiable, and she does it weekly in each of the markets in her area. Every tuesday she cuts and prepares plants or vegetables to be sold in the market in Tarma, her husband helps to transport them to the market. Thus, this activity can cover the education of their oldest son, who is forging a techincal career in the city. Leoner feels very happy and blissful for the organized labor she does with her partner. They are now looking to buy a plot of land in the city, to avoid being out late and leaving early in the morning from their town when they bring in their products. At the same time they can give their son more comfort.

This is her first loan with MFP. She is very motivated to invest in the village bank, in order to learn how to manage their business and savings; they have made commitments to pay on time whenever due. The money she requests will buy farmland for peas, which she will then sell at retail and collect the profits for her son's education.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy farmland for peas.

loans.name: Nfoh

texts.en:
Born on January 25, 1942, Pa Nfoh Michael is married to Ma Nfoneh Margaret and they have been blessed with three children, one of whom is still under 15 years of age. Pa M. and his family live in a seven-room apartment in Ntasem neighborhood in Nkwen.

Due to circumstances beyond his control, Pa Nfoh didn’t have the privilege of a basic education or an apprenticeship to learn a trade, because his parents were poor. Even worse, his parents both died when he was still very young as there was no money to pay for needed medication. Pa Nfoh joined GHAPE in 2005, facing the need to bring up a good family on his own. Since then, he has borrowed and successfully repaid three loans and the profits from these loans has helped him to sustain his life and that of his family, as well as to cater for the school needs of his youngest child.

With this loan he plans to buy piglets, pig feed, wood, and chickens to resell in his home so as to reduce the distance that his neighbors must trek in order to obtain these items. He will use the profit generated by this business to continue to educate his children and part will be ploughed back into his business. He thinks his business will succeed because he has been doing this business for a long period of time. He is going to start repayments the fourth month after the loan has been disbursed.

Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account. Most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust with its clients.

loans.use: To buy piglets, feed, wood and chickens

loans.name: Loveth

texts.en:
Loveth P. sells provisions, drinks and foodstuffs. She is 39 years old and married with three children. 

She hopes for a loan of N70,000 (US$500) to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Farrukh

texts.en: T. Farrukh has a minivan with which he provides transportation services. Having attended to this business for four years, he has gained a rich experience. Initially he rented a car, but in time, after making certain savings, he bought his own minivan. The business is stable and generates the main, considerable income for Farrukh’s family allowing an improvement in living conditions. Currently his minivan needs some repairs. That’s why he needs a loan of 2,500 Somoni to purchase the spare parts. Farrukh thanks everyone supporting him and promises to repay the loan with accuracy. The well-being of this family is in your hands. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase needed spare parts to repair his minivan

loans.name: Komlanvi

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est marié et père de 02 enfants, il habite le quartier d’agoè zongo avec sa famille. L’activité génératrice de revenu qu’il exerce pour subvenir aux charges de sa famille est le commerce en gros de l’eau en sachet appelé « PURE WATER », cette activité lui réussit bien. Il reçoit des commandes tous les jours. Il veut rehausser son stock et sollicite  pour cela de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 850 sachets d’eau « PURE WATER » et un nouveau congélateur.
texts.en:
This gentleman is married and the father of 2 children. He lives in the Agoè Zongo neighborhood with his family. The business he undertakes in order to support his family is selling bagged water ("Pure Water" brand) wholesale. This business is going well; he gets orders every day. He wants to expand his stocks and is therefore asking WAGES for a loan to buy 850 bags of "Pure Water" and a new freezer.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of bags of water for resale

loans.name: Evans Wangila

texts.en:
Evans W. is 40 years old, married, and has four children. He repairs motorcycles in Chekulo, a small town in the Western Province, and has been in this business for the last ten years.

Evans is taking out his first loan from KADET Ltd and was introduced to KADET by an existing client. He is going to use this money to buy more parts and inventory for his motorcycle repair shop, which will enable him to improve his business by repairing all the motorcycles that are brought to him. Evans also hopes to employ one person to help him manage the business.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy more parts and inventory for a motorcycle repair shop

loans.name: Iris Concepción

texts.es: Iris Concepción R. D. vive en la capital de El Salvador junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 11 y 2 años de edad,  Iris maneja su propio negocio  obtiene ganancias con las que ayuda a su esposo a los gastos del hogar, el negocio de Iris es un comedor y pupuseria ubicado en una de las calles principales de San Salvador donde la afluencia de personas es mucha, Iris es muy reconocida en la zona y sus ventas son muy estables el crédito lo solita para compra de materia prima para aumentar producción de su comida.
texts.en:
Iris Concepción R. D. lives in the capital of El Salvador with her husband and two children ages 11 and 12. Iris runs her own business. She gets earnings to help her husband with the household expenses. Iris’ business is a restaurant, and she sells “pupusas” (corn tortillas stuffed with cheese, beans, and pork, then grilled). It is located on one of the main streets in San Salvador, and it is a heavily trafficked area. Iris is very well known in the area. Her sales are very stable. The loan she is asking for is to buy raw material to increase her food production.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw material for her food

loans.name: Pagaran

texts.en:
Pagaran B. is from the village of Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 28 years old. Pagaran is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Pagaran owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle services to local community members. Pagaran has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Pagaran joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pagaran is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Pagaran from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Amigas D. Santa Bárbara”  que esta ubicado en el distrito D. Juliaca, Provincia D. San Román, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 50 años D. edad, estado civil casada y es madre D. 03 hijos (todos ya independientes), la señora Juana estudio secundaria incompleta (3er grado), vive en el Barrio Santa Catalina.

La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 5 años, con un préstamo inicial fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio D. carpintería.

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo D. S/. 700.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra D. chocolates, caramelos, gaseosas, yogures, chisitos, galletas, etc. para venderlos en su tienda escolar.

Su deseo es aprender diseños en tejido a palito.

A ella le gusta la puntualidad y las charlas
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the "Las Amigas D. Santa Bárbara" communal bank, that is located in the district of Juliaca, San Román Province, Puno state. She is 50 years old, married and a mother of 3 children that are independent. Juana studied until the 3rd year of secondary school and lives in the Santa Catalina neighborhood. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos organization for 5 years, with an initial loan of 300 Nuevos Soles which she invested in her carpentry business. Currently, she is requesting a loan of 700 Nuevos Soles, for the purchase of chocolates, caramel candies, sodas, yogurts, "chisitos" (puffed cheese snacks),cookies, etc. to sell in her school store. Her wish is to learn designs in weaving. She likes punctuality and chats

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chocolates, caramel candies, sodas, yogurts, "chisitos" (puffed cheese snacks),cookies, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Comprar una camioneta usada.

loans.name: Women Of God Group

texts.en:
Women of God is a group of five borrowers led by Eva M., a single 20-year-old woman who has thus far achieved an 11th grade education. She lives with her parents in Virginia, a newly built community for poor people who can't afford to buy  town lots north of the capital, Monrovia, Liberia.

Eva's business is selling foodstuffs such as onion, pepper, milk, salt, garden eggs, etc. She buys them wholesale and retails them in the Dualla market, north of the capital, Monrovia, Liberia. In business for two years now, she hopes to develop the enterprise to the point where she can eventually open a shop.

Because Eva depends on her business to pay for her school fees and her daily needs, she places a premium on developing and maintaining a good relationship with her customers to encourage them to continue buying from her.  Payment of her school fees reduces her business capital and savings, so she needs this loan in order to purchase more foodstuffs in order to improve business.

Eva dreams of improving her living standard and continuing her education to the highest level.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs in order to improve the business.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha P. is from the village of Quezon, Balingasag, Mis. Or.. She is 44 years old and married with four school-aged children. To make a living, Editha owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Editha has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately $150 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Editha joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Editha is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Elva

texts.es:
Elva es una mujer muy responsable de 36 años, tiene 4 hijos y vive con su pareja en su casa propia.
Desde hace 15 años se dedica a la venta de comestibles en su pequeña tienda que implementó en su casa. Adicionalmente, prepara comida a pedido o cuando es tiempo de cosecha de café y llegan varios jornaleros para trabajar en las chacras.
La mayor cantidad de tiempo la pasa en su bodega, atiende todos los días, a partir de las 6 de la mañana ya está barriendo el perímetro de su casa para que su tienda luzca muy atractiva. 
Esta actividad le agrada muchísimo, pues no es difícil, ya que conversa con sus clientes, se mantiene entretenida y de paso va captando las ganancias para cubrir las necesidades de su hogar, y eso la hace muy feliz.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y en su banco comunal es una eficiente y muy responsable tesorera, que cumple a la cabalidad su función.El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de comestibles para su bodega, y con la otra adquirirá fertilizantes para sus cultivos de su esposo.
texts.en:
Elva, 36, has 4 children and lives with her partner in their own house. For the past 15 years she has sold food items from a small store she set up in her home. Additionally, she prepares food to order or, during coffee harvest time, when many day workers come to work the farms. She spends most of her time in her store which is open every day. From 6am on you can find her sweeping the perimeter of her house so that her store will look more attractive. She likes her work very much for it isn't particularly difficult and she can chat with her customers, who keep her entertained and, incidentally, provide her with earnings enough to meet her home's expenses; that makes her very happy. This is her second loan with MFP and she is the treasurer of her communal bank, a task she carries out efficiently and responsibly. The money she is asking for now will be used to stock her store with food items and the other part to buy fertilizers for her husband's crops.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Noelina

texts.es:
La señora Noelina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Corazón de Jesús”, Distrito de San José de Sisa, Provincia del Dorado, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 36 años y es madre de 04 hijos, 02 que aun depende de ella. 

Anteriormente Noelina, se dedicaba a la venta de cosméticos, hoy en día lleva 03 años dedicándose a la venta de abarrotes. Noelina, tuvo que pasar por altas y bajas, para llegar a ser una pequeña empresaria y administrar su propio negocio y generar sus propios ingresos, sin dar cuentas a nadie. 

Con su esfuerzo y vigor, llego a implementar su bodega, es muy conocida por sus clientes en el barrio donde vive y sus ventas diarias son buenas. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio ubicada en su misma casa, en un local muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, comprará más productos para surtir su negocio como arroz y azúcar en sacos, insumos para el aseo personal, gaseosas en paquetes y productos variados para mantener contenta a su clientela. 

Ella es una mujer con muchas ganas de salir adelante para el bienestar de su familia y de ella misma. Manifiesta su agradecimiento al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer y apoyar a otras mujeres que también quieren salir adelante.
texts.en:
Sra. Noelina is a member of the Heart of Jesus Communal Bank, located in the District of San José de Sisa, El Dorado Province, Department of San Martín. She is 36 years old, in a common law marriage, and has four children of whom two are still dependents.

Noelina previously sold cosmetics, but now she has her own grocery store and has been in business for three years. She endured several highs and lows to get the point where she is now. Noelina is able to generate her own income without having to report to anyone.

She invested a lot of strength and energy to open her store, which is now well-known among her customers in the neighborhood where she lives. Her sales have been very good. Noelina continues to manage her store out of her home, which is well-suited for accommodating her customers.

With this loan of 2000 soles, she will buy more products to restock her store such as sacks of rice and sugar, personal hygiene products, packs of sodas, and other different products to keep her customers happy. Noelina is eager to move forward for the sake of her family. She thanks Manuela Ramos for helping her grow as an entrepreneur and supporting other women who want to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to increase her inventory

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Christiana is a farmer. She owns five acres of land where she plants cassava, plantain, pineapple, yams and okra. She loves farming because it gives her joy when she sees her customers eating her farm produce.

Christiana is 58 years old and is married with five children. Her husband sells building materials to support the home.

Christiana is hoping for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more seedlings to plant. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more seedlings to plant

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi is twenty-seven years old. She is divorced and has given birth to two children who are both in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana.

Esi works hard to be able to provide for her family. She is a food vendor. She buys bags of maize from nearby farming communities and prepares and sells kenkey (fermented corn and cassava dough, wrapped in corn or banana leaves) with fried fish which she sells on a table by the roadside.

Esi has been in business for over ten years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy supplies.

loans.name: Agnes Kabbaseke 's Group

texts.en:
Agnes is 27 years of age, married with three children.  All her children go to school The family resides and owns a two roomed house where she stays with five people. She takes care of additional family members.  The family has access to electricity and no piped water at home.  The family has three meals a day. Her greatest monthly expenses include paying utility bills, medication and feeding the family. Harriet owns a stall in Nakawa market selling yellow bananas and on average she receives  20 customers a day. She has done this business for over twenty years. She doesn’t incurs transport costs  because she buys from her place of workHer main challenges are seasonality and thieves  She sells on retail and wholesale .She has been with MCDT for ten  years servicing her twentieth loan >Harriet  wants to use this loan to use this buy clusters and bunches of bananas. She is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and own and start going directly to farmers.
.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of yellow bananas

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris is 52 years old, a widow with 5 children. She lives with her children in Benin City, Edo State. Life as a widow has been challenging for her. She sells used clothes at retail prices to her customers. She has been in this business for a long time. Doris hopes to own a boutique in the future. She also hopes to grow her business. She is requesting the loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more used clothes to sell. She is itching for expansion in her business and improvement in her family's living conditions. She duly says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “Virgen de Fátima” esta representada por la señora Evelin y conformado por 12 socios de los cuales 11 son mujeres y con la participación de un varón, este banco se caracteriza por ser muy responsables y a la vez unidos. El señor Freddy que es parte del grupo es una persona muy trabajadora y un padre abnegado   y su pequeño hijo es su fuerza de trabajo, el trabaja en el trasporte público como taxista para poder llevar el sustento a su familia, su mujer lava ropa en diversas casas para colaboraren el ingreso económico de la familia, el socio vive en este momento en alquiler pero tiene un pequeño lote de terreno donde quiere construir su vivienda y poder darle una mejor calidad de vida a su pequeña familia. El resto del grupo se dedica a diferentes actividades, la mayoría son promotoras de cosméticos, venden  comida ya sea de manera ambulante o en puestos fijos. El grupo en general tiene bastante experiencia en los negocios que desempeñan, como también existen otras que recién empezaron con sus negocios. Si bien la competencia en general es bastante amplia, el grupo cuenta con experiencia y también con clientes fijos que reconocen su trabajo y demandan sus servicios, por otra parte es importante el entusiasmo que ponen en sus trabajos. El destino del crédito será utilizado como capital de operaciones, unos comprarán más productos, otros comprarán víveres y para poder arreglar su instrumento de trabajo. La mayor expectativa que tiene el grupo es poder tener unos negocios fructíferos donde con su esfuerzo y dedicacion puedan mejorar sus ingresos de forma honesta y trabajadora para crecer darles a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida. El banco no tiene mucha experiencia en créditos solidarios ya que es si primer ciclo pero por lo que demuestran en las reuniones son gente entusiasta y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Virgen de Fátima” is led by Sra. Evelin and comprised of twelve members, consisting of eleven women and the participation of one man. This group is known for being very responsible and yet united as a single unit.

Sr. Freddy is part of this group. Not only is he a very hardworking person, but he is a devoted father to his young son. Freddy works in the public transportation sector as a taxi driver to support his family. His wife contributes to the family income by going to different homes and providing laundry services. At the moment, Freddy is renting his home, but he has a small plot of land where he hopes to build a house and provide his family with a better quality of life.

The rest of the group is involved in various business activities. Most either sell cosmetics or food as traveling vendors or from a permanent location. In general, the group has enough experience to carry out their businesses. Others have just recently started their businesses. While competition continues to increase, the members know how to deal with it and obtain regular customers who appreciate their work and continue to demand their services. In addition, it is important for the members to show enthusiasm for their work. This loan will be used as operating capital to buy merchandise, acquire provisions, and repair work equipment. Their greatest expectation is to have successful businesses in which their hard work and dedication result in an honest improvement in their income. This will help them provide their families with a better quality of life. This Communal Bank has limited experience with solidarity loans. Even though they are just starting their first loan cycle, they have demonstrated in their meetings that they are enthusiastic and eager to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Albino

texts.es:
Albino tiene 38 años, está casado y tiene 3 hijos. Vive en la localidad de “Palmapampa” (selva central peruana) en su casa propia.

Dormirse en sus laureles nunca fue una opción para él, ya que en anteriores años laboraba en la agricultura, pero en la actualidad trabaja en el sector de construcción, sumadas ambas actividades lleva 20 años de arduo trabajo. Ocasionalmente recibe la ayuda de sus familiares, pero siempre trabaja a cargo de sus ayudantes, además se siente contento con el trabajo, ya que le inspira mucha creatividad e innovación cuando quiere hacer un mueble de acuerdo a los gustos y preferencias de sus clientes. Es por ello que le va muy bien en su negocio, ya que lo otorga buenos resultados. En el futuro quiere implementar su taller de carpintería adquiriendo herramientas modernas que le puedan generar mayores volúmenes de  muebles en un tiempo más corto.

Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con sus respectivos pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más madera con el propósito de cumplir con sus pedidos.
texts.en:
Albino is 38, married, and has three children. He lives in Palmapampa (central Peruvian jungle) in his own house. Resting on his laurels was never an option for him. In previous years he worked in farming, but now he works in the area of building. Counting both activities, he has 20 years of arduous work. At times he receives help from his relatives, but he always takes care of his helpers when he works. He is happy with his work. It inspires a lot of creativity and innovation when he wants to make a piece of furniture according to his customers’ tastes and preferences. That is why it is going very well for him in his business, and he gets good results. In the future he wants to set up a carpentry shop. He wants to get modern tools that will allow him to generate a greater volume of furniture in a shorter time. This is his second loan with MFP, and he promises to keep making his payments. He will use the money he is requesting to buy more wood in order to finish his orders.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wood

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet is divorced with children and her children go to school. She owns a two-room house where she stays with seven people. The family has access to electricity but no piped water. Annet takes care of additional family members. Monthly expenses include medication, rent, school fees and feeding the family. Annet owns a stall selling bananas in Kiwatule and sells to all categories of people at retail only. She works six days a week. Annet receives at least 15 customers a day. Annet has been in this business for many years and her business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She has been with MCDT for a few years servicing her eighth loan. She wants to use this loan to increase her stock by buying more bunches of bananas. She hopes to see her business grow bigger and start going directly to farmers. She joined MCDT because she wanted her business to grow and MCDT was working with poor women.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Toch

texts.en:
Toch S., 47, is married and lives with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorian temples. She produces hand-made brooms and sells them to earn an income of about USD 2 per day. Her husband is a motor taxi driver, earning an income of USD 3 per day to help cover the family expenses.  

Mrs. S. is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase a motorbike for the children to commute to school. She would like to use any additional profit to repair their house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. S.'s husband is pictured instead of his wife.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Sedreddin

texts.en: Sedreddin H. was born in 1958. He is married and has 2 children. The family lives in the city of Baku. He has been in the taxi business for four years. He needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy spare parts for his car to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his car

loans.name: Mirla Macrina

texts.es:
Mirta tiene 42 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos en el distrito pesquero de Santa Rosa, un distrito que pertenece al circuito turístico de playas de la región Lambayeque y que se encuentra ubicado a 25 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de seis años a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su domicilio, su negocio goza de muy buena acogida gracias al buen trato que brinda a sus clientes. Adicionalmente cuenta con una mototaxi (motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para transporte de carga y pasajeros) con la que se genera mas ingresos, las ganancias que posee de estas actividades son de mucha ayuda para la economía de su familia, por lo que trata de mantenerlas siempre.

Mirta desea captar mas clientes para poder percibir mas ingresos y salir adelante, para ello desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas productos, por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que desea invertir en el logro de su objetivo.

Mirta es una mujer trabajadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, su mayor anhelo es poder crecer como empresaria para brindarle a sus hijos la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera superior. Anteriormente ella ya ha trabajado con Nuestra Institución, demostrando ser una cliente puntual y responsable al momento de asumir sus pagos
texts.en:
Mirta is 42 years old, married, and lives with her husband and two children in the fishing district of Santa Rosa, which is part of the circuit of tourist beaches in Lambayeque region. The district is located 25 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo. Mirta has been selling basic necessities and groceries out of a store in her home for more than six years. Her business has earned a good reputation thanks to the excellent service she provides to her customers. In addition, Mirta owns a motorcycle taxi (a motorcycle attached to a cabin used for transporting cargo or passengers) that helps generate extra income. The earnings from all of her business activities have been a great help in supporting the family and maintaining the household finances. Mirta wants to attract more customers so that she can improve her revenue and get ahead. In order to do this, she hopes to expand her business by acquiring more products. Therefore, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 500 PEN so that she can achieve her goal. Mirta is a hardworking woman who has tremendous desire to succeed. Her greatest wish is to grow as an entrepreneur and provide her children the opportunity to study for a college degree. She has previously worked with Edpyme Alternativa and demonstrated that she is prompt and responsible when submitting her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Daisy Jane

texts.en:
Daisy Jane C. is from the village of Taraka, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 23 years old. Daisy Jane is single. To make a living, Daisy Jane works in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from offering computer services to the local community members. Daisy Jane is just starting this business.

In 2010, Daisy Jane joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Daisy Jane is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used additional capital for her business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Daisy Jane from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy D. is a 28-year old married woman who lives in Gen. Luna St., Labangon Pob. Dalaguete, Cebu City.  She earns her living by operating a bakery business. Her husband, Ronald, 28, who is also a baker and Daisy have three children between the ages of two months and five years old. 

Daisy joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 to improve her family's quality of living.  With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 30,000.

Daisy is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 10,000 was used to fund operations of her bakery, and it had a positive impact in both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing for her fourth cycle loan, the amount of Php 15,000 to support her bakery. Daisy is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

---------------------------------
About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.
