loans.use: Additional working capital.

loans.name: Maria Leonor

texts.es:
La Señora María G. es socia del banco comunal Nuevas Amigas, vive en la  ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se caracteriza por ser la tercera ciudad más importante económicamente del Ecuador, su belleza arquitectónica, sus iglesias y ríos hacen de esta una ciudad encantadora.

La Señora María tiene 50 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos quienes se encuentran de 30, 27, 24, 23 años de edad, todos sus hijos son solteros, tres de ellos estudian, trabajan y le ayudan económicamente en su hogar, su tercera hija también trabaja, su esposo tiene un taller de mecánica propio, gracias al trabajo conyugal ha logrado construir su casa propia.

Nuestra señora se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y solo los días viernes se dedica a su negocio que es la venta de carne de res y pollo, también vende verduras, esta actividad la realiza hace 7 años.

Tiene una muy buena amistad con todas las socias del banco comunal, es socia hace dos años y medio; su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de productos para su negocio, su sueño es poder ayudarles a sus hijos para que terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
L Señora María G. is a member of the Nuevas Amigas (New Friends) Community Bank. She lives in the town of Cuenca which is the third most important town in Ecuador from an economic point of view. The beauty of its architecture, its churches, and its rivers make Cuenca an attractive town. María is 50 years old. She is married and has four children aged 30, 27, 24, and 23. None of them are married, and three of them are studying and working, and contribute to household expenses. Her third daughter also works. María’s husband has his own mechanic workshop. Through their hard work, they have built their own home. María works in the home, but on Fridays she works in her butcher’s shop selling beef and chicken as well as vegetables. She’s been doing this for seven years. María has a very good relationship with all the members of the group; she’s been a member of the bank for two and a half years. She plans to use the loan to buy products for her business. Her dream is to help her children complete their education.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy beef, chicken, and vegetables

loans.name: La Juquilita Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Luz Maydet A. Ramírez originaria del pabellón en el Estado de Guerrero es la presidenta del Gpo. La  Juquilita, es una persona que trabaja vendiendo zapatos por catalogo, ella  sustenta a   su familia, pues  es madre de un niño de 2  años y 6 meses, ella esta casada y tiene la edad de 26 años su máximo sueño es incrementar su negocio, como nos comenta que  este ultimo préstamo lo invirtirá en la compra de zapatos y dice que esta agradecida con la Fundación por que la apoyo con su negocio y que le gusta mucho la forma de trabajo de la Fundación a si como su tasa de interés y su bonificación y el trato del personal, también  menciona que ojala  Fundación les siga apoyando por mucho mas tiempo para que ellos puedan sacar adelante su negocio, el nombre del grupo es debido a que tienen una creencia muy arraigada en el pueblo por la virgen de Juquila haya en el estado de Oaxaca, en este grupo hay 10 integrantes trabajadoras que luchan por Salir adelante  y todas agradecidas con fundación realidad, por su confianza que les han brindado y la comprensión.
Las integrantes son Clara M. J. que se dedica a la venta de  pollos, Evangelista Hernández M. elabora tamales, Yazmín Alicia Ríos García vende de ropa,  Yanina M. J. se dedica  a la venta de comida,  Maricruz A.  C.  venta de comida, Gloria M. C.  se dedica a la venta de  tamales, Luz Maydet A. Ramírez  venta de calzado por  catalogo, Dayna Yánez M. ella se dedica a la venta de  perfume, Ángel Yair García A.  se dedica a la albañilería y Florentino L. Rodríguez que se dedica a la venta de agua de garrafón.
Ellos están muy contentos por el crédito que se les financio para el incremento de sus ingresos y comentan que su grupo esta muy unido  trabajando  en equipo.
texts.en:
Luz Maydet A. Ramírez is a native of the state of Guerrero. She is the president of the group “La Juquilita”, and works selling shoes by catalog to support her family. She has a 2½-year old child, is married and 26 years of age. Her greatest dream is to grow her business, and she tells us that this latest loan will help finance the purchase of shoes. She is thankful to the Foundation for the support of her business. She says that she very much likes how the Foundation works, as well as her interest rate, the rewards and the personal treatment. She also mentions that, hopefully, the Foundation will continue to help support her efforts for a long time so the group can grow their businesses. The Foundation got its name due to the town’s deep-rooted religious belief in the Virgin of Juquila. There are 10 hard-working members in the group, and they are all grateful to the Foundation for its confidence and understanding. The members are: Clara M. J., who sells chickens; Evangelista Hernández M., who makes tamales, Yazmín Alicia Ríos García, who sells clothing; Yanina M. J. and Maricruz A. C., who sell food; Gloria M. C., who sells tamales; Luz Maydet A. Ramírez, who sells shoes by catalog; Dayna Yánez M., who sells perfume; Ángel Yair García A., who is a bricklayer; and Florentino L. Rodríguez, who sells bottled water. They are very glad for financing to grow their businesses, and comment that the group is united and working as a team.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase shoes for women, men and children by catalog.

loans.name: Azeneth

texts.es: Azeneth P. O. cuenta con su negocio de manualidades donde elabora trabajos decorativos para mesa, distintivos, plumas, separadores, plumas y mas; para todo tipo de evento según el modelo, color que le pidan. Esta actividad la viene realizando desde un año en el que ahora quiere comprar material para seguir ofreciendo a sus clientes variedad de modelos y así estar preparada con material para cuando se le requiera de su servicio.
texts.en:
Azeneth P. O. has a craft business where she makes decorative table settings, badges, pens, dividers, and other items in different colors and styles for specific events. The work is performed based on orders she receives. Azeneth has been in business for a year and currently needs to buy materials so that she can continue offering her customers a variety of decorations. By having enough materials, she will be prepared whenever her services are needed.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase craft materials

loans.name: Benigno

texts.es:
Benigno tiene 31 años de edad, es soltero y vive en el distrito de Mochumí, un distrito agrícola que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra ubicado a cuarenta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la elaboración de vino desde hace dos años, el prepara esta bebida en su vivienda y luego la  ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y conocidos, adicionalmente se desempeña como profesor en una escuela de la localidad en donde vive. Con los ingresos que percibe de estas dos actividades el solventa sus gastos personales y apoya a su familia.

Benigno desea ampliar su negocio con la producción de mas vino, de modo que sus ventas puedan aumentar. Por ello ha creído conveniente comprar diversos insumos con los que pueda seguir preparando esta bebida, para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Benigno es una persona responsable y emprenderora. El gusta mucho de las actividades que realiza y siempre da lo mejor de si en su dia a dia. En la zona donde vive es bastante conocido y estimado por sus vecinos y amigos,
texts.en:
Benigno, 31, is single and lives in the Mochumí district, an agricultural district belonging to the province of Lambayeque and which is located forty minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For the past two years he has worked at wine-making. He prepares the wine in his home and then offers it for sale to his neighbors and acquaintances. Additionally he works as a school teacher in the area where he lives. With the income he receives from these two activities he covers his personal expenses and supports his family. Benigno would like to expand his business by producing more wine in order to increase his sales. To this end he believes it appropriate to buy various supplies with which to be able to continue preparing this beverage. To achieve his goal he finds it necessary for the first time to seek a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 1500 new soles. Benigno is a responsible and enterprising person. He enjoys his business activities very much and always gives his best in his daily work. He is well-known in the area where he lives and is held in esteem by his neighbors and friends.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wine-making supplies

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es: Lily arreglaba prendas y confeccionaba otras para sus hijas con la idea de hacer un taller, de esto ya hace 2 años, el mismo tiempo que lleva trabajando con Edaprospo y en el cual ah adquirido experiencia y puesto su propio negocio de Confecciones “ZuyNy”. Desde hace 1 año es presidenta del grupo “ Mujeres Emprendedoras”  el cual tiene 7 años y medio de haberse creado, junto a sus 8 socias esperan lograr sus metas particulares, en su caso poner su propio taller de confecciones o una boutique.
texts.en:
Lily used to make and alter clothes for her daughters with the idea of setting up a workshop. This was 2 years ago, the same time she has been collaborating with Edaprospo and in which she has gained experience and has opened her dress shop called “ZuyNy”. For the past year she has been President of the “Mujeres Emprendedoras” (Enterprising Women) group that has been established for seven and a half years. Its 8 members expect to reach particular goals which in her case is to set up her own dressmaking workshop or a boutique.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products and ingredients.

loans.name: Freda

texts.en:
Freda M., from the village of Brgy. Sta. Cruz, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya, is 46 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Freda owns and operates a general store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Engaged in her business for over nine years, she earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Freda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting her first loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI to purchase additional products to sell, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es:
Ana es una pequeña comerciante que ha crecido gracias a su tenacidad y el apoyo de la institución. La venta de cuajadas y tortillas que realiza de varios años, comenzando con poco dinero. También ante se dedicaba a vender desayunos.
Como madre soltera logro apoyar a sus hijos, y mejorar parte de la vivienda, pues le ah tocado muy difícil, pero entre mas trabaja, se siente animada por su objetivos de ventas.
Hoy con este préstamo desea invertir en su negocio. En la compra de varios quintales de maíz, leña, cal y cuajada en mucha cantidad, logrando vender a sus clientes, así como la captación de los mismos.
texts.en:
Ana runs a small business that has grown thanks to her tenacity and the support of the institution.  She has been selling cheese made from curdled milk and tortillas for several years, starting with little money.  She also used to sell breakfasts.  As a single mother, she has been able to support her children and make improvements to their home.  Even though she works a lot, she is inspired by her sales goals.  

She will invest this loan in her business.  She will buy several quintales (100 pounds) of corn, fuel, lime and cheese in large quantities to sell to her current customers and to attract new customers.

loans.use: To purchase corn, fuel, lime and cheese

loans.name: Sarantsetseg

texts.en:
Sarantsetseg S. is 36 years old and lives with her husband and three sons in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent, in Huvsgul province, Mongolia. Two of her sons attend a local secondary school, and her husband operates a transportation business between sub-provinces.

Sarantsetseg operates a hair salon in her own space. She began her business in 1997 after graduating as a hairdresser from vocational school. In 2007 she built a wooden house and opened her hair salon in it. Over the years she has built a stable operation and has gained much experience as a hairdresser.

In the future, she wants to improve her workplace and provide good service in a convenient environment for her customers. Sarantsetseg is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more beauty products and tools for her salon as well as to decorate her work place.

loans.use: To purchase more beauty products and tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For poultry farming

loans.name: Gelinda

texts.en:
Gelinda P. is from the village of Malinao, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 61 years old and married with seven adult children. To make a living, Gelinda owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. Her main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods, junk foods, breads and instant noodles in the local community. Gelinda has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP  a month.

Gelinda joined HSPFI in 2010 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gelinda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional products to buy and sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Gelinda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products

loans.name: Joseph Esekon

texts.en:
Joseph Esekon L. is twenty-five years old, married to Eunice Tergwet, and together they have two beautiful children. They live in Eldoret Town, and Joseph buys and supplies meat to retail shops in town. He has been in this business for two years now and he gets a monthly income of ten thousand shillings. 

Joseph plans to buy more meat to supply and also diversify by buying maize in bulk so that he can sell in small quantities because it is maize season in Eldoret now. This will be his first loan in KADET and he plans to buy more meat to sell and also to buy a new motorcycle for his business so that he can supply meat to a wider area.

In future, he plans to educate his children to the highest level of education, and also buy more motorbikes for his business and also hire people to help him.

loans.use: To purchase meat for sale.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba T. prepares 'Fante kenkey' (fermented maize dough) at Abura.  She is married to a driver. Demand for the 'kenkey' is increasing and so she is asking for the loan  to purchase more maize to prepare' kenkey' for sale. She assists her husband in taking care of the home. She anticipates using the new profit from her business to buy a plot of land.

This photo shows Araba in the process of preparing the 'kenkey' she sells.

loans.use: purchase more maize to prepare the 'kenkey' for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Tires and bodywork

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is a married woman with one child who is still too young for school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. She has operated a matatu (motor vehicle) business for the past seven years; town dwellers are her potential customers. In addition to that, she also operates a retail shop and charcoal-selling business that contributes to her other source of income. Caroline faces a major challenge of seasonality. During rush hours, the demand for transportation is high compared to the normal hours of the day. She hopes to purchase a bus for transport in the future. With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase a new tire to repair her matatu (motor vehicle). She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase a new tire to repair her matatu (motor vehicle)

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
La señora Virginia trabaja como educadora en una guarderia de niños menores; este trabajo lo va realizando ya hace ocho años. Y aprovecha los fines de semana para vender comida ambulando en calles comerciales de la ciudad de La Paz, ya que no cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo el cual la abandono hace mucho tiempo a ella y sus dos hijos. La señora Virginia es separada y tiene dos hijos. Vive en alquiler ya hace quince años, la casa esta ubicada en la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito lo utilizara para la compra de insumos para la preparación de comida (arroz, papa, carne, aji, etc.). Es así como obtiene sus ingresos para su hogar.
Es su primer crédito y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Virginia works as an educator in a nursery school. She has had this job for eight years. She takes advantage of her time during the weekends to sell food on the main streets in the city of La Paz. She does not have help from her husband because he abandoned her and their family a long time ago. Virginia is separated and she has two children. She has rented a home for 15 years. The home is located in the Pasankeri area in the city of La Paz.
The loan will be used to purchase ingredients used for preparing food (rice, potatoes, meat, chilies, etc.). This is how she makes an  income for her household. 
This is her first loan and she has received a favorable report from the socioeconomic analysis performed.

loans.use: to buy rice, potatoes, meat, chilies, onions, etc for her business selling food

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To expand business and make shop larger

loans.name: Gorgorlou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité GORGORLOU est créé le 16 février 2000. Il est composé de 15 femmes qui sont de quartier différents. Mais se réunissent mensuellement pour les activités du Banc Villageois. Elles sont pratiquement toutes des femmes qui font du petits commerce. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de Keur Khaly

Madame ISSEU S. (debout à droite de la photo et mise en médaillon en bas) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 54 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge des 05 autres enfants de sa sœur décédée.

Elle est détentrice d'une cantine au marché centre de la ville. Elle y vend des tissus et des vêtements. Comme activité secondaire elle fait de l'embouche bovine et ovine et de l'élevage de volailles. Elle a une expérience de plus de trente ans dans le domaine du commerce.

Son actuelle prêt lui permettra de renforcer sa capacité de production en matière de commerce et de mieux développer son élevage.

Son objectif à long terme est de construire une maison pour sa famille. Ses revenus financiers lui permettent de prendre entièrement en charge les besoins de ses enfants. En terme de réalisation elle a acheté un taxi pour son fils afin que ce dernier puisse se prendre en charge.
texts.en:
The Gorgorlou solidarity group was created on February 16, 2000. It is composed of 15 women who live in different neighborhoods. But they meet each other monthly for the activities related to Banc Villageois. Almost all of them are vendors. Their group belongs to the Banc Villageouis of Keur Khaly.
Mrs. Isse S. (to the right in the photo) is the group’s leader. She is 54 years old. She is married and the mother of five. In addition, she also  takes care of five children of her deceased sister. 

She keeps a cafeteria at the main market of their town. She sells fabrics and clothing there. As a secondary activity, she raises cattle, sheep and chickens. She has over 30 years of experience as a vendor.

Her loan will allow her to expand her production volume and to better develop her livestock business. Her long-term objective is to build a house for her family. Her revenues allow her to provide for her children fully. As a practical example, she has purchased a taxi for her son in order for him to be able to support himself.

loans.use: to increase her production volume

loans.name: Reyna Maria

texts.es: Reyna María se dedica a al destace de cerdo. Hace más de 5 años que inicio con este medio de vida. Es una persona muy luchadora y disfruta de su negocio, ya que la mayoría de sus clientes se encuentran satisfechos por  la buena calidad de cerdos que ofrece. Su esposo labora como agricultor ya que ambos aportan ingresos para su hogar y así mantener a sus 3 hijos a cargo, que todavía están menores de edad. Reyna solicita este crédito para la compra de concentrado, cerdos y otra comida para los cerdos. Su mayor desafío es ampliar su vivienda pues es aquí donde mantiene a sus cerdos y no tiene mucho espacio. Este es su quinto crédito, está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que desea acceder a otro crédito más adelante y se siente muy agradecida con la Institución por concederle el préstamo.
texts.en:
Reyna María's business is butchering pigs.  She has been in this line of work for 5 years.  Reyna is a real fighter and enjoys her business since most of her customers are satisfied with the good quality of the pigs that she sells.  Her husband works as a farmer and they both provide income for their household and support their three children who are still young.

Reyna is requesting this loan to buy pigs, concentrated feed and other feed for her pigs.  Her greatest challenge is extending her home since that is where she keeps her pigs and she doesn't have a lot of space.  This is her fifth loan and she is ready to make all of her repayments on time because she would like to access another loan in the future.  She feels very grateful to the institution for granting her this loan.

loans.use: to buy pigs, concentrated feed and other feed for her pigs

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es: Lorenza, de 42 años; es una valerosa madre soltera que cuida de su hijo Jefferson, de 8 años de edad. Con él que vive en casa de su madre ubicada en el caserío de Tiambra. Todas las mañanas se dirige a sus terrenos agrícolas que heredó de sus padres en el caserío de Chacapampa, donde siembra desde hace 9 años: papa y arveja. Pero según cuenta la extensión de su terreno agrícola es muy pequeña tanto así que a veces alquila otros terrenos agrícolas para poder sembrar en mayores cantidades. Pues tiene que trabajar con ahínco para poder cubrir los estudios de su pequeño hijo al que le dedica la mayor parte de su tiempo libre. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la tranquilidad que  le proporciona estar en el campo. “Cuando viajo a la ciudad de Tarma, para comercializar mis cosechas me aturde el ruido de los autos”, menciona. Ahora ella se está preparando para la cosecha de papa de la variedad “yungay” y “única”, que sembró hace algunos meses. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Santa rosa de Tiambra”, y este es el sexto crédito con MFP, donde agradece el apoyo que recibe para el trabajo que realiza en cada campaña agrícola.  Lorenza con el crédito solicitado comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico para esparcirlos en sus terrenos agrícolas.
texts.en:
Lorenza, 42, is a brave single mother who cares for her son, Jefferson, 8.  She lives with him in her mother’s house located in Tiambra hamlet.  She heads out to the fields she inherited from her parents every morning in Chacapampa hamlet where she’s farmed potatoes and peas for the last 9 years.  But, according to what she tells us, the size of her field is small so she also leases other fields in order to plant in greater amounts because she has to work very diligently to cover her son’s educational expenses; she dedicates most of her spare time to him.

What she enjoys the most about her work is the tranquility working in the countryside entails.  “When I travel to the city of Tarma to sell my crops the noise from the traffic befuddles me," she mentions.  Now she is preparing to harvest the “Yungay” and “Única” variety of potatoes that she planted a few months ago.

She is a member of the “Santa Rosa de Tiambra” communal bank and this is the sixth loan with MFP where she is grateful for the support she gets for the work she puts into each planting season.  Lorenza will use the requested loan to buy several sacks of organic manure to spread among her fields.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es: Ana Julia A. D. C. D. 57 años D. edad vive con su compañero D. vida y sus hijos en el departamento D. Santa Ana. Ella posee una tienda en su residencia la cual es muy visitada por las personas del lugar porque en toda ocasión encuentran lo que necesitan. Cada día aumenta más su clientela y no los quiere decepcionar y se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le dé la oportunidad D. comprar más productos para su negocio como bebidas, golosinas, sopas instantáneas, granos  básicos entre otros. Ana es una mujer que cumple sus metas, siempre se repite: "lo que me propongo, con la ayuda D. Dios, lo cumplo" Ella ha depositado toda su confianza en que através D. este crédito, logrará otro propósito, el D. dar a su familia la vida plena que se merecen.
texts.en: Ana Julia A. D. C., 57 years old, lives with her life partner and their children in the department of Santa Ana. She has a store in her home that is much-frequented by the people in her neighborhood because they always find what they need for any occasion. Every day her clientele increases and she doesn't want to disappoint them. She decided to ask INTEGRAL for a loan that will give her the opportunity to buy more products for her store like drinks, snacks, instant soups and basic grains, among other things. Ana is a woman who meets her goals, and she always tells herself "what I propose to myself, with the help of God, I accomplish". She has placed total confidence in the fact that through this loan she will achieve another goal, that of giving her family the full life that they deserve.

loans.use: to buy drinks, snacks, instant soups and basic grains

loans.name: Trinite Group

texts.fr: TRINITE est un groupe constitué de trois personnes et dont la présidente (celle qui a le doigt levé sur la photo) est nommée Honorine Chadassi. Les membres du groupe se connaissent compte tenu du fait qu’ils habitent le même quartier à Gbèdégbé à Cotonou (capitale économique du Bénin). Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Née en 1940 à Abomey dans le département du Zou au Bénin, Honorine Chadassi vit depuis environs trois ans au quartier Gbèdégbé à Cotonou. Honorine Chadassi est une veuve ayant trois enfants, tous scolarisés, dont deux sont à sa charge. Honorine Chadassi vit seule avec ses enfants et assure seule leurs différents besoins. Honorine Chadassi n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Honorine Chadassi mène comme activité, la vente de maïs et de charbon de bois de façon secondaire dans son quartier. C’est à Glazoué au Sud du Bénin que Honorine Chadassi s’approvisionne.  Honorine Chadassi a déjà deux ans d’expérience dans l’exercice de cette activité.  Ce prêt permettra certainement à Honorine Chadassi et à son groupe de rehausser le niveau de leur activité par l’augmentation du stock de leurs produits et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en: “Trinity” is a group of three individuals, whose chair (the one giving the thumbs-up sign on the photo) is Honorine Chadassi. The group members know each other thfough being neighbors in the Gbèdégbé district of Cotonou (the economic capital of Benin). With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group is seeking a loan from ALIDé. Born in 1940 in Abomey, in the Zou Department of Benin, Honorine Chadassi has been living in the Gbèdégbé district of Cotonou for about three years.  She is a widow with three children, all of whom are in school, and two of whom are her dependents. Honorine lives by herself with her children, and alone provides for the family needs. Honorine  Chadassi never attended school. In order to support herself, Honorine Chadassi sells corn and also charcoal in her neighborhood. She stocks up in Glazoué in the south of Benin. She already has two years of experience in this line of work. This loan will certainly allow to Honorine Chadassi and her group to expand the business activities by enlarging their stock, in order to attract more customers and increase revenues.

loans.use: to buy corn and charcoal

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es:
El Sr. Porfirio tiene 29 años de edad, vive en el Barrio San Miguel con su señora quien es ama de casa y está esperando un hijo.
Él trabajaba anteriormente como empleado de una ferretería siendo chofer, luego se independizó vendiendo ropas, champión y electrodomésticos, todos a base de pedidos que luego fue creciendo gracias a la cantidad de clientes que ha formado.
En esta ocasión solicita un crédito para la compra de mercaderías por la cantidad de clientes que le demanda los pedidos y aumentar de esta manera sus ingresos que le permitirán ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su señora y su hijo en camino.
texts.en:
Porfirio is 29 years old and lives in San Miguel neighborhood together with his wife who is a homemaker and expecting a child.

Porfirio used to work as an employee at a hardware store.  He worked as a driver.  He later started working for himself, selling clothes, sneakers and electrical appliances.  He made his sales to order.  His business grew thanks to the quantity of customers that he had acquired.

On this occasion, Porfirio is requesting a loan to buy merchandise to fill his customers' orders and increase his income.  This will enable him to offer his wife and son with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and clothes

loans.name: Bountal Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de solidarité est créé le 18 décembre 2001. Il est composé de 09 femmes qui habitent le même village. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce d'huitre, de l'huile de palme et de miel.

Madame Fanseyni qui est à gauche de la photo emmitouflée s'une écharpe est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 43 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants en sa charge.

Elle fait un petit commerce d'huitre. Elle pratique cette activité depuis plus d'une décennie.

Ce prêt lui permettra de mieux développer son activité et de répondre à la demande de ses clients.

les bénéfices lui permettront de prendre en charge les frais de santé et de nourriture de sa famille.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on December 18, 2001. It is composed of nine women who live in the same village. Their main business is selling oysters, palm oil, and honey. 

Madame Fanseyni who is on the left in the photo, wrapped up in a scarf, is responsible for the group. She is 43, married and raising two children. 

She has a small business selling oysters. She has been in this business for more than ten years. This loan will allow her to develop her business and respond to the demand of her customers. The profit will allow her to pay healthcare expenses and buy food for her family.

loans.use: to buy oysters.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.
 
Annabelle has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos to buy canned goods, snacks, breads and beverages.

Annabelle is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Annabelle hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, breads and beverages.

loans.name: Thai

texts.en: Mrs. Thai is a 36-year-old small businesswoman who lives in Siem Reap Province. To make a living, she sells meat to people who eat it with beer or wine and other drinks in the village. Her husband earns a daily income by working in a brick kiln as a supervisor. He makes a profit of approximately $3.50 per day to share some responsibility with Mrs. Thai. They are blessed with four children, all of whom are single. One of the children is employed as a temporary staff member for Metfone mobile company. Mrs. Thai would like to seek a loan to add more capital into her current business so she can purchase more meat and drink to sell. Mrs. Thai hopes she can extend the size of her business and construct a new house for her whole family to live in a comfortable house.

loans.use: to purchase more meat and drink to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther lives in Uganda. She is married and has five children, all of whom are in school. Esther lives in a home that she owns. She has access to piped water but not to electricity. Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family, school fees and medical fees.   

Esther has a business of selling second-hand shoes. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works five days out of every week. 

Esther sells her products at the market by means of retail.  

Esther has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of shoes.  

The main business challenges for Esther include transportation and the rainy season.  

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start importing clothes and also to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used shoes.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan tiene 46 años, es un  hombre pasivo y trabajador, vive en su propia casa  junto a su pareja Fermina de 44 años de edad y sus 03 queridos a quienes le brinda toda su atención. Juan aún cuando era joven trabajaba en las tierras de sus padres, pero hace 18 años cuenta con su propia parcela de 03 hectáreas cultivados con plantas de cacao y café.  La clave de su éxito radica en la creatividad y las ganas de trabajar, sus plantas están trabajadas de manera tecnificada porque recibe capacitación y talleres de manejo de plantas nativas, su producto con mayor demanda es el grano del cacao por la calidad del producto que los ofrece y fruto de ello percibe buenos ingresos económicos. Normalmente trabaja solo, pero en tiempos de cosecha contrata jornaleros, para que de esa manera avance con mayor celeridad en la extracción y selección de su producto. Con el crédito solicitado contratará jornaleros para que le apoyen en las cosechas y desmonte de malezas ya que junio a noviembre son temporadas de ardua cosecha. Su plan a futuro es seguir ampliando su producción agrícola para que de esa manera les brinde una mejor calidad de vida a sus queridos hijos. Este es su primer crédito, por ello se siente muy contento de saber que contará con el apoyo de todos ustedes, ya que así se sentirá seguro de avanzar con su trabajo y esta dispuesto a devolver puntualmente sus aportes programados. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles contratará peones para que le apoyen en la cosecha y sacar la maleza que crece en sus campos.
texts.en: Juan is 46, calm and hard-working.  He lives in his own house with his wife who is 44 years old, Fermina, and three children. When Juan was young he worked in his father's fields, but 18 years ago he acquired a 3-hectare farm planted in cacao and coffee.  His success stems from his creativity and hard work, and he has benefitted from technical training as well.  Cacao is his most sought-after crop, for the high quality he produces, and generates strong profits.  Juan generally works alone, but in times of harvest he hires day laborers on the farm to gather ripe fruit.  He plans to use this credit to hire workers in the June to November harvest period, allowing him to expand production and better his family's prospects. This is his first credit, and with the 3,000 nuevos soles he will hire workers to clear the fields and bring in the harvest.

loans.use: to pay farm workers

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El comité denominado Renacer es de la ciudad de Encarnación, está integrado por amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad. Está integrado por 13 miembros, todas ellas trabajan de forma solidaria y dentro de un ambiente de respeto y cooperación.
Todas ellas se definen como mujeres jefas de familia que día a día luchan para conseguir el progreso de cada una, no solo en el ámbito económico, sino también personal.
Una de las integrantes, Fabiana tiene 31 años, esta casada con el Señor Reinaldo que es un funcionario de la municipalidad, tienen 3 hijos todos viven bajo el mismo techo. Fabiana se dedica a la venta de especias(Remedios medicinales) y con los ingresos que ella tiene ayuda a su marido en los gastos de su hogar. Ella está muy orgullosa de lo que hace, ya que su trabajo es digno y muy honesto.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de más hierbas medicinales, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le brinda.
texts.en:
The group called Renacer is from the city of Encarnación. It is made up of friends and neighbors in that city.  It is composed of 13 members, all of whom work together in an atmosphere of respect and mutual cooperation. All define themselves as women who are
heads of their families and who fight day by day to help one another progress, not only economically but also personally.

One of the members, Fabiana, is 31 years old and is married to Señor Reinaldo, who is a municipal official.  They have 3 children and all live under the same roof. Fabiana sells herbs (medicinal remedies) and uses her income to help her husband with household expenses. She is very proud of what she does since her work is worthwhile and honest.

She requests the loan to buy more medicinal herbs so that she can meet the demands of her customers. She is grateful to the Foundation for the opportunity it is is providing her.

loans.use: to buy medicinal herbs for later sale.

loans.name: Rosalpina

texts.es: Rosalpina de 47 años de edad es soltera trabaja para la Alcaldia Muncipal de Juigalpa desde hace 9 años como auxiliar de RR HH. Esta solicitando  su 10mo credito para construir un muro de su casa ya que con las lluvias se le mete el agua del patio y quiere evitar que se le dañe su casa o que se enferme su familia.  Expresa sentirse muy agradecida por el apoyo que AFODENIC y Kiva le han brindado, pues anteriormente obtuvo 2 creditos financiados por kiva, uno para mejorar su casa y otro para comprar una computadora, lo cual le ha servido muchisimo a sus hijos que estudian.
texts.en:
Rosalpina, 47, is single and has worked in the Mayor’s office of Juiglapa for the past 9 years as a Human Resources Assistant.  She is requesting a loan for her 10th cycle, money to build a wall at her house since when it rains, the water comes in through the patio and she wants to avoid damaging her house or that her family gets sick.

She is thankful for the support that AFODENIC and Kiva have given her.  She previously had 2 loans through Kiva, one to improve her house and the other to buy a computer.  The computer has  been very helpful to her children who are in school.

loans.use: to build a wall

loans.name: Kattia

texts.es: Katia, tiene la edad 26 de años, está en unión libre, vive con su esposa y su hijo que es su mayor prioridad. Ella con el crédito va comprar unos terneros para el engorde. Ella lo que quiere es poder aumentar el número de animales a su poder. Ella quiere comprarlos pequeños para engordarlos y luego venderlos al mercado local. Ella quiere sacar el máximo de ganancias de este proyecto para ayudarle a su esposo con las obligaciones del hogar y tener ingresos extras y mejorar su bienestar familiar. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Katia is 26, in a common-law relationship, and lives with her husband and her son, who is her greatest priority.  She is going to use the loan to buy calves for fattening. 

What she wants is to be able to increase the number of animals she owns. She wants to buy them small to fatten them, and then sell them at the local market. She wants to earn the maximum profit from this project, in order to help her husband with the household expenses, have extra income, and improve the well-being of her family. 

This is the first loan she has received from FUDECOSUR. She hasn't had other loans before from regular banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered her a loan with better terms; and the interest rate is much lower.

loans.use: To buy calves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more mobile phones and prepaid cards for mobiles.

loans.name: Nanci Violeta De Jesús

texts.es:
La Señora. Nanci es socia del banco comunal Pan de Azúcar, vive por un hermoso sector de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es reconocida por su belleza arquitectónica, por su calidez y gentileza de su gente, esta ciudad cautiva con su  variada gastronomía.

La Señora. Nanci tiene 49 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos quienes son mayores de edad, trabajan y le ayudan económicamente. Su esposo es mecánico de profesión y labora en un taller de su propiedad, la casa en la que viven es propia.

Doña Nanci labora en diferentes actividades, trabaja en una fábrica donde confeccionan ropa, lleva 14 años en este trabajo y es en turnos rotativos. En sus tiempos libres vende ropa y cosméticos de la marca Avon y Yanbal.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 2 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir para la compra de pantalones, camisetas, blusas y ropa de niños para surtir su negocio. 

Su meta es tener su taller propio de costura.
texts.en:
Nanci is a member of the communal bank "Pan de Azucar". She lives in a beautiful sector of the city of Cuenca. It is a city that is renowned for its architectural beauty, and for the warmth and kindness of the people. It is a captivating city for its diverse gastronomy. 

Nanci is 49 years old, married, and from her marriage she has conceived 2 children, both of whom are grown, working, and contribute financially. Her husband is a mechanic by profession and he works from a workshop on their property. The house in which they live is their own property.

Nanci works in different activities. She works at a production plant where they make clothing. She has been employed for 14 years and they use rotation cycles. During her spare time she sells Avon and Yanbal brand clothing and cosmetics. 

She has been a member of her communal bank for 2 years and this new loan will be invested in the purchase of pants, t-shirts, blouses, and children's clothing to supply her business.

Her goal is to have her own seamstress workshop.

loans.use: to purchase pants, t-shirts, blouses, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Walter Antonio

texts.es: Walter tiene 23 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Desde hace mas de 5 años que tiene este negocio, tiene una gran demanda de parte de sus clientes que le solicitan variedad como es pintura de labios, polvos, cremas, sabanas, calzado, bolsos entre otros como todo padre responsable tiene que sacar adelante a su hijo de 5 años. El crédito lo utilizara para la compra de materia prima en estos momentos tiene una gran cantidad de pedidos.
texts.en:
Walter, age 23, sells general merchandise.  He has had this business for over five years.  There is a great demand from his customers.  They request a variety of items like lipstick, powder, cream, sheets, shoes, and purses, among others.  

Like all responsible fathers, he has to get his five year old child ahead.

He will use the loan to buy merchandise for these times when he has a great number of orders.

loans.use: to buy  lipstick, powder, cream, sheets, shoes, and purses.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 41 years old and single. He runs a butcher shop to earn a living. He has been in the business for over ten years and has one employee.  Despite running his business in a very competitive environment, he has managed to retain his customers because of his good reputation.  
Samuel hopes to buy a vehicle for transporting meat in the future.  He needs 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy meat.

loans.use: to buy meat for his butcher shop

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a focused business-woman aged 29. She is a single mother of a three-year-old child. For the past three years, she has been running a beauty salon. The major challenge she faces is competition but she is able to retain her customers because of her good services. Mary has requested a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy hair braids and hair chemicals. In the next 5 years, she wants to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy braids and hair chemicals.

loans.name: Jirani Mwema B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from the Jirani Mwema B Group in Western Kenya! Judith is the facilitator of the group. This group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Judith takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Judith had a very good maize yield harvesting 10 bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Judith was only able to harvest two bags of maize on that land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Judith and her group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, Judith will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing. 

In 2012, the members of Jirani Mwema group will each plant between ½ and one acre of maize. 

She is pictured with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Oktom

texts.ru:
Октом  43 года, замужем, растит троих детей - старшие сыновья студенты Ошского Государственного университета, дочь - ученица 9 класса. Октом имеет высшее образование  по специальности преподаватель и работала учителем начальных классов в местной сельской школе.  Зарекомендовав себя как профессионал в своем деле, в 2008 году она была избрана директором школы.
В 1994 году, в поисках дополнительного источника финансирования для своей семьи, Октом вместе с мужем начали бизнес в разведении и откорме скота. Стартовав с суммой 6,000 сом (KGS), Октом приложила все усилия для развития своего хозяйства. На сегодняшний день,  ее хозяйство насчитывает четыре коровы и четыре теленка и приносит около 6,000  сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса , Октом обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 135,0000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота.    В будущем , Октом планирует активно продолжать свой бизнес в животноводстве и мечтает купить машину.
texts.en:
Oktom is 43 years old, married and is raising three children. Her oldest sons are students in the Osh State University and her daughter is a ninth grade student. Oktom has high education with the degree in teaching and has worked as an elementary school teacher in the local village. After recommending herself as a professional in her field she has been selected by the principal of the school in 2008.

In 1994, searching for an additional source of income to finance their family Oktom and her husband have started their business in breeding and feeding cattle. Starting with the amount of 6,000 KGS Oktom applied all her efforts in growing of the business. Today her household has four cows and four calves and give around 6,000 KGS a month from milk product sales. With the purpose of further growing of business Oktom has come to Bai Tushum and partners for a loan in the amount of 135,000 KGS to buy cattle. In the future Oktom plans to actively continue her business in animal husbandry and dreams of buying a car.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Fass Diom Taku Ligueye Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Fass Diom Taku Ligueye, a été crée depuis l'ouverture du Banc villageois. Il est composé de 05 femmes de la méme localité. Elle font du commerce de divers produits.
La présidente du groupe Aissatou âgée de 44 ans est debout à droite sur la photo et levant la main. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants.
Avec le prêt reçu elle va acheter du mil et du "bissap" pour revendre au marché du village. Elle a de l'expérience dans ce domaine d'activité car elle le fait depuis des années et y trouve son compte.
Ainsi avec les recettes de sa vente, elle va renforcer ses épargnes et refaire sa maison.
texts.en: The Fass Diom Taku Ligueye group was created at the inauguration of the banc villageois. It is comprised of five women who live in the same area. They sell miscellaneous products. The president of the group, Aissatou, who is 44 years old, is standing to the right of the photo, raising her hand. She is a married mother of six. With the loan, she will buy millet and hibiscus flowers (used to flavor beverages) to sell at the village market. She has years of experience in this business and relies on the income it brings. With the earnings, she will save and rebuild her house.

loans.use: to buy millet and hibiscus flowers (used to flavor beverages)

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 30 años, es una mujer amable, solidaria y muy responsable, es conviviente con su pareja con quien tiene dos hijos de 11 y 2 años, vive en su casa propia junto a su pareja y sus hijos, ella trabaja mucho para poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. El trabajo de Rosa consiste en la venta de comida, jugos y desayunos, todos los días desde muy temprano sale a vender sus jugos en la vereda de su casa y por las tardes arma su mesita y pone su asador y comienza con la preparación de sus exquisitos potajes, entre las cosas que vende encontramos Juanes, asados de todo tipo, tacacho y mas platos exquisitos con su toque de sazón y secreto de cocina, lleva realizando su trabajo recién por un año, además de trabajar en esta actividad, ella trabaja en una entidad del estado y tiene como un ingreso adicional el de este trabajo, lo hace sola y le esta yendo muy bien ya que tiene dos ingresos y eso le permite brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Como toda mujer con ganas de superarse tiene muchos objetivo, pero el principal por ahora es el de consolidarse con sus actividades y así mejorar la infraestructura de su casa en donde realiza su trabajo. Este será el cuarto crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá más segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Por otro lado se compromete una vez mas de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores crédito que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal por que todos sus integrantes con personas responsables y muy solidarios. Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará ingredientes, insumos y materiales para realizar su trabajo.
texts.en:
Rosa, 30, is a very kind, supportive and responsible woman who lives with her common-law husband and two children, ages 11 and 2, in their own house.  She works hard to give her family a better quality of life.  Rosa has a business selling food, juices and breakfasts.  She gets up early every day to begin selling her juices on the porch of her house and in the afternoons she sets up a table and barbecue and starts making her exquisit stews, "Juanes" (Peruvian tamales), tacacho (mashed plantain dish), and other dishes that have her special touch and cooking secrets.  She has been in business for a year.  She also works for a government agency, so her own business is extra income, allowing her to give her children a better lifestyle.

Like all women who want to get ahead, Rosa has many goals but the main one is to consolidate her activities and improve her home's infrastructure, as this is where she works.  This is her fourth loan through MFP.  She is content knowing she can count on this financial support which gives her more confidence for advancing in her work.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time as she has done with previous loans.  She enjoys being part of her communal bank because all the members are very responsible and supportive.  She plans to use the 1,000 PEN loan to buy ingredients and supplies for her business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make juice and breakfasts, as well as plates.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
He was born in 1944. He is married and has eight children, none of whom are under fifteen years of age. He lives in a six bedroom apartment in Ntsualam, a quarter in Bamenda, in Mezam Division of the Northwest Region of Cameroon. Ill health and the death of his parents are the major challenges he has faced in his life.

He joined GHAPE in the year 2000 and has successfully taken and repaid Empowerment Credit seven times. He invested these past loans in crop cultivation, animal farming, and also in his motorbike transportation business. He used the profit from these loans to feed, clothe, and provide medication for his family. Given a loan, he will invest it again in his motorbike transportation business.

With the profit from his loan, he will repair his house and also to pay for his children’s apprenticeships. He prefers a GHAPE loan because of the training he receives from GHAPE before each loan is disbursed to him.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle and fuel, and to process motorbike documents.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 48 years old and married with seven children.

Leonila works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a 15000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Leonila has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for six years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Leonila aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Fernanda

texts.es:
La socia Fernanda; pertenece al banco comunal "SEÑOR DE LA AGONIA DE TARAY"; El banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Taray perteneciente a la Provincia de Pisac departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 42 años de edad y es conviviente, la socia tiene 3 hijos la socia se dedica a la compra y venta de comidas, la socia tiene su pequeño stand de venta de comidas y bebidas como cervezas, chicha, en esta ocasión la socia desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de maíz amarillo para elaborar jora para la preparación de la chicha, la socia invertira el prestamo en la compra de jora para la chicha y en la compra de cerveza para implementar su negocio.

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
The member Fernanda belongs to the communal bank “Señor de la agonia de Taray”.  The group is located in the Taray district belonging to the Pisac province, department of Cusco.  

This member is 42 years old and lives with her partner.  She has 3 children and makes a living selling food.  She has her own food stall that sells food and drinks like beer, and chicha.  At this time, she wants to invest the loan in the purchase of yellow corn to make chicha.  She will invest the loan in buying corn for chicha and in buying beer to increase her business.

She is grateful for the loan and promises to make her payments at the established times.

loans.use: invest in buying corn to make chicha and in buying beer to increase her business.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 31 years old and lives in P-Makiangayon, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao: Philippines. In order to help her husband to support their family, she is engaged in a direct-selling business. She sells products like cosmetics, men's and women's clothing, and others. In addition to her direct-selling activities, she operates a sari-sari (convenience) store.

She applied for membership with Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and became an active member, with good credit standing. Now, she wants to obtain financial assistance in the amount of PHP 15,000. She will use the loan to purchase more goods for her sari-sari store, because what she has been earning is not sufficient for her daily needs. She plans to send her children to college, so that they can help her in the future. She wants them to help her to repair the house and to live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to buy additional goods for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more chicken for the business.

loans.name: Taleh

texts.en: Taleh is a young barber from the Agsu district. He started his business last year, in 2006. Now he borrows his first loan of $550 to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy additional equipment

loans.name: Lily

texts.en: Lily P.’s husband is good at fixing car engines and motor vehicles of any kind. She is helping to support her husband by providing financial support for him. This is Lily’s business. The loan she gets from SBPD is for their business together, and the money she gets to repay the loan is from her husband.

loans.use: But tools

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en: Mrs. H. is 57 years old. She lives in a Catholic village 10 miles from the next town in central Nghe An Province, one of the poorest regions of Vietnam. She has 7 children from 37-21. Her family has a plot of land on a hill where they grow lemon trees and eucalyptus. They also have a buffalo and pigs. Now she wants to buy 2 cows for breeding and some piglets.

loans.use: To buy pigs and 2 cows

loans.name: Máxima

texts.es:
Maxima R., 42, is separated and has 3 children who are, respectively, 20, 11 and 10 years old. The oldest of her children is a police officer who has worked in the capital for a year and helps her with household expenses. She says that thanks to her efforts and hard work, her daughter has been able to enter that profession.

Maxima has worked for more than 25 years selling “menudencias” (the internal organs—livers, intestines, hearts, etc.—of cattle and pigs that are widely consumed in the country) and she has a well-established customer base of around 30 people that buy from her daily along with other customers who buy from her occasionally. She works everyday, getting up very early and working until approximately 5 p.m. when she returns home. She works rain or shine. She’s very proud of her work and thanks to her income, she has been able to build her own house and to buy little luxuries like a television, stereo equipment, a freezer, etc.

She’s asking for the loan so that she can buy more merchandise because there have been days when she’s run short of stock to sell and she wants to ensure that she always has plenty to sell in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Máxima R. tiene 42 años, es separada , tiene 3 hijos de 20, 11 y 10 años respectivamente. La mayor de sus hijos es policía urbana y trabaja en la capital desde hace 1 años y le ayuda con los gastos del hogar. Comenta que gracias a su esfuerzo y trabajo logró que su hija pueda acceder a dicha profesión.

Máxima se dedica hace más de 25 años a la venta de menudencias (son los órganos internos de vacas y cerdos como hígado, tripa, corazón, etc que son muy consumidos en el país), posee una clientela muy bien formada de aproximadamente 30 personas que le compran todos los días, además de otros clientes ocasionales. Trabaja todos los dias, se levanta muy temprano y está en su puesto de trabajo hasta las 17 hs. p.m. aproximadamente, hora en que emprende la vuelta a su hogar . No conoce de sol ni de días de lluvia. Está muy orgullosa de su trabajo ya que gracias a los ingresos que obtuvo con él pudo construir su casa propia y tener todas las comodidades del hogar como ser televisor, equipo de sonido, heladera, etc.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de más mercaderías debido a que hay días en que escasea y debe comprar de manera anticipada para tener siempre en stock.

loans.use: Buy stock for re-sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The loan will be used to prepare small parcels of land for other micro businesses to use.

loans.name: Faanuu

texts.en: Faanuu T. is a young mother from the village of Sagafili Mulifanua. She just joined SPBD’s loan program recently and she is applying for her first loan. She runs a pig farm and hopes to expand the farm with her loan. The farm has been in her family for many years. Faanuu is hard-working and active and this is the first time she has ever been able to borrow money. She hopes to pay off the loan quickly so that she can receive another one in order to make improvements on her house and to expand the farm even more.

loans.use: To buy wiring, fencing, and iron roofing for her pig sty

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth A. is a trader as well as a seamstress. She is married to a tailor and has three children, ages 16, 13 and 10. She is working very hard to help her husband with the family's finances. She sells crates of eggs, soft drinks, mineral water and other provisions in addition to the clothes she sews. At the moment she is having problems with her electric sewing machine and she is planning to buy another one.

She is asking for $1,200 to add to what she has already saved towards the purchase of a new electric sewing machine, other sewing materials and goods for her shop to increase her income.

loans.use: To buy a new electric sewing machine and provision for her shop.

loans.name: Namile

texts.en: Namile is a 22-year-old local resident of Saatli town. She is married and lives with her husband and their child. She breeds cattle with her family and they have been working in this business for 25 years. She raises calves and sells them alive to the local market or to butcheries. She also sells milk and other dairy products. She wants to buy two more calves to add to their stable of livestock so she applied to the Normicro Saatli branch for a loan in amount of $1,000.

loans.use: To buy additional calves

loans.name: Mariluz

texts.es:
Mrs. Mariluz D. is a member of the “Las Perlas de Pucallpa” microfinance institution, located at Jr. Alfonso Ugarte Cdra. 7, Calleria district, in the Ucayali department. Mariluz is a 39-year-old mother of five. She decided to invest her first loan of S/ 300 soles in the purchase and sale of groceries.

She currently has a well-stocked market, which she operates alongside her husband and children.

She will invest the loan of S/ 1,600 soles, which she will repay in 5 months, in buying more groceries such as rice, milk, sugar, cooking oil, noodles, preserves, etc.

Mariluz keeps working assiduously in order to give her children the best. Her business is growing more and more everyday, which makes her very happy.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Mariluz pertenece al banco comunal Las Perlas de Pucallpa, ubicado en el Jr. Alfonso Ugarte Cdra.7, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Mariluz tiene 39 años y es madre de 5 hijos., Con su primer préstamo de S/ 300 decidió invertir en la compra y venta de abarrotes al por menor.

En la actualidad tiene una bodega muy surtida, que atiende junto con sus hijos y su esposo. Mariluz sigue trabajando muy duro para darles lo mejor a sus hijos que aún necesita. El negocio está creciendo cada día más y eso la hace muy feliz.

loans.use: Purchase of groceries (rice, milk, sugar, cooking oil, noodles, etc.)

loans.name: Pardahol

texts.ru:
Pardahol U. lives in Tursun-zoda, Tajikistan. She is 38, married with no children. She has a high school education and works in the private sector. She buys raw nuts (pistachio and almonds) from farmers, dries them, sorts them out and roasts them in the oven. After this she sells nuts at the market, where she rents a sale kiosk. In spring when there is no new crop yet, prices for raw nuts are higher, so Pardahol needs more money to buy them. A loan would help her to support her business and to keep the current price of her product, which in turn would help to keep her old customers and to attract new ones. Her customers would be able to buy a healthy product at an affordable price. This is why Pardahol is asking for a loan and plans to repay it in 8 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Sheyner, Kiva Volunteer

Умарова Пардахол проживает в городе Турсун-заде.Ей 38 лет , она замужем и не имеет детей. Образование среднее. Занимается частным бизнесом. Торгует на рынке города орехами (фисташки и миндаль). Скупает орехи в сыром виде у дехкан , сушит , перебирает и жарит в духовке. После такой обработки выносит на рынок и продает. Арендует торговую точку в центре базара. С приходом весны еще нет свежей продукции и по этой причине цены на продаваемый товар возросли. Это спровоцировало дефицит денег у клиентки. Кроме того , чтобы запастись товаром до появления нового урожая клиентке нужны деньги. Она закупит сырье , тем самым обеспечив свой бизнес. Еще это поможет сохранить цены на продаваемую продукцию , что даст возможность населению покупать необходимый для здоровья продукт питания и не потерять клиентов, а еще привлечь новых. Поэтому клиентка решила получить кредит. А погасить кредит она сможет в течении 8 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy raw materials

loans.name: Sam-Ath

texts.en:
Sam-ath H. is a married mother of five living on an island in Cambodia's Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from the capital city of Phnom Penh. She and her husband, a cow farmer, have been married for 31 years. One of her daughters is married, another weaves silk at home, one assists in the family business, and the last one works abroad in Thailand. Lastly, her son is still in school.

Sam-anth used to weave silk at home, but last year she started a grocery stand in front of her home. To grow her business, she is requesting a loan of $350 U.S. dollars to buy more grocery supplies to sell.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items tp sell at a stand

loans.name: Juan's Group

texts.en:
Juan is the leader of this amazing group of entrepreneurs, and they are now applying for their second loan with Esperanza. Juan is 24 years old and lives with his wife, Rosa, and their newborn baby girl. He has owned a small grocery store in his community for about three years but has been able to improve and expand his business significantly since his first loan. Juan wants to work hard to provide a better future for his new daughter. On weekends he likes to take his family to the beach or just spend quiet time in their house.

Thank you for your support!

loans.use: To buy vegetables, rice, oil, and other inventory for a small grocery store

loans.name: Muk

texts.en: Muk N., 61, is a widow living in Siem Reap Province with two of her children. She sells firewood, making $2 every day, and she is also supported by her two children, one a motor taxi driver and the other a cleaner at the temple. Her son’s motor taxi has become unreliable recently, creating an unnecessary burden for the family. She has asked CREDIT for a small loan of $200 to replace it. Muk N. sees this investment as a way to reduce the costs of repairs and expand the number of her son's customers, thereby increasing his daily income and raising the family's standard of living.

loans.use: To replace an old motorbike.

loans.name: Evangelia

texts.fr:
Born in Lomé on May 27, 1962, Mrs. Evangelia F. is married and the mother of three children. She was born into a family of bakers, but she always had an interest in the retail trade. In 1998 she began selling staple products necessary for baking. She became supplier to her family. Little by little she became the supplier for other bakers in her area. Her clientele has grown over time and she now needs to expand her inventory to satisfy the demand of her clientele. For this reason she requested her first loan.

This second loan will also allow her to add to her inventory 25 sacks of sugar and 7 sacks of wheat flour.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née à Lomé le 27 mai 1962 madame F. Evangelia est une femme mariée et mère de trois enfants. Elle est née dans une famille de boulangers, mais elle a toujours eu goût pour le commerce. Elle s’est alors lancée depuis 1998 dans la vente des matières premières en boulangerie. Elle devient ainsi la fournisseuse de sa famille. Petit à petit elle est devenue la fournisseuse des autres boulangers de son milieu. Sa clientèle s’est accrue au fil des temps et elle a eu besoin d’augmenter son stock pour satisfaire la demande croissante. C’est ainsi quelque demanda un premier prêt.

Ce deuxième prêt lui permettra aussi d’augmenter son stock de 25 sacs de sucre et de 7 sacs de blé.

loans.use:
Purchase of sugar and wheat flour

Achat de sucre et de farine de blé

loans.name: Fatma's Tusongembele Group

texts.en:
Fatma is a charcoal and firewood seller. She is 26 years old and is married with three children aged 6, 4 and 3. Each day she works 14 hours, from 7am to 9pm, and can earn a monthly profit of about $35 from her sales.

Fatma now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal and firewood for her business. She will share this loan with her sub-group members, who have businesses dealing with tailoring, charcoal sales, fine art and kiosks.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood.

loans.name: Heut

texts.en: Mr. Heut T., 42, and his wife, Mrs. Sareat Ros, 28, are farmers as well as carpenters for a small private enterprise. Their combined income is approximately US$5 per day. Besides making furniture, they also grow rice as a supplemental income for the family. They live with their three children in Chrey Commune in the Battembang Province; all the children living in the family's home and attend school. When the raining season began, Heut started to grow the rice crop. Because his farmland is infertile, he needs to use fertilizer to get high rice yield, but he lacks money to do it. Hence, he decided to request a loan of US$200 to purchase fertilizer. His wife is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Armando Antonio

texts.es: El señor Armando habita el barrio Pantasma, barrio ubicado en la capital de Managua, tiene 30 años de edad, se encuentra acompañado de la señora  Reyna Isabel de 37 años de edad, ella es ama de casa, ambos tienen dos hijos de 10 y 7 años. Actualmente el señor  Armando se dedica a su pequeño negocio que es una pulpería donde vende diferentes productos de granos básicos, hace 1 año que comenzó esta actividad, ya que antes se desempeñaba como guardia de seguridad, pero decidió  poner su propio negocio, por tanto desea trabajar con  micro créditos para poder seguir creciendo en su negocio y solicita C$ 5,000 a un  plazo   de 6 meses, para comprar mas inventario e invertirlo en su pulpería, del tal forma esto le permita tener mas clientes.
texts.en:
Armando lives in the Pantasma neighborhood of Managua, the capital of Nicaragua. He is 30 years old and lives with Reyna Isabel, a housewife, who is 37 years old. They have two children, 10 and 7 years old. Armando now operates a small grocery business where he sells various kinds of basic foodstuffs. He started the grocery a year ago when he was working as a security guard because he wanted to own his own business. He wants to use micro-loans so that he can go on growing his business and he's applying for a C$5,000 loan, for 6 months, to buy more inventory and to invest in his grocery so that he can attract more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more inventory and invest in grocery business.
